IAST: tvam agne dyubhis tvam āśuśukṣaṇis tvam adbhyas tvam aśmanas pari
Griffith: THOU, Agni, shining in thy glory through the days, art brought to life from out the waters, from the stone:
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने द्युभिस्त्वमाशुशुक्षणिस्त्वमद्भ्यस्त्वमश्मनस्परि
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | dyu-bhiḥ | tvam | āśuśukṣaṇiḥ | tvam | at-bhyaḥ | tvam | aśmanaḥ | pari || tvam | vanebhyaḥ | tvam | oṣadhībhyaḥ | tvam | nr̥ṇām | nr̥-pate | jāyase | śuciḥ ||2.1.1||

IAST: tvaṁ vanebhyas tvam oṣadhībhyas tvaṁ nṛṇāṁ nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ
Griffith: From out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground, thou, Sovran Lord of men art generatad [sic] pure.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वनेभ्यस्त्वमोषधीभ्यस्त्वं नृणां नृपते जायसे शुचिः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | dyu-bhiḥ | tvam | āśuśukṣaṇiḥ | tvam | at-bhyaḥ | tvam | aśmanaḥ | pari || tvam | vanebhyaḥ | tvam | oṣadhībhyaḥ | tvam | nr̥ṇām | nr̥-pate | jāyase | śuciḥ ||2.1.1||

IAST: tavāgne hotraṁ tava potram ṛtviyaṁ tava neṣṭraṁ tvam agnid ṛtāyataḥ
Griffith: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man.
Devanāgarī: तवाग्ने होत्रं तव पोत्रमृत्वियं तव नेष्ट्रं त्वमग्निदृतायतः
pada pāṭha: tava | agne | hotram | tava | potram | r̥tviyam | tava | neṣṭram | tvam | agnit | r̥ta-yataḥ || tava | pra-śāstram | tvam | adhvari-yasi | brahmā | ca | asi | gr̥ha-patiḥ | ca | naḥ | dame ||2.1.2||

IAST: tava praśāstraṁ tvam adhvarīyasi brahmā cāsi gṛhapatiś ca no dame
Griffith: Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.
Devanāgarī: तव प्रशास्त्रं त्वमध्वरीयसि ब्रह्मा चासि गृहपतिश्च नो दमे
pada pāṭha: tava | agne | hotram | tava | potram | r̥tviyam | tava | neṣṭram | tvam | agnit | r̥ta-yataḥ || tava | pra-śāstram | tvam | adhvari-yasi | brahmā | ca | asi | gr̥ha-patiḥ | ca | naḥ | dame ||2.1.2||

IAST: tvam agna indro vṛṣabhaḥ satām asi tvaṁ viṣṇur urugāyo namasyaḥ
Griffith: Hero of Heroes, Agni! Thou art Indra, thou art Visnu of the Mighty Stride, adorable:
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्न इन्द्रो वृषभः सतामसि त्वं विष्णुरुरुगायो नमस्यः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | indraḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | satām | asi | tvam | viṣṇuḥ | uru-gāyaḥ | namasyaḥ || tvam | brahmā | rayi-vit | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | tvam | vidhartariti vi-dhartaḥ | sacase | puram-dhyā ||2.1.3||

IAST: tvam brahmā rayivid brahmaṇas pate tvaṁ vidhartaḥ sacase puraṁdhyā
Griffith: Thou, Brahmanaspati, the Brahman finding wealth: thou, O Sustainer, with thy wisdom tendest us.
Devanāgarī: त्वं ब्रह्मा रयिविद्ब्रह्मणस्पते त्वं विधर्तः सचसे पुरंध्या
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | indraḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | satām | asi | tvam | viṣṇuḥ | uru-gāyaḥ | namasyaḥ || tvam | brahmā | rayi-vit | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | tvam | vidhartariti vi-dhartaḥ | sacase | puram-dhyā ||2.1.3||

IAST: tvam agne rājā varuṇo dhṛtavratas tvam mitro bhavasi dasma īḍyaḥ
Griffith: Agni, thou art King Varuna whose laws stand fast; as Mitra, Wonder-Worker, thou must be implored.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने राजा वरुणो धृतव्रतस्त्वं मित्रो भवसि दस्म ईड्यः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | rājā | varuṇaḥ | dhr̥ta-vrataḥ | tvam | mitraḥ | bhavasi | dasmaḥ | īḍyaḥ || tvam | aryamā | sat-patiḥ | yasya | sam-bhujam | tvam | aṁśaḥ | vidathe | deva | bhājayuḥ ||2.1.4||

IAST: tvam aryamā satpatir yasya sambhujaṁ tvam aṁśo vidathe deva bhājayuḥ
Griffith: Aryaman, heroes' Lord, art thou, enrich ing all, and liberal Amsa in the synod, O thou God.
Devanāgarī: त्वमर्यमा सत्पतिर्यस्य सम्भुजं त्वमंशो विदथे देव भाजयुः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | rājā | varuṇaḥ | dhr̥ta-vrataḥ | tvam | mitraḥ | bhavasi | dasmaḥ | īḍyaḥ || tvam | aryamā | sat-patiḥ | yasya | sam-bhujam | tvam | aṁśaḥ | vidathe | deva | bhājayuḥ ||2.1.4||

IAST: tvam agne tvaṣṭā vidhate suvīryaṁ tava gnāvo mitramahaḥ sajātyam
Griffith: Thou givest strength, as Tvastar, to the worshipper: thou wielding Mitra's power hast kinship with the Dames.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने त्वष्टा विधते सुवीर्यं तव ग्नावो मित्रमहः सजात्यम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | tvaṣṭā | vidhate | su-vīryam | tava | gnāvaḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | sa-jātyam || tvam | āśu-hemā | rariṣe | su-aśvyam | tvam | narām | śardhaḥ | asi | puru-vasuḥ ||2.1.5||

IAST: tvam āśuhemā rariṣe svaśvyaṁ tvaṁ narāṁ śardho asi purūvasuḥ
Griffith: Thou, urging thy fleet coursers, givest noble steeds: a host of heroes art thou with great store of wealth.
Devanāgarī: त्वमाशुहेमा ररिषे स्वश्व्यं त्वं नरां शर्धो असि पुरूवसुः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | tvaṣṭā | vidhate | su-vīryam | tava | gnāvaḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | sa-jātyam || tvam | āśu-hemā | rariṣe | su-aśvyam | tvam | narām | śardhaḥ | asi | puru-vasuḥ ||2.1.5||

IAST: tvam agne rudro asuro maho divas tvaṁ śardho mārutam pṛkṣa īśiṣe
Griffith: Rudra art thou, the Asura of mighty heaven: thou art the Maruts' host, thou art the Lord of food,
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने रुद्रो असुरो महो दिवस्त्वं शर्धो मारुतं पृक्ष ईशिषे
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | rudraḥ | asuraḥ | mahaḥ | divaḥ | tvam | śardhaḥ | mārutam | pr̥kṣaḥ | īśiṣe || tvam | vātaiḥ | aruṇaiḥ | yāsi | śam-gayaḥ | tvam | pūṣā | vidhataḥ | pāsi | nu | tmanā ||2.1.6||

IAST: tvaṁ vātair aruṇair yāsi śaṁgayas tvam pūṣā vidhataḥ pāsi nu tmanā
Griffith: Thou goest with red winds: bliss hast thou in thine home. As Pusan thou thyself protectest worshippers.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वातैररुणैर्यासि शंगयस्त्वं पूषा विधतः पासि नु त्मना
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | rudraḥ | asuraḥ | mahaḥ | divaḥ | tvam | śardhaḥ | mārutam | pr̥kṣaḥ | īśiṣe || tvam | vātaiḥ | aruṇaiḥ | yāsi | śam-gayaḥ | tvam | pūṣā | vidhataḥ | pāsi | nu | tmanā ||2.1.6||

IAST: tvam agne draviṇodā araṁkṛte tvaṁ devaḥ savitā ratnadhā asi
Griffith: Giver of wealth art thou to him who honours thee; thou art God Savitar, granter of precious things.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने द्रविणोदा अरंकृते त्वं देवः सविता रत्नधा असि
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | aram-kr̥te | tvam | devaḥ | savitā | ratna-dhāḥ | asi || tvam | bhagaḥ | nr̥-pate | vasvaḥ | īśiṣe | tvam | pāyuḥ | dame | yaḥ | te | avidhat ||2.1.7||

IAST: tvam bhago nṛpate vasva īśiṣe tvam pāyur dame yas te 'vidhat
Griffith: As Bhaga, Lord of men! thou rulest over wealth, and guardest in his house him who hath served thee well.
Devanāgarī: त्वं भगो नृपते वस्व ईशिषे त्वं पायुर्दमे यस्तेऽविधत्
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | aram-kr̥te | tvam | devaḥ | savitā | ratna-dhāḥ | asi || tvam | bhagaḥ | nr̥-pate | vasvaḥ | īśiṣe | tvam | pāyuḥ | dame | yaḥ | te | avidhat ||2.1.7||

IAST: tvām agne dama ā viśpatiṁ viśas tvāṁ rājānaṁ suvidatram ṛñjate
Griffith: To thee, the people's Lord within the house, the folk press forward to their King most graciously inclined.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने दम आ विश्पतिं विशस्त्वां राजानं सुविदत्रमृञ्जते
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | dame | ā | viśpatim | viśaḥ | tvām | rājānam | su-vidatram | r̥ñjate || tvam | viśvāni | su-anīka | patyase | tvam | sahasrāṇi | śatā | daśa | prati ||2.1.8||

IAST: tvaṁ viśvāni svanīka patyase tvaṁ sahasrāṇi śatā daśa prati
Griffith: Lord of the lovely look, all things belong to thee: ten, hundred, yea, a thousand are outweighed by thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विश्वानि स्वनीक पत्यसे त्वं सहस्राणि शता दश प्रति
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | dame | ā | viśpatim | viśaḥ | tvām | rājānam | su-vidatram | r̥ñjate || tvam | viśvāni | su-anīka | patyase | tvam | sahasrāṇi | śatā | daśa | prati ||2.1.8||

IAST: tvām agne pitaram iṣṭibhir naras tvām bhrātrāya śamyā tanūrucam
Griffith: Agni, men seek thee as a Father with their prayers, win thee, bright-formed, to brotherhood with holy act.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने पितरमिष्टिभिर्नरस्त्वां भ्रात्राय शम्या तनूरुचम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | pitaram | iṣṭi-bhiḥ | naraḥ | tvām | bhrātrāya | śamyā | tanū-rucam || tvam | putraḥ | bhavasi | yaḥ | te | avidhat | tvam | sakhā | su-śevaḥ | pāsi | ā-dhr̥ṣaḥ ||2.1.9||

IAST: tvam putro bhavasi yas te 'vidhat tvaṁ sakhā suśevaḥ pāsy ādhṛṣaḥ
Griffith: Thou art a Son to him who duly worships thee, and as a trusty Friend thou guardest from attack.
Devanāgarī: त्वं पुत्रो भवसि यस्तेऽविधत्त्वं सखा सुशेवः पास्याधृषः
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | pitaram | iṣṭi-bhiḥ | naraḥ | tvām | bhrātrāya | śamyā | tanū-rucam || tvam | putraḥ | bhavasi | yaḥ | te | avidhat | tvam | sakhā | su-śevaḥ | pāsi | ā-dhr̥ṣaḥ ||2.1.9||

IAST: tvam agna ṛbhur āke namasyas tvaṁ vājasya kṣumato rāya īśiṣe
Griffith: A Rbhu art thou, Agni, near to be adored thou art the Sovran Lord of foodful spoil and wealth.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्न ऋभुराके नमस्यस्त्वं वाजस्य क्षुमतो राय ईशिषे
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | r̥bhuḥ | āke | namasyaḥ | tvam | vājasya | kṣu-mataḥ | rāyaḥ | īśiṣe || tvam | vi | bhāsi | anu | dhakṣi | dāvane | tvam | vi-śikṣuḥ | asi | yajñam | ā-taniḥ ||2.1.10||

IAST: tvaṁ vi bhāsy anu dakṣi dāvane tvaṁ viśikṣur asi yajñam ātaniḥ
Griffith: Thou shinest brightly forth, thou burnest to bestow: pervading sacrifice, thou lendest us thine help.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वि भास्यनु दक्षि दावने त्वं विशिक्षुरसि यज्ञमातनिः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | r̥bhuḥ | āke | namasyaḥ | tvam | vājasya | kṣu-mataḥ | rāyaḥ | īśiṣe || tvam | vi | bhāsi | anu | dhakṣi | dāvane | tvam | vi-śikṣuḥ | asi | yajñam | ā-taniḥ ||2.1.10||

IAST: tvam agne aditir deva dāśuṣe tvaṁ hotrā bhāratī vardhase girā
Griffith: Thou, God, art Aditi to him who offers gifts: thou, Hotri, Bharati, art strengthened by the song.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने अदितिर्देव दाशुषे त्वं होत्रा भारती वर्धसे गिरा
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | aditiḥ | deva | dāśuṣe | tvam | hotrā | bhāratī | vardhase | girā || tvam | iḷā | śata-himā | asi | dakṣase | tvam | vr̥tra-hā | vasu-pate | sarasvatī ||2.1.11||

IAST: tvam iḻā śatahimāsi dakṣase tvaṁ vṛtrahā vasupate sarasvatī
Griffith: Thou art the hundred-wintered Ila to give strength, Lord of Wealth! Vrtra-slayer and Sarasvati.
Devanāgarī: त्वमिळा शतहिमासि दक्षसे त्वं वृत्रहा वसुपते सरस्वती
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | aditiḥ | deva | dāśuṣe | tvam | hotrā | bhāratī | vardhase | girā || tvam | iḷā | śata-himā | asi | dakṣase | tvam | vr̥tra-hā | vasu-pate | sarasvatī ||2.1.11||

IAST: tvam agne subhṛta uttamaṁ vayas tava spārhe varṇa ā saṁdṛśi śriyaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Agni, cherished well, art highest vital power; in thy delightful hue are glories visible.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने सुभृत उत्तमं वयस्तव स्पार्हे वर्ण आ संदृशि श्रियः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | su-bhr̥taḥ | ut-tamam | vayaḥ | tava | spārhe | varṇe | ā | sam-dr̥śi | śriyaḥ || tvam | vājaḥ | pra-taraṇaḥ | br̥han | asi | tvam | rayiḥ | bahulaḥ | viśvataḥ | pr̥thuḥ ||2.1.12||

IAST: tvaṁ vājaḥ prataraṇo bṛhann asi tvaṁ rayir bahulo viśvatas pṛthuḥ
Griffith: Thou art the lofty might that furthers each design: thou art wealth manifold, diffused on every side.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वाजः प्रतरणो बृहन्नसि त्वं रयिर्बहुलो विश्वतस्पृथुः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | su-bhr̥taḥ | ut-tamam | vayaḥ | tava | spārhe | varṇe | ā | sam-dr̥śi | śriyaḥ || tvam | vājaḥ | pra-taraṇaḥ | br̥han | asi | tvam | rayiḥ | bahulaḥ | viśvataḥ | pr̥thuḥ ||2.1.12||

IAST: tvām agna ādityāsa āsyaṁ tvāṁ jihvāṁ śucayaś cakrire kave
Griffith: Thee, Agni, have the Adityas taken as their mouth; the Bright Ones have made thee, O Sage, to be their tongue.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्न आदित्यास आस्यं त्वां जिह्वां शुचयश्चक्रिरे कवे
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | ādityāsaḥ | āsyam | tvām | jihvām | śucayaḥ | cakrire | kave || tvām | rāti-sācaḥ | adhvareṣu | saścire | tve iti | devāḥ | haviḥ | adanti | ā-hutam ||2.1.13||

IAST: tvāṁ rātiṣāco adhvareṣu saścire tve devā havir adanty āhutam
Griffith: They who love offerings cling to thee at solemn rites: by thee the Gods devour the duly offered food.
Devanāgarī: त्वां रातिषाचो अध्वरेषु सश्चिरे त्वे देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | ādityāsaḥ | āsyam | tvām | jihvām | śucayaḥ | cakrire | kave || tvām | rāti-sācaḥ | adhvareṣu | saścire | tve iti | devāḥ | haviḥ | adanti | ā-hutam ||2.1.13||

IAST: tve agne viśve amṛtāso adruha āsā devā havir adanty āhutam
Griffith: By thee, O Agni, all the Immortal guileless Gods cat with thy mouth the oblation that is offered them.
Devanāgarī: त्वे अग्ने विश्वे अमृतासो अद्रुह आसा देवा हविरदन्त्याहुतम्
pada pāṭha: tve iti | agne | viśve | amr̥tāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | āsā | devāḥ | haviḥ | adanti | ā-hutam || tvayā | martāsaḥ | svadante | ā-sutim | tvam | garbhaḥ | vīrudhām | jajñiṣe | śuciḥ ||2.1.14||

IAST: tvayā martāsaḥ svadanta āsutiṁ tvaṁ garbho vīrudhāṁ jajñiṣe śuciḥ
Griffith: By thee do mortal men give sweetness to their drink. Bright art thou born, the embryo of the plants of earth.
Devanāgarī: त्वया मर्तासः स्वदन्त आसुतिं त्वं गर्भो वीरुधां जज्ञिषे शुचिः
pada pāṭha: tve iti | agne | viśve | amr̥tāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | āsā | devāḥ | haviḥ | adanti | ā-hutam || tvayā | martāsaḥ | svadante | ā-sutim | tvam | garbhaḥ | vīrudhām | jajñiṣe | śuciḥ ||2.1.14||

IAST: tvaṁ tān saṁ ca prati cāsi majmanāgne sujāta pra ca deva ricyase
Griffith: With these thou art united, Agni; yea thou, God of noble birth, surpassest them in majesty,
Devanāgarī: त्वं तान्सं च प्रति चासि मज्मनाग्ने सुजात प्र च देव रिच्यसे
pada pāṭha: tvam | tān | sam | ca | prati | ca | asi | majmanā | agne | su-jāta | pra | ca | deva | ricyase || pr̥kṣaḥ | yat | atra | mahinā | vi | te | bhuvat | anu | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | rodasī iti | ubhe iti ||2.1.15||

IAST: pṛkṣo yad atra mahinā vi te bhuvad anu dyāvāpṛthivī rodasī ubhe
Griffith: Which, through the power of good, here spreads abroad from thee, diffused through both the worlds, throughout the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: पृक्षो यदत्र महिना वि ते भुवदनु द्यावापृथिवी रोदसी उभे
pada pāṭha: tvam | tān | sam | ca | prati | ca | asi | majmanā | agne | su-jāta | pra | ca | deva | ricyase || pr̥kṣaḥ | yat | atra | mahinā | vi | te | bhuvat | anu | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | rodasī iti | ubhe iti ||2.1.15||

IAST: ye stotṛbhyo goagrām aśvapeśasam agne rātim upasṛjanti sūrayaḥ
Griffith: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon graced with kine and steeds,-
Devanāgarī: ये स्तोतृभ्यो गोअग्रामश्वपेशसमग्ने रातिमुपसृजन्ति सूरयः
pada pāṭha: ye | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | go-agrām | aśva-peśasam | agne | rātim | upa-sr̥janti | sūrayaḥ || asmān | ca | tān | ca | pra | hi | neṣi | vasyaḥ | ā | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.1.16||

IAST: asmāñ ca tām̐ś ca pra hi neṣi vasya ā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.
Devanāgarī: अस्माञ्च ताँश्च प्र हि नेषि वस्य आ बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: ye | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | go-agrām | aśva-peśasam | agne | rātim | upa-sr̥janti | sūrayaḥ || asmān | ca | tān | ca | pra | hi | neṣi | vasyaḥ | ā | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.1.16||

IAST: yajñena vardhata jātavedasam agniṁ yajadhvaṁ haviṣā tanā girā
Griffith: WITH sacrifice exalt Agni who knows all life; worship him 'with oblation and the song of praise,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेन वर्धत जातवेदसमग्निं यजध्वं हविषा तना गिरा
pada pāṭha: yajñena | vardhata | jāta-vedasam | agnim | yajadhvam | haviṣā | tanā | girā || sam-idhānam | su-prayasam | svaḥ-naram | dyukṣam | hotāram | vr̥janeṣu | dhūḥ-sadam ||2.2.1||

IAST: samidhānaṁ suprayasaṁ svarṇaraṁ dyukṣaṁ hotāraṁ vṛjaneṣu dhūrṣadam
Griffith: Well kindled, nobly fed; heaven's Lord, Celestial Priest, who labours at the pole where deeds of might are done.
Devanāgarī: समिधानं सुप्रयसं स्वर्णरं द्युक्षं होतारं वृजनेषु धूर्षदम्
pada pāṭha: yajñena | vardhata | jāta-vedasam | agnim | yajadhvam | haviṣā | tanā | girā || sam-idhānam | su-prayasam | svaḥ-naram | dyukṣam | hotāram | vr̥janeṣu | dhūḥ-sadam ||2.2.1||

IAST: abhi tvā naktīr uṣaso vavāśire 'gne vatsaṁ na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ
Griffith: At night and morning, Agni, have they called to thee, like milch-kine in their stalls lowing to meet their young.
Devanāgarī: अभि त्वा नक्तीरुषसो ववाशिरेऽग्ने वत्सं न स्वसरेषु धेनवः
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | naktīḥ | uṣasaḥ | vavāśire | agne | vatsam | na | svasareṣu | dhenavaḥ || divaḥ-iva | it | aratiḥ | mānuṣā | yugā | ā | kṣapaḥ | bhāsi | puru-vāra | sam-yataḥ ||2.2.2||

IAST: diva ived aratir mānuṣā yugā kṣapo bhāsi puruvāra saṁyataḥ
Griffith: As messenger of heaven thou lightest all night long the families of men. Thou Lord of precious boons.
Devanāgarī: दिव इवेदरतिर्मानुषा युगा क्षपो भासि पुरुवार संयतः
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | naktīḥ | uṣasaḥ | vavāśire | agne | vatsam | na | svasareṣu | dhenavaḥ || divaḥ-iva | it | aratiḥ | mānuṣā | yugā | ā | kṣapaḥ | bhāsi | puru-vāra | sam-yataḥ ||2.2.2||

IAST: taṁ devā budhne rajasaḥ sudaṁsasaṁ divaspṛthivyor aratiṁ ny erire
Griffith: Him have the Gods established at the region's base, doer of wondrous deeds, Herald of heaven and earth;
Devanāgarī: तं देवा बुध्ने रजसः सुदंससं दिवस्पृथिव्योररतिं न्येरिरे
pada pāṭha: taṁ | devāḥ | budhne | rajasaḥ | su-daṁsasam | divaḥpr̥thivyoḥ | aratim | ni | erire || ratham-iva | vedyam | śukra-śociṣam | agnim | mitram | na | kṣitiṣu | pra-śaṁsyam ||2.2.3||

IAST: ratham iva vedyaṁ śukraśociṣam agnim mitraṁ na kṣitiṣu praśaṁsyam
Griffith: Like a most famous car, Agni the purely bright, like Mitra. to be glorified among the folk.
Devanāgarī: रथमिव वेद्यं शुक्रशोचिषमग्निं मित्रं न क्षितिषु प्रशंस्यम्
pada pāṭha: taṁ | devāḥ | budhne | rajasaḥ | su-daṁsasam | divaḥpr̥thivyoḥ | aratim | ni | erire || ratham-iva | vedyam | śukra-śociṣam | agnim | mitram | na | kṣitiṣu | pra-śaṁsyam ||2.2.3||

IAST: tam ukṣamāṇaṁ rajasi sva ā dame candram iva surucaṁ hvāra ā dadhuḥ
Griffith: Him have they set in his own dwelling, in the vault, like the Moon waxing, fulgent, in the realm of air.
Devanāgarī: तमुक्षमाणं रजसि स्व आ दमे चन्द्रमिव सुरुचं ह्वार आ दधुः
pada pāṭha: tam | ukṣamāṇam | rajasi | sve | ā | dame | candram-iva | su-rucam | hvāre | ā | dadhuḥ || pr̥śnyāḥ | pataram | citayantam | akṣa-bhiḥ | pāthaḥ | na | pāyum | janasī iti | ubhe iti | anu ||2.2.4||

IAST: pṛśnyāḥ pataraṁ citayantam akṣabhiḥ pātho na pāyuṁ janasī ubhe anu
Griffith: Bird of the firmament, observant with his eyes, guard of the place as 'twere, looking to Gods and men.
Devanāgarī: पृश्न्याः पतरं चितयन्तमक्षभिः पाथो न पायुं जनसी उभे अनु
pada pāṭha: tam | ukṣamāṇam | rajasi | sve | ā | dame | candram-iva | su-rucam | hvāre | ā | dadhuḥ || pr̥śnyāḥ | pataram | citayantam | akṣa-bhiḥ | pāthaḥ | na | pāyum | janasī iti | ubhe iti | anu ||2.2.4||

IAST: sa hotā viśvam pari bhūtv adhvaraṁ tam u havyair manuṣa ṛñjate girā
Griffith: May he as Priest encompass all the sacrifice. men throng to him with offerings and with hymns of praise.
Devanāgarī: स होता विश्वं परि भूत्वध्वरं तमु हव्यैर्मनुष ऋञ्जते गिरा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hotā | viśvam | pari | bhūtu | adhvaram | tam | ūm̐ iti | havyaiḥ | manuṣaḥ | r̥ñjate | girā || hiri-śipraḥ | vr̥dhasānāsu | jarbhurat | dyauḥ | na | str̥-bhiḥ | citayat | rodasī iti | anu ||2.2.5||

IAST: hiriśipro vṛdhasānāsu jarbhurad dyaur na stṛbhiś citayad rodasī anu
Griffith: Raging with jaws of gold among the growing plants, like heaven with all the stars, he quickens earth and sky.
Devanāgarī: हिरिशिप्रो वृधसानासु जर्भुरद्द्यौर्न स्तृभिश्चितयद्रोदसी अनु
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hotā | viśvam | pari | bhūtu | adhvaram | tam | ūm̐ iti | havyaiḥ | manuṣaḥ | r̥ñjate | girā || hiri-śipraḥ | vr̥dhasānāsu | jarbhurat | dyauḥ | na | str̥-bhiḥ | citayat | rodasī iti | anu ||2.2.5||

IAST: sa no revat samidhānaḥ svastaye saṁdadasvān rayim asmāsu dīdihi
Griffith: Such as thou art, brilliantly kindled for our weal, a liberal giver, send us riches in thy shine,
Devanāgarī: स नो रेवत्समिधानः स्वस्तये संददस्वान्रयिमस्मासु दीदिहि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | revat | sam-idhānaḥ | svastaye | sam-dadasvān | rayim | asmāsu | dīdihi || ā | naḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | suvitāya | rodasī iti | agne | havyā | manuṣaḥ | deva | vītaye ||2.2.6||

IAST: ā naḥ kṛṇuṣva suvitāya rodasī agne havyā manuṣo deva vītaye
Griffith: For our advantage, Agni, God, bring Heaven and Earth hither that they may taste oblation brought by man.
Devanāgarī: आ नः कृणुष्व सुविताय रोदसी अग्ने हव्या मनुषो देव वीतये
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | revat | sam-idhānaḥ | svastaye | sam-dadasvān | rayim | asmāsu | dīdihi || ā | naḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | suvitāya | rodasī iti | agne | havyā | manuṣaḥ | deva | vītaye ||2.2.6||

IAST: dā no agne bṛhato dāḥ sahasriṇo duro na vājaṁ śrutyā apā vṛdhi
Griffith: Agni, give us great wealth, give riches thousandfold. unclose to us, like doors, strength that shall bring renown.
Devanāgarī: दा नो अग्ने बृहतो दाः सहस्रिणो दुरो न वाजं श्रुत्या अपा वृधि
pada pāṭha: dāḥ | naḥ | agne | br̥hataḥ | dāḥ | sahasriṇaḥ | duraḥ | na | vājam | śrutyai | apa | vr̥dhi || prācī iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | brahmaṇā | kr̥dhi | svaḥ | na | śukram | uṣasaḥ | vi | didyutaḥ ||2.2.7||

IAST: prācī dyāvāpṛthivī brahmaṇā kṛdhi svar ṇa śukram uṣaso vi didyutaḥ
Griffith: Make Heaven and Earth propitious through the power of prayer, and like the sky's bright sheen let mornings beam on us.
Devanāgarī: प्राची द्यावापृथिवी ब्रह्मणा कृधि स्वर्ण शुक्रमुषसो वि दिद्युतः
pada pāṭha: dāḥ | naḥ | agne | br̥hataḥ | dāḥ | sahasriṇaḥ | duraḥ | na | vājam | śrutyai | apa | vr̥dhi || prācī iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | brahmaṇā | kr̥dhi | svaḥ | na | śukram | uṣasaḥ | vi | didyutaḥ ||2.2.7||

IAST: sa idhāna uṣaso rāmyā anu svar ṇa dīded aruṣeṇa bhānunā
Griffith: Enkindled night by night at every morning's dawn, may he shine forth with red flame like the realm of light,-
Devanāgarī: स इधान उषसो राम्या अनु स्वर्ण दीदेदरुषेण भानुना
pada pāṭha: saḥ | idhānaḥ | uṣasaḥ | rāmyāḥ | anu | svaḥ | na | dīdet | aruṣeṇa | bhānunā || hotrābhiḥ | agniḥ | manuṣaḥ | su-adhvaraḥ | rājā | viśām | atithiḥ | cāruḥ | āyave ||2.2.8||

IAST: hotrābhir agnir manuṣaḥ svadhvaro rājā viśām atithiś cārur āyave
Griffith: Agni adored in beauteous rites with lauds of men, fair guest of living man and King of all our folk.
Devanāgarī: होत्राभिरग्निर्मनुषः स्वध्वरो राजा विशामतिथिश्चारुरायवे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | idhānaḥ | uṣasaḥ | rāmyāḥ | anu | svaḥ | na | dīdet | aruṣeṇa | bhānunā || hotrābhiḥ | agniḥ | manuṣaḥ | su-adhvaraḥ | rājā | viśām | atithiḥ | cāruḥ | āyave ||2.2.8||

IAST: evā no agne amṛteṣu pūrvya dhīṣ pīpāya bṛhaddiveṣu mānuṣā
Griffith: Song chanted by us men, O Agni, Ancient One, has swelled unto the deathless Gods in lofty heaven-
Devanāgarī: एवा नो अग्ने अमृतेषु पूर्व्य धीष्पीपाय बृहद्दिवेषु मानुषा
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | agne | amr̥teṣu | pūrvya | dhīḥ | pīpāya | br̥hat-diveṣu | mānuṣā || duhānā | dhenuḥ | vr̥janeṣu | kārave | tmanā | śatinam | puru-rūpam | iṣaṇi ||2.2.9||

IAST: duhānā dhenur vṛjaneṣu kārave tmanā śatinam pururūpam iṣaṇi
Griffith: A milch-cow yielding to the singer in the rites wealth manifold, in hundreds, even as he wills.
Devanāgarī: दुहाना धेनुर्वृजनेषु कारवे त्मना शतिनं पुरुरूपमिषणि
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | agne | amr̥teṣu | pūrvya | dhīḥ | pīpāya | br̥hat-diveṣu | mānuṣā || duhānā | dhenuḥ | vr̥janeṣu | kārave | tmanā | śatinam | puru-rūpam | iṣaṇi ||2.2.9||

IAST: vayam agne arvatā vā suvīryam brahmaṇā vā citayemā janām̐ ati
Griffith: Agni, may we show forth our valour with the steed or with the power of prayer beyond all other men;
Devanāgarī: वयमग्ने अर्वता वा सुवीर्यं ब्रह्मणा वा चितयेमा जनाँ अति
pada pāṭha: vayam | agne | arvatā | vā | su-vīryam | brahmaṇā | vā | citayema | janān | ati || asmākam | dyumnam | adhi | pañca | kr̥ṣṭiṣu | uccā | svaḥ | na | śuśucīta | dustaram ||2.2.10||

IAST: asmākaṁ dyumnam adhi pañca kṛṣṭiṣūccā svar ṇa śuśucīta duṣṭaram
Griffith: And over the Five Races let our glory shine high like the realm of light and unsurpassable.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं द्युम्नमधि पञ्च कृष्टिषूच्चा स्वर्ण शुशुचीत दुष्टरम्
pada pāṭha: vayam | agne | arvatā | vā | su-vīryam | brahmaṇā | vā | citayema | janān | ati || asmākam | dyumnam | adhi | pañca | kr̥ṣṭiṣu | uccā | svaḥ | na | śuśucīta | dustaram ||2.2.10||

IAST: sa no bodhi sahasya praśaṁsyo yasmin sujātā iṣayanta sūrayaḥ
Griffith: Such, Conqueror! be to us, be worthy of our praise, thou for whom princes nobly born exert themselves;
Devanāgarī: स नो बोधि सहस्य प्रशंस्यो यस्मिन्सुजाता इषयन्त सूरयः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | bodhi | sahasya | pra-śaṁsyaḥ | yasmin | su-jātāḥ | iṣayanta | sūrayaḥ || yam | agne | yajñam | upa-yanti | vājinaḥ | nitye | toke | dīdi-vāṁsam | sve | dame ||2.2.11||

IAST: yam agne yajñam upayanti vājino nitye toke dīdivāṁsaṁ sve dame
Griffith: Whose sacrifice the strong seek, Agni, when it shines for never-failing offspring in thine own abode.
Devanāgarī: यमग्ने यज्ञमुपयन्ति वाजिनो नित्ये तोके दीदिवांसं स्वे दमे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | bodhi | sahasya | pra-śaṁsyaḥ | yasmin | su-jātāḥ | iṣayanta | sūrayaḥ || yam | agne | yajñam | upa-yanti | vājinaḥ | nitye | toke | dīdi-vāṁsam | sve | dame ||2.2.11||

IAST: ubhayāso jātavedaḥ syāma te stotāro agne sūrayaś ca śarmaṇi
Griffith: Knower of all that lives, O Agni may we both, singers of praise and chiefs, be in thy keeping still.
Devanāgarī: उभयासो जातवेदः स्याम ते स्तोतारो अग्ने सूरयश्च शर्मणि
pada pāṭha: ubhayāsaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | syāma | te | stotāraḥ | agne | sūrayaḥ | ca | śarmaṇi || vasvaḥ | rāyaḥ | puru-candrasya | bhūyasaḥ | prajā-vataḥ | su-apatyasya | śagdhi | naḥ ||2.2.12||

IAST: vasvo rāyaḥ puruścandrasya bhūyasaḥ prajāvataḥ svapatyasya śagdhi naḥ
Griffith: Help us to wealth exceeding good and glorious, abundant, rich in children and their progeny.
Devanāgarī: वस्वो रायः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य भूयसः प्रजावतः स्वपत्यस्य शग्धि नः
pada pāṭha: ubhayāsaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | syāma | te | stotāraḥ | agne | sūrayaḥ | ca | śarmaṇi || vasvaḥ | rāyaḥ | puru-candrasya | bhūyasaḥ | prajā-vataḥ | su-apatyasya | śagdhi | naḥ ||2.2.12||

IAST: ye stotṛbhyo goagrām aśvapeśasam agne rātim upasṛjanti sūrayaḥ
Griffith: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon, graced with kine and steeds,-
Devanāgarī: ये स्तोतृभ्यो गोअग्रामश्वपेशसमग्ने रातिमुपसृजन्ति सूरयः
pada pāṭha: ye | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | go-agrām | aśva-peśasam | agne | rātim | upa-sr̥janti | sūrayaḥ || asmān | ca | tān | ca | pra | hi | neṣi | vasyaḥ | ā | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.2.13||

IAST: asmāñ ca tām̐ś ca pra hi neṣi vasya ā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.
Devanāgarī: अस्माञ्च ताँश्च प्र हि नेषि वस्य आ बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: ye | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | go-agrām | aśva-peśasam | agne | rātim | upa-sr̥janti | sūrayaḥ || asmān | ca | tān | ca | pra | hi | neṣi | vasyaḥ | ā | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.2.13||

IAST: samiddho agnir nihitaḥ pṛthivyām pratyaṅ viśvāni bhuvanāny asthāt
Griffith: AGNI is set upon the earth well kindled; he standeth in the presence of all beings.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धो अग्निर्निहितः पृथिव्यां प्रत्यङ्विश्वानि भुवनान्यस्थात्
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhaḥ | agniḥ | ni-hitaḥ | pr̥thivyām | pratyaṅ | viśvāni | bhuvanāni | asthāt || hotā | pāvakaḥ | pra-divaḥ | su-medhāḥ | devaḥ | devān | yajatu | agniḥ | arhan ||2.3.1||

IAST: hotā pāvakaḥ pradivaḥ sumedhā devo devān yajatv agnir arhan
Griffith: Wise, ancient, God, the Priest and Purifier, let Agni serve the Gods for he is worthy.
Devanāgarī: होता पावकः प्रदिवः सुमेधा देवो देवान्यजत्वग्निरर्हन्
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhaḥ | agniḥ | ni-hitaḥ | pr̥thivyām | pratyaṅ | viśvāni | bhuvanāni | asthāt || hotā | pāvakaḥ | pra-divaḥ | su-medhāḥ | devaḥ | devān | yajatu | agniḥ | arhan ||2.3.1||

IAST: narāśaṁsaḥ prati dhāmāny añjan tisro divaḥ prati mahnā svarciḥ
Griffith: May Narasamsa lighting up the chambers, bright in his majesty through threefold heaven,
Devanāgarī: नराशंसः प्रति धामान्यञ्जन्तिस्रो दिवः प्रति मह्ना स्वर्चिः
pada pāṭha: narāśaṁsaḥ | prati | dhāmāni | añjan | tisraḥ | divaḥ | prati | mahnā | su-arciḥ || ghr̥ta-pruṣā | manasā | havyam | undan | mūrdhan | yajñasya | sam | anaktu | devān ||2.3.2||

IAST: ghṛtapruṣā manasā havyam undan mūrdhan yajñasya sam anaktu devān
Griffith: Steeping the gift with oil diffusing purpose, bedew the Gods at chiefest time of worship.
Devanāgarī: घृतप्रुषा मनसा हव्यमुन्दन्मूर्धन्यज्ञस्य समनक्तु देवान्
pada pāṭha: narāśaṁsaḥ | prati | dhāmāni | añjan | tisraḥ | divaḥ | prati | mahnā | su-arciḥ || ghr̥ta-pruṣā | manasā | havyam | undan | mūrdhan | yajñasya | sam | anaktu | devān ||2.3.2||

IAST: īḻito agne manasā no arhan devān yakṣi mānuṣāt pūrvo adya
Griffith: Adored in heart, as is thy right, O Agni, serve the Gods first to-day before the mortal.
Devanāgarī: ईळितो अग्ने मनसा नो अर्हन्देवान्यक्षि मानुषात्पूर्वो अद्य
pada pāṭha: īḷitaḥ | agne | manasā | naḥ | arhan | devān | yakṣi | mānuṣāt | pūrvaḥ | adya || saḥ | ā | vaha | marutām | śardhaḥ | acyutam | indram | naraḥ | barhi-sadam | yajadhvam ||2.3.3||

IAST: sa ā vaha marutāṁ śardho acyutam indraṁ naro barhiṣadaṁ yajadhvam
Griffith: Bring thou the Marut host. Ye men do worship to Indra seated on the grass, eternal.
Devanāgarī: स आ वह मरुतां शर्धो अच्युतमिन्द्रं नरो बर्हिषदं यजध्वम्
pada pāṭha: īḷitaḥ | agne | manasā | naḥ | arhan | devān | yakṣi | mānuṣāt | pūrvaḥ | adya || saḥ | ā | vaha | marutām | śardhaḥ | acyutam | indram | naraḥ | barhi-sadam | yajadhvam ||2.3.3||

IAST: deva barhir vardhamānaṁ suvīraṁ stīrṇaṁ rāye subharaṁ vedy asyām
Griffith: O Grass divine, increasing, rich in heroes, strewn for wealth' sake, well laid upon this altar,-
Devanāgarī: देव बर्हिर्वर्धमानं सुवीरं स्तीर्णं राये सुभरं वेद्यस्याम्
pada pāṭha: deva | barhiḥ | vardhamānam | su-vīram | stīrṇam | rāye | su-bharam | vedī iti | asyām || ghr̥tena | aktam | vasavaḥ | sīdata | idam | viśve | devāḥ | ādityāḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ ||2.3.4||

IAST: ghṛtenāktaṁ vasavaḥ sīdatedaṁ viśve devā ādityā yajñiyāsaḥ
Griffith: On this bedewed with oil sit ye, O Vasus, sit all ye Gods, ye Holy, ye Adityas.
Devanāgarī: घृतेनाक्तं वसवः सीदतेदं विश्वे देवा आदित्या यज्ञियासः
pada pāṭha: deva | barhiḥ | vardhamānam | su-vīram | stīrṇam | rāye | su-bharam | vedī iti | asyām || ghr̥tena | aktam | vasavaḥ | sīdata | idam | viśve | devāḥ | ādityāḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ ||2.3.4||

IAST: vi śrayantām urviyā hūyamānā dvāro devīḥ suprāyaṇā namobhiḥ
Griffith: Wide be the Doors, the Goddesses, thrown open, easy to pass, invoked, through adorations,
Devanāgarī: वि श्रयन्तामुर्विया हूयमाना द्वारो देवीः सुप्रायणा नमोभिः
pada pāṭha: vi | śrayantām | urviyā | hūyamānāḥ | dvāraḥ | devīḥ | supra-ayanāḥ | namaḥ-bhiḥ || vyacasvatīḥ | vi | prathantām | ajuryāḥ | varṇam | punānāḥ | yaśasam | su-vīram ||2.3.5||

IAST: vyacasvatīr vi prathantām ajuryā varṇam punānā yaśasaṁ suvīram
Griffith: Let them unfold, expansive, everlasting, that sanctify the class famed, rich in heroes.
Devanāgarī: व्यचस्वतीर्वि प्रथन्तामजुर्या वर्णं पुनाना यशसं सुवीरम्
pada pāṭha: vi | śrayantām | urviyā | hūyamānāḥ | dvāraḥ | devīḥ | supra-ayanāḥ | namaḥ-bhiḥ || vyacasvatīḥ | vi | prathantām | ajuryāḥ | varṇam | punānāḥ | yaśasam | su-vīram ||2.3.5||

IAST: sādhv apāṁsi sanatā na ukṣite uṣāsānaktā vayyeva raṇvite
Griffith: Good work for us, the glorious Night and Morning, like female weavers, waxen from aforetime,
Devanāgarī: साध्वपांसि सनता न उक्षिते उषासानक्ता वय्येव रण्विते
pada pāṭha: sādhu | apāṁsi | sanatā | naḥ | ukṣite iti | uṣasānaktā | vayyā-iva | raṇvite iti || tantum | tatam | saṁvayantī iti sam-vayantī | samīcī iti sam-īcī | yajñasya | peśaḥ | sudughe iti su-dughe | payasvatī iti ||2.3.6||

IAST: tantuṁ tataṁ saṁvayantī samīcī yajñasya peśaḥ sudughe payasvatī
Griffith: Yielders of rich milk, interweave in concert the long-extended thread, the web of worship.
Devanāgarī: तन्तुं ततं संवयन्ती समीची यज्ञस्य पेशः सुदुघे पयस्वती
pada pāṭha: sādhu | apāṁsi | sanatā | naḥ | ukṣite iti | uṣasānaktā | vayyā-iva | raṇvite iti || tantum | tatam | saṁvayantī iti sam-vayantī | samīcī iti sam-īcī | yajñasya | peśaḥ | sudughe iti su-dughe | payasvatī iti ||2.3.6||

IAST: daivyā hotārā prathamā viduṣṭara ṛju yakṣataḥ sam ṛcā vapuṣṭarā
Griffith: Let the two heavenly Heralds, first, most wise, most fair, present oblation duly with the sacred verse,
Devanāgarī: दैव्या होतारा प्रथमा विदुष्टर ऋजु यक्षतः समृचा वपुष्टरा
pada pāṭha: daivyā | hotārā | prathamā | viduḥ-tarā | r̥ju | yakṣataḥ | sam | r̥cā | vapuḥ-tarā || devān | yajantau | r̥tu-thā | sam | añjataḥ | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | adhi | sānuṣu | triṣu ||2.3.7||

IAST: devān yajantāv ṛtuthā sam añjato nābhā pṛthivyā adhi sānuṣu triṣu
Griffith: Worshipping God at ordered seasons decking them at three high places at the centre of the earth.
Devanāgarī: देवान्यजन्तावृतुथा समञ्जतो नाभा पृथिव्या अधि सानुषु त्रिषु
pada pāṭha: daivyā | hotārā | prathamā | viduḥ-tarā | r̥ju | yakṣataḥ | sam | r̥cā | vapuḥ-tarā || devān | yajantau | r̥tu-thā | sam | añjataḥ | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | adhi | sānuṣu | triṣu ||2.3.7||

IAST: sarasvatī sādhayantī dhiyaṁ na iḻā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ
Griffith: Sarasvati who perfects our devotion, Ila divine, Bharati all surpassing,-
Devanāgarī: सरस्वती साधयन्ती धियं न इळा देवी भारती विश्वतूर्तिः
pada pāṭha: sarasvatī | sādhayantī | dhiyam | naḥ | iḷā | devī | bhāratī | viśva-tūrtiḥ || tisraḥ | devīḥ | svadhayā | barhiḥ | ā | idam | acchidram | pāntu | śaraṇam | ni-sadya ||2.3.8||

IAST: tisro devīḥ svadhayā barhir edam acchidram pāntu śaraṇaṁ niṣadya
Griffith: Three Goddesses, with power inherent, seated, protect this holy Grass, our flawless refuge!
Devanāgarī: तिस्रो देवीः स्वधया बर्हिरेदमच्छिद्रं पान्तु शरणं निषद्य
pada pāṭha: sarasvatī | sādhayantī | dhiyam | naḥ | iḷā | devī | bhāratī | viśva-tūrtiḥ || tisraḥ | devīḥ | svadhayā | barhiḥ | ā | idam | acchidram | pāntu | śaraṇam | ni-sadya ||2.3.8||

IAST: piśaṅgarūpaḥ subharo vayodhāḥ śruṣṭī vīro jāyate devakāmaḥ
Griffith: Born is the pious hero swift of hearing, like gold in hue, well formed, and full of vigour.
Devanāgarī: पिशङ्गरूपः सुभरो वयोधाः श्रुष्टी वीरो जायते देवकामः
pada pāṭha: piśaṅga-rūpaḥ | su-bharaḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | śruṣṭī | vīraḥ | jāyate | deva-kāmaḥ || pra-jām | tvaṣṭā | vi | syatu | nābhim | asme iti | atha | devānām | api | etu | pāthaḥ ||2.3.9||

IAST: prajāṁ tvaṣṭā vi ṣyatu nābhim asme athā devānām apy etu pāthaḥ
Griffith: May Tvastar lengthen our line and kindred, and may they reach the place which Gods inhabit.
Devanāgarī: प्रजां त्वष्टा वि ष्यतु नाभिमस्मे अथा देवानामप्येतु पाथः
pada pāṭha: piśaṅga-rūpaḥ | su-bharaḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | śruṣṭī | vīraḥ | jāyate | deva-kāmaḥ || pra-jām | tvaṣṭā | vi | syatu | nābhim | asme iti | atha | devānām | api | etu | pāthaḥ ||2.3.9||

IAST: vanaspatir avasṛjann upa sthād agnir haviḥ sūdayāti pra dhībhiḥ
Griffith: Vanaspati shall stand anear and start us, and Agni with his arts prepare oblation.
Devanāgarī: वनस्पतिरवसृजन्नुप स्थादग्निर्हविः सूदयाति प्र धीभिः
pada pāṭha: vanaspatiḥ | ava-sr̥jan | upa | sthāt | agniḥ | haviḥ | sūdayāti | pra | dhībhiḥ || tridhā | sam-aktam | nayatu | pra-jānan | devebhyaḥ | daivyaḥ | śamitā | upa | havyam ||2.3.10||

IAST: tridhā samaktaṁ nayatu prajānan devebhyo daivyaḥ śamitopa havyam
Griffith: Let the skilled heavenly Immolator forward unto the Gods the offering thrice anointed.
Devanāgarī: त्रिधा समक्तं नयतु प्रजानन्देवेभ्यो दैव्यः शमितोप हव्यम्
pada pāṭha: vanaspatiḥ | ava-sr̥jan | upa | sthāt | agniḥ | haviḥ | sūdayāti | pra | dhībhiḥ || tridhā | sam-aktam | nayatu | pra-jānan | devebhyaḥ | daivyaḥ | śamitā | upa | havyam ||2.3.10||

IAST: ghṛtam mimikṣe ghṛtam asya yonir ghṛte śrito ghṛtam v asya dhāma
Griffith: Oil has been mixt: oil is his habitation. In oil he rests: oil is his proper province.
Devanāgarī: घृतं मिमिक्षे घृतमस्य योनिर्घृते श्रितो घृतम्वस्य धाम
pada pāṭha: ghr̥tam | mimikṣe | ghr̥tam | asya | yoniḥ | ghr̥te | śritaḥ | ghr̥tam | ūm̐ iti | asya | dhāma || anu-svadham | ā | vaha | mādayasva | svāhā-kr̥tam | vr̥ṣabha | vakṣi | havyam ||2.3.11||

IAST: anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtaṁ vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam
Griffith: Come as thy wont is: O thou Steer, rejoice thee; bear off the oblation duly consecrated.
Devanāgarī: अनुष्वधमा वह मादयस्व स्वाहाकृतं वृषभ वक्षि हव्यम्
pada pāṭha: ghr̥tam | mimikṣe | ghr̥tam | asya | yoniḥ | ghr̥te | śritaḥ | ghr̥tam | ūm̐ iti | asya | dhāma || anu-svadham | ā | vaha | mādayasva | svāhā-kr̥tam | vr̥ṣabha | vakṣi | havyam ||2.3.11||

IAST: huve vaḥ sudyotmānaṁ suvṛktiṁ viśām agnim atithiṁ suprayasam
Griffith: FOR you I call theglorious refulgent Agni, the guest of men, rich in oblations
Devanāgarī: हुवे वः सुद्योत्मानं सुवृक्तिं विशामग्निमतिथिं सुप्रयसम्
pada pāṭha: huve | vaḥ | su-dyotmānam | su-vr̥ktim | viśām | agnim | atithim | su-prayasam || mitraḥ-iva | yaḥ | didhiṣāyyaḥ | bhūt | devaḥ | ā-deve | jane | jāta-vedāḥ ||2.4.1||

IAST: mitra iva yo didhiṣāyyo bhūd deva ādeve jane jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Whom all must strive to win even as a lover, God among godly people, Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: मित्र इव यो दिधिषाय्यो भूद्देव आदेवे जने जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: huve | vaḥ | su-dyotmānam | su-vr̥ktim | viśām | agnim | atithim | su-prayasam || mitraḥ-iva | yaḥ | didhiṣāyyaḥ | bhūt | devaḥ | ā-deve | jane | jāta-vedāḥ ||2.4.1||

IAST: imaṁ vidhanto apāṁ sadhasthe dvitādadhur bhṛgavo vikṣv āyoḥ
Griffith: Bhrgus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living.
Devanāgarī: इमं विधन्तो अपां सधस्थे द्वितादधुर्भृगवो विक्ष्वायोः
pada pāṭha: imam | vidhantaḥ | apām | sadha-sthe | dvitā | adadhuḥ | bhr̥gavaḥ | vikṣu | āyoḥ || eṣaḥ | viśvāni | abhi | astu | bhūma | devānām | agniḥ | aratiḥ | jīra-aśvaḥ ||2.4.2||

IAST: eṣa viśvāny abhy astu bhūmā devānām agnir aratir jīrāśvaḥ
Griffith: Over all worlds let Agni be the Sovran, the messenger of Gods with rapid coursers.
Devanāgarī: एष विश्वान्यभ्यस्तु भूमा देवानामग्निररतिर्जीराश्वः
pada pāṭha: imam | vidhantaḥ | apām | sadha-sthe | dvitā | adadhuḥ | bhr̥gavaḥ | vikṣu | āyoḥ || eṣaḥ | viśvāni | abhi | astu | bhūma | devānām | agniḥ | aratiḥ | jīra-aśvaḥ ||2.4.2||

IAST: agniṁ devāso mānuṣīṣu vikṣu priyaṁ dhuḥ kṣeṣyanto na mitram
Griffith: Among the tribes of men the Gods placed Agni as a dear Friend when they would dwell among them.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं देवासो मानुषीषु विक्षु प्रियं धुः क्षेष्यन्तो न मित्रम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | devāsaḥ | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu | priyam | dhuḥ | kṣeṣyantaḥ | na | mitram || saḥ | dīdayat | uśatīḥ | ūrmyāḥ | ā | dakṣāyyaḥ | yaḥ | dāsvate | dame | ā ||2.4.3||

IAST: sa dīdayad uśatīr ūrmyā ā dakṣāyyo yo dāsvate dama ā
Griffith: Against the longing nights may he shine brightly, and show the offerer in the house his vigour.
Devanāgarī: स दीदयदुशतीरूर्म्या आ दक्षाय्यो यो दास्वते दम आ
pada pāṭha: agnim | devāsaḥ | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu | priyam | dhuḥ | kṣeṣyantaḥ | na | mitram || saḥ | dīdayat | uśatīḥ | ūrmyāḥ | ā | dakṣāyyaḥ | yaḥ | dāsvate | dame | ā ||2.4.3||

IAST: asya raṇvā svasyeva puṣṭiḥ saṁdṛṣṭir asya hiyānasya dakṣoḥ
Griffith: Sweet is his growth as of one's own possessions; his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely.
Devanāgarī: अस्य रण्वा स्वस्येव पुष्टिः संदृष्टिरस्य हियानस्य दक्षोः
pada pāṭha: asya | raṇvā | svasya-iva | puṣṭiḥ | sam-dr̥ṣṭiḥ | asya | hiyānasya | dhakṣoḥ || vi | yaḥ | bharibhrat | oṣadhīṣu | jihvām | atyaḥ | na | rathyaḥ | dodhavīti | vārān ||2.4.4||

IAST: vi yo bharibhrad oṣadhīṣu jihvām atyo na rathyo dodhavīti vārān
Griffith: He darts his tongue forth, like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail, among the bushes.
Devanāgarī: वि यो भरिभ्रदोषधीषु जिह्वामत्यो न रथ्यो दोधवीति वारान्
pada pāṭha: asya | raṇvā | svasya-iva | puṣṭiḥ | sam-dr̥ṣṭiḥ | asya | hiyānasya | dhakṣoḥ || vi | yaḥ | bharibhrat | oṣadhīṣu | jihvām | atyaḥ | na | rathyaḥ | dodhavīti | vārān ||2.4.4||

IAST: ā yan me abhvaṁ vanadaḥ panantośigbhyo nāmimīta varṇam
Griffith: Since they who honour me have praised my greatness,-he gave, as 'twere, his hue to those who love him.
Devanāgarī: आ यन्मे अभ्वं वनदः पनन्तोशिग्भ्यो नामिमीत वर्णम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | me | abhvam | vanadaḥ | pananta | uśik-bhyaḥ | na | amimīta | varṇam || saḥ | citreṇa | cikite | ram-su | bhāsā | jujurvān | yaḥ | muhuḥ | ā | yuvā | bhūt ||2.4.5||

IAST: sa citreṇa cikite raṁsu bhāsā jujurvām̐ yo muhur ā yuvā bhūt
Griffith: Known is he by his bright delightful splendour, and waxing old renews his youth for ever.
Devanāgarī: स चित्रेण चिकिते रंसु भासा जुजुर्वाँ यो मुहुरा युवा भूत्
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | me | abhvam | vanadaḥ | pananta | uśik-bhyaḥ | na | amimīta | varṇam || saḥ | citreṇa | cikite | ram-su | bhāsā | jujurvān | yaḥ | muhuḥ | ā | yuvā | bhūt ||2.4.5||

IAST: ā yo vanā tātṛṣāṇo na bhāti vār ṇa pathā rathyeva svānīt
Griffith: Like one athirst, he lighteth up the forests; like water down the chariot ways he roareth.
Devanāgarī: आ यो वना तातृषाणो न भाति वार्ण पथा रथ्येव स्वानीत्
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | vanā | tatr̥ṣāṇaḥ | na | bhāti | vāḥ | na | pathā | rathyā-iva | svānīt || kr̥ṣṇa-adhvā | tapuḥ | raṇvaḥ | ciketa | dyauḥ-iva | smayamānaḥ | nabhaḥ-bhiḥ ||2.4.6||

IAST: kṛṣṇādhvā tapū raṇvaś ciketa dyaur iva smayamāno nabhobhiḥ
Griffith: On his black path he shines in burning beauty, marked as it were the heaven that smiles through vapour.
Devanāgarī: कृष्णाध्वा तपू रण्वश्चिकेत द्यौरिव स्मयमानो नभोभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | vanā | tatr̥ṣāṇaḥ | na | bhāti | vāḥ | na | pathā | rathyā-iva | svānīt || kr̥ṣṇa-adhvā | tapuḥ | raṇvaḥ | ciketa | dyauḥ-iva | smayamānaḥ | nabhaḥ-bhiḥ ||2.4.6||

IAST: sa yo vy asthād abhi dakṣad urvīm paśur naiti svayur agopāḥ
Griffith: Around, consuming the broad earth, he wanders, free roaming like an ox without a herdsman,-
Devanāgarī: स यो व्यस्थादभि दक्षदुर्वीं पशुर्नैति स्वयुरगोपाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yaḥ | vi | asthāt | abhi | dhakṣat | urvīṁ | paśuḥ | na | eti | sva-yuḥ | agopāḥ || agniḥ | śociṣmān | atasāni | uṣṇan | kr̥ṣṇa-vyathiḥ | asvadayat | na | bhūma ||2.4.7||

IAST: agniḥ śociṣmām̐ atasāny uṣṇan kṛṣṇavyathir asvadayan na bhūma
Griffith: Agni refulgent, burning up the bushes, with blackened lines, as though the earth he seasoned.
Devanāgarī: अग्निः शोचिष्माँ अतसान्युष्णन्कृष्णव्यथिरस्वदयन्न भूम
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yaḥ | vi | asthāt | abhi | dhakṣat | urvīṁ | paśuḥ | na | eti | sva-yuḥ | agopāḥ || agniḥ | śociṣmān | atasāni | uṣṇan | kr̥ṣṇa-vyathiḥ | asvadayat | na | bhūma ||2.4.7||

IAST: nū te pūrvasyāvaso adhītau tṛtīye vidathe manma śaṁsi
Griffith: I, in remembrance of thine ancient favour have sung my hymn in this our third assembly.
Devanāgarī: नू ते पूर्वस्यावसो अधीतौ तृतीये विदथे मन्म शंसि
pada pāṭha: nu | te | pūrvasya | avasaḥ | adhi-itau | tr̥tīye | vidathe | manma | śaṁsi || asme iti | agne | saṁyat-vīram | br̥hantam | kṣu-mantam | vājam | su-apatyam | rayim | dāḥ ||2.4.8||

IAST: asme agne saṁyadvīram bṛhantaṁ kṣumantaṁ vājaṁ svapatyaṁ rayiṁ dāḥ
Griffith: O Agni, give us wealth with store of heroes and mighty strength in food and noble offspring.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे अग्ने संयद्वीरं बृहन्तं क्षुमन्तं वाजं स्वपत्यं रयिं दाः
pada pāṭha: nu | te | pūrvasya | avasaḥ | adhi-itau | tr̥tīye | vidathe | manma | śaṁsi || asme iti | agne | saṁyat-vīram | br̥hantam | kṣu-mantam | vājam | su-apatyam | rayim | dāḥ ||2.4.8||

IAST: tvayā yathā gṛtsamadāso agne guhā vanvanta uparām̐ abhi ṣyuḥ
Griffith: May the Grtsamadas, serving in secret, through thee, O Agni, overcome their neighbours,
Devanāgarī: त्वया यथा गृत्समदासो अग्ने गुहा वन्वन्त उपराँ अभि ष्युः
pada pāṭha: tvayā | yathā | gr̥tsa-madāsaḥ | agne | guhā | vanvantaḥ | uparān | abhi | syuriti syuḥ || su-vīrāsaḥ | abhimāti-sahaḥ | smat | sūri-bhyaḥ | gr̥ṇate | tat | vayaḥ | dhāḥ ||2.4.9||

IAST: suvīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ smat sūribhyo gṛṇate tad vayo dhāḥ
Griffith: Rich in good heroes and subduing foemen. That vital power give thou to chiefs and singers.
Devanāgarī: सुवीरासो अभिमातिषाहः स्मत्सूरिभ्यो गृणते तद्वयो धाः
pada pāṭha: tvayā | yathā | gr̥tsa-madāsaḥ | agne | guhā | vanvantaḥ | uparān | abhi | syuriti syuḥ || su-vīrāsaḥ | abhimāti-sahaḥ | smat | sūri-bhyaḥ | gr̥ṇate | tat | vayaḥ | dhāḥ ||2.4.9||

IAST: hotājaniṣṭa cetanaḥ pitā pitṛbhya ūtaye
Griffith: HERALD and teacher was he born, a guardian for our patrons' help,
Devanāgarī: होताजनिष्ट चेतनः पिता पितृभ्य ऊतये
pada pāṭha: hotā | ajaniṣṭa | cetanaḥ | pitā | pitr̥-bhyaḥ | ūtaye || pra-yakṣan | jenyam | vasu | śakema | vājinaḥ | yamam ||2.5.1||

IAST: prayakṣañ jenyaṁ vasu śakema vājino yamam
Griffith: Earner by rites of noble wealth. That Strong One may we grasp and guide;
Devanāgarī: प्रयक्षञ्जेन्यं वसु शकेम वाजिनो यमम्
pada pāṭha: hotā | ajaniṣṭa | cetanaḥ | pitā | pitr̥-bhyaḥ | ūtaye || pra-yakṣan | jenyam | vasu | śakema | vājinaḥ | yamam ||2.5.1||

IAST: ā yasmin sapta raśmayas tatā yajñasya netari
Griffith: In whom, Leader of sacrifice, the seven reins, far extended, meet;
Devanāgarī: आ यस्मिन्सप्त रश्मयस्तता यज्ञस्य नेतरि
pada pāṭha: ā | yasmin | sapta | raśmayaḥ | tatāḥ | yajñasya | netari || manuṣvat | daivyam | aṣṭamam | potā | viśvam | tat | invati ||2.5.2||

IAST: manuṣvad daivyam aṣṭamam potā viśvaṁ tad invati
Griffith: Who furthers, man-like, eighth in place, as Cleanser, all the work divine.
Devanāgarī: मनुष्वद्दैव्यमष्टमं पोता विश्वं तदिन्वति
pada pāṭha: ā | yasmin | sapta | raśmayaḥ | tatāḥ | yajñasya | netari || manuṣvat | daivyam | aṣṭamam | potā | viśvam | tat | invati ||2.5.2||

IAST: dadhanve vā yad īm anu vocad brahmāṇi ver u tat
Griffith: When swift he follows this behest, bird-like he chants the holy prayers.
Devanāgarī: दधन्वे वा यदीमनु वोचद्ब्रह्माणि वेरु तत्
pada pāṭha: dadhanve | vā | yat | īm | anu | vocat | brahmāṇi | veḥ | ūm̐ iti | tat || pari | viśvāni | kāvyā | nemiḥ | cakram-iva | abhavat ||2.5.3||

IAST: pari viśvāni kāvyā nemiś cakram ivābhavat
Griffith: He holds all knowledge in his grasp even as the felly rounds the wheel.
Devanāgarī: परि विश्वानि काव्या नेमिश्चक्रमिवाभवत्
pada pāṭha: dadhanve | vā | yat | īm | anu | vocat | brahmāṇi | veḥ | ūm̐ iti | tat || pari | viśvāni | kāvyā | nemiḥ | cakram-iva | abhavat ||2.5.3||

IAST: sākaṁ hi śucinā śuciḥ praśāstā kratunājani
Griffith: Together with pure mental power, pure, as Director, was he born.
Devanāgarī: साकं हि शुचिना शुचिः प्रशास्ता क्रतुनाजनि
pada pāṭha: sākam | hi | śucinā | śuciḥ | pra-śāstā | kratunā | ajani || vidvān | asya | vratā | dhruvā | vayāḥ-iva | anu | rohate ||2.5.4||

IAST: vidvām̐ asya vratā dhruvā vayā ivānu rohate
Griffith: Skilled in his own unchanging laws he waxes like the growing boughs.
Devanāgarī: विद्वाँ अस्य व्रता ध्रुवा वया इवानु रोहते
pada pāṭha: sākam | hi | śucinā | śuciḥ | pra-śāstā | kratunā | ajani || vidvān | asya | vratā | dhruvā | vayāḥ-iva | anu | rohate ||2.5.4||

IAST: tā asya varṇam āyuvo neṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenavaḥ
Griffith: Clothing thern in his hues, the kine of him the Leader wait on him.
Devanāgarī: ता अस्य वर्णमायुवो नेष्टुः सचन्त धेनवः
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | asya | varṇam | āyuvaḥ | neṣṭuḥ | sacanta | dhenavaḥ || kuvit | tisr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | varam | svasāraḥ | yāḥ | idam | yayuḥ ||2.5.5||

IAST: kuvit tisṛbhya ā varaṁ svasāro yā idaṁ yayuḥ
Griffith: Is he not better than the Three, the Sisters who have come to us?
Devanāgarī: कुवित्तिसृभ्य आ वरं स्वसारो या इदं ययुः
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | asya | varṇam | āyuvaḥ | neṣṭuḥ | sacanta | dhenavaḥ || kuvit | tisr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | varam | svasāraḥ | yāḥ | idam | yayuḥ ||2.5.5||

IAST: yadī mātur upa svasā ghṛtam bharanty asthita
Griffith: When, laden with the holy oil, the Sitster [sic] by the Mother stands,
Devanāgarī: यदी मातुरुप स्वसा घृतं भरन्त्यस्थित
pada pāṭha: yadi | mātuḥ | upa | svasā | ghr̥tam | bharantī | asthita || tāsām | adhvaryuḥ | ā-gatau | yavaḥ | vr̥ṣṭī-iva | modate ||2.5.6||

IAST: tāsām adhvaryur āgatau yavo vṛṣṭīva modate
Griffith: The Priest delights in their approach, as corn at coming of the rain.
Devanāgarī: तासामध्वर्युरागतौ यवो वृष्टीव मोदते
pada pāṭha: yadi | mātuḥ | upa | svasā | ghr̥tam | bharantī | asthita || tāsām | adhvaryuḥ | ā-gatau | yavaḥ | vr̥ṣṭī-iva | modate ||2.5.6||

IAST: svaḥ svāya dhāyase kṛṇutām ṛtvig ṛtvijam
Griffith: For his support let him perform as ministrant his priestly task;
Devanāgarī: स्वः स्वाय धायसे कृणुतामृत्विगृत्विजम्
pada pāṭha: svaḥ | svāya | dhāyase | kr̥ṇutām | r̥tvik | r̥tvijam || stomam | yajñam | ca | āt | aram | vanema | rarima | vayam ||2.5.7||

IAST: stomaṁ yajñaṁ cād araṁ vanemā rarimā vayam
Griffith: Yea, song of praise and sacrifice: we have bestowed, let us obtain.
Devanāgarī: स्तोमं यज्ञं चादरं वनेमा ररिमा वयम्
pada pāṭha: svaḥ | svāya | dhāyase | kr̥ṇutām | r̥tvik | r̥tvijam || stomam | yajñam | ca | āt | aram | vanema | rarima | vayam ||2.5.7||

IAST: yathā vidvām̐ araṁ karad viśvebhyo yajatebhyaḥ
Griffith: That so this man well skilled, may pay worship to all the Holy Ones.
Devanāgarī: यथा विद्वाँ अरं करद्विश्वेभ्यो यजतेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: yathā | vidvān | aram | karat | viśvebhyaḥ | yajatebhyaḥ || ayam | agne | tve iti | api | yam | yajñam | cakr̥ma | vayam ||2.5.8||

IAST: ayam agne tve api yaṁ yajñaṁ cakṛmā vayam
Griffith: And, Agni, this our sacrifice which wehave here prepared, to thee.
Devanāgarī: अयमग्ने त्वे अपि यं यज्ञं चकृमा वयम्
pada pāṭha: yathā | vidvān | aram | karat | viśvebhyaḥ | yajatebhyaḥ || ayam | agne | tve iti | api | yam | yajñam | cakr̥ma | vayam ||2.5.8||

IAST: imām me agne samidham imām upasadaṁ vaneḥ
Griffith: AGNI, accept this flaming brand, this waiting with my prayer on thee:
Devanāgarī: इमां मे अग्ने समिधमिमामुपसदं वनेः
pada pāṭha: imām | me | agne | sam-idham | imām | upa-sadam | vaneriti vaneḥ || imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | śrudhi | giraḥ ||2.6.1||

IAST: imā u ṣu śrudhī giraḥ
Griffith: Hear graciously these songs of praise.
Devanāgarī: इमा उ षु श्रुधी गिरः
pada pāṭha: imām | me | agne | sam-idham | imām | upa-sadam | vaneriti vaneḥ || imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | śrudhi | giraḥ ||2.6.1||

IAST: ayā te agne vidhemorjo napād aśvamiṣṭe
Griffith: With this hymn let us honour thee, seeker of horses, Son of Strength,
Devanāgarī: अया ते अग्ने विधेमोर्जो नपादश्वमिष्टे
pada pāṭha: ayā | te | agne | vidhema | ūrjaḥ | napāt | aśvam-iṣṭe || enā | su-uktena | su-jāta ||2.6.2||

IAST: enā sūktena sujāta
Griffith: With this fair hymn, thou nobly born.
Devanāgarī: एना सूक्तेन सुजात
pada pāṭha: ayā | te | agne | vidhema | ūrjaḥ | napāt | aśvam-iṣṭe || enā | su-uktena | su-jāta ||2.6.2||

IAST: taṁ tvā gīrbhir girvaṇasaṁ draviṇasyuṁ draviṇodaḥ
Griffith: As such, lover of song, with songs, wealth-lover, giver of our wealth!
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा गीर्भिर्गिर्वणसं द्रविणस्युं द्रविणोदः
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | gīḥ-bhiḥ | girvaṇasam | draviṇasyum | draviṇaḥ-daḥ || saparyema | saparyavaḥ ||2.6.3||

IAST: saparyema saparyavaḥ
Griffith: With reverence let us worship thee.
Devanāgarī: सपर्येम सपर्यवः
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | gīḥ-bhiḥ | girvaṇasam | draviṇasyum | draviṇaḥ-daḥ || saparyema | saparyavaḥ ||2.6.3||

IAST: sa bodhi sūrir maghavā vasupate vasudāvan
Griffith: Be thou for us a liberal Prince, giver and Lord of precious things.
Devanāgarī: स बोधि सूरिर्मघवा वसुपते वसुदावन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bodhi | sūriḥ | magha-vā | vasu-pate | vasu-dāvan || yuyodhi | asmat | dveṣāṁsi ||2.6.4||

IAST: yuyodhy asmad dveṣāṁsi
Griffith: Drive those who hate us far away.
Devanāgarī: युयोध्यस्मद्द्वेषांसि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bodhi | sūriḥ | magha-vā | vasu-pate | vasu-dāvan || yuyodhi | asmat | dveṣāṁsi ||2.6.4||

IAST: sa no vṛṣṭiṁ divas pari sa no vājam anarvāṇam
Griffith: Such as thou art, give rain from heaven, give strength which no man may resist:
Devanāgarī: स नो वृष्टिं दिवस्परि स नो वाजमनर्वाणम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vr̥ṣṭim | divaḥ | pari | saḥ | naḥ | vājam | anarvāṇam || saḥ | naḥ | sahasriṇīḥ | iṣaḥ ||2.6.5||

IAST: sa naḥ sahasriṇīr iṣaḥ
Griffith: Give food exceeding plentiful.
Devanāgarī: स नः सहस्रिणीरिषः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vr̥ṣṭim | divaḥ | pari | saḥ | naḥ | vājam | anarvāṇam || saḥ | naḥ | sahasriṇīḥ | iṣaḥ ||2.6.5||

IAST: īḻānāyāvasyave yaviṣṭha dūta no girā
Griffith: To him who lauds thee, craving help, most youthful envoy! through our song,
Devanāgarī: ईळानायावस्यवे यविष्ठ दूत नो गिरा
pada pāṭha: īḷānāya | avasyave | yaviṣṭha | dūta | naḥ | girā || yajiṣṭha | hotaḥ | ā | gahi ||2.6.6||

IAST: yajiṣṭha hotar ā gahi
Griffith: Most holy Herald! come thou nigh.
Devanāgarī: यजिष्ठ होतरा गहि
pada pāṭha: īḷānāya | avasyave | yaviṣṭha | dūta | naḥ | girā || yajiṣṭha | hotaḥ | ā | gahi ||2.6.6||

IAST: antar hy agna īyase vidvāñ janmobhayā kave
Griffith: Between both races, Agni, Sage, well skilled thou passest to and fro,
Devanāgarī: अन्तर्ह्यग्न ईयसे विद्वाञ्जन्मोभया कवे
pada pāṭha: antaḥ | hi | agne | īyase | vidvān | janma | ubhayā | kave || dūtaḥ | janyā-iva | mitryaḥ ||2.6.7||

IAST: dūto janyeva mitryaḥ
Griffith: As envoy friendly to mankind.
Devanāgarī: दूतो जन्येव मित्र्यः
pada pāṭha: antaḥ | hi | agne | īyase | vidvān | janma | ubhayā | kave || dūtaḥ | janyā-iva | mitryaḥ ||2.6.7||

IAST: sa vidvām̐ ā ca piprayo yakṣi cikitva ānuṣak
Griffith: Befriend us thou as knowing all. Sage, duly worship thou the Gods,
Devanāgarī: स विद्वाँ आ च पिप्रयो यक्षि चिकित्व आनुषक्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vidvān | ā | ca | piprayaḥ | yakṣi | cikitvaḥ | ānuṣak || ā | ca | asmin | satsi | barhiṣi ||2.6.8||

IAST: ā cāsmin satsi barhiṣi
Griffith: And seat thee on this sacred grass.
Devanāgarī: आ चास्मिन्सत्सि बर्हिषि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vidvān | ā | ca | piprayaḥ | yakṣi | cikitvaḥ | ānuṣak || ā | ca | asmin | satsi | barhiṣi ||2.6.8||

IAST: śreṣṭhaṁ yaviṣṭha bhāratāgne dyumantam ā bhara
Griffith: VASU, thou most youthful God, Bharata, Agni, bring us wealth,
Devanāgarī: श्रेष्ठं यविष्ठ भारताग्ने द्युमन्तमा भर
pada pāṭha: śreṣṭham | yaviṣṭha | bhārata | agne | dyu-mantam | ā | bhara || vaso iti | puru-spr̥ham | rayim ||2.7.1||

IAST: vaso puruspṛhaṁ rayim
Griffith: Excellent, splendid, much-desired.
Devanāgarī: वसो पुरुस्पृहं रयिम्
pada pāṭha: śreṣṭham | yaviṣṭha | bhārata | agne | dyu-mantam | ā | bhara || vaso iti | puru-spr̥ham | rayim ||2.7.1||

IAST: mā no arātir īśata devasya martyasya ca
Griffith: Let no malignity prevail against us, either God's or man's.
Devanāgarī: मा नो अरातिरीशत देवस्य मर्त्यस्य च
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | arātiḥ | īśata | devasya | martyasya | ca || parṣi | tasyāḥ | uta | dviṣaḥ ||2.7.2||

IAST: parṣi tasyā uta dviṣaḥ
Griffith: Save us from this and enmity.
Devanāgarī: पर्षि तस्या उत द्विषः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | arātiḥ | īśata | devasya | martyasya | ca || parṣi | tasyāḥ | uta | dviṣaḥ ||2.7.2||

IAST: viśvā uta tvayā vayaṁ dhārā udanyā iva
Griffith: So through thy favour may we force through all our enemies a way,
Devanāgarī: विश्वा उत त्वया वयं धारा उदन्या इव
pada pāṭha: viśvāḥ | uta | tvayā | vayam | dhārāḥ | udanyāḥ-iva || ati | gāhemahi | dviṣaḥ ||2.7.3||

IAST: ati gāhemahi dviṣaḥ
Griffith: As 'twere through streaming water-floods.
Devanāgarī: अति गाहेमहि द्विषः
pada pāṭha: viśvāḥ | uta | tvayā | vayam | dhārāḥ | udanyāḥ-iva || ati | gāhemahi | dviṣaḥ ||2.7.3||

IAST: śuciḥ pāvaka vandyo 'gne bṛhad vi rocase
Griffith: Thou, Purifier Agni, high shinest forth, bright, adorable,
Devanāgarī: शुचिः पावक वन्द्योऽग्ने बृहद्वि रोचसे
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | pāvaka | vandyaḥ | agne | br̥hat | vi | rocase || tvam | ghr̥tebhiḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||2.7.4||

IAST: tvaṁ ghṛtebhir āhutaḥ
Griffith: When worshipped with the sacred oil.
Devanāgarī: त्वं घृतेभिराहुतः
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | pāvaka | vandyaḥ | agne | br̥hat | vi | rocase || tvam | ghr̥tebhiḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||2.7.4||

IAST: tvaṁ no asi bhāratāgne vaśābhir ukṣabhiḥ
Griffith: Ours art thou, Agni, Bharata, honoured by us with barren cows,
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो असि भारताग्ने वशाभिरुक्षभिः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | asi | bhārata | agne | vaśābhiḥ | ukṣa-bhiḥ || aṣṭā-padībhiḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||2.7.5||

IAST: aṣṭāpadībhir āhutaḥ
Griffith: With bullocks and with kine in calf
Devanāgarī: अष्टापदीभिराहुतः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | asi | bhārata | agne | vaśābhiḥ | ukṣa-bhiḥ || aṣṭā-padībhiḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||2.7.5||

IAST: drvannaḥ sarpirāsutiḥ pratno hotā vareṇyaḥ
Griffith: Wood-fed, bedewed with sacred oil, ancient, Invoker, excellent,
Devanāgarī: द्र्वन्नः सर्पिरासुतिः प्रत्नो होता वरेण्यः
pada pāṭha: dru-annaḥ | sarpiḥ-āsutiḥ | pratnaḥ | hotā | vareṇyaḥ || sahasaḥ | putraḥ | adbhutaḥ ||2.7.6||

IAST: sahasas putro adbhutaḥ
Griffith: The Son of Strength, the Wonderful.
Devanāgarī: सहसस्पुत्रो अद्भुतः
pada pāṭha: dru-annaḥ | sarpiḥ-āsutiḥ | pratnaḥ | hotā | vareṇyaḥ || sahasaḥ | putraḥ | adbhutaḥ ||2.7.6||

IAST: vājayann iva nū rathān yogām̐ agner upa stuhi
Griffith: Now praise, as one who strives for strength, the harnessing of Agni's car,
Devanāgarī: वाजयन्निव नू रथान्योगाँ अग्नेरुप स्तुहि
pada pāṭha: vājayan-iva | nu | rathān | yogān | agneḥ | upa | stuhi || yaśaḥ-tamasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ ||2.8.1||

IAST: yaśastamasya mīḻhuṣaḥ
Griffith: The liberal, the most splendid One;
Devanāgarī: यशस्तमस्य मीळ्हुषः
pada pāṭha: vājayan-iva | nu | rathān | yogān | agneḥ | upa | stuhi || yaśaḥ-tamasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ ||2.8.1||

IAST: yaḥ sunītho dadāśuṣe 'juryo jarayann arim
Griffith: Who, guiding worshippers aright, withers, untouched by age, the foe:
Devanāgarī: यः सुनीथो ददाशुषेऽजुर्यो जरयन्नरिम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | su-nīthaḥ | dadāśuṣe | ajuryaḥ | jarayan | arim || cāru-pratīkaḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||2.8.2||

IAST: cārupratīka āhutaḥ
Griffith: When worshipped fair to look upon;
Devanāgarī: चारुप्रतीक आहुतः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | su-nīthaḥ | dadāśuṣe | ajuryaḥ | jarayan | arim || cāru-pratīkaḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||2.8.2||

IAST: ya u śriyā dameṣv ā doṣoṣasi praśasyate
Griffith: Who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes,
Devanāgarī: य उ श्रिया दमेष्वा दोषोषसि प्रशस्यते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ūm̐ iti | śriyā | dameṣu | ā | doṣā | uṣasi | pra-śasyate || yasya | vratam | na | mīyate ||2.8.3||

IAST: yasya vrataṁ na mīyate
Griffith: Whose statute is inviolate;
Devanāgarī: यस्य व्रतं न मीयते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ūm̐ iti | śriyā | dameṣu | ā | doṣā | uṣasi | pra-śasyate || yasya | vratam | na | mīyate ||2.8.3||

IAST: ā yaḥ svar ṇa bhānunā citro vibhāty arciṣā
Griffith: Who shines refulgent like the Sun, with brilliance and with fiery flame,
Devanāgarī: आ यः स्वर्ण भानुना चित्रो विभात्यर्चिषा
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | svaḥ | na | bhānunā | citraḥ | vi-bhāti | arciṣā || añjānaḥ | ajaraiḥ | abhi ||2.8.4||

IAST: añjāno ajarair abhi
Griffith: Decked with imperishable sheen.
Devanāgarī: अञ्जानो अजरैरभि
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | svaḥ | na | bhānunā | citraḥ | vi-bhāti | arciṣā || añjānaḥ | ajaraiḥ | abhi ||2.8.4||

IAST: atrim anu svarājyam agnim ukthāni vāvṛdhuḥ
Griffith: Him Atri, Agni, have our songs Strengthened according to his sway:
Devanāgarī: अत्रिमनु स्वराज्यमग्निमुक्थानि वावृधुः
pada pāṭha: atrim | anu | sva-rājyam | agnim | ukthāni | vavr̥dhuḥ || viśvāḥ | adhi | śriyaḥ | dadhe ||2.8.5||

IAST: viśvā adhi śriyo dadhe
Griffith: All glories hath he made his own.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा अधि श्रियो दधे
pada pāṭha: atrim | anu | sva-rājyam | agnim | ukthāni | vavr̥dhuḥ || viśvāḥ | adhi | śriyaḥ | dadhe ||2.8.5||

IAST: agner indrasya somasya devānām ūtibhir vayam
Griffith: May we with Agni's, Indra's help, with Soma's, yea, of all the Gods,
Devanāgarī: अग्नेरिन्द्रस्य सोमस्य देवानामूतिभिर्वयम्
pada pāṭha: agneḥ | indrasya | somasya | devānām | ūti-bhiḥ | vayam || ariṣyantaḥ | sacemahi | abhi | syāma | pr̥tanyataḥ ||2.8.6||

IAST: ariṣyantaḥ sacemahy abhi ṣyāma pṛtanyataḥ
Griffith: Uninjured dwell together still, and conquer those who fight with us.
Devanāgarī: अरिष्यन्तः सचेमह्यभि ष्याम पृतन्यतः
pada pāṭha: agneḥ | indrasya | somasya | devānām | ūti-bhiḥ | vayam || ariṣyantaḥ | sacemahi | abhi | syāma | pr̥tanyataḥ ||2.8.6||

IAST: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānas tveṣo dīdivām̐ asadat sudakṣaḥ
Griffith: ACCUSTOMED to the Herald's place, the Herald hath seated him, bright, splendid, passing mighty,
Devanāgarī: नि होता होतृषदने विदानस्त्वेषो दीदिवाँ असदत्सुदक्षः
pada pāṭha: ni | hotā | hotr̥-sadane | vidānaḥ | tveṣaḥ | dīdi-vān | asadat | su-dakṣaḥ || adabdhavrata-pramatiḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ | sahasram-bharaḥ | śuci-jihvaḥ | agniḥ ||2.9.1||

IAST: adabdhavratapramatir vasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śucijihvo agniḥ
Griffith: Whose foresight keeps the Law from violation, excellent, pure-tongued, bringing thousands, Agni.
Devanāgarī: अदब्धव्रतप्रमतिर्वसिष्ठः सहस्रम्भरः शुचिजिह्वो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: ni | hotā | hotr̥-sadane | vidānaḥ | tveṣaḥ | dīdi-vān | asadat | su-dakṣaḥ || adabdhavrata-pramatiḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ | sahasram-bharaḥ | śuci-jihvaḥ | agniḥ ||2.9.1||

IAST: tvaṁ dūtas tvam u naḥ paraspās tvaṁ vasya ā vṛṣabha praṇetā
Griffith: Envoy art thou, protector from the foeman, strong God, thou leadest us to higher blessings.
Devanāgarī: त्वं दूतस्त्वमु नः परस्पास्त्वं वस्य आ वृषभ प्रणेता
pada pāṭha: tvam | dūtaḥ | tvam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | paraḥ-pāḥ | tvam | vasyaḥ | ā | vr̥ṣabha | pra-netā || agne | tokasya | naḥ | tane | tanūnām | apra-yucchan | dīdyat | bodhi | gopāḥ ||2.9.2||

IAST: agne tokasya nas tane tanūnām aprayucchan dīdyad bodhi gopāḥ
Griffith: Refulgent, be an ever-heedful keeper, Agni, for us and for our seed offspring.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने तोकस्य नस्तने तनूनामप्रयुच्छन्दीद्यद्बोधि गोपाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | dūtaḥ | tvam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | paraḥ-pāḥ | tvam | vasyaḥ | ā | vr̥ṣabha | pra-netā || agne | tokasya | naḥ | tane | tanūnām | apra-yucchan | dīdyat | bodhi | gopāḥ ||2.9.2||

IAST: vidhema te parame janmann agne vidhema stomair avare sadhasthe
Griffith: May we adore thee in thy loftiest birthplace, and, with our praises, in thy lower station.
Devanāgarī: विधेम ते परमे जन्मन्नग्ने विधेम स्तोमैरवरे सधस्थे
pada pāṭha: vidhema | te | parame | janman | agne | vidhema | stomaiḥ | avare | sadha-sthe || yasmāt | yoneḥ | ut-āritha | yaje | tam | pra | tve iti | havīṁṣi | juhure | sam-iddhe ||2.9.3||

IAST: yasmād yoner udārithā yaje tam pra tve havīṁṣi juhure samiddhe
Griffith: The place whence thou issued forth I worship: to thee well kindled have they paid oblations.
Devanāgarī: यस्माद्योनेरुदारिथा यजे तं प्र त्वे हवींषि जुहुरे समिद्धे
pada pāṭha: vidhema | te | parame | janman | agne | vidhema | stomaiḥ | avare | sadha-sthe || yasmāt | yoneḥ | ut-āritha | yaje | tam | pra | tve iti | havīṁṣi | juhure | sam-iddhe ||2.9.3||

IAST: agne yajasva haviṣā yajīyāñ chruṣṭī deṣṇam abhi gṛṇīhi rādhaḥ
Griffith: Agni, best Priest, pay worship with oblation; quickly commend the gift to be presented;
Devanāgarī: अग्ने यजस्व हविषा यजीयाञ्छ्रुष्टी देष्णमभि गृणीहि राधः
pada pāṭha: agne | yajasva | haviṣā | yajīyān | śruṣṭī | deṣṇam | abhi | gr̥ṇīhi | rādhaḥ || tvam | hi | asi | rayi-patiḥ | rayīṇām | tvam | śukrasya | vacasaḥ | manotā ||2.9.4||

IAST: tvaṁ hy asi rayipatī rayīṇāṁ tvaṁ śukrasya vacaso manotā
Griffith: For thou art Lord of gathered wealth and treasure. of the bright song of praise thou art inventor.
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह्यसि रयिपती रयीणां त्वं शुक्रस्य वचसो मनोता
pada pāṭha: agne | yajasva | haviṣā | yajīyān | śruṣṭī | deṣṇam | abhi | gr̥ṇīhi | rādhaḥ || tvam | hi | asi | rayi-patiḥ | rayīṇām | tvam | śukrasya | vacasaḥ | manotā ||2.9.4||

IAST: ubhayaṁ te na kṣīyate vasavyaṁ dive-dive jāyamānasya dasma
Griffith: The twofold opulence, O Wonder-Worker, of thee new-born each day never decreases.
Devanāgarī: उभयं ते न क्षीयते वसव्यं दिवेदिवे जायमानस्य दस्म
pada pāṭha: ubhayam | te | na | kṣīyate | vasavyam | dive-dive | jāyamānasya | dasma || kr̥dhi | kṣu-mantam | jaritāram | agne | kr̥dhi | patim | su-apatyasya | rāyaḥ ||2.9.5||

IAST: kṛdhi kṣumantaṁ jaritāram agne kṛdhi patiṁ svapatyasya rāyaḥ
Griffith: Enrich with food the man who lauds thee, Agni: make him the lord of wealth with noble offspring.
Devanāgarī: कृधि क्षुमन्तं जरितारमग्ने कृधि पतिं स्वपत्यस्य रायः
pada pāṭha: ubhayam | te | na | kṣīyate | vasavyam | dive-dive | jāyamānasya | dasma || kr̥dhi | kṣu-mantam | jaritāram | agne | kr̥dhi | patim | su-apatyasya | rāyaḥ ||2.9.5||

IAST: sainānīkena suvidatro asme yaṣṭā devām̐ āyajiṣṭhaḥ svasti
Griffith: May he, benevolent with this fair aspect, best sacrificer, bring the Gods to bless us.
Devanāgarī: सैनानीकेन सुविदत्रो अस्मे यष्टा देवाँ आयजिष्ठः स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | enā | anīkena | su-vidatraḥ | asme iti | yaṣṭā | devān | ā-yajiṣṭhaḥ | svasti || adabdhaḥ | gopāḥ | uta | naḥ | paraḥ-pāḥ | agne | dyu-mat | uta | revat | didīhi ||2.9.6||

IAST: adabdho gopā uta naḥ paraspā agne dyumad uta revad didīhi
Griffith: Sure guardian, our protector from the foemen, shine, Agni, with thine affluence and splendour.
Devanāgarī: अदब्धो गोपा उत नः परस्पा अग्ने द्युमदुत रेवद्दिदीहि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | enā | anīkena | su-vidatraḥ | asme iti | yaṣṭā | devān | ā-yajiṣṭhaḥ | svasti || adabdhaḥ | gopāḥ | uta | naḥ | paraḥ-pāḥ | agne | dyu-mat | uta | revat | didīhi ||2.9.6||

IAST: johūtro agniḥ prathamaḥ piteveḻas pade manuṣā yat samiddhaḥ
Griffith: AGNI, first, loudly calling, like a Father, kindled by man upon the seat of worship.
Devanāgarī: जोहूत्रो अग्निः प्रथमः पितेवेळस्पदे मनुषा यत्समिद्धः
pada pāṭha: johūtraḥ | agniḥ | prathamaḥ | pitā-iva | iḷaḥ | pade | manuṣā | yat | sam-iddhaḥ || śriyam | vasānaḥ | amr̥taḥ | vi-cetāḥ | marmr̥jenyaḥ | śravasyaḥ | saḥ | vājī ||2.10.1||

IAST: śriyaṁ vasāno amṛto vicetā marmṛjenyaḥ śravasyaḥ sa vājī
Griffith: Clothed in his glory, deathless, keen of insight, must be adorned by all, the Strong, the Famous.
Devanāgarī: श्रियं वसानो अमृतो विचेता मर्मृजेन्यः श्रवस्यः स वाजी
pada pāṭha: johūtraḥ | agniḥ | prathamaḥ | pitā-iva | iḷaḥ | pade | manuṣā | yat | sam-iddhaḥ || śriyam | vasānaḥ | amr̥taḥ | vi-cetāḥ | marmr̥jenyaḥ | śravasyaḥ | saḥ | vājī ||2.10.1||

IAST: śrūyā agniś citrabhānur havam me viśvābhir gīrbhir amṛto vicetāḥ
Griffith: May Agni the resplendent hear my calling through all my songs, Immortal, keen of insight.
Devanāgarī: श्रूया अग्निश्चित्रभानुर्हवं मे विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरमृतो विचेताः
pada pāṭha: śruyāḥ | agniḥ | citra-bhānuḥ | havam | me | viśvābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | amr̥taḥ | vi-cetāḥ || śyāvā | ratham | vahataḥ | rohitā | vā | uta | aruṣā | aha | cakre | vi-bhr̥traḥ ||2.10.2||

IAST: śyāvā rathaṁ vahato rohitā votāruṣāha cakre vibhṛtraḥ
Griffith: Dark steeds or ruddy draw his car, or carried in sundry ways he makes them red of colour.
Devanāgarī: श्यावा रथं वहतो रोहिता वोतारुषाह चक्रे विभृत्रः
pada pāṭha: śruyāḥ | agniḥ | citra-bhānuḥ | havam | me | viśvābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | amr̥taḥ | vi-cetāḥ || śyāvā | ratham | vahataḥ | rohitā | vā | uta | aruṣā | aha | cakre | vi-bhr̥traḥ ||2.10.2||

IAST: uttānāyām ajanayan suṣūtam bhuvad agniḥ purupeśāsu garbhaḥ
Griffith: On wood supine they got the well-formed Infant: a germ in various-fashioned plants was Agni;
Devanāgarī: उत्तानायामजनयन्सुषूतं भुवदग्निः पुरुपेशासु गर्भः
pada pāṭha: uttānāyām | ajanayan | su-sūtam | bhuvat | agniḥ | puru-peśāsu | garbhaḥ || śiriṇāyām | cit | aktunā | mahaḥ-bhiḥ | apari-vr̥taḥ | vasati | pra-cetāḥ ||2.10.3||

IAST: śiriṇāyāṁ cid aktunā mahobhir aparīvṛto vasati pracetāḥ
Griffith: And in the night, not compassed round by darkness, he dwells exceeding wise, with rays of splendour.
Devanāgarī: शिरिणायां चिदक्तुना महोभिरपरीवृतो वसति प्रचेताः
pada pāṭha: uttānāyām | ajanayan | su-sūtam | bhuvat | agniḥ | puru-peśāsu | garbhaḥ || śiriṇāyām | cit | aktunā | mahaḥ-bhiḥ | apari-vr̥taḥ | vasati | pra-cetāḥ ||2.10.3||

IAST: jigharmy agniṁ haviṣā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantam bhuvanāni viśvā
Griffith: With oil and sacred gifts I sprinkle Agni who makes his home in front of all things living,
Devanāgarī: जिघर्म्यग्निं हविषा घृतेन प्रतिक्षियन्तं भुवनानि विश्वा
pada pāṭha: jigharmi | agnim | haviṣā | ghr̥tena | prati-kṣiyantam | bhuvanāni | viśvā || pr̥thum | tiraścā | vayasā | br̥hantam | vyaciṣṭham | annaiḥ | rabhasam | dr̥śānam ||2.10.4||

IAST: pṛthuṁ tiraścā vayasā bṛhantaṁ vyaciṣṭham annai rabhasaṁ dṛśānam
Griffith: Broad, vast, through vital power o'er all expanded, conspicuous, strong with all the food that feeds him.
Devanāgarī: पृथुं तिरश्चा वयसा बृहन्तं व्यचिष्ठमन्नै रभसं दृशानम्
pada pāṭha: jigharmi | agnim | haviṣā | ghr̥tena | prati-kṣiyantam | bhuvanāni | viśvā || pr̥thum | tiraścā | vayasā | br̥hantam | vyaciṣṭham | annaiḥ | rabhasam | dr̥śānam ||2.10.4||

IAST: ā viśvataḥ pratyañcaṁ jigharmy arakṣasā manasā taj juṣeta
Griffith: I pour to him who looks in all directions: may he accept it with a friendly spirit.
Devanāgarī: आ विश्वतः प्रत्यञ्चं जिघर्म्यरक्षसा मनसा तज्जुषेत
pada pāṭha: ā | viśvataḥ | pratyañcam | jigharmi | arakṣasā | manasā | tat | juṣeta || marya-śrīḥ | spr̥hayat-varṇaḥ | agniḥ | na | abhi-mr̥śe | tanvā | jarbhurāṇaḥ ||2.10.5||

IAST: maryaśrīḥ spṛhayadvarṇo agnir nābhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ
Griffith: Agni with bridegroom's grace and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury.
Devanāgarī: मर्यश्रीः स्पृहयद्वर्णो अग्निर्नाभिमृशे तन्वा जर्भुराणः
pada pāṭha: ā | viśvataḥ | pratyañcam | jigharmi | arakṣasā | manasā | tat | juṣeta || marya-śrīḥ | spr̥hayat-varṇaḥ | agniḥ | na | abhi-mr̥śe | tanvā | jarbhurāṇaḥ ||2.10.5||

IAST: jñeyā bhāgaṁ sahasāno vareṇa tvādūtāso manuvad vadema
Griffith: By choice victorious, recognize thy portion: with thee for envoy may we speak like Manu.
Devanāgarī: ज्ञेया भागं सहसानो वरेण त्वादूतासो मनुवद्वदेम
pada pāṭha: jñeyāḥ | bhāgam | sahasānaḥ | vareṇa | tvā-dūtāsaḥ | manu-vat | vadema || anūnam | agnim | juhvā | vacasyā | madhu-pr̥cam | dhana-sāḥ | johavīmi ||2.10.6||

IAST: anūnam agniṁ juhvā vacasyā madhupṛcaṁ dhanasā johavīmi
Griffith: Obtaining wealth, I call on perfect Agni who with an eloquent tongue dispenses sweetness.
Devanāgarī: अनूनमग्निं जुह्वा वचस्या मधुपृचं धनसा जोहवीमि
pada pāṭha: jñeyāḥ | bhāgam | sahasānaḥ | vareṇa | tvā-dūtāsaḥ | manu-vat | vadema || anūnam | agnim | juhvā | vacasyā | madhu-pr̥cam | dhana-sāḥ | johavīmi ||2.10.6||

IAST: śrudhī havam indra mā riṣaṇyaḥ syāma te dāvane vasūnām
Griffith: HEAR thou my call, O Indra; be not heedless: thine may we be for thee to give us treasures;
Devanāgarī: श्रुधी हवमिन्द्र मा रिषण्यः स्याम ते दावने वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: śrudhi | havam | indra | mā | riṣaṇyaḥ | syāma | te | dāvane | vasūnām || imāḥ | hi | tvām | ūrjaḥ | vardhayanti | vasu-yavaḥ | sindhavaḥ | na | kṣarantaḥ ||2.11.1||

IAST: imā hi tvām ūrjo vardhayanti vasūyavaḥ sindhavo na kṣarantaḥ
Griffith: For these presented viands, seeking riches, increase thy strength like streams of water flowing.
Devanāgarī: इमा हि त्वामूर्जो वर्धयन्ति वसूयवः सिन्धवो न क्षरन्तः
pada pāṭha: śrudhi | havam | indra | mā | riṣaṇyaḥ | syāma | te | dāvane | vasūnām || imāḥ | hi | tvām | ūrjaḥ | vardhayanti | vasu-yavaḥ | sindhavaḥ | na | kṣarantaḥ ||2.11.1||

IAST: sṛjo mahīr indra yā apinvaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Floods great and many, compassed by the Dragon, thou badest swell and settest free, O Hero.
Devanāgarī: सृजो महीरिन्द्र या अपिन्वः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: sr̥jaḥ | mahīḥ | indra | yāḥ | apinvaḥ | pari-sthitāḥ | ahinā | śūra | pūrvīḥ || amartyam | cit | dāsam | manyamānam | ava | abhinat | ukthaiḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ ||2.11.2||

IAST: amartyaṁ cid dāsam manyamānam avābhinad ukthair vāvṛdhānaḥ
Griffith: Strengthened by songs of praise thou rentest piecemeal the Dasa, him who deemed himself immortal.
Devanāgarī: अमर्त्यं चिद्दासं मन्यमानमवाभिनदुक्थैर्वावृधानः
pada pāṭha: sr̥jaḥ | mahīḥ | indra | yāḥ | apinvaḥ | pari-sthitāḥ | ahinā | śūra | pūrvīḥ || amartyam | cit | dāsam | manyamānam | ava | abhinat | ukthaiḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ ||2.11.2||

IAST: uktheṣv in nu śūra yeṣu cākan stomeṣv indra rudriyeṣu ca
Griffith: For, Hero, in the lauds wherein thou joyedst, in hymns of praise, O Indra, songs of Rudras,
Devanāgarī: उक्थेष्विन्नु शूर येषु चाकन्स्तोमेष्विन्द्र रुद्रियेषु च
pada pāṭha: uktheṣu | it | nu | śūra | yeṣu | cākan | stomeṣu | indra | rudriyeṣu | ca || tubhya | it | etāḥ | yāsu | mandasānaḥ | pra | vāyave | sisrate | na | śubhrāḥ ||2.11.3||

IAST: tubhyed etā yāsu mandasānaḥ pra vāyave sisrate na śubhrāḥ
Griffith: These streams in which is thy delight approach thee, even as the brilliant ones draw near to Vayu.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्येदेता यासु मन्दसानः प्र वायवे सिस्रते न शुभ्राः
pada pāṭha: uktheṣu | it | nu | śūra | yeṣu | cākan | stomeṣu | indra | rudriyeṣu | ca || tubhya | it | etāḥ | yāsu | mandasānaḥ | pra | vāyave | sisrate | na | śubhrāḥ ||2.11.3||

IAST: śubhraṁ nu te śuṣmaṁ vardhayantaḥ śubhraṁ vajram bāhvor dadhānāḥ
Griffith: We who add strength to thine own splendid vigour, laying within thine arms the splendid thunder-
Devanāgarī: शुभ्रं नु ते शुष्मं वर्धयन्तः शुभ्रं वज्रं बाह्वोर्दधानाः
pada pāṭha: śubhram | nu | te | śuṣmam | vardhayantaḥ | śubhram | vajram | bāhvoḥ | dadhānāḥ || śubhraḥ | tvam | indra | vavr̥dhānaḥ | asme iti | dāsīḥ | viśaḥ | sūryeṇa | sahyāḥ ||2.11.4||

IAST: śubhras tvam indra vāvṛdhāno asme dāsīr viśaḥ sūryeṇa sahyāḥ
Griffith: With us mayst thou, O Indra, waxen splendid, with Surya overcome the Dasa races.
Devanāgarī: शुभ्रस्त्वमिन्द्र वावृधानो अस्मे दासीर्विशः सूर्येण सह्याः
pada pāṭha: śubhram | nu | te | śuṣmam | vardhayantaḥ | śubhram | vajram | bāhvoḥ | dadhānāḥ || śubhraḥ | tvam | indra | vavr̥dhānaḥ | asme iti | dāsīḥ | viśaḥ | sūryeṇa | sahyāḥ ||2.11.4||

IAST: guhā hitaṁ guhyaṁ gūḻham apsv apīvṛtam māyinaṁ kṣiyantam
Griffith: Hero, thou slewest in thy valour Ahi concealed in depths, mysterious, great enchanter,
Devanāgarī: गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळ्हमप्स्वपीवृतं मायिनं क्षियन्तम्
pada pāṭha: guhā | hitam | guhyam | gūḷham | ap-su | api-vr̥tam | māyinam | kṣiyantam || uto iti | apaḥ | dyām | tastabhvāṁsam | ahan | ahim | śūra | vīryeṇa ||2.11.5||

IAST: uto apo dyāṁ tastabhvāṁsam ahann ahiṁ śūra vīryeṇa
Griffith: Dwelling enveloped deep within the waters, him who checked heaven and stayed the floods from flowing.
Devanāgarī: उतो अपो द्यां तस्तभ्वांसमहन्नहिं शूर वीर्येण
pada pāṭha: guhā | hitam | guhyam | gūḷham | ap-su | api-vr̥tam | māyinam | kṣiyantam || uto iti | apaḥ | dyām | tastabhvāṁsam | ahan | ahim | śūra | vīryeṇa ||2.11.5||

IAST: stavā nu ta indra pūrvyā mahāny uta stavāma nūtanā kṛtāni
Griffith: Indra, we laud thy great deeds wrought aforetime, we laud thine exploits later of achievement;
Devanāgarī: स्तवा नु त इन्द्र पूर्व्या महान्युत स्तवाम नूतना कृतानि
pada pāṭha: stava | nu | te | indra | pūrvyā | mahāni | uta | stavāma | nūtanā | kr̥tāni || stava | vajram | bāhvoḥ | uśantam | stava | harī iti | sūryasya | ketū iti ||2.11.6||

IAST: stavā vajram bāhvor uśantaṁ stavā harī sūryasya ketū
Griffith: We laud the bolt that in thine arms lies eager; we laud thy two Bay Steeds, heralds of Surya.
Devanāgarī: स्तवा वज्रं बाह्वोरुशन्तं स्तवा हरी सूर्यस्य केतू
pada pāṭha: stava | nu | te | indra | pūrvyā | mahāni | uta | stavāma | nūtanā | kr̥tāni || stava | vajram | bāhvoḥ | uśantam | stava | harī iti | sūryasya | ketū iti ||2.11.6||

IAST: harī nu ta indra vājayantā ghṛtaścutaṁ svāram asvārṣṭām
Griffith: Indra, thy Bay Steeds showing forth their vigour have sent a loud cry out that droppeth fatness.
Devanāgarī: हरी नु त इन्द्र वाजयन्ता घृतश्चुतं स्वारमस्वार्ष्टाम्
pada pāṭha: harī iti | nu | te | indra | vājayantā | ghr̥ta-ścutam | svāram | asvārṣṭām || vi | samanā | bhūmiḥ | aprathiṣṭa | araṁsta | parvataḥ | cit | sariṣyan ||2.11.7||

IAST: vi samanā bhūmir aprathiṣṭāraṁsta parvataś cit sariṣyan
Griffith: The earth hath spread herself in all her fulness: the cloud that was about to move hath rested.
Devanāgarī: वि समना भूमिरप्रथिष्टारंस्त पर्वतश्चित्सरिष्यन्
pada pāṭha: harī iti | nu | te | indra | vājayantā | ghr̥ta-ścutam | svāram | asvārṣṭām || vi | samanā | bhūmiḥ | aprathiṣṭa | araṁsta | parvataḥ | cit | sariṣyan ||2.11.7||

IAST: ni parvataḥ sādy aprayucchan sam mātṛbhir vāvaśāno akrān
Griffith: Down, never ceasing, hath the rain-cloud settled: bellowing, it hath wandered with the Mothers.
Devanāgarī: नि पर्वतः साद्यप्रयुच्छन्सं मातृभिर्वावशानो अक्रान्
pada pāṭha: ni | parvataḥ | sādi | apra-yucchan | sam | mātr̥-bhiḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | akrān || dūre | pāre | vāṇīm | vardhayantaḥ | indra-iṣitām | dhamanim | paprathan | ni ||2.11.8||

IAST: dūre pāre vāṇīṁ vardhayanta indreṣitāṁ dhamanim paprathan ni
Griffith: Swelling the roar in the far distant limits, they have spread wide the blast sent forth by Indra.
Devanāgarī: दूरे पारे वाणीं वर्धयन्त इन्द्रेषितां धमनिं पप्रथन्नि
pada pāṭha: ni | parvataḥ | sādi | apra-yucchan | sam | mātr̥-bhiḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | akrān || dūre | pāre | vāṇīm | vardhayantaḥ | indra-iṣitām | dhamanim | paprathan | ni ||2.11.8||

IAST: indro mahāṁ sindhum āśayānam māyāvinaṁ vṛtram asphuran niḥ
Griffith: Indra hath hurled down the magician Vrtra who lay beleaguering the mighty river.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो महां सिन्धुमाशयानं मायाविनं वृत्रमस्फुरन्निः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | mahām | sindhum | ā-śayānam | māyā-vinam | vr̥tram | asphurat | niḥ || arejetām | rodasī iti | bhiyāne iti | kanikradataḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | asya | vajrāt ||2.11.9||

IAST: arejetāṁ rodasī bhiyāne kanikradato vṛṣṇo asya vajrāt
Griffith: Then both the heaven and earth trembled in terror at the strong Hero's thunder when he bellowed.
Devanāgarī: अरेजेतां रोदसी भियाने कनिक्रदतो वृष्णो अस्य वज्रात्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | mahām | sindhum | ā-śayānam | māyā-vinam | vr̥tram | asphurat | niḥ || arejetām | rodasī iti | bhiyāne iti | kanikradataḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | asya | vajrāt ||2.11.9||

IAST: aroravīd vṛṣṇo asya vajro 'mānuṣaṁ yan mānuṣo nijūrvāt
Griffith: Loud roared the mighty Hero's bolt of thunder, when he, the Friend of man, burnt up the monster,
Devanāgarī: अरोरवीद्वृष्णो अस्य वज्रोऽमानुषं यन्मानुषो निजूर्वात्
pada pāṭha: aroravīt | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | asya | vajraḥ | amānuṣam | yat | mānuṣaḥ | ni-jūrvāt || ni | māyinaḥ | dānavasya | māyāḥ | apādayat | papi-vān | sutasya ||2.11.10||

IAST: ni māyino dānavasya māyā apādayat papivān sutasya
Griffith: And, having drunk his fill of flowing Soma, baffled the guileful Danava's devices.
Devanāgarī: नि मायिनो दानवस्य माया अपादयत्पपिवान्सुतस्य
pada pāṭha: aroravīt | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | asya | vajraḥ | amānuṣam | yat | mānuṣaḥ | ni-jūrvāt || ni | māyinaḥ | dānavasya | māyāḥ | apādayat | papi-vān | sutasya ||2.11.10||

IAST: pibā-pibed indra śūra somam mandantu tvā mandinaḥ sutāsaḥ
Griffith: Drink thou, O Hero Indra, drink the Soma; let the joy-giving juices make thee joyful.
Devanāgarī: पिबापिबेदिन्द्र शूर सोमं मन्दन्तु त्वा मन्दिनः सुतासः
pada pāṭha: piba-piba | it | indra | śūra | somam | mandantu | tvā | mandinaḥ | sutāsaḥ || pr̥ṇantaḥ | te | kukṣī iti | vardhayantu | itthā | sutaḥ | pauraḥ | indram | āva ||2.11.11||

IAST: pṛṇantas te kukṣī vardhayantv itthā sutaḥ paura indram āva
Griffith: They, filling both thy flanks, shall swell thy vigour. The juice that satisfies hath helped Indra.
Devanāgarī: पृणन्तस्ते कुक्षी वर्धयन्त्वित्था सुतः पौर इन्द्रमाव
pada pāṭha: piba-piba | it | indra | śūra | somam | mandantu | tvā | mandinaḥ | sutāsaḥ || pr̥ṇantaḥ | te | kukṣī iti | vardhayantu | itthā | sutaḥ | pauraḥ | indram | āva ||2.11.11||

IAST: tve indrāpy abhūma viprā dhiyaṁ vanema ṛtayā sapantaḥ
Griffith: Singers have we become with thee, O Indra: may we serve duly and prepare devotion.
Devanāgarī: त्वे इन्द्राप्यभूम विप्रा धियं वनेम ऋतया सपन्तः
pada pāṭha: tve iti | indra | api | abhūma | viprāḥ | dhiyam | vanema | r̥ta-yā | sapantaḥ || avasyavaḥ | dhīmahi | pra-śastim | sadyaḥ | te | rāyaḥ | dāvane | syāma ||2.11.12||

IAST: avasyavo dhīmahi praśastiṁ sadyas te rāyo dāvane syāma
Griffith: Seeking thy help we meditate thy praises: may we at once enjoy thy gift of riches.
Devanāgarī: अवस्यवो धीमहि प्रशस्तिं सद्यस्ते रायो दावने स्याम
pada pāṭha: tve iti | indra | api | abhūma | viprāḥ | dhiyam | vanema | r̥ta-yā | sapantaḥ || avasyavaḥ | dhīmahi | pra-śastim | sadyaḥ | te | rāyaḥ | dāvane | syāma ||2.11.12||

IAST: syāma te ta indra ye ta ūtī avasyava ūrjaṁ vardhayantaḥ
Griffith: May we be thine, such by thy help, O Indra, as swell thy vigour while they seek thy favour.
Devanāgarī: स्याम ते त इन्द्र ये त ऊती अवस्यव ऊर्जं वर्धयन्तः
pada pāṭha: syāma | te | te | indra | ye | te | ūtī | avasyavaḥ | ūrjam | vardhayantaḥ || śuṣmin-tamam | yam | cākanāma | deva | asme iti | rayim | rāsi | vīra-vantam ||2.11.13||

IAST: śuṣmintamaṁ yaṁ cākanāma devāsme rayiṁ rāsi vīravantam
Griffith: Give us, thou God, the riches that we long for, most powerful, with stare of noble children.
Devanāgarī: शुष्मिन्तमं यं चाकनाम देवास्मे रयिं रासि वीरवन्तम्
pada pāṭha: syāma | te | te | indra | ye | te | ūtī | avasyavaḥ | ūrjam | vardhayantaḥ || śuṣmin-tamam | yam | cākanāma | deva | asme iti | rayim | rāsi | vīra-vantam ||2.11.13||

IAST: rāsi kṣayaṁ rāsi mitram asme rāsi śardha indra mārutaṁ naḥ
Griffith: Give us a friend, give us an habitation; Indra, give us the company of Maruts,
Devanāgarī: रासि क्षयं रासि मित्रमस्मे रासि शर्ध इन्द्र मारुतं नः
pada pāṭha: rāsi | kṣayam | rāsi | mitram | asme iti | rāsi | śardhaḥ | indra | mārutam | naḥ || sa-joṣasaḥ | ye | ca | mandasānāḥ | pra | vāyavaḥ | pānti | agra-nītim ||2.11.14||

IAST: sajoṣaso ye ca mandasānāḥ pra vāyavaḥ pānty agraṇītim
Griffith: And those whose minds accord with theirs, the Vayus, who drink the first libation of the Soma.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसो ये च मन्दसानाः प्र वायवः पान्त्यग्रणीतिम्
pada pāṭha: rāsi | kṣayam | rāsi | mitram | asme iti | rāsi | śardhaḥ | indra | mārutam | naḥ || sa-joṣasaḥ | ye | ca | mandasānāḥ | pra | vāyavaḥ | pānti | agra-nītim ||2.11.14||

IAST: vyantv in nu yeṣu mandasānas tṛpat somam pāhi drahyad indra
