Griffith: Let those enjoy in whom thou art delighted. Indra, drink Soma for thy strength and gladness.
Devanāgarī: व्यन्त्विन्नु येषु मन्दसानस्तृपत्सोमं पाहि द्रह्यदिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: vyantu | it | nu | yeṣu | mandasānaḥ | tr̥pat | somam | pāhi | drahyat | indra || asmān | su | pr̥t-su | ā | tarutra | avardhayaḥ | dyām | br̥hat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ ||2.11.15||

IAST: asmān su pṛtsv ā tarutrāvardhayo dyām bṛhadbhir arkaiḥ
Griffith: Thou hast exalted us to heaven, Preserver, in battles, through the lofty hymns that praise thee.
Devanāgarī: अस्मान्सु पृत्स्वा तरुत्रावर्धयो द्यां बृहद्भिरर्कैः
pada pāṭha: vyantu | it | nu | yeṣu | mandasānaḥ | tr̥pat | somam | pāhi | drahyat | indra || asmān | su | pr̥t-su | ā | tarutra | avardhayaḥ | dyām | br̥hat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ ||2.11.15||

IAST: bṛhanta in nu ye te tarutrokthebhir vā sumnam āvivāsān
Griffith: Great, verily, are they, O thou Protector, who by their songs of praise have won the blessing.
Devanāgarī: बृहन्त इन्नु ये ते तरुत्रोक्थेभिर्वा सुम्नमाविवासान्
pada pāṭha: br̥hantaḥ | it | nu | ye | te | tarutra | ukthebhiḥ | vā | sumnam | ā-vivāsān || str̥ṇānāsaḥ | barhiḥ | pastya-vat | tvā-ūtāḥ | it | indra | vājam | agman ||2.11.16||

IAST: stṛṇānāso barhiḥ pastyāvat tvotā id indra vājam agman
Griffith: They who strew sacred grass to be thy dwelling, helped by thee have got them strength, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: स्तृणानासो बर्हिः पस्त्यावत्त्वोता इदिन्द्र वाजमग्मन्
pada pāṭha: br̥hantaḥ | it | nu | ye | te | tarutra | ukthebhiḥ | vā | sumnam | ā-vivāsān || str̥ṇānāsaḥ | barhiḥ | pastya-vat | tvā-ūtāḥ | it | indra | vājam | agman ||2.11.16||

IAST: ugreṣv in nu śūra mandasānas trikadrukeṣu pāhi somam indra
Griffith: Upon the great Trikadruka days, Hero, rejoicing thee, O Indra, drink the Soma.
Devanāgarī: उग्रेष्विन्नु शूर मन्दसानस्त्रिकद्रुकेषु पाहि सोममिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: ugreṣu | it | nu | śūra | mandasānaḥ | tri-kadrukeṣu | pāhi | somam | indra || pra-dodhuvat | śmaśruṣu | prīṇānaḥ | yāhi | hari-bhyām | sutasya | pītim ||2.11.17||

IAST: pradodhuvac chmaśruṣu prīṇāno yāhi haribhyāṁ sutasya pītim
Griffith: Come with Bay Steeds to drink of libation, shaking the drops from out thy beard, contented.
Devanāgarī: प्रदोधुवच्छ्मश्रुषु प्रीणानो याहि हरिभ्यां सुतस्य पीतिम्
pada pāṭha: ugreṣu | it | nu | śūra | mandasānaḥ | tri-kadrukeṣu | pāhi | somam | indra || pra-dodhuvat | śmaśruṣu | prīṇānaḥ | yāhi | hari-bhyām | sutasya | pītim ||2.11.17||

IAST: dhiṣvā śavaḥ śūra yena vṛtram avābhinad dānum aurṇavābham
Griffith: Hero, assume the might wherewith thou clavest Vrtra piecemeal, the Danava Aurnavabha.
Devanāgarī: धिष्वा शवः शूर येन वृत्रमवाभिनद्दानुमौर्णवाभम्
pada pāṭha: dhiṣva | śavaḥ | śūra | yena | vr̥tram | ava-abhinat | dānum | aurṇa-vābham || apa | avr̥ṇoḥ | jyotiḥ | āryāya | ni | savyataḥ | sādi | dasyuḥ | indra ||2.11.18||

IAST: apāvṛṇor jyotir āryāya ni savyataḥ sādi dasyur indra
Griffith: Thou hast disclosed the light to light the Arya: on thy left hand, O Indra, sank the Dasyu.
Devanāgarī: अपावृणोर्ज्योतिरार्याय नि सव्यतः सादि दस्युरिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: dhiṣva | śavaḥ | śūra | yena | vr̥tram | ava-abhinat | dānum | aurṇa-vābham || apa | avr̥ṇoḥ | jyotiḥ | āryāya | ni | savyataḥ | sādi | dasyuḥ | indra ||2.11.18||

IAST: sanema ye ta ūtibhis taranto viśvāḥ spṛdha āryeṇa dasyūn
Griffith: May we gain wealth, subduing with thy succour and with the Arya, all our foes, the Dasyus.
Devanāgarī: सनेम ये त ऊतिभिस्तरन्तो विश्वाः स्पृध आर्येण दस्यून्
pada pāṭha: sanema | ye | te | ūti-bhiḥ | tarantaḥ | viśvāḥ | spr̥dhaḥ | āryeṇa | dasyūn || asmabhyam | tat | tvāṣṭram | viśva-rūpam | arandhayaḥ | sākhyasya | tritāya ||2.11.19||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ tat tvāṣṭraṁ viśvarūpam arandhayaḥ sākhyasya tritāya
Griffith: Our gain was that to Trta of our party thou gavest up Tvastar's son Visvarupa.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं तत्त्वाष्ट्रं विश्वरूपमरन्धयः साख्यस्य त्रिताय
pada pāṭha: sanema | ye | te | ūti-bhiḥ | tarantaḥ | viśvāḥ | spr̥dhaḥ | āryeṇa | dasyūn || asmabhyam | tat | tvāṣṭram | viśva-rūpam | arandhayaḥ | sākhyasya | tritāya ||2.11.19||

IAST: asya suvānasya mandinas tritasya ny arbudaṁ vāvṛdhāno astaḥ
Griffith: He cast down Arbuda what time his vigour was strengthened by libations poured by Trta.
Devanāgarī: अस्य सुवानस्य मन्दिनस्त्रितस्य न्यर्बुदं वावृधानो अस्तः
pada pāṭha: asya | suvānasya | mandinaḥ | tritasya | ni | arbudam | vavr̥dhānaḥ | astarityastaḥ || avartayat | sūryaḥ | na | cakram | bhinat | valam | indraḥ | aṅgirasvān ||2.11.20||

IAST: avartayat sūryo na cakram bhinad valam indro aṅgirasvān
Griffith: Indra sent forth his whirling wheel like Surya, and aided by the Angirases rent Vala.
Devanāgarī: अवर्तयत्सूर्यो न चक्रं भिनद्वलमिन्द्रो अङ्गिरस्वान्
pada pāṭha: asya | suvānasya | mandinaḥ | tritasya | ni | arbudam | vavr̥dhānaḥ | astarityastaḥ || avartayat | sūryaḥ | na | cakram | bhinat | valam | indraḥ | aṅgirasvān ||2.11.20||

IAST: nūnaṁ sā te prati varaṁ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
Griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.11.21||

IAST: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in the assembly.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.11.21||

IAST: yo jāta eva prathamo manasvān devo devān kratunā paryabhūṣat
Griffith: HE who, just born, chief God of lofty spirit by power and might became the Gods' protector,
Devanāgarī: यो जात एव प्रथमो मनस्वान्देवो देवान्क्रतुना पर्यभूषत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | jātaḥ | eva | prathamaḥ | manasvān | devaḥ | devān | kratunā | pari-abhūṣat || yasya | śuṣmāt | rodasī iti | abhyasetām | nr̥mṇasya | mahnā | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.1||

IAST: yasya śuṣmād rodasī abhyasetāṁ nṛmṇasya mahnā sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled, He, O men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यस्य शुष्माद्रोदसी अभ्यसेतां नृम्णस्य मह्ना स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | jātaḥ | eva | prathamaḥ | manasvān | devaḥ | devān | kratunā | pari-abhūṣat || yasya | śuṣmāt | rodasī iti | abhyasetām | nr̥mṇasya | mahnā | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.1||

IAST: yaḥ pṛthivīṁ vyathamānām adṛṁhad yaḥ parvatān prakupitām̐ aramṇāt
Griffith: He who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered, and set at rest the agitated mountains,
Devanāgarī: यः पृथिवीं व्यथमानामदृंहद्यः पर्वतान्प्रकुपिताँ अरम्णात्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | pr̥thivīm | vyathamānām | adr̥ṁhat | yaḥ | parvatān | pra-kupitān | aramṇāt || yaḥ | antarikṣam | vi-mame | varīyaḥ | yaḥ | dyām | astabhnāt | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.2||

IAST: yo antarikṣaṁ vimame varīyo yo dyām astabhnāt sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Who measured out the air's wide middle region and gave the heaven support, He, men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यो अन्तरिक्षं विममे वरीयो यो द्यामस्तभ्नात्स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | pr̥thivīm | vyathamānām | adr̥ṁhat | yaḥ | parvatān | pra-kupitān | aramṇāt || yaḥ | antarikṣam | vi-mame | varīyaḥ | yaḥ | dyām | astabhnāt | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.2||

IAST: yo hatvāhim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yo gā udājad apadhā valasya
Griffith: Who slew the Dragon, freed the Seven Rivers, and drove the kine forth from the cave of Vala,
Devanāgarī: यो हत्वाहिमरिणात्सप्त सिन्धून्यो गा उदाजदपधा वलस्य
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | hatvā | ahim | ariṇāt | sapta | sindhūn | yaḥ | gāḥ | ut-ājat | apa-dhā | valasya || yaḥ | aśmanoḥ | antaḥ | agnim | jajāna | sam-vr̥k | samat-su | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.3||

IAST: yo aśmanor antar agniṁ jajāna saṁvṛk samatsu sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Begat the fire between two stones, the spoiler in warriors' battle, He, O men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यो अश्मनोरन्तरग्निं जजान संवृक्समत्सु स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | hatvā | ahim | ariṇāt | sapta | sindhūn | yaḥ | gāḥ | ut-ājat | apa-dhā | valasya || yaḥ | aśmanoḥ | antaḥ | agnim | jajāna | sam-vr̥k | samat-su | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.3||

IAST: yenemā viśvā cyavanā kṛtāni yo dāsaṁ varṇam adharaṁ guhākaḥ
Griffith: By whom this universe was made to tremble, who chased away the humbled brood of demons,
Devanāgarī: येनेमा विश्वा च्यवना कृतानि यो दासं वर्णमधरं गुहाकः
pada pāṭha: yena | imā | viśvā | cyavanā | kr̥tāni | yaḥ | dāsam | varṇam | adharam | guhā | akarityakaḥ || śvaghnī-iva | yaḥ | jigīvān | lakṣam | ādat | aryaḥ | puṣṭāni | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.4||

IAST: śvaghnīva yo jigīvām̐l lakṣam ādad aryaḥ puṣṭāni sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Who, like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foe's riches, He, O men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: श्वघ्नीव यो जिगीवाँल्लक्षमाददर्यः पुष्टानि स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yena | imā | viśvā | cyavanā | kr̥tāni | yaḥ | dāsam | varṇam | adharam | guhā | akarityakaḥ || śvaghnī-iva | yaḥ | jigīvān | lakṣam | ādat | aryaḥ | puṣṭāni | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.4||

IAST: yaṁ smā pṛcchanti kuha seti ghoram utem āhur naiṣo astīty enam
Griffith: Of whom, the Terrible, they ask, Where is He? or verily they say of him, He is not.
Devanāgarī: यं स्मा पृच्छन्ति कुह सेति घोरमुतेमाहुर्नैषो अस्तीत्येनम्
pada pāṭha: yam | sma | pr̥cchanti | kuha | saḥ | iti | ghoram | uta | īm | āhuḥ | na | eṣaḥ | asti | iti | enam || saḥ | aryaḥ | puṣṭīḥ | vijaḥ-iva | ā | mināti | śrat | asmai | dhatta | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.5||

IAST: so aryaḥ puṣṭīr vija ivā mināti śrad asmai dhatta sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: He sweeps away, like birds, the foe's possessions. Have faith in him, for He, O men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: सो अर्यः पुष्टीर्विज इवा मिनाति श्रदस्मै धत्त स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yam | sma | pr̥cchanti | kuha | saḥ | iti | ghoram | uta | īm | āhuḥ | na | eṣaḥ | asti | iti | enam || saḥ | aryaḥ | puṣṭīḥ | vijaḥ-iva | ā | mināti | śrat | asmai | dhatta | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.5||

IAST: yo radhrasya coditā yaḥ kṛśasya yo brahmaṇo nādhamānasya kīreḥ
Griffith: Stirrer to action of the poor and lowly, of priest, of suppliant who sings his praises;
Devanāgarī: यो रध्रस्य चोदिता यः कृशस्य यो ब्रह्मणो नाधमानस्य कीरेः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | radhrasya | coditā | yaḥ | kr̥śasya | yaḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | nādhamānasya | kīreḥ || yukta-grāvṇaḥ | yaḥ | avitā | su-śipraḥ | suta-somasya | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.6||

IAST: yuktagrāvṇo yo 'vitā suśipraḥ sutasomasya sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Who, fair-faced, favours him who presses Soma with stones made ready, He, O men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: युक्तग्राव्णो योऽविता सुशिप्रः सुतसोमस्य स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | radhrasya | coditā | yaḥ | kr̥śasya | yaḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | nādhamānasya | kīreḥ || yukta-grāvṇaḥ | yaḥ | avitā | su-śipraḥ | suta-somasya | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.6||

IAST: yasyāśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvo yasya grāmā yasya viśve rathāsaḥ
Griffith: He under whose supreme control are horses, all chariots, and the villages, and cattle;
Devanāgarī: यस्याश्वासः प्रदिशि यस्य गावो यस्य ग्रामा यस्य विश्वे रथासः
pada pāṭha: yasya | aśvāsaḥ | pra-diśi | yasya | gāvaḥ | yasya | grāmāḥ | yasya | viśve | rathāsaḥ || yaḥ | sūryam | yaḥ | uṣasam | jajāna | yaḥ | apām | netā | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.7||

IAST: yaḥ sūryaṁ ya uṣasaṁ jajāna yo apāṁ netā sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: He who gave being to the Sun and Morning, who leads the waters, He, O men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यः सूर्यं य उषसं जजान यो अपां नेता स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yasya | aśvāsaḥ | pra-diśi | yasya | gāvaḥ | yasya | grāmāḥ | yasya | viśve | rathāsaḥ || yaḥ | sūryam | yaḥ | uṣasam | jajāna | yaḥ | apām | netā | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.7||

IAST: yaṁ krandasī saṁyatī vihvayete pare 'vara ubhayā amitrāḥ
Griffith: To whom two armies cry in close encounter, both enemies, the stronger and the weaker;
Devanāgarī: यं क्रन्दसी संयती विह्वयेते परेऽवर उभया अमित्राः
pada pāṭha: yam | krandasī iti | saṁyatī iti sam-yatī | vihvayete iti vi-hvayete | pare | avare | ubhayāḥ | amitrāḥ || samānam | cit | ratham | ātasthi-vāṁsā | nānā | havete iti | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.8||

IAST: samānaṁ cid ratham ātasthivāṁsā nānā havete sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted, each for himself, He, O ye men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: समानं चिद्रथमातस्थिवांसा नाना हवेते स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yam | krandasī iti | saṁyatī iti sam-yatī | vihvayete iti vi-hvayete | pare | avare | ubhayāḥ | amitrāḥ || samānam | cit | ratham | ātasthi-vāṁsā | nānā | havete iti | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.8||

IAST: yasmān na ṛte vijayante janāso yaṁ yudhyamānā avase havante
Griffith: Without whose help our people never conquer; whom, battling, they invoke to give them succour;
Devanāgarī: यस्मान्न ऋते विजयन्ते जनासो यं युध्यमाना अवसे हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: yasmāt | na | r̥te | vi-jayante | janāsaḥ | yam | yudhyamānāḥ | avase | havante || yaḥ | viśvasya | prati-mānam | babhūva | yaḥ | acyuta-cyut | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.9||

IAST: yo viśvasya pratimānam babhūva yo acyutacyut sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: He of whom all this world is but the copy, who shakes things moveless, He, O men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यो विश्वस्य प्रतिमानं बभूव यो अच्युतच्युत्स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yasmāt | na | r̥te | vi-jayante | janāsaḥ | yam | yudhyamānāḥ | avase | havante || yaḥ | viśvasya | prati-mānam | babhūva | yaḥ | acyuta-cyut | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.9||

IAST: yaḥ śaśvato mahy eno dadhānān amanyamānāñ charvā jaghāna
Griffith: He who hath smitten, ere they knew their danger, with his hurled weapon many grievous sinners;
Devanāgarī: यः शश्वतो मह्येनो दधानानमन्यमानाञ्छर्वा जघान
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śaśvataḥ | mahi | enaḥ | dadhānān | amanyamānān | śarvā | jaghāna || yaḥ | śardhate | na | anu-dadāti | śr̥dhyām | yaḥ | dasyoḥ | hantā | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.10||

IAST: yaḥ śardhate nānudadāti śṛdhyāṁ yo dasyor hantā sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Who pardons not his boldness who provokes him, who slays the Dasyti, He, O men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यः शर्धते नानुददाति शृध्यां यो दस्योर्हन्ता स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śaśvataḥ | mahi | enaḥ | dadhānān | amanyamānān | śarvā | jaghāna || yaḥ | śardhate | na | anu-dadāti | śr̥dhyām | yaḥ | dasyoḥ | hantā | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.10||

IAST: yaḥ śambaram parvateṣu kṣiyantaṁ catvāriṁśyāṁ śarady anvavindat
Griffith: He who discovered in the fortieth autumn Sambara as he dwelt among the mountains;
Devanāgarī: यः शम्बरं पर्वतेषु क्षियन्तं चत्वारिंश्यां शरद्यन्वविन्दत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śambaram | parvateṣu | kṣiyantam | catvāriṁśyām | śaradi | anu-avindat || ojāyamānam | yaḥ | ahim | jaghāna | dānum | śayānam | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.11||

IAST: ojāyamānaṁ yo ahiṁ jaghāna dānuṁ śayānaṁ sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Who slew the Dragon putting forth his vigour, the demon lying there, He, men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: ओजायमानं यो अहिं जघान दानुं शयानं स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śambaram | parvateṣu | kṣiyantam | catvāriṁśyām | śaradi | anu-avindat || ojāyamānam | yaḥ | ahim | jaghāna | dānum | śayānam | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.11||

IAST: yaḥ saptaraśmir vṛṣabhas tuviṣmān avāsṛjat sartave sapta sindhūn
Griffith: Who with seven guiding reins, the Bull, the Mighty, set free the Seven great Floods to flow at pleasure;
Devanāgarī: यः सप्तरश्मिर्वृषभस्तुविष्मानवासृजत्सर्तवे सप्त सिन्धून्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sapta-raśmiḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | tuviṣmān | ava-asr̥jat | sartave | sapta | sindhūn || yaḥ | rauhiṇam | asphurat | vajra-bāhuḥ | dyām | ā-rohantam | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.12||

IAST: yo rauhiṇam asphurad vajrabāhur dyām ārohantaṁ sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Who, thunder-armed, rent Rauhina in pieces when scaling heaven, He, O ye men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यो रौहिणमस्फुरद्वज्रबाहुर्द्यामारोहन्तं स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sapta-raśmiḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | tuviṣmān | ava-asr̥jat | sartave | sapta | sindhūn || yaḥ | rauhiṇam | asphurat | vajra-bāhuḥ | dyām | ā-rohantam | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.12||

IAST: dyāvā cid asmai pṛthivī namete śuṣmāc cid asya parvatā bhayante
Griffith: Even the Heaven and Earth bow down before him, before his very breath the mountains tremble.
Devanāgarī: द्यावा चिदस्मै पृथिवी नमेते शुष्माच्चिदस्य पर्वता भयन्ते
pada pāṭha: dyāvā | cit | asmai | pr̥thivī iti | namete iti | śuṣmāt | cit | asya | parvatāḥ | bhayante || yaḥ | soma-pāḥ | ni-citaḥ | vajra-bāhuḥ | yaḥ | vajra-hastaḥ | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.13||

IAST: yaḥ somapā nicito vajrabāhur yo vajrahastaḥ sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Known as the Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, who wields the bolt, He, O ye men, is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यः सोमपा निचितो वज्रबाहुर्यो वज्रहस्तः स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: dyāvā | cit | asmai | pr̥thivī iti | namete iti | śuṣmāt | cit | asya | parvatāḥ | bhayante || yaḥ | soma-pāḥ | ni-citaḥ | vajra-bāhuḥ | yaḥ | vajra-hastaḥ | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.13||

IAST: yaḥ sunvantam avati yaḥ pacantaṁ yaḥ śaṁsantaṁ yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī
Griffith: Who aids with favour him who pours the Soma and him who brews it, sacrificer, singer.
Devanāgarī: यः सुन्वन्तमवति यः पचन्तं यः शंसन्तं यः शशमानमूती
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sunvantam | avati | yaḥ | pacantam | yaḥ | śaṁsantam | yaḥ | śaśamānam | ūtī || yasya | brahma | vardhanam | yasya | somaḥ | yasya | idam | rādhaḥ | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.14||

IAST: yasya brahma vardhanaṁ yasya somo yasyedaṁ rādhaḥ sa janāsa indraḥ
Griffith: Whom prayer exalts, and pouring forth of Soma, and this our gift, He, O ye men, Is Indra.
Devanāgarī: यस्य ब्रह्म वर्धनं यस्य सोमो यस्येदं राधः स जनास इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sunvantam | avati | yaḥ | pacantam | yaḥ | śaṁsantam | yaḥ | śaśamānam | ūtī || yasya | brahma | vardhanam | yasya | somaḥ | yasya | idam | rādhaḥ | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ ||2.12.14||

IAST: yaḥ sunvate pacate dudhra ā cid vājaṁ dardarṣi sa kilāsi satyaḥ
Griffith: Thou verily art fierce and true who sendest strength to the man who brews and pours libation.
Devanāgarī: यः सुन्वते पचते दुध्र आ चिद्वाजं दर्दर्षि स किलासि सत्यः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sunvate | pacate | dudhraḥ | ā | cit | vājam | dardarṣi | saḥ | kila | asi | satyaḥ || vayam | te | indra | viśvaha | priyāsaḥ | su-vīrāsaḥ | vidatham | ā | vadema ||2.12.15||

IAST: vayaṁ ta indra viśvaha priyāsaḥ suvīrāso vidatham ā vadema
Griffith: So may we evermore, thy friends, O Indra, speak loudly to the synod with our heroes.
Devanāgarī: वयं त इन्द्र विश्वह प्रियासः सुवीरासो विदथमा वदेम
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sunvate | pacate | dudhraḥ | ā | cit | vājam | dardarṣi | saḥ | kila | asi | satyaḥ || vayam | te | indra | viśvaha | priyāsaḥ | su-vīrāsaḥ | vidatham | ā | vadema ||2.12.15||

IAST: ṛtur janitrī tasyā apas pari makṣū jāta āviśad yāsu vardhate
Griffith: THE Season was the parent, and when born therefrom it entered rapidly the floods wherein it grows.
Devanāgarī: ऋतुर्जनित्री तस्या अपस्परि मक्षू जात आविशद्यासु वर्धते
pada pāṭha: r̥tuḥ | janitrī | tasyāḥ | apaḥ | pari | makṣu | jātaḥ | ā | aviśat | yāsu | vardhate || tat | āhanāḥ | abhavat | pipyuṣī | payaḥ | aṁśoḥ | pīyūṣam | prathamam | tat | ukthyam ||2.13.1||

IAST: tad āhanā abhavat pipyuṣī payo 'ṁśoḥ pīyūṣam prathamaṁ tad ukthyam
Griffith: Thence was it full of sap, streaming with milky juice: the milk of the plant's stalk is chief and meet for lauds.
Devanāgarī: तदाहना अभवत्पिप्युषी पयोंऽशोः पीयूषं प्रथमं तदुक्थ्यम्
pada pāṭha: r̥tuḥ | janitrī | tasyāḥ | apaḥ | pari | makṣu | jātaḥ | ā | aviśat | yāsu | vardhate || tat | āhanāḥ | abhavat | pipyuṣī | payaḥ | aṁśoḥ | pīyūṣam | prathamam | tat | ukthyam ||2.13.1||

IAST: sadhrīm ā yanti pari bibhratīḥ payo viśvapsnyāya pra bharanta bhojanam
Griffith: They come trooping together bearing milk to him, and bring him sustenance who gives support to all.
Devanāgarī: सध्रीमा यन्ति परि बिभ्रतीः पयो विश्वप्स्न्याय प्र भरन्त भोजनम्
pada pāṭha: sadhrī | īm | ā | yanti | pari | bibhratīḥ | payaḥ | viśva-psnyāya | pra | bharanta | bhojanam || samānaḥ | adhvā | pra-vatām | anu-syade | yaḥ | tā | akr̥ṇoḥ | prathamam | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.2||

IAST: samāno adhvā pravatām anuṣyade yas tākṛṇoḥ prathamaṁ sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: The way is common for the downward streams to flow. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.
Devanāgarī: समानो अध्वा प्रवतामनुष्यदे यस्ताकृणोः प्रथमं सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: sadhrī | īm | ā | yanti | pari | bibhratīḥ | payaḥ | viśva-psnyāya | pra | bharanta | bhojanam || samānaḥ | adhvā | pra-vatām | anu-syade | yaḥ | tā | akr̥ṇoḥ | prathamam | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.2||

IAST: anv eko vadati yad dadāti tad rūpā minan tadapā eka īyate
Griffith: One priest announces what the institutor gives: one, altering the forms, zealously plies his task,
Devanāgarī: अन्वेको वदति यद्ददाति तद्रूपा मिनन्तदपा एक ईयते
pada pāṭha: anu | ekaḥ | vadati | yat | dadāti | tat | rūpā | minan | tat-apāḥ | ekaḥ | īyate || viśvāḥ | ekasya | vi-nudaḥ | titikṣate | yaḥ | tā | akr̥ṇoḥ | prathamam | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.3||

IAST: viśvā ekasya vinudas titikṣate yas tākṛṇoḥ prathamaṁ sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: The third corrects the imperfections left by each. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा एकस्य विनुदस्तितिक्षते यस्ताकृणोः प्रथमं सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: anu | ekaḥ | vadati | yat | dadāti | tat | rūpā | minan | tat-apāḥ | ekaḥ | īyate || viśvāḥ | ekasya | vi-nudaḥ | titikṣate | yaḥ | tā | akr̥ṇoḥ | prathamam | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.3||

IAST: prajābhyaḥ puṣṭiṁ vibhajanta āsate rayim iva pṛṣṭham prabhavantam āyate
Griffith: Dealing out food unto their people there they sit, like wealth to him who comes, more than the back can bear.
Devanāgarī: प्रजाभ्यः पुष्टिं विभजन्त आसते रयिमिव पृष्ठं प्रभवन्तमायते
pada pāṭha: pra-jābhyaḥ | puṣṭim | vi-bhajantaḥ | āsate | rayim-iva | pr̥ṣṭham | pra-bhavantam | ā-yate || asinvan | daṁṣṭraiḥ | pituḥ | atti | bhojanam | yaḥ | tā | akr̥ṇoḥ | prathamam | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.4||

IAST: asinvan daṁṣṭraiḥ pitur atti bhojanaṁ yas tākṛṇoḥ prathamaṁ sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Greedily with his teeth he eats the master's food. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.
Devanāgarī: असिन्वन्दंष्ट्रैः पितुरत्ति भोजनं यस्ताकृणोः प्रथमं सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: pra-jābhyaḥ | puṣṭim | vi-bhajantaḥ | āsate | rayim-iva | pr̥ṣṭham | pra-bhavantam | ā-yate || asinvan | daṁṣṭraiḥ | pituḥ | atti | bhojanam | yaḥ | tā | akr̥ṇoḥ | prathamam | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.4||

IAST: adhākṛṇoḥ pṛthivīṁ saṁdṛśe dive yo dhautīnām ahihann āriṇak pathaḥ
Griffith: Thou hast created earth to look upon the sky: thou, slaying Ahi, settest free the river's paths.
Devanāgarī: अधाकृणोः पृथिवीं संदृशे दिवे यो धौतीनामहिहन्नारिणक्पथः
pada pāṭha: adha | akr̥ṇoḥ | pr̥thivīm | sam-dr̥śe | dive | yaḥ | dhautīnām | ahi-han | ariṇak | pathaḥ || tam | tvā | stomebhiḥ | uda-bhiḥ | na | vājinam | devam | devāḥ | ajanan | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.5||

IAST: taṁ tvā stomebhir udabhir na vājinaṁ devaṁ devā ajanan sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Thee, such, a God, the Gods have quickened with their lauds, even as a steed with waters: meet for praise art thou.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा स्तोमेभिरुदभिर्न वाजिनं देवं देवा अजनन्सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: adha | akr̥ṇoḥ | pr̥thivīm | sam-dr̥śe | dive | yaḥ | dhautīnām | ahi-han | ariṇak | pathaḥ || tam | tvā | stomebhiḥ | uda-bhiḥ | na | vājinam | devam | devāḥ | ajanan | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.5||

IAST: yo bhojanaṁ ca dayase ca vardhanam ārdrād ā śuṣkam madhumad dudohitha
Griffith: Thou givest increase, thou dealest to us our food: thou milkest from the moist the dry, the rich in sweets.
Devanāgarī: यो भोजनं च दयसे च वर्धनमार्द्रादा शुष्कं मधुमद्दुदोहिथ
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | bhojanam | ca | dayase | ca | vardhanam | ārdrāt | ā | śuṣkam | madhu-mat | dudohitha || saḥ | śeva-dhim | ni | dadhiṣe | vivasvati | viśvasya | ekaḥ | īśiṣe | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.6||

IAST: sa śevadhiṁ ni dadhiṣe vivasvati viśvasyaika īśiṣe sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Thou by the worshipper layest thy precious store: thou art sole Lord of all. Meet for our praise art thou.
Devanāgarī: स शेवधिं नि दधिषे विवस्वति विश्वस्यैक ईशिषे सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | bhojanam | ca | dayase | ca | vardhanam | ārdrāt | ā | śuṣkam | madhu-mat | dudohitha || saḥ | śeva-dhim | ni | dadhiṣe | vivasvati | viśvasya | ekaḥ | īśiṣe | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.6||

IAST: yaḥ puṣpiṇīś ca prasvaś ca dharmaṇādhi dāne vy avanīr adhārayaḥ
Griffith: Thou who hast spread abroad the streams by stablished law, and in the field the plants that blossom and bear seed;
Devanāgarī: यः पुष्पिणीश्च प्रस्वश्च धर्मणाधि दाने व्यवनीरधारयः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | puṣpiṇīḥ | ca | pra-svaḥ | ca | dharmaṇā | adhi | dāne | vi | avanīḥ | adhārayaḥ || yaḥ | ca | asamāḥ | ajanaḥ | didyutaḥ | divaḥ | uruḥ | ūrvān | abhitaḥ | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.7||

IAST: yaś cāsamā ajano didyuto diva urur ūrvām̐ abhitaḥ sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Thou who hast made the matchless lightnings of the sky,-vast, compassing vast realms, meet for our praise art thou.
Devanāgarī: यश्चासमा अजनो दिद्युतो दिव उरुरूर्वाँ अभितः सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | puṣpiṇīḥ | ca | pra-svaḥ | ca | dharmaṇā | adhi | dāne | vi | avanīḥ | adhārayaḥ || yaḥ | ca | asamāḥ | ajanaḥ | didyutaḥ | divaḥ | uruḥ | ūrvān | abhitaḥ | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.7||

IAST: yo nārmaraṁ sahavasuṁ nihantave pṛkṣāya ca dāsaveśāya cāvahaḥ
Griffith: Who broughtest Narmara with all his wealth, for sake of food, to slay him that the fiends might be destroyed,
Devanāgarī: यो नार्मरं सहवसुं निहन्तवे पृक्षाय च दासवेशाय चावहः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | nārmaram | saha-vasum | ni-hantave | pr̥kṣāya | ca | dāsa-veśāya | ca | avahaḥ || ūrjayantyāḥ | apari-viṣṭam | āsyam | uta | eva | adya | puru-kr̥t | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.8||

IAST: ūrjayantyā apariviṣṭam āsyam utaivādya purukṛt sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Broughtest the face unclouded of the strengthening one, performing much even now, worthy art thou of praise.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्जयन्त्या अपरिविष्टमास्यमुतैवाद्य पुरुकृत्सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | nārmaram | saha-vasum | ni-hantave | pr̥kṣāya | ca | dāsa-veśāya | ca | avahaḥ || ūrjayantyāḥ | apari-viṣṭam | āsyam | uta | eva | adya | puru-kr̥t | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.8||

IAST: śataṁ vā yasya daśa sākam ādya ekasya śruṣṭau yad dha codam āvitha
Griffith: Thou boundest up the Dasa's hundred friends and ten, when, at one's hearing, thou belpest thy worshipper.
Devanāgarī: शतं वा यस्य दश साकमाद्य एकस्य श्रुष्टौ यद्ध चोदमाविथ
pada pāṭha: śatam | vā | yasya | daśa | sākam | ā | adyaḥ | ekasya | śruṣṭau | yat | ha | codam | āvitha || arajjau | dasyūn | sam | unap | dabhītaye | supra-avyaḥ | abhavaḥ | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.9||

IAST: arajjau dasyūn sam unab dabhītaye suprāvyo abhavaḥ sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Thou for Dabhiti boundest Dasyus not with cords; Thou wast a mighty help. Worthy of lauds art thou.
Devanāgarī: अरज्जौ दस्यून्समुनब्दभीतये सुप्राव्यो अभवः सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: śatam | vā | yasya | daśa | sākam | ā | adyaḥ | ekasya | śruṣṭau | yat | ha | codam | āvitha || arajjau | dasyūn | sam | unap | dabhītaye | supra-avyaḥ | abhavaḥ | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.9||

IAST: viśved anu rodhanā asya pauṁsyaṁ dadur asmai dadhire kṛtnave dhanam
Griffith: All banks of rivers yielded to his manly might; to him they gave, to him, the Strong, gave up their wealth.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेदनु रोधना अस्य पौंस्यं ददुरस्मै दधिरे कृत्नवे धनम्
pada pāṭha: viśvā | it | anu | rodhanāḥ | asya | pauṁsyam | daduḥ | asmai | dadhire | kr̥tnave | dhanam || ṣaṭ | astabhnāḥ | vi-stiraḥ | pañca | sam-dr̥śaḥ | pari | paraḥ | abhavaḥ | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.10||

IAST: ṣaḻ astabhnā viṣṭiraḥ pañca saṁdṛśaḥ pari paro abhavaḥ sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: The six directions hast thou fixed, a five-fold view: thy victories reached afar. Worthy of lauds art thou.
Devanāgarī: षळस्तभ्ना विष्टिरः पञ्च संदृशः परि परो अभवः सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: viśvā | it | anu | rodhanāḥ | asya | pauṁsyam | daduḥ | asmai | dadhire | kr̥tnave | dhanam || ṣaṭ | astabhnāḥ | vi-stiraḥ | pañca | sam-dr̥śaḥ | pari | paraḥ | abhavaḥ | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.10||

IAST: supravācanaṁ tava vīra vīryaṁ yad ekena kratunā vindase vasu
Griffith: Meet for high praise, O Hero, is thy power, that with thy single wisdom thou obtainest wealth,
Devanāgarī: सुप्रवाचनं तव वीर वीर्यं यदेकेन क्रतुना विन्दसे वसु
pada pāṭha: su-pravācanam | tava | vīra | vīryam | yat | ekena | kratunā | vindase | vasu || jātū-sthirasya | pra | vayaḥ | sahasvataḥ | yā | cakartha | saḥ | indra | viśvā | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.11||

IAST: jātūṣṭhirasya pra vayaḥ sahasvato yā cakartha sendra viśvāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: The life-support of conquering Jatusthira. Indra, for all thy deeds, worthy of lauds art thou.
Devanāgarī: जातूष्ठिरस्य प्र वयः सहस्वतो या चकर्थ सेन्द्र विश्वास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: su-pravācanam | tava | vīra | vīryam | yat | ekena | kratunā | vindase | vasu || jātū-sthirasya | pra | vayaḥ | sahasvataḥ | yā | cakartha | saḥ | indra | viśvā | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.11||

IAST: aramayaḥ sarapasas tarāya kaṁ turvītaye ca vayyāya ca srutim
Griffith: Thou for Turviti heldest still the flowing floods, the river-stream for Vayya easily to pass
Devanāgarī: अरमयः सरपसस्तराय कं तुर्वीतये च वय्याय च स्रुतिम्
pada pāṭha: aramayaḥ | sara-apasaḥ | tarāya | kam | turvītaye | ca | vayyāya | ca | srutim || nīcā | santam | ut | anayaḥ | parā-vr̥jam | pra | andham | śroṇam | śravayan | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.12||

IAST: nīcā santam ud anayaḥ parāvṛjam prāndhaṁ śroṇaṁ śravayan sāsy ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Didst raise the outcast from the depths, and gavest fame unto the halt and blind. Worthy of lauds art thou.
Devanāgarī: नीचा सन्तमुदनयः परावृजं प्रान्धं श्रोणं श्रवयन्सास्युक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: aramayaḥ | sara-apasaḥ | tarāya | kam | turvītaye | ca | vayyāya | ca | srutim || nīcā | santam | ut | anayaḥ | parā-vr̥jam | pra | andham | śroṇam | śravayan | saḥ | asi | ukthyaḥ ||2.13.12||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ tad vaso dānāya rādhaḥ sam arthayasva bahu te vasavyam
Griffith: Prepare thyself to grant us that great bounty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं तद्वसो दानाय राधः समर्थयस्व बहु ते वसव्यम्
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tat | vaso iti | dānāya | rādhaḥ | sam | arthayasva | bahu | te | vasavyam || indra | yat | citram | śravasyāḥ | anu | dyūn | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.13.13||

IAST: indra yac citraṁ śravasyā anu dyūn bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Snatch up the wonderful, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र यच्चित्रं श्रवस्या अनु द्यून्बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tat | vaso iti | dānāya | rādhaḥ | sam | arthayasva | bahu | te | vasavyam || indra | yat | citram | śravasyāḥ | anu | dyūn | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.13.13||

IAST: adhvaryavo bharatendrāya somam āmatrebhiḥ siñcatā madyam andhaḥ
Griffith: MINISTERS, bring the Soma juice for Indra, pour forth the gladdening liquor with the beakers.logeth ever
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो भरतेन्द्राय सोममामत्रेभिः सिञ्चता मद्यमन्धः
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | bharata | indrāya | somam | ā | amatrebhiḥ | siñcata | madyam | andhaḥ || kāmī | hi | vīraḥ | sadam | asya | pītim | juhota | vr̥ṣṇe | tat | it | eṣaḥ | vaṣṭi ||2.14.1||

IAST: kāmī hi vīraḥ sadam asya pītiṁ juhota vṛṣṇe tad id eṣa vaṣṭi
Griffith: To drink of this the Hero offer it to the Bull, for this he willeth.
Devanāgarī: कामी हि वीरः सदमस्य पीतिं जुहोत वृष्णे तदिदेष वष्टि
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | bharata | indrāya | somam | ā | amatrebhiḥ | siñcata | madyam | andhaḥ || kāmī | hi | vīraḥ | sadam | asya | pītim | juhota | vr̥ṣṇe | tat | it | eṣaḥ | vaṣṭi ||2.14.1||

IAST: adhvaryavo yo apo vavrivāṁsaṁ vṛtraṁ jaghānāśanyeva vṛkṣam
Griffith: Ye ministers, to him who with the lightning smote, like a tree, the rain-withholding Vrtra-
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो यो अपो वव्रिवांसं वृत्रं जघानाशन्येव वृक्षम्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | apaḥ | vavri-vāṁsam | vr̥tram | jaghāna | aśanyā-iva | vr̥kṣam || tasmai | etam | bharata | tat-vaśāya | eṣaḥ | indraḥ | arhati | pītim | asya ||2.14.2||

IAST: tasmā etam bharata tadvaśāyam̐ eṣa indro arhati pītim asya
Griffith: Bring it to him, him who is fain to taste it, a draught of this which Indra here deserveth.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा एतं भरत तद्वशायँ एष इन्द्रो अर्हति पीतिमस्य
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | apaḥ | vavri-vāṁsam | vr̥tram | jaghāna | aśanyā-iva | vr̥kṣam || tasmai | etam | bharata | tat-vaśāya | eṣaḥ | indraḥ | arhati | pītim | asya ||2.14.2||

IAST: adhvaryavo yo dṛbhīkaṁ jaghāna yo gā udājad apa hi valaṁ vaḥ
Griffith: Ye ministers, to him who smote Drhhikas who drove the kine forth, and discovered Vala,
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो यो दृभीकं जघान यो गा उदाजदप हि वलं वः
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | dr̥bhīkam | jaghāna | yaḥ | gāḥ | ut-ājat | apa | hi | valam | variti vaḥ || tasmai | etam | antarikṣe | na | vātam | indram | somaiḥ | ā | ūrṇuta | jūḥ | na | vastraiḥ ||2.14.3||

IAST: tasmā etam antarikṣe na vātam indraṁ somair orṇuta jūr na vastraiḥ
Griffith: Offer this draught, like Vita in the region: clothe him with Soma even as steeds with trappings.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा एतमन्तरिक्षे न वातमिन्द्रं सोमैरोर्णुत जूर्न वस्त्रैः
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | dr̥bhīkam | jaghāna | yaḥ | gāḥ | ut-ājat | apa | hi | valam | variti vaḥ || tasmai | etam | antarikṣe | na | vātam | indram | somaiḥ | ā | ūrṇuta | jūḥ | na | vastraiḥ ||2.14.3||

IAST: adhvaryavo ya uraṇaṁ jaghāna nava cakhvāṁsaṁ navatiṁ ca bāhūn
Griffith: Him who did Urana to death, Adhvaryus! though showing arms ninety-and-nine in number;
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो य उरणं जघान नव चख्वांसं नवतिं च बाहून्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | uraṇam | jaghāna | nava | cakhvāṁsam | navatim | ca | bāhūn || yaḥ | arbudam | ava | nīcā | babādhe | tam | indram | somasya | bhr̥the | hinota ||2.14.4||

IAST: yo arbudam ava nīcā babādhe tam indraṁ somasya bhṛthe hinota
Griffith: Who cast down headlong Arbuda and slew him,-speed ye that Indra to our offered Soma.
Devanāgarī: यो अर्बुदमव नीचा बबाधे तमिन्द्रं सोमस्य भृथे हिनोत
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | uraṇam | jaghāna | nava | cakhvāṁsam | navatim | ca | bāhūn || yaḥ | arbudam | ava | nīcā | babādhe | tam | indram | somasya | bhr̥the | hinota ||2.14.4||

IAST: adhvaryavo yaḥ sv aśnaṁ jaghāna yaḥ śuṣṇam aśuṣaṁ yo vyaṁsam
Griffith: Ye ministers, to him who struck down Svasna, and did to death Vyamsa and greedy Susna,
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो यः स्वश्नं जघान यः शुष्णमशुषं यो व्यंसम्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | su | aśnam | jaghāna | yaḥ | śuṣṇam | aśuṣam | yaḥ | vi-aṁsam || yaḥ | piprum | namucim | yaḥ | rudhi-krām | tasmai | indrāya | andhasaḥ | juhota ||2.14.5||

IAST: yaḥ pipruṁ namuciṁ yo rudhikrāṁ tasmā indrāyāndhaso juhota
Griffith: And Rudhikras and Namuci and Pipru,- to him, to Indra, pour ye forth libation.
Devanāgarī: यः पिप्रुं नमुचिं यो रुधिक्रां तस्मा इन्द्रायान्धसो जुहोत
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | su | aśnam | jaghāna | yaḥ | śuṣṇam | aśuṣam | yaḥ | vi-aṁsam || yaḥ | piprum | namucim | yaḥ | rudhi-krām | tasmai | indrāya | andhasaḥ | juhota ||2.14.5||

IAST: adhvaryavo yaḥ śataṁ śambarasya puro bibhedāśmaneva pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Ye ministers, to him who as with thunder demolished Sambara's hundred ancient castles;
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो यः शतं शम्बरस्य पुरो बिभेदाश्मनेव पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | śatam | śambarasya | puraḥ | bibheda | aśmanā-iva | pūrvīḥ || yaḥ | varcinaḥ | śatam | indraḥ | sahasram | apa-avapat | bharata | somam | asmai ||2.14.6||

IAST: yo varcinaḥ śatam indraḥ sahasram apāvapad bharatā somam asmai
Griffith: Who cast down Varcin's sons, a hundred thousand,-to him, to Indra, offer ye the Soma.
Devanāgarī: यो वर्चिनः शतमिन्द्रः सहस्रमपावपद्भरता सोममस्मै
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | śatam | śambarasya | puraḥ | bibheda | aśmanā-iva | pūrvīḥ || yaḥ | varcinaḥ | śatam | indraḥ | sahasram | apa-avapat | bharata | somam | asmai ||2.14.6||

IAST: adhvaryavo yaḥ śatam ā sahasram bhūmyā upasthe 'vapaj jaghanvān
Griffith: Ye ministers, to him who slew a hundred thousand, and cast them down upon earth's bosom;
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो यः शतमा सहस्रं भूम्या उपस्थेऽवपज्जघन्वान्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | śatam | ā | sahasram | bhūmyāḥ | upa-sthe | avapat | jaghanvān || kutsasya | āyoḥ | atithi-gvasya | vīrān | ni | avr̥ṇak | bharata | somam | asmai ||2.14.7||

IAST: kutsasyāyor atithigvasya vīrān ny āvṛṇag bharatā somam asmai
Griffith: Who quelled the valiant men of Atithigva, Kutsa, and Ayu,-bring to him the Soma.
Devanāgarī: कुत्सस्यायोरतिथिग्वस्य वीरान्न्यावृणग्भरता सोममस्मै
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | śatam | ā | sahasram | bhūmyāḥ | upa-sthe | avapat | jaghanvān || kutsasya | āyoḥ | atithi-gvasya | vīrān | ni | avr̥ṇak | bharata | somam | asmai ||2.14.7||

IAST: adhvaryavo yan naraḥ kāmayādhve śruṣṭī vahanto naśathā tad indre
Griffith: Ministers, men, whatever thing ye long for obtain ye quickly bringing gifts to Indra.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो यन्नरः कामयाध्वे श्रुष्टी वहन्तो नशथा तदिन्द्रे
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yat | naraḥ | kāmayādhve | śruṣṭī | vahantaḥ | naśatha | tat | indre || gabhasti-pūtam | bharata | śrutāya | indrāya | somam | yajyavaḥ | juhota ||2.14.8||

IAST: gabhastipūtam bharata śrutāyendrāya somaṁ yajyavo juhota
Griffith: Bring to the Glorious One what bands have cleansed; to Indra bring, ye pious ones, the Soma.
Devanāgarī: गभस्तिपूतं भरत श्रुतायेन्द्राय सोमं यज्यवो जुहोत
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yat | naraḥ | kāmayādhve | śruṣṭī | vahantaḥ | naśatha | tat | indre || gabhasti-pūtam | bharata | śrutāya | indrāya | somam | yajyavaḥ | juhota ||2.14.8||

IAST: adhvaryavaḥ kartanā śruṣṭim asmai vane nipūtaṁ vana un nayadhvam
Griffith: Do ye, O ministers, obey his order: that purified in wood, in wood uplift ye.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवः कर्तना श्रुष्टिमस्मै वने निपूतं वन उन्नयध्वम्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | kartana | śruṣṭim | asmai | vane | ni-pūtam | vane | ut | nayadhvam || juṣāṇaḥ | hastyam | abhi | vāvaśe | vaḥ | indrāya | somam | madiram | juhota ||2.14.9||

IAST: juṣāṇo hastyam abhi vāvaśe va indrāya somam madiraṁ juhota
Griffith: Well pleased he longs for what your hands have tended: offer the gladdening Soma juice to Indra.
Devanāgarī: जुषाणो हस्त्यमभि वावशे व इन्द्राय सोमं मदिरं जुहोत
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | kartana | śruṣṭim | asmai | vane | ni-pūtam | vane | ut | nayadhvam || juṣāṇaḥ | hastyam | abhi | vāvaśe | vaḥ | indrāya | somam | madiram | juhota ||2.14.9||

IAST: adhvaryavaḥ payasodhar yathā goḥ somebhir īm pṛṇatā bhojam indram
Griffith: As the cow's udder teems with milk, Adhvaryus, so fill with Soma Indra, liberal giver.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवः पयसोधर्यथा गोः सोमेभिरीं पृणता भोजमिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | payasā | ūdhaḥ | yathā | goḥ | somebhiḥ | īm | pr̥ṇata | bhojam | indram || veda | aham | asya | ni-bhr̥tam | me | etat | ditsantam | bhūyaḥ | yajataḥ | ciketa ||2.14.10||

IAST: vedāham asya nibhṛtam ma etad ditsantam bhūyo yajataś ciketa
Griffith: I know him: I am sure of this, the Holy knows that I fain would give to him more largely.
Devanāgarī: वेदाहमस्य निभृतं म एतद्दित्सन्तं भूयो यजतश्चिकेत
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | payasā | ūdhaḥ | yathā | goḥ | somebhiḥ | īm | pr̥ṇata | bhojam | indram || veda | aham | asya | ni-bhr̥tam | me | etat | ditsantam | bhūyaḥ | yajataḥ | ciketa ||2.14.10||

IAST: adhvaryavo yo divyasya vasvo yaḥ pārthivasya kṣamyasya rājā
Griffith: Him, ministers, the Lord of heavenly treasure and all terrestrial wealth that earth possesses,
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो यो दिव्यस्य वस्वो यः पार्थिवस्य क्षम्यस्य राजा
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | divyasya | vasvaḥ | yaḥ | pārthivasya | kṣamyasya | rājā || tam | ūrdaram | na | pr̥ṇata | yavena | indram | somebhiḥ | tat | apaḥ | vaḥ | astu ||2.14.11||

IAST: tam ūrdaraṁ na pṛṇatā yavenendraṁ somebhis tad apo vo astu
Griffith: Him, Indra, fill with Soma as a garner is filled with barley full: be this your labour.
Devanāgarī: तमूर्दरं न पृणता यवेनेन्द्रं सोमेभिस्तदपो वो अस्तु
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | yaḥ | divyasya | vasvaḥ | yaḥ | pārthivasya | kṣamyasya | rājā || tam | ūrdaram | na | pr̥ṇata | yavena | indram | somebhiḥ | tat | apaḥ | vaḥ | astu ||2.14.11||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ tad vaso dānāya rādhaḥ sam arthayasva bahu te vasavyam
Griffith: Prepare thyself to grant us that great booty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं तद्वसो दानाय राधः समर्थयस्व बहु ते वसव्यम्
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tat | vaso iti | dānāya | rādhaḥ | sam | arthayasva | bahu | te | vasavyam || indra | yat | citram | śravasyāḥ | anu | dyūn | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.14.12||

IAST: indra yac citraṁ śravasyā anu dyūn bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Gather up wondrous wealth, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र यच्चित्रं श्रवस्या अनु द्यून्बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tat | vaso iti | dānāya | rādhaḥ | sam | arthayasva | bahu | te | vasavyam || indra | yat | citram | śravasyāḥ | anu | dyūn | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.14.12||

IAST: pra ghā nv asya mahato mahāni satyā satyasya karaṇāni vocam
Griffith: Now, verily, will I declare the exploits, mighty and true, of him the True and Mighty.
Devanāgarī: प्र घा न्वस्य महतो महानि सत्या सत्यस्य करणानि वोचम्
pada pāṭha: pra | gha | nu | asya | mahataḥ | mahāni | satyā | satyasya | karaṇāni | vocam || tri-kadrukeṣu | apibat | sutasya | asya | made | ahim | indraḥ | jaghāna ||2.15.1||

IAST: trikadrukeṣv apibat sutasyāsya made ahim indro jaghāna
Griffith: In the Trikadrukas he drank the Soma then in its rapture Indra slew the Dragon.
Devanāgarī: त्रिकद्रुकेष्वपिबत्सुतस्यास्य मदे अहिमिन्द्रो जघान
pada pāṭha: pra | gha | nu | asya | mahataḥ | mahāni | satyā | satyasya | karaṇāni | vocam || tri-kadrukeṣu | apibat | sutasya | asya | made | ahim | indraḥ | jaghāna ||2.15.1||

IAST: avaṁśe dyām astabhāyad bṛhantam ā rodasī apṛṇad antarikṣam
Griffith: High heaven unsupported in space he stablished: he filled the two worlds and the air's mid-region.
Devanāgarī: अवंशे द्यामस्तभायद्बृहन्तमा रोदसी अपृणदन्तरिक्षम्
pada pāṭha: avaṁśe | dyām | astabhāyat | br̥hantam | ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇat | antarikṣam || saḥ | dhārayat | pr̥thivīm | paprathat | ca | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.2||

IAST: sa dhārayat pṛthivīm paprathac ca somasya tā mada indraś cakāra
Griffith: Earth he upheld, and gave it wide expansion. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.
Devanāgarī: स धारयत्पृथिवीं पप्रथच्च सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
pada pāṭha: avaṁśe | dyām | astabhāyat | br̥hantam | ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇat | antarikṣam || saḥ | dhārayat | pr̥thivīm | paprathat | ca | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.2||

IAST: sadmeva prāco vi mimāya mānair vajreṇa khāny atṛṇan nadīnām
Griffith: From front, as 'twere a house, he ruled and measured; pierced with his bolt the fountains of the rivers,
Devanāgarī: सद्मेव प्राचो वि मिमाय मानैर्वज्रेण खान्यतृणन्नदीनाम्
pada pāṭha: sadma-iva | prācaḥ | vi | mimāya | mānaiḥ | vajreṇa | khāni | atr̥ṇat | nadīnām || vr̥thā | asr̥jat | pathi-bhiḥ | dīrgha-yāthaiḥ | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.3||

IAST: vṛthāsṛjat pathibhir dīrghayāthaiḥ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra
Griffith: And made them flow at ease by paths far-reaching, These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.
Devanāgarī: वृथासृजत्पथिभिर्दीर्घयाथैः सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
pada pāṭha: sadma-iva | prācaḥ | vi | mimāya | mānaiḥ | vajreṇa | khāni | atr̥ṇat | nadīnām || vr̥thā | asr̥jat | pathi-bhiḥ | dīrgha-yāthaiḥ | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.3||

IAST: sa pravoḻhṝn parigatyā dabhīter viśvam adhāg āyudham iddhe agnau
Griffith: Compassing those who bore away Dabhiti, in kindled fire he burnt up all their weapons.
Devanāgarī: स प्रवोळ्हॄन्परिगत्या दभीतेर्विश्वमधागायुधमिद्धे अग्नौ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pra-voḷhr̥̄n | pari-gatya | dabhīteḥ | viśvam | adhāk | āyudham | iddhe | agnau || sam | gobhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | asr̥jat | rathebhiḥ | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.4||

IAST: saṁ gobhir aśvair asṛjad rathebhiḥ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra
Griffith: And made him rich with kine and cars and horses. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.
Devanāgarī: सं गोभिरश्वैरसृजद्रथेभिः सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pra-voḷhr̥̄n | pari-gatya | dabhīteḥ | viśvam | adhāk | āyudham | iddhe | agnau || sam | gobhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | asr̥jat | rathebhiḥ | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.4||

IAST: sa īm mahīṁ dhunim etor aramṇāt so asnātṝn apārayat svasti
Griffith: The mighty roaring flood he stayed from flowing, and carried those who swam not safely over.
Devanāgarī: स ईं महीं धुनिमेतोररम्णात्सो अस्नातॄनपारयत्स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | mahīm | dhunim | etoḥ | aramṇāt | saḥ | asnātr̥̄n | apārayat | svasti || te | ut-snāya | rayim | abhi | pra | tasthuḥ | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.5||

IAST: ta utsnāya rayim abhi pra tasthuḥ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra
Griffith: They having crossed the stream attained to riches. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.
Devanāgarī: त उत्स्नाय रयिमभि प्र तस्थुः सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | mahīm | dhunim | etoḥ | aramṇāt | saḥ | asnātr̥̄n | apārayat | svasti || te | ut-snāya | rayim | abhi | pra | tasthuḥ | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.5||

IAST: sodañcaṁ sindhum ariṇān mahitvā vajreṇāna uṣasaḥ sam pipeṣa
Griffith: With mighty power he made the stream flow upward, crushed with his thunderbolt the car of Usas,
Devanāgarī: सोदञ्चं सिन्धुमरिणान्महित्वा वज्रेणान उषसः सं पिपेष
pada pāṭha: saḥ | udañcam | sindhum | ariṇāt | mahi-tvā | vajreṇa | anaḥ | uṣasaḥ | sam | pipeṣa || ajavasaḥ | javinībhiḥ | vi-vr̥ścan | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.6||

IAST: ajavaso javinībhir vivṛścan somasya tā mada indraś cakāra
Griffith: Rending her slow steeds with his rapid coursers. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.
Devanāgarī: अजवसो जविनीभिर्विवृश्चन्सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
pada pāṭha: saḥ | udañcam | sindhum | ariṇāt | mahi-tvā | vajreṇa | anaḥ | uṣasaḥ | sam | pipeṣa || ajavasaḥ | javinībhiḥ | vi-vr̥ścan | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.6||

IAST: sa vidvām̐ apagohaṁ kanīnām āvir bhavann ud atiṣṭhat parāvṛk
Griffith: Knowing the place wherein the maids were hiding, the outcast showed himself and stood before them.
Devanāgarī: स विद्वाँ अपगोहं कनीनामाविर्भवन्नुदतिष्ठत्परावृक्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vidvān | apa-goham | kanīnām | āviḥ | bhavan | ut | atiṣṭhat | parā-vr̥k || prati | śroṇaḥ | sthāt | vi | anak | acaṣṭa | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.7||

IAST: prati śroṇaḥ sthād vy anag acaṣṭa somasya tā mada indraś cakāra
Griffith: The cripple stood erect, the blind beheld them. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.
Devanāgarī: प्रति श्रोणः स्थाद्व्यनगचष्ट सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vidvān | apa-goham | kanīnām | āviḥ | bhavan | ut | atiṣṭhat | parā-vr̥k || prati | śroṇaḥ | sthāt | vi | anak | acaṣṭa | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.7||

IAST: bhinad valam aṅgirobhir gṛṇāno vi parvatasya dṛṁhitāny airat
Griffith: Praised by the Angirases he slaughtered Vala, and burst apart the bulwarks of the mountain.
Devanāgarī: भिनद्वलमङ्गिरोभिर्गृणानो वि पर्वतस्य दृंहितान्यैरत्
pada pāṭha: bhinat | valam | aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ | vi | parvatasya | dr̥ṁhitāni | airat || riṇak | rodhāṁsi | kr̥trimāṇi | eṣām | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.8||

IAST: riṇag rodhāṁsi kṛtrimāṇy eṣāṁ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra
Griffith: He tore away their deftly-built defences. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.
Devanāgarī: रिणग्रोधांसि कृत्रिमाण्येषां सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
pada pāṭha: bhinat | valam | aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ | vi | parvatasya | dr̥ṁhitāni | airat || riṇak | rodhāṁsi | kr̥trimāṇi | eṣām | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.8||

IAST: svapnenābhyupyā cumuriṁ dhuniṁ ca jaghantha dasyum pra dabhītim āvaḥ
Griffith: Thou, with sleep whelming Cumuri and Dhuni, slewest the Dasyu, keptest safe Dabhiti.
Devanāgarī: स्वप्नेनाभ्युप्या चुमुरिं धुनिं च जघन्थ दस्युं प्र दभीतिमावः
pada pāṭha: svapnena | abhi-upya | cumurim | dhunim | ca | jaghantha | dasyum | pra | dabhītim | āvaḥ || rambhī | cit | atra | vivide | hiraṇyam | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.9||

IAST: rambhī cid atra vivide hiraṇyaṁ somasya tā mada indraś cakāra
Griffith: There the staff-bearer found the golden treasure. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.
Devanāgarī: रम्भी चिदत्र विविदे हिरण्यं सोमस्य ता मद इन्द्रश्चकार
pada pāṭha: svapnena | abhi-upya | cumurim | dhunim | ca | jaghantha | dasyum | pra | dabhītim | āvaḥ || rambhī | cit | atra | vivide | hiraṇyam | somasya | tā | made | indraḥ | cakāra ||2.15.9||

IAST: nūnaṁ sā te prati varaṁ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
Griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra , yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.15.10||

IAST: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.15.10||

IAST: pra vaḥ satāṁ jyeṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutim agnāv iva samidhāne havir bhare
Griffith: To him, your own, the best among the good, I bring eulogy, like oblation in the kindled fire.
Devanāgarī: प्र वः सतां ज्येष्ठतमाय सुष्टुतिमग्नाविव समिधाने हविर्भरे
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | satām | jyeṣṭha-tamāya | su-stutim | agnau-iva | sam-idhāne | haviḥ | bhare || indram | ajuryam | jarayantam | ukṣitam | sanāt | yuvānam | avase | havāmahe ||2.16.1||

IAST: indram ajuryaṁ jarayantam ukṣitaṁ sanād yuvānam avase havāmahe
Griffith: We invocate for help Indra untouched by eld, who maketh all decay, strengthened, for ever young.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमजुर्यं जरयन्तमुक्षितं सनाद्युवानमवसे हवामहे
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | satām | jyeṣṭha-tamāya | su-stutim | agnau-iva | sam-idhāne | haviḥ | bhare || indram | ajuryam | jarayantam | ukṣitam | sanāt | yuvānam | avase | havāmahe ||2.16.1||

IAST: yasmād indrād bṛhataḥ kiṁ canem ṛte viśvāny asmin sambhṛtādhi vīryā
Griffith: Without whom naught exists, Indra the Lofty One; in whom alone all powers heroic are combined.
Devanāgarī: यस्मादिन्द्राद्बृहतः किं चनेमृते विश्वान्यस्मिन्सम्भृताधि वीर्या
pada pāṭha: yasmāt | indrāt | br̥hataḥ | kim | cana | īm | r̥te | viśvāni | asmin | sam-bhr̥tā | adhi | vīryā || jaṭhare | somam | tanvi | sahaḥ | mahaḥ | haste | vajram | bharati | śīrṣaṇi | kratum ||2.16.2||

IAST: jaṭhare somaṁ tanvī saho maho haste vajram bharati śīrṣaṇi kratum
Griffith: The Soma is within him, in his frame vast strength, the thunder in his hand and wisdom in his head.
Devanāgarī: जठरे सोमं तन्वी सहो महो हस्ते वज्रं भरति शीर्षणि क्रतुम्
pada pāṭha: yasmāt | indrāt | br̥hataḥ | kim | cana | īm | r̥te | viśvāni | asmin | sam-bhr̥tā | adhi | vīryā || jaṭhare | somam | tanvi | sahaḥ | mahaḥ | haste | vajram | bharati | śīrṣaṇi | kratum ||2.16.2||

IAST: na kṣoṇībhyām paribhve ta indriyaṁ na samudraiḥ parvatair indra te rathaḥ
Griffith: Not by both worlds is thine own power to be surpassed, nor may thy car be stayed by mountains or by seas.
Devanāgarī: न क्षोणीभ्यां परिभ्वे त इन्द्रियं न समुद्रैः पर्वतैरिन्द्र ते रथः
pada pāṭha: na | kṣoṇībhyām | pari-bhve | te | indriyam | na | samudraiḥ | parvataiḥ | indra | te | rathaḥ || na | te | vajram | anu | aśnoti | kaḥ | cana | yat | āśu-bhiḥ | patasi | yojanā | puru ||2.16.3||

IAST: na te vajram anv aśnoti kaś cana yad āśubhiḥ patasi yojanā puru
Griffith: None cometh near, O Indra, to thy thunderbolt, when with swift steeds thou fliest over many a league.
Devanāgarī: न ते वज्रमन्वश्नोति कश्चन यदाशुभिः पतसि योजना पुरु
pada pāṭha: na | kṣoṇībhyām | pari-bhve | te | indriyam | na | samudraiḥ | parvataiḥ | indra | te | rathaḥ || na | te | vajram | anu | aśnoti | kaḥ | cana | yat | āśu-bhiḥ | patasi | yojanā | puru ||2.16.3||

IAST: viśve hy asmai yajatāya dhṛṣṇave kratum bharanti vṛṣabhāya saścate
Griffith: For all men bring their will to him the Resolute, to him the Holy One, to him the Strong they cleave.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे ह्यस्मै यजताय धृष्णवे क्रतुं भरन्ति वृषभाय सश्चते
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | asmai | yajatāya | dhr̥ṣṇave | kratum | bharanti | vr̥ṣabhāya | saścate || vr̥ṣā | yajasva | haviṣā | viduḥ-taraḥ | piba | indra | somam | vr̥ṣabheṇa | bhānunā ||2.16.4||

IAST: vṛṣā yajasva haviṣā viduṣṭaraḥ pibendra somaṁ vṛṣabheṇa bhānunā
Griffith: Pay worship with oblation, strong and passing wise. Drink thou the Soma, Indra, through the mighty blaze.
Devanāgarī: वृषा यजस्व हविषा विदुष्टरः पिबेन्द्र सोमं वृषभेण भानुना
pada pāṭha: viśve | hi | asmai | yajatāya | dhr̥ṣṇave | kratum | bharanti | vr̥ṣabhāya | saścate || vr̥ṣā | yajasva | haviṣā | viduḥ-taraḥ | piba | indra | somam | vr̥ṣabheṇa | bhānunā ||2.16.4||

IAST: vṛṣṇaḥ kośaḥ pavate madhva ūrmir vṛṣabhānnāya vṛṣabhāya pātave
Griffith: The vessel of the strong flows forth, the flood of meath, unto the Strong who feeds upon the strong, for drink,
Devanāgarī: वृष्णः कोशः पवते मध्व ऊर्मिर्वृषभान्नाय वृषभाय पातवे
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṇaḥ | kośaḥ | pavate | madhvaḥ | ūrmiḥ | vr̥ṣabha-annāya | vr̥ṣabhāya | pātave || vr̥ṣaṇā | adhvaryū iti | vr̥ṣabhāsaḥ | adrayaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇam | somam | vr̥ṣabhāya | susvati ||2.16.5||

IAST: vṛṣaṇādhvaryū vṛṣabhāso adrayo vṛṣaṇaṁ somaṁ vṛṣabhāya suṣvati
Griffith: Strong are the two Adhvaryus, strong are both the stones. They press the Soma that is strong for him the Strong.
Devanāgarī: वृषणाध्वर्यू वृषभासो अद्रयो वृषणं सोमं वृषभाय सुष्वति
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣṇaḥ | kośaḥ | pavate | madhvaḥ | ūrmiḥ | vr̥ṣabha-annāya | vr̥ṣabhāya | pātave || vr̥ṣaṇā | adhvaryū iti | vr̥ṣabhāsaḥ | adrayaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇam | somam | vr̥ṣabhāya | susvati ||2.16.5||

IAST: vṛṣā te vajra uta te vṛṣā ratho vṛṣaṇā harī vṛṣabhāṇy āyudhā
Griffith: Strong is thy thunderbolt, yea, and thy car is strong; strong are thy Bay Steeds and thy weapons powerful.
Devanāgarī: वृषा ते वज्र उत ते वृषा रथो वृषणा हरी वृषभाण्यायुधा
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | te | vajraḥ | uta | te | vr̥ṣā | rathaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti | vr̥ṣabhāṇi | āyudhā || vr̥ṣṇaḥ | madasya | vr̥ṣabha | tvam | īśiṣe | indra | somasya | vr̥ṣabhasya | tr̥pṇuhi ||2.16.6||

IAST: vṛṣṇo madasya vṛṣabha tvam īśiṣa indra somasya vṛṣabhasya tṛpṇuhi
Griffith: Thou, Indra, Bull, art Lord of the strong gladdening drink. with the strong Soma, Indra, satisfy thyself.
Devanāgarī: वृष्णो मदस्य वृषभ त्वमीशिष इन्द्र सोमस्य वृषभस्य तृप्णुहि
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | te | vajraḥ | uta | te | vr̥ṣā | rathaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | harī iti | vr̥ṣabhāṇi | āyudhā || vr̥ṣṇaḥ | madasya | vr̥ṣabha | tvam | īśiṣe | indra | somasya | vr̥ṣabhasya | tr̥pṇuhi ||2.16.6||

IAST: pra te nāvaṁ na samane vacasyuvam brahmaṇā yāmi savaneṣu dādhṛṣiḥ
Griffith: I, bold by prayer, come near thee in thy sacred rites, thee like a saving ship, thee shouting in the war.
Devanāgarī: प्र ते नावं न समने वचस्युवं ब्रह्मणा यामि सवनेषु दाधृषिः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | nāvam | na | samane | vacasyuvam | brahmaṇā | yāmi | savaneṣu | dadhr̥ṣiḥ || kuvit | naḥ | asya | vacasaḥ | ni-bodhiṣat | indram | utsam | na | vasunaḥ | sicāmahe ||2.16.7||

IAST: kuvin no asya vacaso nibodhiṣad indram utsaṁ na vasunaḥ sicāmahe
Griffith: Verily he will hear and mark this word of ours: we will pour Indra forth as 'twere a spring of wealth.
Devanāgarī: कुविन्नो अस्य वचसो निबोधिषदिन्द्रमुत्सं न वसुनः सिचामहे
pada pāṭha: pra | te | nāvam | na | samane | vacasyuvam | brahmaṇā | yāmi | savaneṣu | dadhr̥ṣiḥ || kuvit | naḥ | asya | vacasaḥ | ni-bodhiṣat | indram | utsam | na | vasunaḥ | sicāmahe ||2.16.7||

IAST: purā sambādhād abhy ā vavṛtsva no dhenur na vatsaṁ yavasasya pipyuṣī
Griffith: Turn thee unto us ere calamity come nigh, as a cow full of pasture turns her to her calf.
Devanāgarī: पुरा सम्बाधादभ्या ववृत्स्व नो धेनुर्न वत्सं यवसस्य पिप्युषी
pada pāṭha: purā | sam-bādhāt | abhi | ā | vavr̥tsva | naḥ | dhenuḥ | na | vatsam | yavasasya | pipyuṣī || sakr̥t | su | te | sumati-bhiḥ | śatakrato iti śata-krato | sam | patnībhiḥ | na | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | nasīmahi ||2.16.8||

IAST: sakṛt su te sumatibhiḥ śatakrato sam patnībhir na vṛṣaṇo nasīmahi
Griffith: Lord of a Hundred Powers, may we once firmly cling to thy fair favours even as husbands to their wives.
Devanāgarī: सकृत्सु ते सुमतिभिः शतक्रतो सं पत्नीभिर्न वृषणो नसीमहि
pada pāṭha: purā | sam-bādhāt | abhi | ā | vavr̥tsva | naḥ | dhenuḥ | na | vatsam | yavasasya | pipyuṣī || sakr̥t | su | te | sumati-bhiḥ | śatakrato iti śata-krato | sam | patnībhiḥ | na | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | nasīmahi ||2.16.8||

IAST: nūnaṁ sā te prati varaṁ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
Griffith: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.16.9||

IAST: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.16.9||

IAST: tad asmai navyam aṅgirasvad arcata śuṣmā yad asya pratnathodīrate
Griffith: LIKE the Angirases, sing this new song forth to him, for, as in ancient days, his mighty powers are shown,
Devanāgarī: तदस्मै नव्यमङ्गिरस्वदर्चत शुष्मा यदस्य प्रत्नथोदीरते
pada pāṭha: tat | asmai | navyam | aṅgirasvat | arcata | śuṣmāḥ | yat | asya | pratna-thā | ut-īrate || viśvā | yat | gotrā | sahasā | pari-vr̥tā | made | somasya | dr̥ṁhitāni | airayat ||2.17.1||

IAST: viśvā yad gotrā sahasā parīvṛtā made somasya dṛṁhitāny airayat
Griffith: When in the rapture of the Soma he unclosed with strength the solid firm-shut stables of the kine.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा यद्गोत्रा सहसा परीवृता मदे सोमस्य दृंहितान्यैरयत्
pada pāṭha: tat | asmai | navyam | aṅgirasvat | arcata | śuṣmāḥ | yat | asya | pratna-thā | ut-īrate || viśvā | yat | gotrā | sahasā | pari-vr̥tā | made | somasya | dr̥ṁhitāni | airayat ||2.17.1||

IAST: sa bhūtu yo ha prathamāya dhāyasa ojo mimāno mahimānam ātirat
Griffith: Let him be even that God who, for the earliest draught measuring out his power, increased his majesty;
Devanāgarī: स भूतु यो ह प्रथमाय धायस ओजो मिमानो महिमानमातिरत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bhūtu | yaḥ | ha | prathamāya | dhāyase | ojaḥ | mimānaḥ | mahimānam | ā | atirat || śūraḥ | yaḥ | yut-su | tanvam | pari-vyata | śīrṣaṇi | dyām | mahinā | prati | amuñcata ||2.17.2||

IAST: śūro yo yutsu tanvam parivyata śīrṣaṇi dyām mahinā praty amuñcata
Griffith: Hero who fortified his body in the wars, and through his greatness set the heaven upon his head.
Devanāgarī: शूरो यो युत्सु तन्वं परिव्यत शीर्षणि द्यां महिना प्रत्यमुञ्चत
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bhūtu | yaḥ | ha | prathamāya | dhāyase | ojaḥ | mimānaḥ | mahimānam | ā | atirat || śūraḥ | yaḥ | yut-su | tanvam | pari-vyata | śīrṣaṇi | dyām | mahinā | prati | amuñcata ||2.17.2||

IAST: adhākṛṇoḥ prathamaṁ vīryam mahad yad asyāgre brahmaṇā śuṣmam airayaḥ
Griffith: Thou didst perform thy first great deed of hero might what time thou showedst power, through prayer, before this folk.
Devanāgarī: अधाकृणोः प्रथमं वीर्यं महद्यदस्याग्रे ब्रह्मणा शुष्ममैरयः
pada pāṭha: adha | akr̥ṇoḥ | prathamam | vīryam | mahat | yat | asya | agre | brahmaṇā | śuṣmam | airayaḥ || rathe-sthena | hari-aśvena | vi-cyutāḥ | pra | jīrayaḥ | sisrate | sadhryak | pr̥thak ||2.17.3||

IAST: ratheṣṭhena haryaśvena vicyutāḥ pra jīrayaḥ sisrate sadhryak pṛthak
Griffith: Hurled down by thee the car-borne Lord of Tawny Steeds, the congregated swift ones fled in sundry ways.
Devanāgarī: रथेष्ठेन हर्यश्वेन विच्युताः प्र जीरयः सिस्रते सध्र्यक्पृथक्
pada pāṭha: adha | akr̥ṇoḥ | prathamam | vīryam | mahat | yat | asya | agre | brahmaṇā | śuṣmam | airayaḥ || rathe-sthena | hari-aśvena | vi-cyutāḥ | pra | jīrayaḥ | sisrate | sadhryak | pr̥thak ||2.17.3||

IAST: adhā yo viśvā bhuvanābhi majmaneśānakṛt pravayā abhy avardhata
Griffith: He made himself by might Lord of all living things, and strong in vital power waxed great above them all.
Devanāgarī: अधा यो विश्वा भुवनाभि मज्मनेशानकृत्प्रवया अभ्यवर्धत
pada pāṭha: adha | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | majmanā | īśāna-kr̥t | pra-vayāḥ | abhi | avardhata || āt | rodasī iti | jyotiṣā | vahniḥ | ā | atanot | sīvyan | tamāṁsi | dudhitā | sam | avyayat ||2.17.4||

IAST: ād rodasī jyotiṣā vahnir ātanot sīvyan tamāṁsi dudhitā sam avyayat
Griffith: He, borne on high, o'erspread with light the heaven and earth, and, sewing up the turbid darkness, closed it in.
Devanāgarī: आद्रोदसी ज्योतिषा वह्निरातनोत्सीव्यन्तमांसि दुधिता समव्ययत्
pada pāṭha: adha | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | majmanā | īśāna-kr̥t | pra-vayāḥ | abhi | avardhata || āt | rodasī iti | jyotiṣā | vahniḥ | ā | atanot | sīvyan | tamāṁsi | dudhitā | sam | avyayat ||2.17.4||

IAST: sa prācīnān parvatān dṛṁhad ojasādharācīnam akṛṇod apām apaḥ
Griffith: He with his might made firm the forward-bending hills, the downward rushing of the waters he ordained.
Devanāgarī: स प्राचीनान्पर्वतान्दृंहदोजसाधराचीनमकृणोदपामपः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | prācīnān | parvatān | dr̥ṁhat | ojasā | adharācīnam | akr̥ṇot | apām | apaḥ || adhārayat | pr̥thivīm | viśva-dhāyasam | astabhnāt | māyayā | dyām | ava-srasaḥ ||2.17.5||

IAST: adhārayat pṛthivīṁ viśvadhāyasam astabhnān māyayā dyām avasrasaḥ
Griffith: Fast he upheld the earth that nourisheth all life, and stayed the heaven from falling by his wondrous skill.
Devanāgarī: अधारयत्पृथिवीं विश्वधायसमस्तभ्नान्मायया द्यामवस्रसः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | prācīnān | parvatān | dr̥ṁhat | ojasā | adharācīnam | akr̥ṇot | apām | apaḥ || adhārayat | pr̥thivīm | viśva-dhāyasam | astabhnāt | māyayā | dyām | ava-srasaḥ ||2.17.5||

IAST: sāsmā aram bāhubhyāṁ yam pitākṛṇod viśvasmād ā januṣo vedasas pari
Griffith: Fit for the grasping of his arms is what the Sire hath fabricated from all kind of precious wealth.
Devanāgarī: सास्मा अरं बाहुभ्यां यं पिताकृणोद्विश्वस्मादा जनुषो वेदसस्परि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | asmai | aram | bāhu-bhyām | yam | pitā | akr̥ṇot | viśvasmāt | ā | januṣaḥ | vedasaḥ | pari || yena | pr̥thivyām | ni | krivim | śayadhyai | vajreṇa | hatvī | avr̥ṇak | tuvi-svaniḥ ||2.17.6||

IAST: yenā pṛthivyāṁ ni kriviṁ śayadhyai vajreṇa hatvy avṛṇak tuviṣvaṇiḥ
Griffith: The thunderbolt, wherewith, loud-roaring, he smote down, and striking him to death laid Krivi on the earth.
Devanāgarī: येना पृथिव्यां नि क्रिविं शयध्यै वज्रेण हत्व्यवृणक्तुविष्वणिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | asmai | aram | bāhu-bhyām | yam | pitā | akr̥ṇot | viśvasmāt | ā | januṣaḥ | vedasaḥ | pari || yena | pr̥thivyām | ni | krivim | śayadhyai | vajreṇa | hatvī | avr̥ṇak | tuvi-svaniḥ ||2.17.6||

IAST: amājūr iva pitroḥ sacā satī samānād ā sadasas tvām iye bhagam
Griffith: As she who in her parents' house is growing old, I pray to thee as Bhaga from the seat of all.
Devanāgarī: अमाजूरिव पित्रोः सचा सती समानादा सदसस्त्वामिये भगम्
pada pāṭha: amājūḥ-iva | pitroḥ | sacā | satī | samānāt | ā | sadasaḥ | tvām | iye | bhagam || kr̥dhi | pra-ketam | upa | māsi | ā | bhara | daddhi | bhāgam | tanvaḥ | yena | mamahaḥ ||2.17.7||

IAST: kṛdhi praketam upa māsy ā bhara daddhi bhāgaṁ tanvo yena māmahaḥ
Griffith: Grant knowledge, mete it out and bring it to us here: give us the share wherewith thou makest people glad.
Devanāgarī: कृधि प्रकेतमुप मास्या भर दद्धि भागं तन्वो येन मामहः
pada pāṭha: amājūḥ-iva | pitroḥ | sacā | satī | samānāt | ā | sadasaḥ | tvām | iye | bhagam || kr̥dhi | pra-ketam | upa | māsi | ā | bhara | daddhi | bhāgam | tanvaḥ | yena | mamahaḥ ||2.17.7||

IAST: bhojaṁ tvām indra vayaṁ huvema dadiṣ ṭvam indrāpāṁsi vājān
Griffith: May we invoke thee as a liberal giver thou givest us, O Indra, strength and labours.
Devanāgarī: भोजं त्वामिन्द्र वयं हुवेम ददिष्ट्वमिन्द्रापांसि वाजान्
pada pāṭha: bhojam | tvām | indra | vayam | huvema | dadiḥ | tvam | indra | apāṁsi | vājān || aviḍḍhi | indra | citrayā | naḥ | ūtī | kr̥dhi | vr̥ṣan | indra | vasyasaḥ | naḥ ||2.17.8||

IAST: aviḍḍhīndra citrayā na ūtī kṛdhi vṛṣann indra vasyaso naḥ
Griffith: Help us with manifold assistance, Indra: Migthy One, Indra, make us yet more wealthy.
Devanāgarī: अविड्ढीन्द्र चित्रया न ऊती कृधि वृषन्निन्द्र वस्यसो नः
pada pāṭha: bhojam | tvām | indra | vayam | huvema | dadiḥ | tvam | indra | apāṁsi | vājān || aviḍḍhi | indra | citrayā | naḥ | ūtī | kr̥dhi | vr̥ṣan | indra | vasyasaḥ | naḥ ||2.17.8||

IAST: nūnaṁ sā te prati varaṁ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
Griffith: Now may that weaithy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.17.9||

IAST: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.17.9||

IAST: prātā ratho navo yoji sasniś caturyugas trikaśaḥ saptaraśmiḥ
Griffith: THE rich new car hath been equipped at morning; four yokes it hath, three whips, seven reins to guide it:
Devanāgarī: प्राता रथो नवो योजि सस्निश्चतुर्युगस्त्रिकशः सप्तरश्मिः
pada pāṭha: prātariti | rathaḥ | navaḥ | yoji | sasniḥ | catuḥ-yugaḥ | tri-kaśaḥ | sapta-raśmiḥ || daśa-aritraḥ | manuṣyaḥ | svaḥ-sāḥ | saḥ | iṣṭi-bhiḥ | mati-bhiḥ | raṁhyaḥ | bhūt ||2.18.1||

IAST: daśāritro manuṣyaḥ svarṣāḥ sa iṣṭibhir matibhī raṁhyo bhūt
Griffith: Ten-sided, friendly to mankind, light-winner, that must be urged to speed with prayers and wishes.
Devanāgarī: दशारित्रो मनुष्यः स्वर्षाः स इष्टिभिर्मतिभी रंह्यो भूत्
pada pāṭha: prātariti | rathaḥ | navaḥ | yoji | sasniḥ | catuḥ-yugaḥ | tri-kaśaḥ | sapta-raśmiḥ || daśa-aritraḥ | manuṣyaḥ | svaḥ-sāḥ | saḥ | iṣṭi-bhiḥ | mati-bhiḥ | raṁhyaḥ | bhūt ||2.18.1||

IAST: sāsmā aram prathamaṁ sa dvitīyam uto tṛtīyam manuṣaḥ sa hotā
Griffith: This is prepared for him the first, the second, and the third time: he is man's Priest and Herald.
Devanāgarī: सास्मा अरं प्रथमं स द्वितीयमुतो तृतीयं मनुषः स होता
pada pāṭha: saḥ | asmai | aram | prathamam | saḥ | dvitīyam | uto iti | tr̥tīyam | manuṣaḥ | saḥ | hotā || anyasyāḥ | garbham | anye | ūm̐ iti | jananta | saḥ | anyebhiḥ | sacate | jenyaḥ | vr̥ṣā ||2.18.2||

IAST: anyasyā garbham anya ū jananta so anyebhiḥ sacate jenyo vṛṣā
Griffith: Others get offspring of another parent he goeth, as a noble Bull, with others.
Devanāgarī: अन्यस्या गर्भमन्य ऊ जनन्त सो अन्येभिः सचते जेन्यो वृषा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | asmai | aram | prathamam | saḥ | dvitīyam | uto iti | tr̥tīyam | manuṣaḥ | saḥ | hotā || anyasyāḥ | garbham | anye | ūm̐ iti | jananta | saḥ | anyebhiḥ | sacate | jenyaḥ | vr̥ṣā ||2.18.2||

IAST: harī nu kaṁ ratha indrasya yojam āyai sūktena vacasā navena
Griffith: To Indra's car the Bay Steeds have I harnessed, that new well-spoken words may bring him hither.
Devanāgarī: हरी नु कं रथ इन्द्रस्य योजमायै सूक्तेन वचसा नवेन
pada pāṭha: harī iti | nu | kam | rathe | indrasya | yojam | ā-yai | su-uktena | vacasā | navena || mo iti | su | tvām | atra | bahavaḥ | hi | viprāḥ | ni | rīraman | yajamānāsaḥ | anye ||2.18.3||

IAST: mo ṣu tvām atra bahavo hi viprā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye
Griffith: Here let not other worshippers detain thee, for among us are many holy singers.
Devanāgarī: मो षु त्वामत्र बहवो हि विप्रा नि रीरमन्यजमानासो अन्ये
pada pāṭha: harī iti | nu | kam | rathe | indrasya | yojam | ā-yai | su-uktena | vacasā | navena || mo iti | su | tvām | atra | bahavaḥ | hi | viprāḥ | ni | rīraman | yajamānāsaḥ | anye ||2.18.3||

IAST: ā dvābhyāṁ haribhyām indra yāhy ā caturbhir ā ṣaḍbhir hūyamānaḥ
Griffith: Indra, come hitherward with two Bay Coursers, come thou with four, with six when invocated.
Devanāgarī: आ द्वाभ्यां हरिभ्यामिन्द्र याह्या चतुर्भिरा षड्भिर्हूयमानः
pada pāṭha: ā | dvābhyām | hari-bhyām | indra | yāhi | ā | catuḥ-bhiḥ | ā | ṣaṭ-bhiḥ | hūyamānaḥ || ā | aṣṭābhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | soma-peyam | ayam | sutaḥ | su-makha | mā | mr̥dhaḥ | kariti kaḥ ||2.18.4||

IAST: āṣṭābhir daśabhiḥ somapeyam ayaṁ sutaḥ sumakha mā mṛdhas kaḥ
Griffith: Come thou with eight, with ten, to drink the Soma. Here is the juice, brave Warrior: do not scorn it.
Devanāgarī: आष्टाभिर्दशभिः सोमपेयमयं सुतः सुमख मा मृधस्कः
pada pāṭha: ā | dvābhyām | hari-bhyām | indra | yāhi | ā | catuḥ-bhiḥ | ā | ṣaṭ-bhiḥ | hūyamānaḥ || ā | aṣṭābhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | soma-peyam | ayam | sutaḥ | su-makha | mā | mr̥dhaḥ | kariti kaḥ ||2.18.4||

IAST: ā viṁśatyā triṁśatā yāhy arvāṅ ā catvāriṁśatā haribhir yujānaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, come thou hither having harnessed thy car with twenty, thirty, forty horses.
Devanāgarī: आ विंशत्या त्रिंशता याह्यर्वाङा चत्वारिंशता हरिभिर्युजानः
pada pāṭha: ā | viṁśatyā | triṁśatā | yāhi | arvāṅ | ā | catvāriṁśatā | hari-bhiḥ | yujānaḥ || ā | pañcāśatā | su-rathebhiḥ | indra | ā | ṣaṣṭyā | saptatyā | soma-peyam ||2.18.5||

IAST: ā pañcāśatā surathebhir indrā ṣaṣṭyā saptatyā somapeyam
Griffith: Come thou with fifty well trained coursers, Indra, sixty or seventy, to drink the Soma.
Devanāgarī: आ पञ्चाशता सुरथेभिरिन्द्रा षष्ट्या सप्तत्या सोमपेयम्
pada pāṭha: ā | viṁśatyā | triṁśatā | yāhi | arvāṅ | ā | catvāriṁśatā | hari-bhiḥ | yujānaḥ || ā | pañcāśatā | su-rathebhiḥ | indra | ā | ṣaṣṭyā | saptatyā | soma-peyam ||2.18.5||

IAST: āśītyā navatyā yāhy arvāṅ ā śatena haribhir uhyamānaḥ
Griffith: Come to us hitherward, O Indra, carried by eighty, ninety, or an hundred horses.
Devanāgarī: आशीत्या नवत्या याह्यर्वाङा शतेन हरिभिरुह्यमानः
pada pāṭha: ā | aśītyā | navatyā | yāhi | arvāṅ | ā | śatena | hari-bhiḥ | uhyamānaḥ || ayam | hi | te | śuna-hotreṣu | somaḥ | indra | tvā-yā | pari-siktaḥ | madāya ||2.18.6||

IAST: ayaṁ hi te śunahotreṣu soma indra tvāyā pariṣikto madāya
Griffith: This Soma juice among the Sunahotras hath been poured out, in love, to glad thee, Indra.
Devanāgarī: अयं हि ते शुनहोत्रेषु सोम इन्द्र त्वाया परिषिक्तो मदाय
pada pāṭha: ā | aśītyā | navatyā | yāhi | arvāṅ | ā | śatena | hari-bhiḥ | uhyamānaḥ || ayam | hi | te | śuna-hotreṣu | somaḥ | indra | tvā-yā | pari-siktaḥ | madāya ||2.18.6||

IAST: mama brahmendra yāhy acchā viśvā harī dhuri dhiṣvā rathasya
Griffith: To this my prayer, O Indra, come thou hither: bind to thy car's pole all thy two Bay Coursers.
Devanāgarī: मम ब्रह्मेन्द्र याह्यच्छा विश्वा हरी धुरि धिष्वा रथस्य
pada pāṭha: mama | brahma | indra | yāhi | accha | viśvā | harī iti | dhuri | dhiṣva | rathasya || puru-trā | hi | vi-havyaḥ | babhūtha | asmin | śūra | savane | mādayasva ||2.18.7||

IAST: purutrā hi vihavyo babhūthāsmiñ chūra savane mādayasva
Griffith: Thou art to be invoked in many places Hero, rejoice thyself in this libation.
Devanāgarī: पुरुत्रा हि विहव्यो बभूथास्मिञ्छूर सवने मादयस्व
pada pāṭha: mama | brahma | indra | yāhi | accha | viśvā | harī iti | dhuri | dhiṣva | rathasya || puru-trā | hi | vi-havyaḥ | babhūtha | asmin | śūra | savane | mādayasva ||2.18.7||

IAST: na ma indreṇa sakhyaṁ vi yoṣad asmabhyam asya dakṣiṇā duhīta
Griffith: Ne'er be my love from Indra disunited still may his liberal Milch-cow yield us treasure.
Devanāgarī: न म इन्द्रेण सख्यं वि योषदस्मभ्यमस्य दक्षिणा दुहीत
pada pāṭha: na | me | indreṇa | sakhyam | vi | yoṣat | asmabhyam | asya | dakṣiṇā | duhīta || upa | jyeṣṭhe | varūthe | gabhastau | prāye-prāye | jigīvāṁsaḥ | syāma ||2.18.8||

IAST: upa jyeṣṭhe varūthe gabhastau prāye-prāye jigīvāṁsaḥ syāma
Griffith: So may we under his supreme protection, safe in his arms, succeed in each forth-going.
Devanāgarī: उप ज्येष्ठे वरूथे गभस्तौ प्रायेप्राये जिगीवांसः स्याम
pada pāṭha: na | me | indreṇa | sakhyam | vi | yoṣat | asmabhyam | asya | dakṣiṇā | duhīta || upa | jyeṣṭhe | varūthe | gabhastau | prāye-prāye | jigīvāṁsaḥ | syāma ||2.18.8||

IAST: nūnaṁ sā te prati varaṁ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
Griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow Of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.18.9||

IAST: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.18.9||

IAST: apāyy asyāndhaso madāya manīṣiṇaḥ suvānasya prayasaḥ
Griffith: DRAUGHTS of this sweet juice have been drunk for rapture, of the wise Soma-presser's offered dainty,
Devanāgarī: अपाय्यस्यान्धसो मदाय मनीषिणः सुवानस्य प्रयसः
pada pāṭha: apāyi | asya | andhasaḥ | madāya | manīṣiṇaḥ | suvānasya | prayasaḥ || yasmin | indraḥ | pra-divi | vavr̥dhānaḥ | okaḥ | dadhe | brahmaṇyantaḥ | ca | naraḥ ||2.19.1||

IAST: yasminn indraḥ pradivi vāvṛdhāna oko dadhe brahmaṇyantaś ca naraḥ
Griffith: Wherein, grown mighty in the days aforetime, Indra hath found delight, and men who worship.
Devanāgarī: यस्मिन्निन्द्रः प्रदिवि वावृधान ओको दधे ब्रह्मण्यन्तश्च नरः
pada pāṭha: apāyi | asya | andhasaḥ | madāya | manīṣiṇaḥ | suvānasya | prayasaḥ || yasmin | indraḥ | pra-divi | vavr̥dhānaḥ | okaḥ | dadhe | brahmaṇyantaḥ | ca | naraḥ ||2.19.1||

IAST: asya mandāno madhvo vajrahasto 'him indro arṇovṛtaṁ vi vṛścat
Griffith: Cheered by this meath Indra, whose hand wields thunder, rent piecemeal Ahi who barred up the waters,
Devanāgarī: अस्य मन्दानो मध्वो वज्रहस्तोऽहिमिन्द्रो अर्णोवृतं वि वृश्चत्
pada pāṭha: asya | mandānaḥ | madhvaḥ | vajra-hastaḥ | ahim | indraḥ | arṇaḥ-vr̥tam | vi | vr̥ścat || pra | yat | vayaḥ | na | svasarāṇi | accha | prayāṁsi | ca | nadīnām | cakramanta ||2.19.2||

IAST: pra yad vayo na svasarāṇy acchā prayāṁsi ca nadīnāṁ cakramanta
Griffith: So that the quickening currents of the rivers flowed forth like birds unto their resting-places.
Devanāgarī: प्र यद्वयो न स्वसराण्यच्छा प्रयांसि च नदीनां चक्रमन्त
pada pāṭha: asya | mandānaḥ | madhvaḥ | vajra-hastaḥ | ahim | indraḥ | arṇaḥ-vr̥tam | vi | vr̥ścat || pra | yat | vayaḥ | na | svasarāṇi | accha | prayāṁsi | ca | nadīnām | cakramanta ||2.19.2||

IAST: sa māhina indro arṇo apām prairayad ahihācchā samudram
Griffith: Indra, this Mighty One, the Dragon's slayer, sent forth the flood of waters to the ocean.
Devanāgarī: स माहिन इन्द्रो अर्णो अपां प्रैरयदहिहाच्छा समुद्रम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | māhinaḥ | indraḥ | arṇaḥ | apām | pra | airayat | ahi-hā | accha | samudram || ajanayat | sūryam | vidat | gāḥ | aktunā | ahnām | vayunāni | sādhat ||2.19.3||

IAST: ajanayat sūryaṁ vidad gā aktunāhnāṁ vayunāni sādhat
Griffith: He gave the Sun his life, he found the cattle, and with the night the works of days completed.
Devanāgarī: अजनयत्सूर्यं विदद्गा अक्तुनाह्नां वयुनानि साधत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | māhinaḥ | indraḥ | arṇaḥ | apām | pra | airayat | ahi-hā | accha | samudram || ajanayat | sūryam | vidat | gāḥ | aktunā | ahnām | vayunāni | sādhat ||2.19.3||

IAST: so apratīni manave purūṇīndro dāśad dāśuṣe hanti vṛtram
Griffith: To him who worshippeth hath Indra given many and matchless gifts. He slayeth Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: सो अप्रतीनि मनवे पुरूणीन्द्रो दाशद्दाशुषे हन्ति वृत्रम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | apratīni | manave | purūṇi | indraḥ | dāśat | dāśuṣe | hanti | vr̥tram || sadyaḥ | yaḥ | nr̥-bhyaḥ | atasāyyaḥ | bhūt | paspr̥dhānebhyaḥ | sūryasya | sātau ||2.19.4||

IAST: sadyo yo nṛbhyo atasāyyo bhūt paspṛdhānebhyaḥ sūryasya sātau
Griffith: Straight was he to be sought with supplications by men who struggled to obtain the sunlight.
Devanāgarī: सद्यो यो नृभ्यो अतसाय्यो भूत्पस्पृधानेभ्यः सूर्यस्य सातौ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | apratīni | manave | purūṇi | indraḥ | dāśat | dāśuṣe | hanti | vr̥tram || sadyaḥ | yaḥ | nr̥-bhyaḥ | atasāyyaḥ | bhūt | paspr̥dhānebhyaḥ | sūryasya | sātau ||2.19.4||

IAST: sa sunvata indraḥ sūryam ā devo riṇaṅ martyāya stavān
Griffith: To him who poured him gifts he gave up Surya,-Indra, the God, the Mighty, to the mortal;
Devanāgarī: स सुन्वत इन्द्रः सूर्यमा देवो रिणङ्मर्त्याय स्तवान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sunvate | indraḥ | sūryam | ā | devaḥ | riṇak | martyāya | stavān || ā | yat | rayim | guhat-avadyam | asmai | bharat | aṁśam | na | etaśaḥ | daśasyan ||2.19.5||

IAST: ā yad rayiṁ guhadavadyam asmai bharad aṁśaṁ naitaśo daśasyan
Griffith: For Etasa with worship brought him riches that keep distress afar, as 'twere his portion.
Devanāgarī: आ यद्रयिं गुहदवद्यमस्मै भरदंशं नैतशो दशस्यन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sunvate | indraḥ | sūryam | ā | devaḥ | riṇak | martyāya | stavān || ā | yat | rayim | guhat-avadyam | asmai | bharat | aṁśam | na | etaśaḥ | daśasyan ||2.19.5||

IAST: sa randhayat sadivaḥ sārathaye śuṣṇam aśuṣaṁ kuyavaṁ kutsāya
Griffith: Once to the driver of his chariot, Kutsa, he gave up greedy Surya, plague of harvest;
Devanāgarī: स रन्धयत्सदिवः सारथये शुष्णमशुषं कुयवं कुत्साय
pada pāṭha: saḥ | randhayat | sa-divaḥ | sārathaye | śuṣṇam | aśuṣam | kuyavam | kutsāya || divaḥ-dāsāya | navatim | ca | nava | indraḥ | puraḥ | vi | airat | śambarasya ||2.19.6||

IAST: divodāsāya navatiṁ ca navendraḥ puro vy airac chambarasya
Griffith: And Indra, for the sake of Divodasa demolished Sambara's nine-and-ninety castles.
Devanāgarī: दिवोदासाय नवतिं च नवेन्द्रः पुरो व्यैरच्छम्बरस्य
pada pāṭha: saḥ | randhayat | sa-divaḥ | sārathaye | śuṣṇam | aśuṣam | kuyavam | kutsāya || divaḥ-dāsāya | navatim | ca | nava | indraḥ | puraḥ | vi | airat | śambarasya ||2.19.6||

IAST: evā ta indrocatham ahema śravasyā na tmanā vājayantaḥ
Griffith: So have we brought our hymn to thee, O Indra, strengthening thee and fain ourselves for glory.
Devanāgarī: एवा त इन्द्रोचथमहेम श्रवस्या न त्मना वाजयन्तः
pada pāṭha: eva | te | indra | ucatham | ahema | śravasyā | na | tmanā | vājayantaḥ || aśyāma | tat | sāptam | āśuṣāṇāḥ | nanamaḥ | vadhaḥ | adevasya | pīyoḥ ||2.19.7||

IAST: aśyāma tat sāptam āśuṣāṇā nanamo vadhar adevasya pīyoḥ
Griffith: May we with best endeavours gain this friendship, and mayst thou bend the godless scorner's weapons.
Devanāgarī: अश्याम तत्साप्तमाशुषाणा ननमो वधरदेवस्य पीयोः
pada pāṭha: eva | te | indra | ucatham | ahema | śravasyā | na | tmanā | vājayantaḥ || aśyāma | tat | sāptam | āśuṣāṇāḥ | nanamaḥ | vadhaḥ | adevasya | pīyoḥ ||2.19.7||

IAST: evā te gṛtsamadāḥ śūra manmāvasyavo na vayunāni takṣuḥ
Griffith: Thus the Grtsamadas for thee, O Hero, have wrought their hymn and task as seeking favour.
Devanāgarī: एवा ते गृत्समदाः शूर मन्मावस्यवो न वयुनानि तक्षुः
pada pāṭha: eva | te | gr̥tsa-madāḥ | śūra | manma | avasyavaḥ | na | vayunāni | takṣuḥ || brahmaṇyantaḥ | indra | te | navīyaḥ | iṣam | ūrjam | su-kṣitim | sumnam | aśyuḥ ||2.19.8||

IAST: brahmaṇyanta indra te navīya iṣam ūrjaṁ sukṣitiṁ sumnam aśyuḥ
Griffith: May they who worship thee afresh, O Indra, gain food and strength, bliss, and a happy dwelling.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मण्यन्त इन्द्र ते नवीय इषमूर्जं सुक्षितिं सुम्नमश्युः
pada pāṭha: eva | te | gr̥tsa-madāḥ | śūra | manma | avasyavaḥ | na | vayunāni | takṣuḥ || brahmaṇyantaḥ | indra | te | navīyaḥ | iṣam | ūrjam | su-kṣitim | sumnam | aśyuḥ ||2.19.8||
