IAST: nūnaṁ sā te prati varaṁ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
Griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee,
Devanāgarī: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.19.9||

IAST: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.19.9||

IAST: vayaṁ te vaya indra viddhi ṣu ṇaḥ pra bharāmahe vājayur na ratham
Griffith: As one brings forth his car when fain for combat, so bring we power to thee- regard us, Indra-
Devanāgarī: वयं ते वय इन्द्र विद्धि षु णः प्र भरामहे वाजयुर्न रथम्
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | vayaḥ | indra | viddhi | su | naḥ | pra | bharāmahe | vāja-yuḥ | na | ratham || vipanyavaḥ | dīdhyataḥ | manīṣā | sumnam | iyakṣantaḥ | tvā-vataḥ | nr̥̄n ||2.20.1||

IAST: vipanyavo dīdhyato manīṣā sumnam iyakṣantas tvāvato nṝn
Griffith: Well skilled in song, thoughtful in spirit, seeking great bliss from one like thee amid the Heroes.
Devanāgarī: विपन्यवो दीध्यतो मनीषा सुम्नमियक्षन्तस्त्वावतो नॄन्
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | vayaḥ | indra | viddhi | su | naḥ | pra | bharāmahe | vāja-yuḥ | na | ratham || vipanyavaḥ | dīdhyataḥ | manīṣā | sumnam | iyakṣantaḥ | tvā-vataḥ | nr̥̄n ||2.20.1||

IAST: tvaṁ na indra tvābhir ūtī tvāyato abhiṣṭipāsi janān
Griffith: Indra, thou art our own with thy protection, a guardian near to men who love thee truly,
Devanāgarī: त्वं न इन्द्र त्वाभिरूती त्वायतो अभिष्टिपासि जनान्
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | indra | tvābhiḥ | ūtī | tvā-yataḥ | abhiṣṭi-pā | asi | janān || tvam | inaḥ | dāśuṣaḥ | varūtā | itthā-dhīḥ | abhi | yaḥ | nakṣati | tvā ||2.20.2||

IAST: tvam ino dāśuṣo varūtetthādhīr abhi yo nakṣati tvā
Griffith: Active art thou, the liberal man's defender, his who draws near to thee with right devotion.
Devanāgarī: त्वमिनो दाशुषो वरूतेत्थाधीरभि यो नक्षति त्वा
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | indra | tvābhiḥ | ūtī | tvā-yataḥ | abhiṣṭi-pā | asi | janān || tvam | inaḥ | dāśuṣaḥ | varūtā | itthā-dhīḥ | abhi | yaḥ | nakṣati | tvā ||2.20.2||

IAST: sa no yuvendro johūtraḥ sakhā śivo narām astu pātā
Griffith: May Indra, called with solemn invocations. the young, the Friend, be men's auspicious keeper,
Devanāgarī: स नो युवेन्द्रो जोहूत्रः सखा शिवो नरामस्तु पाता
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | yuvā | indraḥ | johūtraḥ | sakhā | śivaḥ | narām | astu | pātā || yaḥ | śaṁsantam | yaḥ | śaśamānam | ūtī | pacantam | ca | stuvantam | ca | pra-neṣat ||2.20.3||

IAST: yaḥ śaṁsantaṁ yaḥ śaśamānam ūtī pacantaṁ ca stuvantaṁ ca praṇeṣat
Griffith: One who will further with his aid the singer, the toiler, praiser, dresser of oblations.
Devanāgarī: यः शंसन्तं यः शशमानमूती पचन्तं च स्तुवन्तं च प्रणेषत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | yuvā | indraḥ | johūtraḥ | sakhā | śivaḥ | narām | astu | pātā || yaḥ | śaṁsantam | yaḥ | śaśamānam | ūtī | pacantam | ca | stuvantam | ca | pra-neṣat ||2.20.3||

IAST: tam u stuṣa indraṁ taṁ gṛṇīṣe yasmin purā vāvṛdhuḥ śāśaduś ca
Griffith: With laud and song let me extol that Indra in whom of old men prospered and were mighty.
Devanāgarī: तमु स्तुष इन्द्रं तं गृणीषे यस्मिन्पुरा वावृधुः शाशदुश्च
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stuṣe | indram | tam | gr̥ṇīṣe | yasmin | purā | vavr̥dhuḥ | śāśaduḥ | ca || saḥ | vasvaḥ | kāmam | pīparat | iyānaḥ | brahmaṇyataḥ | nūtanasya | āyoḥ ||2.20.4||

IAST: sa vasvaḥ kāmam pīparad iyāno brahmaṇyato nūtanasyāyoḥ
Griffith: May he, implored, fulfil the prayer for plenty of him who worships, of the living mortal.
Devanāgarī: स वस्वः कामं पीपरदियानो ब्रह्मण्यतो नूतनस्यायोः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stuṣe | indram | tam | gr̥ṇīṣe | yasmin | purā | vavr̥dhuḥ | śāśaduḥ | ca || saḥ | vasvaḥ | kāmam | pīparat | iyānaḥ | brahmaṇyataḥ | nūtanasya | āyoḥ ||2.20.4||

IAST: so aṅgirasām ucathā jujuṣvān brahmā tūtod indro gātum iṣṇan
Griffith: He, Indra whom the Angirases' praise delighted, strengthened their prayer and made their goings prosper.
Devanāgarī: सो अङ्गिरसामुचथा जुजुष्वान्ब्रह्मा तूतोदिन्द्रो गातुमिष्णन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | aṅgirasām | ucathā | jujuṣvān | brahma | tūtot | indraḥ | gātum | iṣṇan || muṣṇan | uṣasaḥ | sūryeṇa | stavān | aśnasya | cit | śiśnathat | pūrvyāṇi ||2.20.5||

IAST: muṣṇann uṣasaḥ sūryeṇa stavān aśnasya cic chiśnathat pūrvyāṇi
Griffith: Stealing away the mornings with the sunlight, he, lauded, crushed even Asna's ancient powers.
Devanāgarī: मुष्णन्नुषसः सूर्येण स्तवानश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत्पूर्व्याणि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | aṅgirasām | ucathā | jujuṣvān | brahma | tūtot | indraḥ | gātum | iṣṇan || muṣṇan | uṣasaḥ | sūryeṇa | stavān | aśnasya | cit | śiśnathat | pūrvyāṇi ||2.20.5||

IAST: sa ha śruta indro nāma deva ūrdhvo bhuvan manuṣe dasmatamaḥ
Griffith: He verily, the God, the glorious Indra, hath raised him up for man, best Wonder-Worker.
Devanāgarī: स ह श्रुत इन्द्रो नाम देव ऊर्ध्वो भुवन्मनुषे दस्मतमः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ha | śrutaḥ | indraḥ | nāma | devaḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | bhuvat | manuṣe | dasma-tamaḥ || ava | priyam | arśasānasya | sahvān | śiraḥ | bharat | dāsasya | svadhā-vān ||2.20.6||

IAST: ava priyam arśasānasya sāhvāñ chiro bharad dāsasya svadhāvān
Griffith: He, self-reliant, mighty and triumphant, brought low the dear head of the wicked Dasa.
Devanāgarī: अव प्रियमर्शसानस्य साह्वाञ्छिरो भरद्दासस्य स्वधावान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ha | śrutaḥ | indraḥ | nāma | devaḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | bhuvat | manuṣe | dasma-tamaḥ || ava | priyam | arśasānasya | sahvān | śiraḥ | bharat | dāsasya | svadhā-vān ||2.20.6||

IAST: sa vṛtrahendraḥ kṛṣṇayonīḥ puraṁdaro dāsīr airayad vi
Griffith: Indra theVrtra-slayer, Fort-destroyer, scattered the Dasa hosts who dwelt in darkness.
Devanāgarī: स वृत्रहेन्द्रः कृष्णयोनीः पुरंदरो दासीरैरयद्वि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | indraḥ | kr̥ṣṇa-yonīḥ | puram-daraḥ | dāsīḥ | airayat | vi || ajanayat | manave | kṣām | apaḥ | ca | satrā | śaṁsam | yajamānasya | tūtot ||2.20.7||

IAST: ajanayan manave kṣām apaś ca satrā śaṁsaṁ yajamānasya tūtot
Griffith: For men hath he created earth and waters, and ever helped the prayer of him who worships.
Devanāgarī: अजनयन्मनवे क्षामपश्च सत्रा शंसं यजमानस्य तूतोत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | indraḥ | kr̥ṣṇa-yonīḥ | puram-daraḥ | dāsīḥ | airayat | vi || ajanayat | manave | kṣām | apaḥ | ca | satrā | śaṁsam | yajamānasya | tūtot ||2.20.7||

IAST: tasmai tavasyam anu dāyi satrendrāya devebhir arṇasātau
Griffith: To him in might the Gods have ever yielded, to Indra in the tumult of thebattle.
Devanāgarī: तस्मै तवस्यमनु दायि सत्रेन्द्राय देवेभिरर्णसातौ
pada pāṭha: tasmai | tavasyam | anu | dāyi | satrā | indrāya | devebhiḥ | arṇa-sātau || prati | yat | asya | vajram | bāhvoḥ | dhuḥ | hatvī | dasyūn | puraḥ | āyasīḥ | ni | tārīt ||2.20.8||

IAST: prati yad asya vajram bāhvor dhur hatvī dasyūn pura āyasīr ni tārīt
Griffith: When in his arms they laid the bolt, he slaughtered the Dasyus and cast down their forts of iron.
Devanāgarī: प्रति यदस्य वज्रं बाह्वोर्धुर्हत्वी दस्यून्पुर आयसीर्नि तारीत्
pada pāṭha: tasmai | tavasyam | anu | dāyi | satrā | indrāya | devebhiḥ | arṇa-sātau || prati | yat | asya | vajram | bāhvoḥ | dhuḥ | hatvī | dasyūn | puraḥ | āyasīḥ | ni | tārīt ||2.20.8||

IAST: nūnaṁ sā te prati varaṁ jaritre duhīyad indra dakṣiṇā maghonī
Griffith: Now may that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, give in return a boon to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: नूनं सा ते प्रति वरं जरित्रे दुहीयदिन्द्र दक्षिणा मघोनी
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.20.9||

IAST: śikṣā stotṛbhyo māti dhag bhago no bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा स्तोतृभ्यो माति धग्भगो नो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: nūnam | sā | te | prati | varam | jaritre | duhīyat | indra | dakṣiṇā | maghonī || śikṣa | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | mā | ati | dhak | bhagaḥ | naḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.20.9||

IAST: viśvajite dhanajite svarjite satrājite nṛjita urvarājite
Griffith: To him the Lord of all, the Lord of wealth, of light; him who is Lord for ever, Lord of men and tilth,
Devanāgarī: विश्वजिते धनजिते स्वर्जिते सत्राजिते नृजित उर्वराजिते
pada pāṭha: viśva-jite | dhana-jite | svaḥ-jite | satrā-jite | nr̥-jite | urvarā-jite || aśva-jite | go-jite | ap-jite | bhara | indrāya | somam | yajatāya | haryatam ||2.21.1||

IAST: aśvajite gojite abjite bharendrāya somaṁ yajatāya haryatam
Griffith: Him who is Lord of horses, Lord of kine,of floods, to Indra, to the Holy bring sweet Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: अश्वजिते गोजिते अब्जिते भरेन्द्राय सोमं यजताय हर्यतम्
pada pāṭha: viśva-jite | dhana-jite | svaḥ-jite | satrā-jite | nr̥-jite | urvarā-jite || aśva-jite | go-jite | ap-jite | bhara | indrāya | somam | yajatāya | haryatam ||2.21.1||

IAST: abhibhuve 'bhibhaṅgāya vanvate 'ṣāḻhāya sahamānāya vedhase
Griffith: To him the potent One, who conquers and breaks down, the Victor never vanquished who disposes all,
Devanāgarī: अभिभुवेऽभिभङ्गाय वन्वतेऽषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे
pada pāṭha: abhi-bhuve | abhi-bhaṅgāya | vanvate | aṣāḷhāya | sahamānāya | vedhase || tuvi-graye | vahnaye | dustarītave | satrā-sahe | namaḥ | indrāya | vocata ||2.21.2||

IAST: tuvigraye vahnaye duṣṭarītave satrāsāhe nama indrāya vocata
Griffith: The migbty-voiced, the rider, unassailable, to Indra everconquering speak your reverent prayer.
Devanāgarī: तुविग्रये वह्नये दुष्टरीतवे सत्रासाहे नम इन्द्राय वोचत
pada pāṭha: abhi-bhuve | abhi-bhaṅgāya | vanvate | aṣāḷhāya | sahamānāya | vedhase || tuvi-graye | vahnaye | dustarītave | satrā-sahe | namaḥ | indrāya | vocata ||2.21.2||

IAST: satrāsāho janabhakṣo janaṁsahaś cyavano yudhmo anu joṣam ukṣitaḥ
Griffith: Still Victor, loved by mortals, ruler over men, o'erthrower, warrior, he hath waxen as he would;
Devanāgarī: सत्रासाहो जनभक्षो जनंसहश्च्यवनो युध्मो अनु जोषमुक्षितः
pada pāṭha: satrā-sahaḥ | jana-bhakṣaḥ | janam-sahaḥ | cyavanaḥ | yudhmaḥ | anu | joṣam | ukṣitaḥ || vr̥tam-cayaḥ | sahuriḥ | vikṣu | āritaḥ | indrasya | vocam | pra | kr̥tāni | vīryā ||2.21.3||

IAST: vṛtaṁcayaḥ sahurir vikṣv ārita indrasya vocam pra kṛtāni vīryā
Griffith: Host-gatherer, triumphant, honoured mid the folk. Indra's heroic deeds will I tell forth to all.
Devanāgarī: वृतंचयः सहुरिर्विक्ष्वारित इन्द्रस्य वोचं प्र कृतानि वीर्या
pada pāṭha: satrā-sahaḥ | jana-bhakṣaḥ | janam-sahaḥ | cyavanaḥ | yudhmaḥ | anu | joṣam | ukṣitaḥ || vr̥tam-cayaḥ | sahuriḥ | vikṣu | āritaḥ | indrasya | vocam | pra | kr̥tāni | vīryā ||2.21.3||

IAST: anānudo vṛṣabho dodhato vadho gambhīra ṛṣvo asamaṣṭakāvyaḥ
Griffith: The strong who never yields, who slew the furious fiend, the deep, the vast, of wisdom unattainable;
Devanāgarī: अनानुदो वृषभो दोधतो वधो गम्भीर ऋष्वो असमष्टकाव्यः
pada pāṭha: ananu-daḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | dodhataḥ | vadhaḥ | gambhīraḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | asamaṣṭa-kāvyaḥ || radhra-codaḥ | śnathanaḥ | vīḷitaḥ | pr̥thuḥ | indraḥ | su-yajñaḥ | uṣasaḥ | svaḥ | janat ||2.21.4||

IAST: radhracodaḥ śnathano vīḻitas pṛthur indraḥ suyajña uṣasaḥ svar janat
Griffith: Who speeds the good, the breaker-down, the firm, the vast,-Indra whose rites bring joy hath made the light of Dawn.
Devanāgarī: रध्रचोदः श्नथनो वीळितस्पृथुरिन्द्रः सुयज्ञ उषसः स्वर्जनत्
pada pāṭha: ananu-daḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | dodhataḥ | vadhaḥ | gambhīraḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | asamaṣṭa-kāvyaḥ || radhra-codaḥ | śnathanaḥ | vīḷitaḥ | pr̥thuḥ | indraḥ | su-yajñaḥ | uṣasaḥ | svaḥ | janat ||2.21.4||

IAST: yajñena gātum apturo vividrire dhiyo hinvānā uśijo manīṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: By sacrifice the yearning sages sending forth their songs found furtherance from him who speeds the flood.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेन गातुमप्तुरो विविद्रिरे धियो हिन्वाना उशिजो मनीषिणः
pada pāṭha: yajñena | gātum | ap-turaḥ | vividrire | dhiyaḥ | hinvānāḥ | uśijaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ || abhi-svarā | ni-sadā | gāḥ | avasyavaḥ | indre | hinvānāḥ | draviṇāni | āśata ||2.21.5||

IAST: abhisvarā niṣadā gā avasyava indre hinvānā draviṇāny āśata
Griffith: In Indra seeking help with worship and with hymn, they drew him to themselves and won them kine and wealth.
Devanāgarī: अभिस्वरा निषदा गा अवस्यव इन्द्रे हिन्वाना द्रविणान्याशत
pada pāṭha: yajñena | gātum | ap-turaḥ | vividrire | dhiyaḥ | hinvānāḥ | uśijaḥ | manīṣiṇaḥ || abhi-svarā | ni-sadā | gāḥ | avasyavaḥ | indre | hinvānāḥ | draviṇāni | āśata ||2.21.5||

IAST: indra śreṣṭhāni draviṇāni dhehi cittiṁ dakṣasya subhagatvam asme
Griffith: Indra, bestow on us the best of treasures, the spirit of ability and fortune;
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र श्रेष्ठानि द्रविणानि धेहि चित्तिं दक्षस्य सुभगत्वमस्मे
pada pāṭha: indra | śreṣṭhāni | draviṇāni | dhehi | cittim | dakṣasya | subhaga-tvam | asme iti || poṣam | rayīṇām | ariṣṭim | tanūnām | svādmānam | vācaḥ | sudina-tvam | ahnām ||2.21.6||

IAST: poṣaṁ rayīṇām ariṣṭiṁ tanūnāṁ svādmānaṁ vācaḥ sudinatvam ahnām
Griffith: Increase of riches, safety of our bodies, charm of sweet speech, and days of pleasant weather.
Devanāgarī: पोषं रयीणामरिष्टिं तनूनां स्वाद्मानं वाचः सुदिनत्वमह्नाम्
pada pāṭha: indra | śreṣṭhāni | draviṇāni | dhehi | cittim | dakṣasya | subhaga-tvam | asme iti || poṣam | rayīṇām | ariṣṭim | tanūnām | svādmānam | vācaḥ | sudina-tvam | ahnām ||2.21.6||

IAST: trikadrukeṣu mahiṣo yavāśiraṁ tuviśuṣmas tṛpat somam apibad viṣṇunā sutaṁ yathāvaśat
Griffith: I. At the Trikadrukas the Great and Strong hath drunk drink blent with meal. With Visnu hath he quaffed the poured out Soma juice, all that he would.
Devanāgarī: त्रिकद्रुकेषु महिषो यवाशिरं तुविशुष्मस्तृपत्सोममपिबद्विष्णुना सुतं यथावशत्
pada pāṭha: tri-kadrukeṣu | mahiṣaḥ | yava-āśiram | tuvi-śuṣmaḥ | tr̥pat | somam | apibat | viṣṇunā | sutam | yathā | avaśat || saḥ | īm | mamāda | mahi | karma | kartave | mahām | urum | saḥ | enam | saścat | devaḥ | devam | satyam | indram | satyaḥ | induḥ ||2.22.1||

IAST: sa īm mamāda mahi karma kartave mahām uruṁ sainaṁ saścad devo devaṁ satyam indraṁ satya induḥ
Griffith: That hath so heightened him the Great, the Wide, to do his mighty work. So may the God attain the God, true Indu Indra who is true.
Devanāgarī: स ईं ममाद महि कर्म कर्तवे महामुरुं सैनं सश्चद्देवो देवं सत्यमिन्द्रं सत्य इन्दुः
pada pāṭha: tri-kadrukeṣu | mahiṣaḥ | yava-āśiram | tuvi-śuṣmaḥ | tr̥pat | somam | apibat | viṣṇunā | sutam | yathā | avaśat || saḥ | īm | mamāda | mahi | karma | kartave | mahām | urum | saḥ | enam | saścat | devaḥ | devam | satyam | indram | satyaḥ | induḥ ||2.22.1||

IAST: adha tviṣīmām̐ abhy ojasā kriviṁ yudhābhavad ā rodasī apṛṇad asya majmanā pra vāvṛdhe
Griffith: So he resplendent in the battle overcame Krivi by might. He with his majesty hath filled the earth and heaven, and waxen strong.
Devanāgarī: अध त्विषीमाँ अभ्योजसा क्रिविं युधाभवदा रोदसी अपृणदस्य मज्मना प्र वावृधे
pada pāṭha: adha | tviṣi-mān | abhi | ojasā | krivim | yudhā | abhavat | ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇat | asya | majmanā | pra | vavr̥dhe || adhatta | anyam | jaṭhare | pra | īm | aricyata | saḥ | enam | saścat | devaḥ | devam | satyam | indram | satyaḥ | induḥ ||2.22.2||

IAST: adhattānyaṁ jaṭhare prem aricyata sainaṁ saścad devo devaṁ satyam indraṁ satya induḥ
Griffith: One share of the libation hath he swallowed down: one share he left. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.
Devanāgarī: अधत्तान्यं जठरे प्रेमरिच्यत सैनं सश्चद्देवो देवं सत्यमिन्द्रं सत्य इन्दुः
pada pāṭha: adha | tviṣi-mān | abhi | ojasā | krivim | yudhā | abhavat | ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇat | asya | majmanā | pra | vavr̥dhe || adhatta | anyam | jaṭhare | pra | īm | aricyata | saḥ | enam | saścat | devaḥ | devam | satyam | indram | satyaḥ | induḥ ||2.22.2||

IAST: sākaṁ jātaḥ kratunā sākam ojasā vavakṣitha sākaṁ vṛddho vīryaiḥ sāsahir mṛdho vicarṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: Brought forth together with wisdom and mighty power thou grewest great; with hero deeds subduing the malevolent, most swift in act;
Devanāgarī: साकं जातः क्रतुना साकमोजसा ववक्षिथ साकं वृद्धो वीर्यैः सासहिर्मृधो विचर्षणिः
pada pāṭha: sākam | jātaḥ | kratunā | sākam | ojasā | vavakṣitha | sākam | vr̥ddhaḥ | vīryaiḥ | sasahiḥ | mr̥dhaḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ || dātā | rādhaḥ | stuvate | kāmyam | vasu | saḥ | enam | saścat | devaḥ | devam | satyam | indram | satyaḥ | induḥ ||2.22.3||

IAST: dātā rādhaḥ stuvate kāmyaṁ vasu sainaṁ saścad devo devaṁ satyam indraṁ satya induḥ
Griffith: Giving prosperity, and lovely wealth to him who praiseth thee. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.
Devanāgarī: दाता राधः स्तुवते काम्यं वसु सैनं सश्चद्देवो देवं सत्यमिन्द्रं सत्य इन्दुः
pada pāṭha: sākam | jātaḥ | kratunā | sākam | ojasā | vavakṣitha | sākam | vr̥ddhaḥ | vīryaiḥ | sasahiḥ | mr̥dhaḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ || dātā | rādhaḥ | stuvate | kāmyam | vasu | saḥ | enam | saścat | devaḥ | devam | satyam | indram | satyaḥ | induḥ ||2.22.3||

IAST: tava tyan naryaṁ nṛto 'pa indra prathamam pūrvyaṁ divi pravācyaṁ kṛtam
Griffith: This, Indra, was thy hero deed, Dancer, thy first and ancient work, worthy to be told forth in heaven,
Devanāgarī: तव त्यन्नर्यं नृतोऽप इन्द्र प्रथमं पूर्व्यं दिवि प्रवाच्यं कृतम्
pada pāṭha: tava | tyat | naryam | nr̥to iti | apaḥ | indra | prathamam | pūrvyam | divi | pra-vācyam | kr̥tam || yat | devasya | śavasā | pra | ariṇāḥ | asum | riṇan | apaḥ || bhuvat | viśvam | abhi | adevam | ojasā | vidāt | ūrjam | śata-kratuḥ | vidāt | iṣam ||2.22.4||

IAST: yad devasya śavasā prāriṇā asuṁ riṇann apaḥ
Griffith: What time thou sentest down life with a God's own power, freeing the floods.
Devanāgarī: यद्देवस्य शवसा प्रारिणा असुं रिणन्नपः
pada pāṭha: tava | tyat | naryam | nr̥to iti | apaḥ | indra | prathamam | pūrvyam | divi | pra-vācyam | kr̥tam || yat | devasya | śavasā | pra | ariṇāḥ | asum | riṇan | apaḥ || bhuvat | viśvam | abhi | adevam | ojasā | vidāt | ūrjam | śata-kratuḥ | vidāt | iṣam ||2.22.4||

IAST: bhuvad viśvam abhy ādevam ojasā vidād ūrjaṁ śatakratur vidād iṣam
Griffith: All that is godless may he conquer with his might, and, Lord of Hundred Powers, find for us strength and food.
Devanāgarī: भुवद्विश्वमभ्यादेवमोजसा विदादूर्जं शतक्रतुर्विदादिषम्
pada pāṭha: tava | tyat | naryam | nr̥to iti | apaḥ | indra | prathamam | pūrvyam | divi | pra-vācyam | kr̥tam || yat | devasya | śavasā | pra | ariṇāḥ | asum | riṇan | apaḥ || bhuvat | viśvam | abhi | adevam | ojasā | vidāt | ūrjam | śata-kratuḥ | vidāt | iṣam ||2.22.4||

IAST: gaṇānāṁ tvā gaṇapatiṁ havāmahe kaviṁ kavīnām upamaśravastamam
Griffith: WE call thee, Lord and Leader of the heavenly hosts, the wise among the wise, the famousest of all,
Devanāgarī: गणानां त्वा गणपतिं हवामहे कविं कवीनामुपमश्रवस्तमम्
pada pāṭha: gaṇānām | tvā | gaṇa-patim | havāmahe | kavim | kavīnām | upamaśravaḥ-tamam || jyeṣṭha-rājam | brahmaṇām | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | ā | naḥ | śr̥ṇvan | ūti-bhiḥ | sīda | sadanam ||2.23.1||

IAST: jyeṣṭharājam brahmaṇām brahmaṇas pata ā naḥ śṛṇvann ūtibhiḥ sīda sādanam
Griffith: The King supreme of prayers, O Brahmanaspati: hear us with help; sit down in place of sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: ज्येष्ठराजं ब्रह्मणां ब्रह्मणस्पत आ नः शृण्वन्नूतिभिः सीद सादनम्
pada pāṭha: gaṇānām | tvā | gaṇa-patim | havāmahe | kavim | kavīnām | upamaśravaḥ-tamam || jyeṣṭha-rājam | brahmaṇām | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | ā | naḥ | śr̥ṇvan | ūti-bhiḥ | sīda | sadanam ||2.23.1||

IAST: devāś cit te asurya pracetaso bṛhaspate yajñiyam bhāgam ānaśuḥ
Griffith: Brhaspati, God immortal! verily the Gods have gained from thee, the wise, a share in holy rites.
Devanāgarī: देवाश्चित्ते असुर्य प्रचेतसो बृहस्पते यज्ञियं भागमानशुः
pada pāṭha: devāḥ | cit | te | asurya | pra-cetasaḥ | br̥haspate | yajñiyam | bhāgam | ānaśuḥ || usrāḥ-iva | sūryaḥ | jyotiṣā | mahaḥ | viśveṣām | it | janitā | brahmaṇām | asi ||2.23.2||

IAST: usrā iva sūryo jyotiṣā maho viśveṣām ij janitā brahmaṇām asi
Griffith: As with great light the Sun brings forth the rays of morn, so thou alone art Father of all sacred prayer.
Devanāgarī: उस्रा इव सूर्यो ज्योतिषा महो विश्वेषामिज्जनिता ब्रह्मणामसि
pada pāṭha: devāḥ | cit | te | asurya | pra-cetasaḥ | br̥haspate | yajñiyam | bhāgam | ānaśuḥ || usrāḥ-iva | sūryaḥ | jyotiṣā | mahaḥ | viśveṣām | it | janitā | brahmaṇām | asi ||2.23.2||

IAST: ā vibādhyā parirāpas tamāṁsi ca jyotiṣmantaṁ ratham ṛtasya tiṣṭhasi
Griffith: When thou hast chased away revilers and the gloom, thou mountest the refulgent car of sacrifice;
Devanāgarī: आ विबाध्या परिरापस्तमांसि च ज्योतिष्मन्तं रथमृतस्य तिष्ठसि
pada pāṭha: ā | vi-bādhya | pari-rapaḥ | tamāṁsi | ca | jyotiṣmantam | ratham | r̥tasya | tiṣṭhasi || br̥haspate | bhīmam | amitra-dambhanam | rakṣaḥ-hanam | gotra-bhidam | svaḥ-vidam ||2.23.3||

IAST: bṛhaspate bhīmam amitradambhanaṁ rakṣohaṇaṁ gotrabhidaṁ svarvidam
Griffith: The awful car, Brhaspati, that quells the foe, slays demons, cleaves the stall of kine, and finds the light.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते भीमममित्रदम्भनं रक्षोहणं गोत्रभिदं स्वर्विदम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vi-bādhya | pari-rapaḥ | tamāṁsi | ca | jyotiṣmantam | ratham | r̥tasya | tiṣṭhasi || br̥haspate | bhīmam | amitra-dambhanam | rakṣaḥ-hanam | gotra-bhidam | svaḥ-vidam ||2.23.3||

IAST: sunītibhir nayasi trāyase janaṁ yas tubhyaṁ dāśān na tam aṁho aśnavat
Griffith: Thou leadest with good guidance and preservest men; distress o'ertakes not him who offers gifts to thee.
Devanāgarī: सुनीतिभिर्नयसि त्रायसे जनं यस्तुभ्यं दाशान्न तमंहो अश्नवत्
pada pāṭha: sunīti-bhiḥ | nayasi | trāyase | janam | yaḥ | tubhyam | dāśāt | na | tam | aṁhaḥ | aśnavat || brahma-dviṣaḥ | tapanaḥ | manyu-mīḥ | asi | br̥haspate | mahi | tat | te | mahi-tvanam ||2.23.4||

IAST: brahmadviṣas tapano manyumīr asi bṛhaspate mahi tat te mahitvanam
Griffith: Him who hates prayer thou punishest, Brhaspati, quelling his wrath: herein is thy great mightiness.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मद्विषस्तपनो मन्युमीरसि बृहस्पते महि तत्ते महित्वनम्
pada pāṭha: sunīti-bhiḥ | nayasi | trāyase | janam | yaḥ | tubhyam | dāśāt | na | tam | aṁhaḥ | aśnavat || brahma-dviṣaḥ | tapanaḥ | manyu-mīḥ | asi | br̥haspate | mahi | tat | te | mahi-tvanam ||2.23.4||

IAST: na tam aṁho na duritaṁ kutaś cana nārātayas titirur na dvayāvinaḥ
Griffith: No sorrow, no distress from any side, no foes, no creatures double-tongued have overcome the man,-
Devanāgarī: न तमंहो न दुरितं कुतश्चन नारातयस्तितिरुर्न द्वयाविनः
pada pāṭha: na | tam | aṁhaḥ | na | duḥ-itam | kutaḥ | cana | na | arātayaḥ | titiruḥ | na | dvayāvinaḥ || viśvāḥ | it | asmāt | dhvarasaḥ | vi | bādhase | yam | su-gopāḥ | rakṣasi | brahmaṇaḥ | pate ||2.23.5||

IAST: viśvā id asmād dhvaraso vi bādhase yaṁ sugopā rakṣasi brahmaṇas pate
Griffith: Thou drivest all seductive fiends away from him whom, careful guard, thou keepest Brahmanaspati.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा इदस्माद्ध्वरसो वि बाधसे यं सुगोपा रक्षसि ब्रह्मणस्पते
pada pāṭha: na | tam | aṁhaḥ | na | duḥ-itam | kutaḥ | cana | na | arātayaḥ | titiruḥ | na | dvayāvinaḥ || viśvāḥ | it | asmāt | dhvarasaḥ | vi | bādhase | yam | su-gopāḥ | rakṣasi | brahmaṇaḥ | pate ||2.23.5||

IAST: tvaṁ no gopāḥ pathikṛd vicakṣaṇas tava vratāya matibhir jarāmahe
Griffith: Thou art our keeper, wise, preparer of our paths: we, for thy service, sing to thee with hymns of praise.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो गोपाः पथिकृद्विचक्षणस्तव व्रताय मतिभिर्जरामहे
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | gopāḥ | pathi-kr̥t | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | tava | vratāya | mati-bhiḥ | jarāmahe || br̥haspate | yaḥ | naḥ | abhi | hvaraḥ | dadhe | svā | tam | marmartu | ducchunā | harasvatī ||2.23.6||

IAST: bṛhaspate yo no abhi hvaro dadhe svā tam marmartu ducchunā harasvatī
Griffith: Brhaspati, whoever lays a snare for us, him may his evil fate, precipitate, destroy.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते यो नो अभि ह्वरो दधे स्वा तं मर्मर्तु दुच्छुना हरस्वती
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | gopāḥ | pathi-kr̥t | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | tava | vratāya | mati-bhiḥ | jarāmahe || br̥haspate | yaḥ | naḥ | abhi | hvaraḥ | dadhe | svā | tam | marmartu | ducchunā | harasvatī ||2.23.6||

IAST: uta vā yo no marcayād anāgaso 'rātīvā martaḥ sānuko vṛkaḥ
Griffith: Him, too, who threatens us without offence of ours, the evilminded, arrogant, rapacious man,-
Devanāgarī: उत वा यो नो मर्चयादनागसोऽरातीवा मर्तः सानुको वृकः
pada pāṭha: uta | vā | yaḥ | naḥ | marcayāt | anāgasaḥ | arātī-vā | martaḥ | sānukaḥ | vr̥kaḥ || br̥haspate | apa | tam | vartaya | pathaḥ | su-gam | naḥ | asyai | deva-vītaye | kr̥dhi ||2.23.7||

IAST: bṛhaspate apa taṁ vartayā pathaḥ sugaṁ no asyai devavītaye kṛdhi
Griffith: Him turn thou from our path away, Brhaspati: give us fair access to this banquet of the Gods.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते अप तं वर्तया पथः सुगं नो अस्यै देववीतये कृधि
pada pāṭha: uta | vā | yaḥ | naḥ | marcayāt | anāgasaḥ | arātī-vā | martaḥ | sānukaḥ | vr̥kaḥ || br̥haspate | apa | tam | vartaya | pathaḥ | su-gam | naḥ | asyai | deva-vītaye | kr̥dhi ||2.23.7||

IAST: trātāraṁ tvā tanūnāṁ havāmahe 'vaspartar adhivaktāram asmayum
Griffith: Thee as protector of our bodies we invoke, thee, saviour, as the comforter who loveth us.
Devanāgarī: त्रातारं त्वा तनूनां हवामहेऽवस्पर्तरधिवक्तारमस्मयुम्
pada pāṭha: trātāram | tvā | tanūnām | havāmahe | ava-spartaḥ | adhi-vaktāram | asma-yum || br̥haspate | deva-nidaḥ | ni | barhaya | mā | duḥ-evāḥ | ut-taram | sumnam | ut | naśan ||2.23.8||

IAST: bṛhaspate devanido ni barhaya mā durevā uttaraṁ sumnam un naśan
Griffith: Strike, O Brhaspati, the Gods' revilers down, and let not the unrighteous come to highest bliss.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते देवनिदो नि बर्हय मा दुरेवा उत्तरं सुम्नमुन्नशन्
pada pāṭha: trātāram | tvā | tanūnām | havāmahe | ava-spartaḥ | adhi-vaktāram | asma-yum || br̥haspate | deva-nidaḥ | ni | barhaya | mā | duḥ-evāḥ | ut-taram | sumnam | ut | naśan ||2.23.8||

IAST: tvayā vayaṁ suvṛdhā brahmaṇas pate spārhā vasu manuṣyā dadīmahi
Griffith: Through thee, kind -prosperer, O Brahmanaspati, may we obtain the wealth of Men which all desire:
Devanāgarī: त्वया वयं सुवृधा ब्रह्मणस्पते स्पार्हा वसु मनुष्या ददीमहि
pada pāṭha: tvayā | vayam | su-vr̥dhā | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | spārhā | vasu | manuṣyā | ā | dadīmahi || yāḥ | naḥ | dūre | taḷitaḥ | yāḥ | arātayaḥ | abhi | santi | jambhaya | tāḥ | anapnasaḥ ||2.23.9||

IAST: yā no dūre taḻito yā arātayo 'bhi santi jambhayā tā anapnasaḥ
Griffith: And all our enemies, who near or far away prevail against us, crush, and leave them destitute.
Devanāgarī: या नो दूरे तळितो या अरातयोऽभि सन्ति जम्भया ता अनप्नसः
pada pāṭha: tvayā | vayam | su-vr̥dhā | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | spārhā | vasu | manuṣyā | ā | dadīmahi || yāḥ | naḥ | dūre | taḷitaḥ | yāḥ | arātayaḥ | abhi | santi | jambhaya | tāḥ | anapnasaḥ ||2.23.9||

IAST: tvayā vayam uttamaṁ dhīmahe vayo bṛhaspate papriṇā sasninā yujā
Griffith: With thee as our own rich and liberal ally may we, Brhaspati, gain highest power of life.
Devanāgarī: त्वया वयमुत्तमं धीमहे वयो बृहस्पते पप्रिणा सस्निना युजा
pada pāṭha: tvayā | vayam | ut-tamam | dhīmahe | vayaḥ | br̥haspate | papriṇā | sasninā | yujā || mā | naḥ | duḥ-śaṁsaḥ | abhi-dipsuḥ | īśata | pra | su-śaṁsāḥ | mati-bhiḥ | tāriṣīmahi ||2.23.10||

IAST: mā no duḥśaṁso abhidipsur īśata pra suśaṁsā matibhis tāriṣīmahi
Griffith: Let not the guileful wicked man be lord of us:-still may we prosper, singing goodly hymns of praise.
Devanāgarī: मा नो दुःशंसो अभिदिप्सुरीशत प्र सुशंसा मतिभिस्तारिषीमहि
pada pāṭha: tvayā | vayam | ut-tamam | dhīmahe | vayaḥ | br̥haspate | papriṇā | sasninā | yujā || mā | naḥ | duḥ-śaṁsaḥ | abhi-dipsuḥ | īśata | pra | su-śaṁsāḥ | mati-bhiḥ | tāriṣīmahi ||2.23.10||

IAST: anānudo vṛṣabho jagmir āhavaṁ niṣṭaptā śatrum pṛtanāsu sāsahiḥ
Griffith: Strong, never yielding, hastening to the battle-cry, consumer of the foe, victorious in the strife,
Devanāgarī: अनानुदो वृषभो जग्मिराहवं निष्टप्ता शत्रुं पृतनासु सासहिः
pada pāṭha: ananu-daḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | jagmiḥ | ā-havam | niḥ-taptā | śatrum | pr̥tanāsu | sasahiḥ || asi | satyaḥ | r̥ṇa-yāḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | ugrasya | cit | damitā | vīḷu-harṣiṇaḥ ||2.23.11||

IAST: asi satya ṛṇayā brahmaṇas pata ugrasya cid damitā vīḻuharṣiṇaḥ
Griffith: Thou art sin's true avenger, Brahmanaspati, who tamest e'en the fierce, the wildly passionate.
Devanāgarī: असि सत्य ऋणया ब्रह्मणस्पत उग्रस्य चिद्दमिता वीळुहर्षिणः
pada pāṭha: ananu-daḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | jagmiḥ | ā-havam | niḥ-taptā | śatrum | pr̥tanāsu | sasahiḥ || asi | satyaḥ | r̥ṇa-yāḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | ugrasya | cit | damitā | vīḷu-harṣiṇaḥ ||2.23.11||

IAST: adevena manasā yo riṣaṇyati śāsām ugro manyamāno jighāṁsati
Griffith: Whoso with mind ungodly seeks to do us harm, who, deeming him a man of might mid lords, would slay,-
Devanāgarī: अदेवेन मनसा यो रिषण्यति शासामुग्रो मन्यमानो जिघांसति
pada pāṭha: adevena | manasā | yaḥ | riṣaṇyati | śāsām | ugraḥ | mayamānaḥ | jighāṁsati || br̥haspate | mā | praṇak | tasya | naḥ | vadhaḥ | ni | karma | manyum | duḥ-evasya | śardhataḥ ||2.23.12||

IAST: bṛhaspate mā praṇak tasya no vadho ni karma manyuṁ durevasya śardhataḥ
Griffith: Let not his deadly blow reach us, Brhaspati; may we humiliate the strong ill-doer's wrath.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते मा प्रणक्तस्य नो वधो नि कर्म मन्युं दुरेवस्य शर्धतः
pada pāṭha: adevena | manasā | yaḥ | riṣaṇyati | śāsām | ugraḥ | mayamānaḥ | jighāṁsati || br̥haspate | mā | praṇak | tasya | naḥ | vadhaḥ | ni | karma | manyum | duḥ-evasya | śardhataḥ ||2.23.12||

IAST: bhareṣu havyo namasopasadyo gantā vājeṣu sanitā dhanaṁ-dhanam
Griffith: The mover mid the spoil, the winner of all wealth, to be invoked in fight and reverently adored,
Devanāgarī: भरेषु हव्यो नमसोपसद्यो गन्ता वाजेषु सनिता धनंधनम्
pada pāṭha: bhareṣu | havyaḥ | namasā | upa-sadyaḥ | gantā | vājeṣu | sanitā | dhanam-dhanam || viśvāḥ | it | aryaḥ | abhi-dipsvaḥ | mr̥dhaḥ | br̥haspatiḥ | vi | vavarha | rathān-iva ||2.23.13||

IAST: viśvā id aryo abhidipsvo mṛdho bṛhaspatir vi vavarhā rathām̐ iva
Griffith: Brhaspati hath overthrown like cars of war all wicked enemies who fain would injure us.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा इदर्यो अभिदिप्स्वो मृधो बृहस्पतिर्वि ववर्हा रथाँ इव
pada pāṭha: bhareṣu | havyaḥ | namasā | upa-sadyaḥ | gantā | vājeṣu | sanitā | dhanam-dhanam || viśvāḥ | it | aryaḥ | abhi-dipsvaḥ | mr̥dhaḥ | br̥haspatiḥ | vi | vavarha | rathān-iva ||2.23.13||

IAST: tejiṣṭhayā tapanī rakṣasas tapa ye tvā nide dadhire dṛṣṭavīryam
Griffith: Burn up the demons with thy fiercest flaming brand, those who have scorned thee in thy manifested might.
Devanāgarī: तेजिष्ठया तपनी रक्षसस्तप ये त्वा निदे दधिरे दृष्टवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: tejiṣṭhayā | tapanī | rakṣasaḥ | tapa | ye | tvā | nide | dadhire | dr̥ṣṭa-vīryam || āviḥ | tat | kr̥ṣva | yat | asat | te | ukthyam | br̥haspate | vi | pari-rapaḥ | ardaya ||2.23.14||

IAST: āvis tat kṛṣva yad asat ta ukthyam bṛhaspate vi parirāpo ardaya
Griffith: Show forth that power that shall deserve the hymn of praise: destroy the evil speakers, O Brhaspati.
Devanāgarī: आविस्तत्कृष्व यदसत्त उक्थ्यं बृहस्पते वि परिरापो अर्दय
pada pāṭha: tejiṣṭhayā | tapanī | rakṣasaḥ | tapa | ye | tvā | nide | dadhire | dr̥ṣṭa-vīryam || āviḥ | tat | kr̥ṣva | yat | asat | te | ukthyam | br̥haspate | vi | pari-rapaḥ | ardaya ||2.23.14||

IAST: bṛhaspate ati yad aryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumaj janeṣu
Griffith: Brhaspati, that which the foe deserves not which shines among the folk effectual, splendid,
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते अति यदर्यो अर्हाद्द्युमद्विभाति क्रतुमज्जनेषु
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | ati | yat | aryaḥ | arhāt | dyu-mat | vi-bhāti | kratu-mat | janeṣu || yat | dīdayat | śavasā | r̥ta-prajāta | tat | asmāsu | draviṇam | dhehi | citram ||2.23.15||

IAST: yad dīdayac chavasa ṛtaprajāta tad asmāsu draviṇaṁ dhehi citram
Griffith: That, Son of Law I which is with might refulgent-that treasure wonderful bestow thou on us.
Devanāgarī: यद्दीदयच्छवस ऋतप्रजात तदस्मासु द्रविणं धेहि चित्रम्
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | ati | yat | aryaḥ | arhāt | dyu-mat | vi-bhāti | kratu-mat | janeṣu || yat | dīdayat | śavasā | r̥ta-prajāta | tat | asmāsu | draviṇam | dhehi | citram ||2.23.15||

IAST: mā naḥ stenebhyo ye abhi druhas pade nirāmiṇo ripavo 'nneṣu jāgṛdhuḥ
Griffith: Give us not up to those who, foes in ambuscade, are greedy for the wealth of him who sits at ease,
Devanāgarī: मा नः स्तेनेभ्यो ये अभि द्रुहस्पदे निरामिणो रिपवोऽन्नेषु जागृधुः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | stenebhyaḥ | ye | abhi | druhaḥ | pade | nirāmiṇaḥ | ripavaḥ | anneṣu | jagr̥dhuḥ || ā | devānām | ohate | vi | vrayaḥ | hr̥di | br̥haspate | na | paraḥ | sāmnaḥ | viduḥ ||2.23.16||

IAST: ā devānām ohate vi vrayo hṛdi bṛhaspate na paraḥ sāmno viduḥ
Griffith: Who cherish in their heart abandonment of Gods. Brhaspati, no further rest shall they obtain.
Devanāgarī: आ देवानामोहते वि व्रयो हृदि बृहस्पते न परः साम्नो विदुः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | stenebhyaḥ | ye | abhi | druhaḥ | pade | nirāmiṇaḥ | ripavaḥ | anneṣu | jagr̥dhuḥ || ā | devānām | ohate | vi | vrayaḥ | hr̥di | br̥haspate | na | paraḥ | sāmnaḥ | viduḥ ||2.23.16||

IAST: viśvebhyo hi tvā bhuvanebhyas pari tvaṣṭājanat sāmnaḥ-sāmnaḥ kaviḥ
Griffith: For Tvastar, he who knows each sacred song, brought thee to life, preeminent o'er all the things that be.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेभ्यो हि त्वा भुवनेभ्यस्परि त्वष्टाजनत्साम्नःसाम्नः कविः
pada pāṭha: viśvebhyaḥ | hi | tvā | bhuvanebhyaḥ | pari | tvaṣṭā | ajanat | sāmnaḥ-sāmnaḥ | kaviḥ || saḥ | r̥ṇa-cit | r̥ṇa-yāḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | druhaḥ | hantā | mahaḥ | r̥tasya | dhartari ||2.23.17||

IAST: sa ṛṇacid ṛṇayā brahmaṇas patir druho hantā maha ṛtasya dhartari
Griffith: Guilt-scourger, guilt-avenger is Brhaspati, who slays the spoiler and upholds the mighty Law.
Devanāgarī: स ऋणचिदृणया ब्रह्मणस्पतिर्द्रुहो हन्ता मह ऋतस्य धर्तरि
pada pāṭha: viśvebhyaḥ | hi | tvā | bhuvanebhyaḥ | pari | tvaṣṭā | ajanat | sāmnaḥ-sāmnaḥ | kaviḥ || saḥ | r̥ṇa-cit | r̥ṇa-yāḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | druhaḥ | hantā | mahaḥ | r̥tasya | dhartari ||2.23.17||

IAST: tava śriye vy ajihīta parvato gavāṁ gotram udasṛjo yad aṅgiraḥ
Griffith: The mountain, for thy glory, cleft itself apart when, Angiras! thou openedst the stall of kine.
Devanāgarī: तव श्रिये व्यजिहीत पर्वतो गवां गोत्रमुदसृजो यदङ्गिरः
pada pāṭha: tava | śriye | vi | ajihīta | parvataḥ | gavām | gotram | ut-asr̥jaḥ | yat | aṅgiraḥ || indreṇa | yujā | tamasā | pari-vr̥tam | br̥haspate | niḥ | apām | aubjaḥ | arṇavam ||2.23.18||

IAST: indreṇa yujā tamasā parīvṛtam bṛhaspate nir apām aubjo arṇavam
Griffith: Thoul O Brhaspati, with Indra for ally didst hurl down water-floods which gloom had compa-sed round.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेण युजा तमसा परीवृतं बृहस्पते निरपामौब्जो अर्णवम्
pada pāṭha: tava | śriye | vi | ajihīta | parvataḥ | gavām | gotram | ut-asr̥jaḥ | yat | aṅgiraḥ || indreṇa | yujā | tamasā | pari-vr̥tam | br̥haspate | niḥ | apām | aubjaḥ | arṇavam ||2.23.18||

IAST: brahmaṇas pate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṁ ca jinva
Griffith: O Brahmanaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn and prosper thou our children.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मणस्पते त्वमस्य यन्ता सूक्तस्य बोधि तनयं च जिन्व
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇaḥ | pate | tvam | asya | yantā | su-uktasya | bodhi | tanayam | ca | jinva || viśvam | tat | bhadram | yat | avanti | devāḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.23.19||

IAST: viśvaṁ tad bhadraṁ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: विश्वं तद्भद्रं यदवन्ति देवा बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇaḥ | pate | tvam | asya | yantā | su-uktasya | bodhi | tanayam | ca | jinva || viśvam | tat | bhadram | yat | avanti | devāḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.23.19||

IAST: semām aviḍḍhi prabhṛtiṁ ya īśiṣe 'yā vidhema navayā mahā girā
Griffith: BE pleased with this our offering, thou who art the Lord; we will adore thee with this new and mighty song.
Devanāgarī: सेमामविड्ढि प्रभृतिं य ईशिषेऽया विधेम नवया महा गिरा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | imām | aviḍḍhi | pra-bhr̥tim | yaḥ | īśiṣe | ayā | vidhema | navayā | mahā | girā || yathā | naḥ | mīḍhvān | stavate | sakhā | tava | br̥haspate | sīsadhaḥ | saḥ | uta | naḥ | matim ||2.24.1||

IAST: yathā no mīḍhvān stavate sakhā tava bṛhaspate sīṣadhaḥ sota no matim
Griffith: As this thy friend, our liberal patron, praises thee, do thou, Brhaspati, fulfil our hearts' desire.
Devanāgarī: यथा नो मीढ्वान्स्तवते सखा तव बृहस्पते सीषधः सोत नो मतिम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | imām | aviḍḍhi | pra-bhr̥tim | yaḥ | īśiṣe | ayā | vidhema | navayā | mahā | girā || yathā | naḥ | mīḍhvān | stavate | sakhā | tava | br̥haspate | sīsadhaḥ | saḥ | uta | naḥ | matim ||2.24.1||

IAST: yo nantvāny anaman ny ojasotādardar manyunā śambarāṇi vi
Griffith: He who with might bowed down the things that should be bowed, and in his fury rent the holds of Sambara:
Devanāgarī: यो नन्त्वान्यनमन्न्योजसोतादर्दर्मन्युना शम्बराणि वि
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | nantvāni | anamat | ni | ojasā | uta | adardaḥ | manyunā | śambarāṇi | vi || pra | acyavayat | acyutā | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | ā | ca | aviśat | vasu-mantam | vi | parvatam ||2.24.2||

IAST: prācyāvayad acyutā brahmaṇas patir ā cāviśad vasumantaṁ vi parvatam
Griffith: Who overthrew what shook not, Brahmapaspati,-he made his way within the mountain stored with wealth.
Devanāgarī: प्राच्यावयदच्युता ब्रह्मणस्पतिरा चाविशद्वसुमन्तं वि पर्वतम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | nantvāni | anamat | ni | ojasā | uta | adardaḥ | manyunā | śambarāṇi | vi || pra | acyavayat | acyutā | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | ā | ca | aviśat | vasu-mantam | vi | parvatam ||2.24.2||

IAST: tad devānāṁ devatamāya kartvam aśrathnan dṛḻhāvradanta vīḻitā
Griffith: That was a great deed for the Godliest of the Gods: strong things were loosened and the firmly fixed gave way.
Devanāgarī: तद्देवानां देवतमाय कर्त्वमश्रथ्नन्दृळ्हाव्रदन्त वीळिता
pada pāṭha: tat | devānām | deva-tamāya | kartvam | aśrathnan | dr̥ḷhā | avradanta | vīḷitā || ut | gāḥ | ājat | abhinat | brahmaṇā | valam | agūhat | tamaḥ | vi | acakṣayat | svariti svaḥ ||2.24.3||

IAST: ud gā ājad abhinad brahmaṇā valam agūhat tamo vy acakṣayat svaḥ
Griffith: He drave the kine forth and cleft Vala through by prayer, dispelled the darkness and displayed the light of heaven.
Devanāgarī: उद्गा आजदभिनद्ब्रह्मणा वलमगूहत्तमो व्यचक्षयत्स्वः
pada pāṭha: tat | devānām | deva-tamāya | kartvam | aśrathnan | dr̥ḷhā | avradanta | vīḷitā || ut | gāḥ | ājat | abhinat | brahmaṇā | valam | agūhat | tamaḥ | vi | acakṣayat | svariti svaḥ ||2.24.3||

IAST: aśmāsyam avatam brahmaṇas patir madhudhāram abhi yam ojasātṛṇat
Griffith: The well with mouth of stone that poured a flood of meath, which Brahmapaspati hath opened with his might-
Devanāgarī: अश्मास्यमवतं ब्रह्मणस्पतिर्मधुधारमभि यमोजसातृणत्
pada pāṭha: aśma-āsyam | avatam | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | madhu-dhāram | abhi | yam | ojasā | atr̥ṇat || tam | eva | viśve | papire | svaḥ-dr̥śaḥ | bahu | sākam | sisicuḥ | utsam | udriṇam ||2.24.4||

IAST: tam eva viśve papire svardṛśo bahu sākaṁ sisicur utsam udriṇam
Griffith: All they who see the light have drunk their fill thereat: together they have made the watery fount flow forth.
Devanāgarī: तमेव विश्वे पपिरे स्वर्दृशो बहु साकं सिसिचुरुत्समुद्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: aśma-āsyam | avatam | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | madhu-dhāram | abhi | yam | ojasā | atr̥ṇat || tam | eva | viśve | papire | svaḥ-dr̥śaḥ | bahu | sākam | sisicuḥ | utsam | udriṇam ||2.24.4||

IAST: sanā tā kā cid bhuvanā bhavītvā mādbhiḥ śaradbhir duro varanta vaḥ
Griffith: Ancient will be those creatures, whatsoe'er they be; with moons, with autumns, doors unclose themselves to you.
Devanāgarī: सना ता का चिद्भुवना भवीत्वा माद्भिः शरद्भिर्दुरो वरन्त वः
pada pāṭha: sanā | tā | kā | cit | bhuvanā | bhavītvā | māt-bhiḥ | śarat-bhiḥ | duraḥ | varanta | vaḥ || ayatantā | carataḥ | anyat-anyat | it | yā | cakāra | vayunā | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.24.5||

IAST: ayatantā carato anyad-anyad id yā cakāra vayunā brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: Effortless they pass on to perfect this and that, appointed works which Brahmanaspati ordained.
Devanāgarī: अयतन्ता चरतो अन्यदन्यदिद्या चकार वयुना ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: sanā | tā | kā | cit | bhuvanā | bhavītvā | māt-bhiḥ | śarat-bhiḥ | duraḥ | varanta | vaḥ || ayatantā | carataḥ | anyat-anyat | it | yā | cakāra | vayunā | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.24.5||

IAST: abhinakṣanto abhi ye tam ānaśur nidhim paṇīnām paramaṁ guhā hitam
Griffith: They who with much endeavour searching round obtained the Panis' noblest treasure hidden in the cave,-
Devanāgarī: अभिनक्षन्तो अभि ये तमानशुर्निधिं पणीनां परमं गुहा हितम्
pada pāṭha: abhi-nakṣantaḥ | abhi | ye | tam | ānaśuḥ | ni-dhim | paṇīnām | paramam | guhā | hitam || te | vidvāṁsaḥ | prati-cakṣya | anr̥tā | punaḥ | yataḥ | ūm̐ iti | āyan | tat | ut | īyuḥ | ā-viśam ||2.24.6||

IAST: te vidvāṁsaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punar yata u āyan tad ud īyur āviśam
Griffith: Those sages, having marked the falsehoods, turned them back whence they had come, and sought again to enter in.
Devanāgarī: ते विद्वांसः प्रतिचक्ष्यानृता पुनर्यत उ आयन्तदुदीयुराविशम्
pada pāṭha: abhi-nakṣantaḥ | abhi | ye | tam | ānaśuḥ | ni-dhim | paṇīnām | paramam | guhā | hitam || te | vidvāṁsaḥ | prati-cakṣya | anr̥tā | punaḥ | yataḥ | ūm̐ iti | āyan | tat | ut | īyuḥ | ā-viśam ||2.24.6||

IAST: ṛtāvānaḥ praticakṣyānṛtā punar āta ā tasthuḥ kavayo mahas pathaḥ
Griffith: The pious ones when they had seen the falsehoods turned them back, the sages stood again upon the lofty ways.
Devanāgarī: ऋतावानः प्रतिचक्ष्यानृता पुनरात आ तस्थुः कवयो महस्पथः
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānaḥ | prati-cakṣya | anr̥tā | punaḥ | ā | ataḥ | ā | tasthuḥ | kavayaḥ | mahaḥ | pathaḥ || te | bāhu-bhyām | dhamitam | agnim | aśmani | nakiḥ | saḥ | asti | araṇaḥ | juhuḥ | hi | tam ||2.24.7||

IAST: te bāhubhyāṁ dhamitam agnim aśmani nakiḥ ṣo asty araṇo jahur hi tam
Griffith: Cast down with both their arms upon the rock they left the kindled fire, and said, No enemy is he.
Devanāgarī: ते बाहुभ्यां धमितमग्निमश्मनि नकिः षो अस्त्यरणो जहुर्हि तम्
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānaḥ | prati-cakṣya | anr̥tā | punaḥ | ā | ataḥ | ā | tasthuḥ | kavayaḥ | mahaḥ | pathaḥ || te | bāhu-bhyām | dhamitam | agnim | aśmani | nakiḥ | saḥ | asti | araṇaḥ | juhuḥ | hi | tam ||2.24.7||

IAST: ṛtajyena kṣipreṇa brahmaṇas patir yatra vaṣṭi pra tad aśnoti dhanvanā
Griffith: With his swift bow, strung truly, Brahmanaspati reaches the mark whate'er it be that he desires.
Devanāgarī: ऋतज्येन क्षिप्रेण ब्रह्मणस्पतिर्यत्र वष्टि प्र तदश्नोति धन्वना
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-jyena | kṣipreṇa | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | yatra | vaṣṭi | pra | tat | aśnoti | dhanvanā || tasya | sādhvīḥ | iṣavaḥ | yābhiḥ | asyati | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ | dr̥śaye | karṇa-yonayaḥ ||2.24.8||

IAST: tasya sādhvīr iṣavo yābhir asyati nṛcakṣaso dṛśaye karṇayonayaḥ
Griffith: Excellent are the arrows wherewithal he shoots, keen-eyed to look on men and springing from his ear.
Devanāgarī: तस्य साध्वीरिषवो याभिरस्यति नृचक्षसो दृशये कर्णयोनयः
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-jyena | kṣipreṇa | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | yatra | vaṣṭi | pra | tat | aśnoti | dhanvanā || tasya | sādhvīḥ | iṣavaḥ | yābhiḥ | asyati | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ | dr̥śaye | karṇa-yonayaḥ ||2.24.8||

IAST: sa saṁnayaḥ sa vinayaḥ purohitaḥ sa suṣṭutaḥ sa yudhi brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: He brings together and he parts, the great High Priest; extolled is he, in battle Brahmapaspati.
Devanāgarī: स संनयः स विनयः पुरोहितः स सुष्टुतः स युधि ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sam-nayaḥ | saḥ | vi-nayaḥ | puraḥ-hitaḥ | saḥ | su-stutaḥ | saḥ | yudhi | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ || cākṣmaḥ | yat | vājam | bharate | matī | dhanā | āt | it | sūryaḥ | tapati | tapyatuḥ | vr̥thā ||2.24.9||

IAST: cākṣmo yad vājam bharate matī dhanād it sūryas tapati tapyatur vṛthā
Griffith: When, gracious, for the hymn he brings forth food and wealth, the glowing Sun untroubled sends forth fervent heat.
Devanāgarī: चाक्ष्मो यद्वाजं भरते मती धनादित्सूर्यस्तपति तप्यतुर्वृथा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sam-nayaḥ | saḥ | vi-nayaḥ | puraḥ-hitaḥ | saḥ | su-stutaḥ | saḥ | yudhi | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ || cākṣmaḥ | yat | vājam | bharate | matī | dhanā | āt | it | sūryaḥ | tapati | tapyatuḥ | vr̥thā ||2.24.9||

IAST: vibhu prabhu prathamam mehanāvato bṛhaspateḥ suvidatrāṇi rādhyā
Griffith: First and preeminent, excelling all besides are the kind gifts of liberal Brhaspati.
Devanāgarī: विभु प्रभु प्रथमं मेहनावतो बृहस्पतेः सुविदत्राणि राध्या
pada pāṭha: vi-bhu | pra-bhu | prathamam | mehanā-vataḥ | br̥haspateḥ | su-vidatrāṇi | rādhyā || imā | sātāni | venyasya | vājinaḥ | yena | janāḥ | ubhaye | bhuñjate | viśaḥ ||2.24.10||

IAST: imā sātāni venyasya vājino yena janā ubhaye bhuñjate viśaḥ
Griffith: These are the boons of him the Strong who should be loved, whereby both classes and the people have delight.
Devanāgarī: इमा सातानि वेन्यस्य वाजिनो येन जना उभये भुञ्जते विशः
pada pāṭha: vi-bhu | pra-bhu | prathamam | mehanā-vataḥ | br̥haspateḥ | su-vidatrāṇi | rādhyā || imā | sātāni | venyasya | vājinaḥ | yena | janāḥ | ubhaye | bhuñjate | viśaḥ ||2.24.10||

IAST: yo 'vare vṛjane viśvathā vibhur mahām u raṇvaḥ śavasā vavakṣitha
Griffith: Thou who in every way supreme in earthly power, rejoicing, by thy mighty strength hast waxen great,-
Devanāgarī: योऽवरे वृजने विश्वथा विभुर्महामु रण्वः शवसा ववक्षिथ
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | avare | vr̥jane | viśva-thā | vi-bhuḥ | mahām | ūm̐ iti | raṇvaḥ | śavasā | vavakṣitha || saḥ | devaḥ | devān | prati | paprathe | pr̥thu | viśvā | it | ūm̐ iti | tā | pari-bhūḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.24.11||

IAST: sa devo devān prati paprathe pṛthu viśved u tā paribhūr brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: He is the God spread forth in breadth against the Gods: he, Brahmanaspati, encompasseth this All.
Devanāgarī: स देवो देवान्प्रति पप्रथे पृथु विश्वेदु ता परिभूर्ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | avare | vr̥jane | viśva-thā | vi-bhuḥ | mahām | ūm̐ iti | raṇvaḥ | śavasā | vavakṣitha || saḥ | devaḥ | devān | prati | paprathe | pr̥thu | viśvā | it | ūm̐ iti | tā | pari-bhūḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.24.11||

IAST: viśvaṁ satyam maghavānā yuvor id āpaś cana pra minanti vrataṁ vām
Griffith: From you, twain Maghavans, all truth proceedeth: even the waters break not your commandment.
Devanāgarī: विश्वं सत्यं मघवाना युवोरिदापश्चन प्र मिनन्ति व्रतं वाम्
pada pāṭha: viśvam | satyam | magha-vānā | yuvoḥ | it | āpaḥ | cana | pra | minanti | vratam | vām || accha | indrābrahmaṇaspatī iti | haviḥ | naḥ | annam | yujā-iva | vājinā | jigātam ||2.24.12||

IAST: acchendrābrahmaṇaspatī havir no 'nnaṁ yujeva vājinā jigātam
Griffith: Come to us, Brahmanaspati and Indra, to our oblation Iiie yoked steeds to fodder.
Devanāgarī: अच्छेन्द्राब्रह्मणस्पती हविर्नोऽन्नं युजेव वाजिना जिगातम्
pada pāṭha: viśvam | satyam | magha-vānā | yuvoḥ | it | āpaḥ | cana | pra | minanti | vratam | vām || accha | indrābrahmaṇaspatī iti | haviḥ | naḥ | annam | yujā-iva | vājinā | jigātam ||2.24.12||

IAST: utāśiṣṭhā anu śṛṇvanti vahnayaḥ sabheyo vipro bharate matī dhanā
Griffith: The sacrificial flames most swiftly hear the call: the priest of the assembly gaineth wealth for hymns.
Devanāgarī: उताशिष्ठा अनु शृण्वन्ति वह्नयः सभेयो विप्रो भरते मती धना
pada pāṭha: uta | āśiṣṭhāḥ | anu | śr̥ṇvanti | vahnayaḥ | sabheyaḥ | vipraḥ | bharate | matī | dhanā || vīḷu-dveṣāḥ | anu | vaśā | r̥ṇam | ā-dadiḥ | saḥ | ha | vājī | sam-ithe | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.24.13||

IAST: vīḻudveṣā anu vaśa ṛṇam ādadiḥ sa ha vājī samithe brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: Hating the stern, remitting at his will the debt, strong in the shock of fight is Brahmanaspati.
Devanāgarī: वीळुद्वेषा अनु वश ऋणमाददिः स ह वाजी समिथे ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: uta | āśiṣṭhāḥ | anu | śr̥ṇvanti | vahnayaḥ | sabheyaḥ | vipraḥ | bharate | matī | dhanā || vīḷu-dveṣāḥ | anu | vaśā | r̥ṇam | ā-dadiḥ | saḥ | ha | vājī | sam-ithe | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.24.13||

IAST: brahmaṇas pater abhavad yathāvaśaṁ satyo manyur mahi karmā kariṣyataḥ
Griffith: The wrath of Brahmanaspati according to his will had full effect when he would do a mighty deed.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मणस्पतेरभवद्यथावशं सत्यो मन्युर्महि कर्मा करिष्यतः
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇaḥ | pateḥ | abhavat | yathā-vaśam | satyaḥ | manyuḥ | mahi | karma | kariṣyataḥ || yaḥ | gāḥ | ut-ājat | saḥ | dive | vi | ca | abhajat | mahī-iva | rītiḥ | śavasā | asarat | pr̥thak ||2.24.14||

IAST: yo gā udājat sa dive vi cābhajan mahīva rītiḥ śavasāsarat pṛthak
Griffith: The kine he drave forth and distributed to heaven, even as a copious flood with strength flows sundry ways.
Devanāgarī: यो गा उदाजत्स दिवे वि चाभजन्महीव रीतिः शवसासरत्पृथक्
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇaḥ | pateḥ | abhavat | yathā-vaśam | satyaḥ | manyuḥ | mahi | karma | kariṣyataḥ || yaḥ | gāḥ | ut-ājat | saḥ | dive | vi | ca | abhajat | mahī-iva | rītiḥ | śavasā | asarat | pr̥thak ||2.24.14||

IAST: brahmaṇas pate suyamasya viśvahā rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ
Griffith: O Brahmanaspati, may we be evermore masters of wealth well-guided, full of vital strength.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मणस्पते सुयमस्य विश्वहा रायः स्याम रथ्यो वयस्वतः
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇaḥ | pate | su-yamasya | viśvahā | rāyaḥ | syāma | rathyaḥ | vayasvataḥ || vīreṣu | vīrān | upa | pr̥ṅdhi | naḥ | tvam | yat | īśānaḥ | brahmaṇā | veṣi | me | havam ||2.24.15||

IAST: vīreṣu vīrām̐ upa pṛṅdhi nas tvaṁ yad īśāno brahmaṇā veṣi me havam
Griffith: Heroes on heroes send abundantly to us, when thou omnipotent through prayer seekest my call.
Devanāgarī: वीरेषु वीराँ उप पृङ्धि नस्त्वं यदीशानो ब्रह्मणा वेषि मे हवम्
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇaḥ | pate | su-yamasya | viśvahā | rāyaḥ | syāma | rathyaḥ | vayasvataḥ || vīreṣu | vīrān | upa | pr̥ṅdhi | naḥ | tvam | yat | īśānaḥ | brahmaṇā | veṣi | me | havam ||2.24.15||

IAST: brahmaṇas pate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṁ ca jinva
Griffith: O Brahmanaspati, be thou controller of this our hymn, and prosper thou our children.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मणस्पते त्वमस्य यन्ता सूक्तस्य बोधि तनयं च जिन्व
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇaḥ | pate | tvam | asya | yantā | su-uktasya | bodhi | tanayam | ca | jinva || viśvam | tat | bhadram | yat | avanti | devāḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.24.16||

IAST: viśvaṁ tad bhadraṁ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: विश्वं तद्भद्रं यदवन्ति देवा बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇaḥ | pate | tvam | asya | yantā | su-uktasya | bodhi | tanayam | ca | jinva || viśvam | tat | bhadram | yat | avanti | devāḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.24.16||

IAST: indhāno agniṁ vanavad vanuṣyataḥ kṛtabrahmā śūśuvad rātahavya it
Griffith: HE lighting up the flame shall conquer enemies: strong shall he be who offers prayer and brings his gift.
Devanāgarī: इन्धानो अग्निं वनवद्वनुष्यतः कृतब्रह्मा शूशुवद्रातहव्य इत्
pada pāṭha: indhānaḥ | agnim | vanavat | vanuṣyataḥ | kr̥ta-brahmā | śūśuvat | rāta-havyaḥ | it || jātena | jātam | ati | saḥ | pra | sarsr̥te | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.1||

IAST: jātena jātam ati sa pra sarsṛte yaṁ-yaṁ yujaṁ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: He with his seed spreads forth beyond another's seed, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.
Devanāgarī: जातेन जातमति स प्र सर्सृते यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: indhānaḥ | agnim | vanavat | vanuṣyataḥ | kr̥ta-brahmā | śūśuvat | rāta-havyaḥ | it || jātena | jātam | ati | saḥ | pra | sarsr̥te | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.1||

IAST: vīrebhir vīrān vanavad vanuṣyato gobhī rayim paprathad bodhati tmanā
Griffith: With heroes he shall overcome his hero foes, and spread his wealth by kine wise by himself is be.
Devanāgarī: वीरेभिर्वीरान्वनवद्वनुष्यतो गोभी रयिं पप्रथद्बोधति त्मना
pada pāṭha: vīrebhiḥ | vīrān | vanavat | vanuṣyataḥ | gobhiḥ | rayim | paprathat | bodhati | tmanā || tokam | ca | tasya | tanayam | ca | vardhate | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.2||

IAST: tokaṁ ca tasya tanayaṁ ca vardhate yaṁ-yaṁ yujaṁ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: His children and his children's children grow in strength, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.
Devanāgarī: तोकं च तस्य तनयं च वर्धते यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: vīrebhiḥ | vīrān | vanavat | vanuṣyataḥ | gobhiḥ | rayim | paprathat | bodhati | tmanā || tokam | ca | tasya | tanayam | ca | vardhate | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.2||

IAST: sindhur na kṣodaḥ śimīvām̐ ṛghāyato vṛṣeva vadhrīm̐r abhi vaṣṭy ojasā
Griffith: He, mighty like a raving river's billowy flood, as a bull conquers oxen, overcomes with strength.
Devanāgarī: सिन्धुर्न क्षोदः शिमीवाँ ऋघायतो वृषेव वध्रीँरभि वष्ट्योजसा
pada pāṭha: sindhuḥ | na | kṣodaḥ | śimī-vān | r̥ghāyataḥ | vr̥ṣā-iva | vadhrīn | abhi | vaṣṭi | ojasā || agneḥ-iva | pra-sitiḥ | na | aha | vartave | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.3||

IAST: agner iva prasitir nāha vartave yaṁ-yaṁ yujaṁ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: Like Agni's blazing rush he may not be restrained, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.
Devanāgarī: अग्नेरिव प्रसितिर्नाह वर्तवे यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: sindhuḥ | na | kṣodaḥ | śimī-vān | r̥ghāyataḥ | vr̥ṣā-iva | vadhrīn | abhi | vaṣṭi | ojasā || agneḥ-iva | pra-sitiḥ | na | aha | vartave | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.3||

IAST: tasmā arṣanti divyā asaścataḥ sa satvabhiḥ prathamo goṣu gacchati
Griffith: For him the floods of heaven flow never failing down: first with the heroes he goes forth to war for kine.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा अर्षन्ति दिव्या असश्चतः स सत्वभिः प्रथमो गोषु गच्छति
pada pāṭha: tasmai | arṣanti | divyāḥ | asaścataḥ | saḥ | satva-bhiḥ | prathamaḥ | goṣu | gacchati || anibhr̥ṣṭa-taviṣiḥ | hanti | ojasā | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.4||

IAST: anibhṛṣṭataviṣir hanty ojasā yaṁ-yaṁ yujaṁ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: He slays in unabated vigour with great might, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.
Devanāgarī: अनिभृष्टतविषिर्हन्त्योजसा यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: tasmai | arṣanti | divyāḥ | asaścataḥ | saḥ | satva-bhiḥ | prathamaḥ | goṣu | gacchati || anibhr̥ṣṭa-taviṣiḥ | hanti | ojasā | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.4||

IAST: tasmā id viśve dhunayanta sindhavo 'cchidrā śarma dadhire purūṇi
Griffith: All roaring rivers pour their waters down for him, and many a flawless shelter hath been granted him.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा इद्विश्वे धुनयन्त सिन्धवोऽच्छिद्रा शर्म दधिरे पुरूणि
pada pāṭha: tasmai | it | viśve | dhunayanta | sindhavaḥ | acchidrā | śarma | dadhire | purūṇi || devānām | sumne | su-bhagaḥ | saḥ | edhate | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.5||

IAST: devānāṁ sumne subhagaḥ sa edhate yaṁ-yaṁ yujaṁ kṛṇute brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: Blest with the happiness of Gods he prospers well, whomever Brahmanaspati takes for his friend.
Devanāgarī: देवानां सुम्ने सुभगः स एधते यंयं युजं कृणुते ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: tasmai | it | viśve | dhunayanta | sindhavaḥ | acchidrā | śarma | dadhire | purūṇi || devānām | sumne | su-bhagaḥ | saḥ | edhate | yam-yam | yujam | kr̥ṇute | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ ||2.25.5||

IAST: ṛjur ic chaṁso vanavad vanuṣyato devayann id adevayantam abhy asat
Griffith: THE righteous singer shall o'ercome his enemies, and he who serves the Gods subdue the godless man.
Devanāgarī: ऋजुरिच्छंसो वनवद्वनुष्यतो देवयन्निददेवयन्तमभ्यसत्
pada pāṭha: r̥juḥ | it | śaṁsaḥ | vanavat | vanuṣyataḥ | deva-yan | it | adeva-yantam | abhi | asat || supra-avīḥ | it | vanavat | pr̥t-su | dustaram | yajvā | it | ayajyoḥ | vi | bhajāti | bhojanam ||2.26.1||

IAST: suprāvīr id vanavat pṛtsu duṣṭaraṁ yajved ayajyor vi bhajāti bhojanam
Griffith: The zealous man shall vanquish the invincible, the worshipper share the food of him who worships not.
Devanāgarī: सुप्रावीरिद्वनवत्पृत्सु दुष्टरं यज्वेदयज्योर्वि भजाति भोजनम्
pada pāṭha: r̥juḥ | it | śaṁsaḥ | vanavat | vanuṣyataḥ | deva-yan | it | adeva-yantam | abhi | asat || supra-avīḥ | it | vanavat | pr̥t-su | dustaram | yajvā | it | ayajyoḥ | vi | bhajāti | bhojanam ||2.26.1||

IAST: yajasva vīra pra vihi manāyato bhadram manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye
Griffith: Worship, thou hero, chase the arrogant afar: put on auspicious courage for the fight with foes.
Devanāgarī: यजस्व वीर प्र विहि मनायतो भद्रं मनः कृणुष्व वृत्रतूर्ये
pada pāṭha: yajasva | vīra | pra | vihi | manāyataḥ | bhadram | manaḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | vr̥tra-tūrye || haviḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | su-bhagaḥ | yathā | asasi | brahmaṇaḥ | pateḥ | avaḥ | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe ||2.26.2||

IAST: haviṣ kṛṇuṣva subhago yathāsasi brahmaṇas pater ava ā vṛṇīmahe
Griffith: Prepare oblation so that thou mayst have success. we crave the favouring help of Brahmanaspati.
Devanāgarī: हविष्कृणुष्व सुभगो यथाससि ब्रह्मणस्पतेरव आ वृणीमहे
pada pāṭha: yajasva | vīra | pra | vihi | manāyataḥ | bhadram | manaḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | vr̥tra-tūrye || haviḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | su-bhagaḥ | yathā | asasi | brahmaṇaḥ | pateḥ | avaḥ | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe ||2.26.2||

IAST: sa ij janena sa viśā sa janmanā sa putrair vājam bharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ
Griffith: He with his folk, his house, his family, his sons, gains booty for himself, and, with the heroes, wealth,believing
Devanāgarī: स इज्जनेन स विशा स जन्मना स पुत्रैर्वाजं भरते धना नृभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | janena | saḥ | viśā | saḥ | janmanā | saḥ | putraiḥ | vājam | bharate | dhanā | nr̥-bhiḥ || devānām | yaḥ | pitaram | ā-vivāsati | śraddhā-manāḥ | haviṣā | brahmaṇaḥ | patim ||2.26.3||

IAST: devānāṁ yaḥ pitaram āvivāsati śraddhāmanā haviṣā brahmaṇas patim
Griffith: Who with oblation and a true heart serves Brahmanaspati the Father of the Gods.
Devanāgarī: देवानां यः पितरमाविवासति श्रद्धामना हविषा ब्रह्मणस्पतिम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | janena | saḥ | viśā | saḥ | janmanā | saḥ | putraiḥ | vājam | bharate | dhanā | nr̥-bhiḥ || devānām | yaḥ | pitaram | ā-vivāsati | śraddhā-manāḥ | haviṣā | brahmaṇaḥ | patim ||2.26.3||

IAST: yo asmai havyair ghṛtavadbhir avidhat pra tam prācā nayati brahmaṇas patiḥ
Griffith: Whoso hath honoured him with offerings rich in oil, him Brahmanaspati leads forward on his way,
Devanāgarī: यो अस्मै हव्यैर्घृतवद्भिरविधत्प्र तं प्राचा नयति ब्रह्मणस्पतिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asmai | havyaiḥ | ghr̥tavat-bhiḥ | avidhat | pra | tam | prācā | nayati | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ || uruṣyati | īm | aṁhasaḥ | rakṣati | riṣaḥ | aṁhoḥ | cit | asmai | uru-cakriḥ | adbhutaḥ ||2.26.4||

IAST: uruṣyatīm aṁhaso rakṣatī riṣo 'ṁhoś cid asmā urucakrir adbhutaḥ
Griffith: Saves him from sorrow, frees him from his enemy, and is his wonderful deliverer from woe.
Devanāgarī: उरुष्यतीमंहसो रक्षती रिषोंऽहोश्चिदस्मा उरुचक्रिरद्भुतः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asmai | havyaiḥ | ghr̥tavat-bhiḥ | avidhat | pra | tam | prācā | nayati | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ || uruṣyati | īm | aṁhasaḥ | rakṣati | riṣaḥ | aṁhoḥ | cit | asmai | uru-cakriḥ | adbhutaḥ ||2.26.4||

IAST: imā gira ādityebhyo ghṛtasnūḥ sanād rājabhyo juhvā juhomi
Griffith: THESE hymns that drop down fatness, with the ladle I ever offer tothe Kings Adityas.
Devanāgarī: इमा गिर आदित्येभ्यो घृतस्नूः सनाद्राजभ्यो जुह्वा जुहोमि
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | giraḥ | ādityebhyaḥ | ghr̥ta-snūḥ | sanāt | rāja-bhyaḥ | juhvā | juhomi || śr̥ṇotu | mitraḥ | aryamā | bhagaḥ | naḥ | tuvi-jātaḥ | varuṇaḥ | dakṣaḥ | aṁśaḥ ||2.27.1||

IAST: śṛṇotu mitro aryamā bhago nas tuvijāto varuṇo dakṣo aṁśaḥ
Griffith: May Mitra, Aryanian, and Bhaga hear us, the mighty Varuna Daksa, and Amsa.
Devanāgarī: शृणोतु मित्रो अर्यमा भगो नस्तुविजातो वरुणो दक्षो अंशः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | giraḥ | ādityebhyaḥ | ghr̥ta-snūḥ | sanāt | rāja-bhyaḥ | juhvā | juhomi || śr̥ṇotu | mitraḥ | aryamā | bhagaḥ | naḥ | tuvi-jātaḥ | varuṇaḥ | dakṣaḥ | aṁśaḥ ||2.27.1||

IAST: imaṁ stomaṁ sakratavo me adya mitro aryamā varuṇo juṣanta
Griffith: With one accord may Aryaman and Mitra and Varuna this day accept this praise-song-
Devanāgarī: इमं स्तोमं सक्रतवो मे अद्य मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: imam | stomam | sa-kratavaḥ | me | adya | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | juṣanta || ādityāsaḥ | śucayaḥ | dhāra-pūtāḥ | avr̥jināḥ | anavadyāḥ | ariṣṭāḥ ||2.27.2||

IAST: ādityāsaḥ śucayo dhārapūtā avṛjinā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ
Griffith: Adityas bright and pure as streams of water, free from all guile and falsehood, blameless, perfect.
Devanāgarī: आदित्यासः शुचयो धारपूता अवृजिना अनवद्या अरिष्टाः
pada pāṭha: imam | stomam | sa-kratavaḥ | me | adya | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | juṣanta || ādityāsaḥ | śucayaḥ | dhāra-pūtāḥ | avr̥jināḥ | anavadyāḥ | ariṣṭāḥ ||2.27.2||

IAST: ta ādityāsa uravo gabhīrā adabdhāso dipsanto bhūryakṣāḥ
Griffith: These Gods, Adityas, vast, profound, and faithful, with many eyes, fain to deceive the wicked,
Devanāgarī: त आदित्यास उरवो गभीरा अदब्धासो दिप्सन्तो भूर्यक्षाः
pada pāṭha: te | ādityāsaḥ | uravaḥ | gabhīrāḥ | adabdhāsaḥ | dipsantaḥ | bhūri-akṣāḥ || antariti | paśyanti | vr̥jinā | uta | sādhu | sarvam | rāja-bhyaḥ | paramā | cit | anti ||2.27.3||

IAST: antaḥ paśyanti vṛjinota sādhu sarvaṁ rājabhyaḥ paramā cid anti
Griffith: Looking within behold the good and evil near to the Kings is even the thing most distant.
Devanāgarī: अन्तः पश्यन्ति वृजिनोत साधु सर्वं राजभ्यः परमा चिदन्ति
pada pāṭha: te | ādityāsaḥ | uravaḥ | gabhīrāḥ | adabdhāsaḥ | dipsantaḥ | bhūri-akṣāḥ || antariti | paśyanti | vr̥jinā | uta | sādhu | sarvam | rāja-bhyaḥ | paramā | cit | anti ||2.27.3||

IAST: dhārayanta ādityāso jagat sthā devā viśvasya bhuvanasya gopāḥ
Griffith: Upholding that which moves and that which moves not, Adityas, Gods, protectors of all being,
Devanāgarī: धारयन्त आदित्यासो जगत्स्था देवा विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपाः
pada pāṭha: dhārayantaḥ | ādityāsaḥ | jagat | sthāḥ | devāḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | gopāḥ || dīrgha-dhiyaḥ | rakṣamāṇāḥ | asuryam | r̥ta-vānaḥ | cayamānāḥ | r̥ṇāni ||2.27.4||

IAST: dīrghādhiyo rakṣamāṇā asuryam ṛtāvānaś cayamānā ṛṇāni
Griffith: Provident, guarding well the world of spirits, true to eternal Law, the debt-exactors.
Devanāgarī: दीर्घाधियो रक्षमाणा असुर्यमृतावानश्चयमाना ऋणानि
pada pāṭha: dhārayantaḥ | ādityāsaḥ | jagat | sthāḥ | devāḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | gopāḥ || dīrgha-dhiyaḥ | rakṣamāṇāḥ | asuryam | r̥ta-vānaḥ | cayamānāḥ | r̥ṇāni ||2.27.4||

IAST: vidyām ādityā avaso vo asya yad aryaman bhaya ā cin mayobhu
Griffith: May I, Adityas, share m this your favour which, Aryaman, brings profit e'en in danger.
Devanāgarī: विद्यामादित्या अवसो वो अस्य यदर्यमन्भय आ चिन्मयोभु
pada pāṭha: vidyām | ādityāḥ | avasaḥ | vaḥ | asya | yat | aryaman | bhaye | ā | cit | mayaḥ-bhu || yuṣmākam | mitrāvaruṇā | pra-nītau | pari | śvabhrā-iva | duḥ-itāni | vr̥jyām ||2.27.5||

IAST: yuṣmākam mitrāvaruṇā praṇītau pari śvabhreva duritāni vṛjyām
Griffith: Under your guidance, Varuna and Mitra, round troubles may I pass, like rugged places.
Devanāgarī: युष्माकं मित्रावरुणा प्रणीतौ परि श्वभ्रेव दुरितानि वृज्याम्
pada pāṭha: vidyām | ādityāḥ | avasaḥ | vaḥ | asya | yat | aryaman | bhaye | ā | cit | mayaḥ-bhu || yuṣmākam | mitrāvaruṇā | pra-nītau | pari | śvabhrā-iva | duḥ-itāni | vr̥jyām ||2.27.5||

IAST: sugo hi vo aryaman mitra panthā anṛkṣaro varuṇa sādhur asti
Griffith: Smooth is your path, O Aryaman and Mitra; excellent is it, Varuna, and thornless.
Devanāgarī: सुगो हि वो अर्यमन्मित्र पन्था अनृक्षरो वरुण साधुरस्ति
pada pāṭha: su-gaḥ | hi | vaḥ | aryaman | mitra | panthāḥ | anr̥kṣaraḥ | varuṇa | sādhuḥ | asti || tena | ādityāḥ | adhi | vocata | naḥ | yacchata | naḥ | duḥ-parihantu | śarma ||2.27.6||

IAST: tenādityā adhi vocatā no yacchatā no duṣparihantu śarma
Griffith: Thereon, Adityas, send us down your blessing: grant us a shelter hard to be demolished.
Devanāgarī: तेनादित्या अधि वोचता नो यच्छता नो दुष्परिहन्तु शर्म
pada pāṭha: su-gaḥ | hi | vaḥ | aryaman | mitra | panthāḥ | anr̥kṣaraḥ | varuṇa | sādhuḥ | asti || tena | ādityāḥ | adhi | vocata | naḥ | yacchata | naḥ | duḥ-parihantu | śarma ||2.27.6||

IAST: pipartu no aditī rājaputrāti dveṣāṁsy aryamā sugebhiḥ
Griffith: Mother of Kings, may Aditi transport us, by fair paths Aryaman, beyond all hatred.
Devanāgarī: पिपर्तु नो अदिती राजपुत्राति द्वेषांस्यर्यमा सुगेभिः
pada pāṭha: pipartu | naḥ | aditiḥ | rāja-putrā | ati | dveṣāṁsi | aryamā | su-gebhiḥ || br̥hat | mitrasya | varuṇasya | śarma | upa | syāma | puru-vīrāḥ | ariṣṭāḥ ||2.27.7||

IAST: bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya śarmopa syāma puruvīrā ariṣṭāḥ
Griffith: May we uninjured, girt by many heroes, win Varuna's and Mitra's high protection.
Devanāgarī: बृहन्मित्रस्य वरुणस्य शर्मोप स्याम पुरुवीरा अरिष्टाः
pada pāṭha: pipartu | naḥ | aditiḥ | rāja-putrā | ati | dveṣāṁsi | aryamā | su-gebhiḥ || br̥hat | mitrasya | varuṇasya | śarma | upa | syāma | puru-vīrāḥ | ariṣṭāḥ ||2.27.7||

IAST: tisro bhūmīr dhārayan trīm̐r uta dyūn trīṇi vratā vidathe antar eṣām
Griffith: With their support they stay three earths, three heavens; three are their functions in the Gods' assembly.
Devanāgarī: तिस्रो भूमीर्धारयन्त्रीँरुत द्यून्त्रीणि व्रता विदथे अन्तरेषाम्
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | bhūmīḥ | dhārayan | trīn | uta | dyūn | trīṇi | vratā | vidathe | antaḥ | eṣām || r̥tena | ādityāḥ | mahi | vaḥ | mahi-tvam | tat | aryaman | varuṇa | mitra | cāru ||2.27.8||

IAST: ṛtenādityā mahi vo mahitvaṁ tad aryaman varuṇa mitra cāru
Griffith: Mighty through Law, Adityas, is your greatness; fair is it, Aryaman, Varuna, and Mitra.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेनादित्या महि वो महित्वं तदर्यमन्वरुण मित्र चारु
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | bhūmīḥ | dhārayan | trīn | uta | dyūn | trīṇi | vratā | vidathe | antaḥ | eṣām || r̥tena | ādityāḥ | mahi | vaḥ | mahi-tvam | tat | aryaman | varuṇa | mitra | cāru ||2.27.8||

IAST: trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta hiraṇyayāḥ śucayo dhārapūtāḥ
Griffith: Golden and splendid, pure like streams of water, they hold aloft the three bright heavenly regions.
Devanāgarī: त्री रोचना दिव्या धारयन्त हिरण्ययाः शुचयो धारपूताः
pada pāṭha: trī | rocanā | divyā | dhārayanta | hiraṇyayāḥ | śucayaḥ | dhāra-pūtāḥ || asvapna-jaḥ | ani-miṣāḥ | adabdhāḥ | uru-śaṁsāḥ | r̥jave | martyāya ||2.27.9||

IAST: asvapnajo animiṣā adabdhā uruśaṁsā ṛjave martyāya
Griffith: Ne'er do they slumber, never close their eyelids, faithful, far-ruling for the righteous mortal.
Devanāgarī: अस्वप्नजो अनिमिषा अदब्धा उरुशंसा ऋजवे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: trī | rocanā | divyā | dhārayanta | hiraṇyayāḥ | śucayaḥ | dhāra-pūtāḥ || asvapna-jaḥ | ani-miṣāḥ | adabdhāḥ | uru-śaṁsāḥ | r̥jave | martyāya ||2.27.9||

IAST: tvaṁ viśveṣāṁ varuṇāsi rājā ye ca devā asura ye ca martāḥ
Griffith: Thou over all, O Varuna, art Sovran, be they Gods, Asura! or be they mortals.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विश्वेषां वरुणासि राजा ये च देवा असुर ये च मर्ताः
pada pāṭha: tvam | viśveṣām | varuṇa | asi | rājā | ye | ca | devāḥ | asura | ye | ca | martāḥ || śatam | naḥ | rāsva | śaradaḥ | vi-cakṣe | aśyāma | āyūṁṣi | su-dhitāni | pūrvā ||2.27.10||

IAST: śataṁ no rāsva śarado vicakṣe 'śyāmāyūṁṣi sudhitāni pūrvā
Griffith: Grant unto us to see a hundred autumns ours be the blest long lives of our forefathers.
Devanāgarī: शतं नो रास्व शरदो विचक्षेऽश्यामायूंषि सुधितानि पूर्वा
pada pāṭha: tvam | viśveṣām | varuṇa | asi | rājā | ye | ca | devāḥ | asura | ye | ca | martāḥ || śatam | naḥ | rāsva | śaradaḥ | vi-cakṣe | aśyāma | āyūṁṣi | su-dhitāni | pūrvā ||2.27.10||

IAST: na dakṣiṇā vi cikite na savyā na prācīnam ādityā nota paścā
Griffith: Neither the right nor left do I distinguish, neither the cast nor yet the west, Adityas.
Devanāgarī: न दक्षिणा वि चिकिते न सव्या न प्राचीनमादित्या नोत पश्चा
pada pāṭha: na | dakṣiṇā | vi | cikite | na | savyā | na | prācīnam | ādityāḥ | na | uta | paścā || pākyā | cit | vasavaḥ | dhīryā | cit | yuṣmā-nītaḥ | abhayam | jyotiḥ | aśyām ||2.27.11||

IAST: pākyā cid vasavo dhīryā cid yuṣmānīto abhayaṁ jyotir aśyām
Griffith: Simple and guided by your wisdom, Vasus! May I attain the light that brings no danger.
Devanāgarī: पाक्या चिद्वसवो धीर्या चिद्युष्मानीतो अभयं ज्योतिरश्याम्
pada pāṭha: na | dakṣiṇā | vi | cikite | na | savyā | na | prācīnam | ādityāḥ | na | uta | paścā || pākyā | cit | vasavaḥ | dhīryā | cit | yuṣmā-nītaḥ | abhayam | jyotiḥ | aśyām ||2.27.11||

IAST: yo rājabhya ṛtanibhyo dadāśa yaṁ vardhayanti puṣṭayaś ca nityāḥ
Griffith: He who bears gifts unto the Kings, true Leaders, he whom their everlasting blessings prosper,
Devanāgarī: यो राजभ्य ऋतनिभ्यो ददाश यं वर्धयन्ति पुष्टयश्च नित्याः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rāja-bhyaḥ | r̥tani-bhyaḥ | dadāśa | yam | vardhayanti | puṣṭayaḥ | ca | nityāḥ || saḥ | revān | yāti | prathamaḥ | rathena | vasu-dāvā | vidatheṣu | pra-śastaḥ ||2.27.12||

IAST: sa revān yāti prathamo rathena vasudāvā vidatheṣu praśastaḥ
Griffith: Moves with his chariot first in rank and wealthy, munificent and lauded in assemblies.
Devanāgarī: स रेवान्याति प्रथमो रथेन वसुदावा विदथेषु प्रशस्तः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rāja-bhyaḥ | r̥tani-bhyaḥ | dadāśa | yam | vardhayanti | puṣṭayaḥ | ca | nityāḥ || saḥ | revān | yāti | prathamaḥ | rathena | vasu-dāvā | vidatheṣu | pra-śastaḥ ||2.27.12||

IAST: śucir apaḥ sūyavasā adabdha upa kṣeti vṛddhavayāḥ suvīraḥ
Griffith: Pure, faithful, very strong, with heroes round him, he dwells beside the waters rich with pasture.
Devanāgarī: शुचिरपः सूयवसा अदब्ध उप क्षेति वृद्धवयाः सुवीरः
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | apaḥ | su-yavasāḥ | adabdhaḥ | upa | kṣeti | vr̥ddha-vayāḥ | su-vīraḥ || nakiḥ | tam | ghnanti | antitaḥ | na | dūrāt | yaḥ | ādityānām | bhavati | pra-nītau ||2.27.13||

IAST: nakiṣ ṭaṁ ghnanty antito na dūrād ya ādityānām bhavati praṇītau
Griffith: None slays, from near at hand or from a distance, him who is under the Adityas' guidance.
Devanāgarī: नकिष्टं घ्नन्त्यन्तितो न दूराद्य आदित्यानां भवति प्रणीतौ
pada pāṭha: śuciḥ | apaḥ | su-yavasāḥ | adabdhaḥ | upa | kṣeti | vr̥ddha-vayāḥ | su-vīraḥ || nakiḥ | tam | ghnanti | antitaḥ | na | dūrāt | yaḥ | ādityānām | bhavati | pra-nītau ||2.27.13||

IAST: adite mitra varuṇota mṛḻa yad vo vayaṁ cakṛmā kac cid āgaḥ
Griffith: Aditi, Mitra, Varuna, forgive us however we have erred and sinned against you.
Devanāgarī: अदिते मित्र वरुणोत मृळ यद्वो वयं चकृमा कच्चिदागः
pada pāṭha: adite | mitra | varuṇa | uta | mr̥ḷa | yat | vaḥ | vayam | cakr̥ma | kat | cit | āgaḥ || uru | aśyām | abhayam | jyotiḥ | indra | mā | naḥ | dīrghāḥ | abhi | naśan | tamisrāḥ ||2.27.14||

IAST: urv aśyām abhayaṁ jyotir indra mā no dīrghā abhi naśan tamisrāḥ
Griffith: May I obtain the broad light free from peril: O Indra, let not during darkness seize us.
Devanāgarī: उर्वश्यामभयं ज्योतिरिन्द्र मा नो दीर्घा अभि नशन्तमिस्राः
pada pāṭha: adite | mitra | varuṇa | uta | mr̥ḷa | yat | vaḥ | vayam | cakr̥ma | kat | cit | āgaḥ || uru | aśyām | abhayam | jyotiḥ | indra | mā | naḥ | dīrghāḥ | abhi | naśan | tamisrāḥ ||2.27.14||

IAST: ubhe asmai pīpayataḥ samīcī divo vṛṣṭiṁ subhago nāma puṣyan
Griffith: For him the Twain united pour their fulness, the rain from heaven: he thrives most highly favoured.
Devanāgarī: उभे अस्मै पीपयतः समीची दिवो वृष्टिं सुभगो नाम पुष्यन्
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | asmai | pīpayataḥ | samīcī iti sam-īcī | divaḥ | vr̥ṣṭim | su-bhagaḥ | nāma | puṣyan || ubhā | kṣayau | ā-jayan | yāti | pr̥t-su | ubhau | ardhau | bhavataḥ | sādhū iti | asmai ||2.27.15||

IAST: ubhā kṣayāv ājayan yāti pṛtsūbhāv ardhau bhavataḥ sādhū asmai
Griffith: He goes to war mastering both the mansions: to him both portions of the world are gracious.
Devanāgarī: उभा क्षयावाजयन्याति पृत्सूभावर्धौ भवतः साधू अस्मै
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | asmai | pīpayataḥ | samīcī iti sam-īcī | divaḥ | vr̥ṣṭim | su-bhagaḥ | nāma | puṣyan || ubhā | kṣayau | ā-jayan | yāti | pr̥t-su | ubhau | ardhau | bhavataḥ | sādhū iti | asmai ||2.27.15||

IAST: yā vo māyā abhidruhe yajatrāḥ pāśā ādityā ripave vicṛttāḥ
Griffith: Your guiles, ye Holy Ones, to quell oppressors, your snares spread out against the foe, Adityas,
Devanāgarī: या वो माया अभिद्रुहे यजत्राः पाशा आदित्या रिपवे विचृत्ताः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vaḥ | māyāḥ | abhi-druhe | yajatrāḥ | pāśāḥ | ādityāḥ | ripave | vi-cr̥ttāḥ || aśvī-iva | tān | ati | yeṣam | rathena | ariṣṭāḥ | urau | ā | śarman | syāma ||2.27.16||

IAST: aśvīva tām̐ ati yeṣaṁ rathenāriṣṭā urāv ā śarman syāma
Griffith: May I car-borne pass like a skilful horseman: uninjured may we dwell in spacious shelter.
Devanāgarī: अश्वीव ताँ अति येषं रथेनारिष्टा उरावा शर्मन्स्याम
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vaḥ | māyāḥ | abhi-druhe | yajatrāḥ | pāśāḥ | ādityāḥ | ripave | vi-cr̥ttāḥ || aśvī-iva | tān | ati | yeṣam | rathena | ariṣṭāḥ | urau | ā | śarman | syāma ||2.27.16||

IAST: māham maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṁ śūnam āpeḥ
Griffith: May not live, O Varuna, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution.
Devanāgarī: माहं मघोनो वरुण प्रियस्य भूरिदाव्न आ विदं शूनमापेः
pada pāṭha: mā | aham | maghonaḥ | varuṇa | priyasya | bhūri-dāvnaḥ | ā | vidam | śūnam | āpeḥ || mā | rāyaḥ | rājan | su-yamāt | ava | sthām | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.27.17||

IAST: mā rāyo rājan suyamād ava sthām bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: King, may never lack well-ordered riches. Lond may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: मा रायो राजन्सुयमादव स्थां बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: mā | aham | maghonaḥ | varuṇa | priyasya | bhūri-dāvnaḥ | ā | vidam | śūnam | āpeḥ || mā | rāyaḥ | rājan | su-yamāt | ava | sthām | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.27.17||

IAST: idaṁ kaver ādityasya svarājo viśvāni sānty abhy astu mahnā
Griffith: THIS laud of the self-radiant wise Aditya shall be supreme o'er all that is in greatness.
Devanāgarī: इदं कवेरादित्यस्य स्वराजो विश्वानि सान्त्यभ्यस्तु मह्ना
pada pāṭha: idam | kaveḥ | ādityasya | sva-rājaḥ | viśvāni | santi | abhi | astu | mahnā || ati | yaḥ | mandraḥ | yajathāya | devaḥ | su-kīrtim | bhikṣe | varuṇasya | bhūreḥ ||2.28.1||

IAST: ati yo mandro yajathāya devaḥ sukīrtim bhikṣe varuṇasya bhūreḥ
Griffith: beg renown of Varuna the Mighty, the God exceeding kind to him who worships.
Devanāgarī: अति यो मन्द्रो यजथाय देवः सुकीर्तिं भिक्षे वरुणस्य भूरेः
pada pāṭha: idam | kaveḥ | ādityasya | sva-rājaḥ | viśvāni | santi | abhi | astu | mahnā || ati | yaḥ | mandraḥ | yajathāya | devaḥ | su-kīrtim | bhikṣe | varuṇasya | bhūreḥ ||2.28.1||

IAST: tava vrate subhagāsaḥ syāma svādhyo varuṇa tuṣṭuvāṁsaḥ
Griffith: Having extolled thee. Varuna, with thoughtful care may we have high fortune in thy service,
Devanāgarī: तव व्रते सुभगासः स्याम स्वाध्यो वरुण तुष्टुवांसः
pada pāṭha: tava | vrate | su-bhagāsaḥ | syāma | su-ādhyaḥ | varuṇa | tustu-vāṁsaḥ || upa-ayane | uṣasām | go-matīnām | agnayaḥ | na | jaramāṇāḥ | anu | dyūn ||2.28.2||

IAST: upāyana uṣasāṁ gomatīnām agnayo na jaramāṇā anu dyūn
Griffith: Sinffing thy praises like the fires at coming, day after day, of mornings rich in cattle.
Devanāgarī: उपायन उषसां गोमतीनामग्नयो न जरमाणा अनु द्यून्
pada pāṭha: tava | vrate | su-bhagāsaḥ | syāma | su-ādhyaḥ | varuṇa | tustu-vāṁsaḥ || upa-ayane | uṣasām | go-matīnām | agnayaḥ | na | jaramāṇāḥ | anu | dyūn ||2.28.2||

IAST: tava syāma puruvīrasya śarmann uruśaṁsasya varuṇa praṇetaḥ
Griffith: May we be in thy keeping, O thou Leader wide-ruling Varuna, Lord of many heroes.
Devanāgarī: तव स्याम पुरुवीरस्य शर्मन्नुरुशंसस्य वरुण प्रणेतः
pada pāṭha: tava | syāma | puru-vīrasya | śarman | uru-śaṁsasya | varuṇa | pranetariti pra-netaḥ || yūyam | naḥ | putrāḥ | aditeḥ | adabdhāḥ | abhi | kṣamadhvam | yujyāya | devāḥ ||2.28.3||

IAST: yūyaṁ naḥ putrā aditer adabdhā abhi kṣamadhvaṁ yujyāya devāḥ
Griffith: O sons of Aditi, for ever faithful, pardon us, Gods, admit us to your friendship.
Devanāgarī: यूयं नः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धा अभि क्षमध्वं युज्याय देवाः
pada pāṭha: tava | syāma | puru-vīrasya | śarman | uru-śaṁsasya | varuṇa | pranetariti pra-netaḥ || yūyam | naḥ | putrāḥ | aditeḥ | adabdhāḥ | abhi | kṣamadhvam | yujyāya | devāḥ ||2.28.3||

IAST: pra sīm ādityo asṛjad vidhartām̐ ṛtaṁ sindhavo varuṇasya yanti
Griffith: He made them flow, the Aditya, the Sustainer: the rivers run by Varuna's commandment.
Devanāgarī: प्र सीमादित्यो असृजद्विधर्ताँ ऋतं सिन्धवो वरुणस्य यन्ति
pada pāṭha: pra | sīm | ādityaḥ | asr̥jat | vi-dhartā | r̥tam | sindhavaḥ | varuṇasya | yanti || na | śrāmyanti | na | vi | mucanti | ete | vayaḥ | na | paptuḥ | raghu-yā | pari-jman ||2.28.4||

IAST: na śrāmyanti na vi mucanty ete vayo na paptū raghuyā parijman
Griffith: These feel no weariness, nor cease from flowing: swift have they flown like birds in air around us.
Devanāgarī: न श्राम्यन्ति न वि मुचन्त्येते वयो न पप्तू रघुया परिज्मन्
pada pāṭha: pra | sīm | ādityaḥ | asr̥jat | vi-dhartā | r̥tam | sindhavaḥ | varuṇasya | yanti || na | śrāmyanti | na | vi | mucanti | ete | vayaḥ | na | paptuḥ | raghu-yā | pari-jman ||2.28.4||

IAST: vi mac chrathāya raśanām ivāga ṛdhyāma te varuṇa khām ṛtasya
Griffith: Loose me from sin as from a bond that binds me: may we swell, Varuna, thy spring of Order.
Devanāgarī: वि मच्छ्रथाय रशनामिवाग ऋध्याम ते वरुण खामृतस्य
pada pāṭha: vi | mat | śrathaya | raśanām-iva | āgaḥ | r̥dhyāma | te | varuṇa | khām | r̥tasya || mā | tantuḥ | chedi | vayataḥ | dhiyam | me | mā | mātrā | śāri | apasaḥ | purā | r̥toḥ ||2.28.5||

IAST: mā tantuś chedi vayato dhiyam me mā mātrā śāry apasaḥ pura ṛtoḥ
Griffith: Let not my thread, while I weave song, be severed, nor my work's sum, before the time, be shattered.
Devanāgarī: मा तन्तुश्छेदि वयतो धियं मे मा मात्रा शार्यपसः पुर ऋतोः
pada pāṭha: vi | mat | śrathaya | raśanām-iva | āgaḥ | r̥dhyāma | te | varuṇa | khām | r̥tasya || mā | tantuḥ | chedi | vayataḥ | dhiyam | me | mā | mātrā | śāri | apasaḥ | purā | r̥toḥ ||2.28.5||

IAST: apo su myakṣa varuṇa bhiyasam mat samrāḻ ṛtāvo 'nu mā gṛbhāya
Griffith: Far from me, Varuna, remove all danger accept me graciously, thou Holy Sovran.
Devanāgarī: अपो सु म्यक्ष वरुण भियसं मत्सम्राळृतावोऽनु मा गृभाय
pada pāṭha: apo iti | su | myakṣa | varuṇa | bhiyasam | mat | sam-rāṭ | r̥ta-vaḥ | anu | mā | gr̥bhāya || dāma-iva | vatsāt | vi | mumugdhi | aṁhaḥ | nahi | tvat | āre | ni-miṣaḥ | cana | īśe ||2.28.6||

IAST: dāmeva vatsād vi mumugdhy aṁho nahi tvad āre nimiṣaś caneśe
Griffith: Cast off, like cords that hold a calf, my troubles: I am not even mine eyelid's lord without thee.
Devanāgarī: दामेव वत्साद्वि मुमुग्ध्यंहो नहि त्वदारे निमिषश्चनेशे
pada pāṭha: apo iti | su | myakṣa | varuṇa | bhiyasam | mat | sam-rāṭ | r̥ta-vaḥ | anu | mā | gr̥bhāya || dāma-iva | vatsāt | vi | mumugdhi | aṁhaḥ | nahi | tvat | āre | ni-miṣaḥ | cana | īśe ||2.28.6||

IAST: mā no vadhair varuṇa ye ta iṣṭāv enaḥ kṛṇvantam asura bhrīṇanti
Griffith: Strike us not, Varuna, with those dread weapons which, Asura, at thy bidding wound the sinner.
Devanāgarī: मा नो वधैर्वरुण ये त इष्टावेनः कृण्वन्तमसुर भ्रीणन्ति
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | vadhaiḥ | varuṇa | ye | te | iṣṭau | enaḥ | kr̥ṇvantam | asura | bhrīṇanti || mā | jyotiṣaḥ | pra-vasathāni | ganma | vi | su | mr̥dhaḥ | śiśrathaḥ | jīvase | naḥ ||2.28.7||

IAST: mā jyotiṣaḥ pravasathāni ganma vi ṣū mṛdhaḥ śiśratho jīvase naḥ
Griffith: Let us not pass away from light to exile. Scatter, that we may live, the men who hate us
Devanāgarī: मा ज्योतिषः प्रवसथानि गन्म वि षू मृधः शिश्रथो जीवसे नः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | vadhaiḥ | varuṇa | ye | te | iṣṭau | enaḥ | kr̥ṇvantam | asura | bhrīṇanti || mā | jyotiṣaḥ | pra-vasathāni | ganma | vi | su | mr̥dhaḥ | śiśrathaḥ | jīvase | naḥ ||2.28.7||

IAST: namaḥ purā te varuṇota nūnam utāparaṁ tuvijāta bravāma
Griffith: O mighty Varuna, now and hereafter, even as of old, will we speak forth our worship.
Devanāgarī: नमः पुरा ते वरुणोत नूनमुतापरं तुविजात ब्रवाम
pada pāṭha: namaḥ | purā | te | varuṇa | uta | nūnam | uta | aparam | tuvi-jāta | bravāma || tve iti | hi | kam | parvate | na | śritāni | apra-cyutāni | duḥ-dabha | vratāni ||2.28.8||

IAST: tve hi kam parvate na śritāny apracyutāni dūḻabha vratāni
Griffith: For in thyself, invincible God, thy statutes ne er to be moved are fixed as on a mountain.
Devanāgarī: त्वे हि कं पर्वते न श्रितान्यप्रच्युतानि दूळभ व्रतानि
pada pāṭha: namaḥ | purā | te | varuṇa | uta | nūnam | uta | aparam | tuvi-jāta | bravāma || tve iti | hi | kam | parvate | na | śritāni | apra-cyutāni | duḥ-dabha | vratāni ||2.28.8||

IAST: para ṛṇā sāvīr adha matkṛtāni māhaṁ rājann anyakṛtena bhojam
Griffith: Move far from me what sins I have committed: let me not suffer, King, for guilt of others.
Devanāgarī: पर ऋणा सावीरध मत्कृतानि माहं राजन्नन्यकृतेन भोजम्
pada pāṭha: parā | r̥ṇā | sāvīḥ | adha | mat-kr̥tāni | mā | aham | rājan | anya-kr̥tena | bhojam || avi-uṣṭāḥ | it | nu | bhūyasīḥ | uṣasaḥ | ā | naḥ | jīvān | varuṇa | tāsu | śādhi ||2.28.9||

IAST: avyuṣṭā in nu bhūyasīr uṣāsa ā no jīvān varuṇa tāsu śādhi
Griffith: Full many a morn remains to dawn upon us: in these, O Varuna, while we live direct us.
Devanāgarī: अव्युष्टा इन्नु भूयसीरुषास आ नो जीवान्वरुण तासु शाधि
