pada pāṭha: parā | r̥ṇā | sāvīḥ | adha | mat-kr̥tāni | mā | aham | rājan | anya-kr̥tena | bhojam || avi-uṣṭāḥ | it | nu | bhūyasīḥ | uṣasaḥ | ā | naḥ | jīvān | varuṇa | tāsu | śādhi ||2.28.9||

IAST: yo me rājan yujyo vā sakhā vā svapne bhayam bhīrave mahyam āha
Griffith: O King, whoever, be he friend or kinsman, hath threatened me affrighted in my slumber-
Devanāgarī: यो मे राजन्युज्यो वा सखा वा स्वप्ने भयं भीरवे मह्यमाह
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | rājan | yujyaḥ | vā | sakhā | vā | svapne | bhayam | bhīrave | mahyam | āha || stenaḥ | vā | yaḥ | dipsati | naḥ | vr̥kaḥ | vā | tvam | tasmāt | varuṇa | pāhi | asmān ||2.28.10||

IAST: steno vā yo dipsati no vṛko vā tvaṁ tasmād varuṇa pāhy asmān
Griffith: If any wolf or robber fain would harm us, therefrom, O Varuna, give thou us protection.
Devanāgarī: स्तेनो वा यो दिप्सति नो वृको वा त्वं तस्माद्वरुण पाह्यस्मान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | me | rājan | yujyaḥ | vā | sakhā | vā | svapne | bhayam | bhīrave | mahyam | āha || stenaḥ | vā | yaḥ | dipsati | naḥ | vr̥kaḥ | vā | tvam | tasmāt | varuṇa | pāhi | asmān ||2.28.10||

IAST: māham maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṁ śūnam āpeḥ
Griffith: May I not live O Varuna, to witness my wealthy, liberal dear friend's destitution.
Devanāgarī: माहं मघोनो वरुण प्रियस्य भूरिदाव्न आ विदं शूनमापेः
pada pāṭha: mā | aham | maghonaḥ | varuṇa | priyasya | bhūri-dāvnaḥ | ā | vidam | śūnam | āpeḥ || mā | rāyaḥ | rājan | su-yamāt | ava | sthām | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.28.11||

IAST: mā rāyo rājan suyamād ava sthām bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: मा रायो राजन्सुयमादव स्थां बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: mā | aham | maghonaḥ | varuṇa | priyasya | bhūri-dāvnaḥ | ā | vidam | śūnam | āpeḥ || mā | rāyaḥ | rājan | su-yamāt | ava | sthām | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.28.11||

IAST: dhṛtavratā ādityā iṣirā āre mat karta rahasūr ivāgaḥ
Griffith: I. UPHOLDERS of the Law, ye strong Adityas, remove my sin like her who bears in secret.
Devanāgarī: धृतव्रता आदित्या इषिरा आरे मत्कर्त रहसूरिवागः
pada pāṭha: dhr̥ta-vratāḥ | ādityāḥ | iṣirāḥ | āre | mat | karta | rahasūḥ-iva | āgaḥ || śr̥ṇvataḥ | vaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | devāḥ | bhadrasya | vidvān | avase | huve | vaḥ ||2.29.1||

IAST: śṛṇvato vo varuṇa mitra devā bhadrasya vidvām̐ avase huve vaḥ
Griffith: You, Varuna, Mitra and all Gods who listen, I call to help me, I who know your goodness.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वतो वो वरुण मित्र देवा भद्रस्य विद्वाँ अवसे हुवे वः
pada pāṭha: dhr̥ta-vratāḥ | ādityāḥ | iṣirāḥ | āre | mat | karta | rahasūḥ-iva | āgaḥ || śr̥ṇvataḥ | vaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | devāḥ | bhadrasya | vidvān | avase | huve | vaḥ ||2.29.1||

IAST: yūyaṁ devāḥ pramatir yūyam ojo yūyaṁ dveṣāṁsi sanutar yuyota
Griffith: Ye, Gods, are providence and ye are power: remove ye utterly all those who hate us.
Devanāgarī: यूयं देवाः प्रमतिर्यूयमोजो यूयं द्वेषांसि सनुतर्युयोत
pada pāṭha: yūyam | devāḥ | pra-matiḥ | yūyam | ojaḥ | yūyam | dveṣāṁsi | sanutaḥ | yuyota || abhi-kṣattāraḥ | abhi | ca | kṣamadhvam | adya | ca | naḥ | mr̥ḷayata | aparam | ca ||2.29.2||

IAST: abhikṣattāro abhi ca kṣamadhvam adyā ca no mṛḻayatāparaṁ ca
Griffith: As givers of good things deal with us kindly: this day be gracious to us and hereafter.
Devanāgarī: अभिक्षत्तारो अभि च क्षमध्वमद्या च नो मृळयतापरं च
pada pāṭha: yūyam | devāḥ | pra-matiḥ | yūyam | ojaḥ | yūyam | dveṣāṁsi | sanutaḥ | yuyota || abhi-kṣattāraḥ | abhi | ca | kṣamadhvam | adya | ca | naḥ | mr̥ḷayata | aparam | ca ||2.29.2||

IAST: kim ū nu vaḥ kṛṇavāmāpareṇa kiṁ sanena vasava āpyena
Griffith: What service may we do you with our future, what service, Vasus, with our ancient friendship?
Devanāgarī: किमू नु वः कृणवामापरेण किं सनेन वसव आप्येन
pada pāṭha: kim | ūm̐ iti | nu | vaḥ | kr̥ṇavāma | apareṇa | kim | sanena | vasavaḥ | āpyena || yūyam | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | adite | ca | svastim | indrāmarutaḥ | dadhāta ||2.29.3||

IAST: yūyaṁ no mitrāvaruṇādite ca svastim indrāmaruto dadhāta
Griffith: O Aditi, and VaruVa and Mitra, Indra and Maruts, make us well and happy.
Devanāgarī: यूयं नो मित्रावरुणादिते च स्वस्तिमिन्द्रामरुतो दधात
pada pāṭha: kim | ūm̐ iti | nu | vaḥ | kr̥ṇavāma | apareṇa | kim | sanena | vasavaḥ | āpyena || yūyam | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | adite | ca | svastim | indrāmarutaḥ | dadhāta ||2.29.3||

IAST: haye devā yūyam id āpayaḥ stha te mṛḻata nādhamānāya mahyam
Griffith: Ye, O ye Gods, are verily our kinsmen as such be kind to me who now implore you.
Devanāgarī: हये देवा यूयमिदापयः स्थ ते मृळत नाधमानाय मह्यम्
pada pāṭha: haye | devāḥ | yūyam | it | āpayaḥ | stha | te | mr̥ḷata | nādhamānāya | mahyam || mā | vaḥ | rathaḥ | madhyama-vāṭ | r̥te | bhūt | mā | yuṣmāvat-su | āpiṣu | śramiṣma ||2.29.4||

IAST: mā vo ratho madhyamavāḻ ṛte bhūn mā yuṣmāvatsv āpiṣu śramiṣma
Griffith: Let not your car come slowly to our worship: of kinsmen such as you ne'er let us weary.
Devanāgarī: मा वो रथो मध्यमवाळृते भून्मा युष्मावत्स्वापिषु श्रमिष्म
pada pāṭha: haye | devāḥ | yūyam | it | āpayaḥ | stha | te | mr̥ḷata | nādhamānāya | mahyam || mā | vaḥ | rathaḥ | madhyama-vāṭ | r̥te | bhūt | mā | yuṣmāvat-su | āpiṣu | śramiṣma ||2.29.4||

IAST: pra va eko mimaya bhūry āgo yan mā piteva kitavaṁ śaśāsa
Griffith: I singly have sinned many a sin against you, and ye chastised me as a sire the gambler.
Devanāgarī: प्र व एको मिमय भूर्यागो यन्मा पितेव कितवं शशास
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | ekaḥ | mimaya | bhūri | āgaḥ | yat | mā | pitā-iva | kitavam | śaśāsa || āre | pāśāḥ | āre | aghāni | devāḥ | mā | mā | adhi | putre | vim-iva | grabhīṣṭa ||2.29.5||

IAST: āre pāśā āre aghāni devā mā mādhi putre vim iva grabhīṣṭa
Griffith: Far be your nets, far, Gods, be mine offences: seize me not like a bird upon her offspring.
Devanāgarī: आरे पाशा आरे अघानि देवा मा माधि पुत्रे विमिव ग्रभीष्ट
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | ekaḥ | mimaya | bhūri | āgaḥ | yat | mā | pitā-iva | kitavam | śaśāsa || āre | pāśāḥ | āre | aghāni | devāḥ | mā | mā | adhi | putre | vim-iva | grabhīṣṭa ||2.29.5||

IAST: arvāñco adyā bhavatā yajatrā ā vo hārdi bhayamāno vyayeyam
Griffith: Turn yourselves hitherward this day, ye Holy, that fearing in my heart I may approach you.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाञ्चो अद्या भवता यजत्रा आ वो हार्दि भयमानो व्ययेयम्
pada pāṭha: arvāñcaḥ | adya | bhavata | yajatrāḥ | ā | vaḥ | hārdi | bhayamānaḥ | vyayeyam || trādhvam | naḥ | devāḥ | ni-juraḥ | vr̥kasya | trādhvam | kartāt | ava-padaḥ | yajatrāḥ ||2.29.6||

IAST: trādhvaṁ no devā nijuro vṛkasya trādhvaṁ kartād avapado yajatrāḥ
Griffith: Protect us, God; let not the wolf destroy us. Save us, ye Holy, from the pit and falling.
Devanāgarī: त्राध्वं नो देवा निजुरो वृकस्य त्राध्वं कर्तादवपदो यजत्राः
pada pāṭha: arvāñcaḥ | adya | bhavata | yajatrāḥ | ā | vaḥ | hārdi | bhayamānaḥ | vyayeyam || trādhvam | naḥ | devāḥ | ni-juraḥ | vr̥kasya | trādhvam | kartāt | ava-padaḥ | yajatrāḥ ||2.29.6||

IAST: māham maghono varuṇa priyasya bhūridāvna ā vidaṁ śūnam āpeḥ
Griffith: May I not live, O Varuna, to witness my wealthy, liberal, dear friend's destitution.
Devanāgarī: माहं मघोनो वरुण प्रियस्य भूरिदाव्न आ विदं शूनमापेः
pada pāṭha: mā | aham | maghonaḥ | varuṇa | priyasya | bhūri-dāvnaḥ | ā | vidam | śūnam | āpeḥ || mā | rāyaḥ | rājan | su-yamāt | ava | sthām | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.29.7||

IAST: mā rāyo rājan suyamād ava sthām bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: King, may I never lack well-ordered riches. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: मा रायो राजन्सुयमादव स्थां बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: mā | aham | maghonaḥ | varuṇa | priyasya | bhūri-dāvnaḥ | ā | vidam | śūnam | āpeḥ || mā | rāyaḥ | rājan | su-yamāt | ava | sthām | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.29.7||

IAST: ṛtaṁ devāya kṛṇvate savitra indrāyāhighne na ramanta āpaḥ
Griffith: THE streams unceasing flow to Indra, slayer of Ahi, Savitar, God, Law's fulfiller,
Devanāgarī: ऋतं देवाय कृण्वते सवित्र इन्द्रायाहिघ्ने न रमन्त आपः
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | devāya | kr̥ṇvate | savitre | indrāya | ahi-ghne | na | ramante | āpaḥ || ahaḥ-ahaḥ | yāti | aktuḥ | apām | kiyati | ā | prathamaḥ | sargaḥ | āsām ||2.30.1||

IAST: ahar-ahar yāty aktur apāṁ kiyāty ā prathamaḥ sarga āsām
Griffith: Day after day goes on the sheen of waters. What time hath past since they were first set flowing?
Devanāgarī: अहरहर्यात्यक्तुरपां कियात्या प्रथमः सर्ग आसाम्
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | devāya | kr̥ṇvate | savitre | indrāya | ahi-ghne | na | ramante | āpaḥ || ahaḥ-ahaḥ | yāti | aktuḥ | apām | kiyati | ā | prathamaḥ | sargaḥ | āsām ||2.30.1||

IAST: yo vṛtrāya sinam atrābhariṣyat pra taṁ janitrī viduṣa uvāca
Griffith: His Mother-for she knew-spake and proclaimed him who was about to cast his bolt at Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: यो वृत्राय सिनमत्राभरिष्यत्प्र तं जनित्री विदुष उवाच
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vr̥trāya | sinam | atra | abhariṣyat | pra | tam | janitrī | viduṣe | uvāca || pathaḥ | radantīḥ | anu | joṣam | asmai | dive-dive | dhunayaḥ | yanti | artham ||2.30.2||

IAST: patho radantīr anu joṣam asmai dive-dive dhunayo yanty artham
Griffith: Cutting their paths according to his pleasure day after day flow to their goal the rivers.
Devanāgarī: पथो रदन्तीरनु जोषमस्मै दिवेदिवे धुनयो यन्त्यर्थम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vr̥trāya | sinam | atra | abhariṣyat | pra | tam | janitrī | viduṣe | uvāca || pathaḥ | radantīḥ | anu | joṣam | asmai | dive-dive | dhunayaḥ | yanti | artham ||2.30.2||

IAST: ūrdhvo hy asthād adhy antarikṣe 'dhā vṛtrāya pra vadhaṁ jabhāra
Griffith: Aloft he stood above the airy region, and against Vrtra shot his deadly missile.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वो ह्यस्थादध्यन्तरिक्षेऽधा वृत्राय प्र वधं जभार
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | hi | asthāt | adhi | antarikṣe | adha | vr̥trāya | pra | vadham | jabhāra || miham | vasānaḥ | upa | hi | īm | adudrot | tigma-āyudhaḥ | ajayat | śatrum | indraḥ ||2.30.3||

IAST: mihaṁ vasāna upa hīm adudrot tigmāyudho ajayac chatrum indraḥ
Griffith: Enveloped in a cloud he rushed upon him. Indra subdued the foe with sharpened weapons.
Devanāgarī: मिहं वसान उप हीमदुद्रोत्तिग्मायुधो अजयच्छत्रुमिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | hi | asthāt | adhi | antarikṣe | adha | vr̥trāya | pra | vadham | jabhāra || miham | vasānaḥ | upa | hi | īm | adudrot | tigma-āyudhaḥ | ajayat | śatrum | indraḥ ||2.30.3||

IAST: bṛhaspate tapuṣāśneva vidhya vṛkadvaraso asurasya vīrān
Griffith: As with a bolt, Brhaspati, fiercely flaming, pierce thou Vrkadvaras', the Asura's, heroes.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते तपुषाश्नेव विध्य वृकद्वरसो असुरस्य वीरान्
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | tapuṣā | aśnā-iva | vidhya | vr̥ka-dvarasaḥ | asurasya | vīrān || yathā | jaghantha | dhr̥ṣatā | purā | cit | eva | jahi | śatrum | asmākam | indra ||2.30.4||

IAST: yathā jaghantha dhṛṣatā purā cid evā jahi śatrum asmākam indra
Griffith: Even as in time of old with might thou slewest, so slay even now our enemy, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: यथा जघन्थ धृषता पुरा चिदेवा जहि शत्रुमस्माकमिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | tapuṣā | aśnā-iva | vidhya | vr̥ka-dvarasaḥ | asurasya | vīrān || yathā | jaghantha | dhr̥ṣatā | purā | cit | eva | jahi | śatrum | asmākam | indra ||2.30.4||

IAST: ava kṣipa divo aśmānam uccā yena śatrum mandasāno nijūrvāḥ
Griffith: Cast down from heaven on high thy bolt of thunder wherewith in joy thou smitest dead the foeman.
Devanāgarī: अव क्षिप दिवो अश्मानमुच्चा येन शत्रुं मन्दसानो निजूर्वाः
pada pāṭha: ava | kṣipa | divaḥ | aśmānam | uccā | yena | śatrum | mandasānaḥ | ni-jūrvāḥ || tokasya | sātau | tanayasya | bhūreḥ | asmān | ardham | kr̥ṇutāt | indra | gonām ||2.30.5||

IAST: tokasya sātau tanayasya bhūrer asmām̐ ardhaṁ kṛṇutād indra gonām
Griffith: For gain of children make us thine, O Indra, of many children's children and of cattle.
Devanāgarī: तोकस्य सातौ तनयस्य भूरेरस्माँ अर्धं कृणुतादिन्द्र गोनाम्
pada pāṭha: ava | kṣipa | divaḥ | aśmānam | uccā | yena | śatrum | mandasānaḥ | ni-jūrvāḥ || tokasya | sātau | tanayasya | bhūreḥ | asmān | ardham | kr̥ṇutāt | indra | gonām ||2.30.5||

IAST: pra hi kratuṁ vṛhatho yaṁ vanutho radhrasya stho yajamānasya codau
Griffith: Whomso ye love, his power ye aid and strengthen; ye Twain are the rich worshipper's advancers.
Devanāgarī: प्र हि क्रतुं वृहथो यं वनुथो रध्रस्य स्थो यजमानस्य चोदौ
pada pāṭha: pra | hi | kratum | vr̥hathaḥ | yam | vanuthaḥ | radhrasya | sthaḥ | yajamānasya | codau || indrāsomā | yuvam | asmān | aviṣṭam | asmin | bhaya-sthe | kr̥ṇutam | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||2.30.6||

IAST: indrāsomā yuvam asmām̐ aviṣṭam asmin bhayasthe kṛṇutam u lokam
Griffith: Graciously favour us, Indra and Soma; give us firm standing in this time of danger.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा युवमस्माँ अविष्टमस्मिन्भयस्थे कृणुतमु लोकम्
pada pāṭha: pra | hi | kratum | vr̥hathaḥ | yam | vanuthaḥ | radhrasya | sthaḥ | yajamānasya | codau || indrāsomā | yuvam | asmān | aviṣṭam | asmin | bhaya-sthe | kr̥ṇutam | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||2.30.6||

IAST: na mā taman na śraman nota tandran na vocāma mā sunoteti somam
Griffith: Let it not vex me, tire me, make me slothful, and never let us say, Press not the Soma;
Devanāgarī: न मा तमन्न श्रमन्नोत तन्द्रन्न वोचाम मा सुनोतेति सोमम्
pada pāṭha: na | mā | tamat | na | śramat | na | uta | tandrat | na | vocāma | mā | sunota | iti | somam || yaḥ | me | pr̥ṇāt | yaḥ | dadat | yaḥ | ni-bodhāt | yaḥ | mā | sunvantam | upa | gobhiḥ | ā | ayat ||2.30.7||

IAST: yo me pṛṇād yo dadad yo nibodhād yo mā sunvantam upa gobhir āyat
Griffith: For him who cares for me, gives gifts, supports me, who comes with kine to me who pour libations.
Devanāgarī: यो मे पृणाद्यो ददद्यो निबोधाद्यो मा सुन्वन्तमुप गोभिरायत्
pada pāṭha: na | mā | tamat | na | śramat | na | uta | tandrat | na | vocāma | mā | sunota | iti | somam || yaḥ | me | pr̥ṇāt | yaḥ | dadat | yaḥ | ni-bodhāt | yaḥ | mā | sunvantam | upa | gobhiḥ | ā | ayat ||2.30.7||

IAST: sarasvati tvam asmām̐ aviḍḍhi marutvatī dhṛṣatī jeṣi śatrūn
Griffith: Sarasvati, protect us: with the Maruts allied thou boldly conquerest our foemen,
Devanāgarī: सरस्वति त्वमस्माँ अविड्ढि मरुत्वती धृषती जेषि शत्रून्
pada pāṭha: sarasvati | tvam | asmān | aviḍḍhi | marutvatī | dhr̥ṣatī | jeṣi | śatrūn || tyam | cit | śardhantam | taviṣī-yamāṇam | indraḥ | hanti | vr̥ṣabham | śaṇḍikānām ||2.30.8||

IAST: tyaṁ cic chardhantaṁ taviṣīyamāṇam indro hanti vṛṣabhaṁ śaṇḍikānām
Griffith: While Indra does to death the daring chieftain of Sandikas exulting in his prowess.
Devanāgarī: त्यं चिच्छर्धन्तं तविषीयमाणमिन्द्रो हन्ति वृषभं शण्डिकानाम्
pada pāṭha: sarasvati | tvam | asmān | aviḍḍhi | marutvatī | dhr̥ṣatī | jeṣi | śatrūn || tyam | cit | śardhantam | taviṣī-yamāṇam | indraḥ | hanti | vr̥ṣabham | śaṇḍikānām ||2.30.8||

IAST: yo naḥ sanutya uta vā jighatnur abhikhyāya taṁ tigitena vidhya
Griffith: Him who waylays, yea, him who would destroy us,-aim at him, pierce him with thy sharpened weapon.
Devanāgarī: यो नः सनुत्य उत वा जिघत्नुरभिख्याय तं तिगितेन विध्य
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | sanutyaḥ | uta | vā | jighatnuḥ | abhi-khyāya | tam | tigitena | vidhya || br̥haspate | āyudhaiḥ | jeṣi | śatrūn | druhe | riṣantam | pari | dhehi | rājan ||2.30.9||

IAST: bṛhaspata āyudhair jeṣi śatrūn druhe rīṣantam pari dhehi rājan
Griffith: Brhaspati, with arms thou slayest foemen O King, give up the spoiler to destruction.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पत आयुधैर्जेषि शत्रून्द्रुहे रीषन्तं परि धेहि राजन्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | sanutyaḥ | uta | vā | jighatnuḥ | abhi-khyāya | tam | tigitena | vidhya || br̥haspate | āyudhaiḥ | jeṣi | śatrūn | druhe | riṣantam | pari | dhehi | rājan ||2.30.9||

IAST: asmākebhiḥ satvabhiḥ śūra śūrair vīryā kṛdhi yāni te kartvāni
Griffith: Perform, O Hero, with our valiant heroes the deeds heroic which thou hast to finish.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकेभिः सत्वभिः शूर शूरैर्वीर्या कृधि यानि ते कर्त्वानि
pada pāṭha: asmākebhiḥ | satva-bhiḥ | śūra | śūraiḥ | vīryā | kr̥dhi | yāni | te | kartvāni || jyok | abhūvan | anu-dhūpitāsaḥ | hatvī | teṣām | ā | bhara | naḥ | vasūni ||2.30.10||

IAST: jyog abhūvann anudhūpitāso hatvī teṣām ā bharā no vasūni
Griffith: Long have they been inflated with presumption: slay them, and bring us hither their possessions.
Devanāgarī: ज्योगभूवन्ननुधूपितासो हत्वी तेषामा भरा नो वसूनि
pada pāṭha: asmākebhiḥ | satva-bhiḥ | śūra | śūraiḥ | vīryā | kr̥dhi | yāni | te | kartvāni || jyok | abhūvan | anu-dhūpitāsaḥ | hatvī | teṣām | ā | bhara | naḥ | vasūni ||2.30.10||

IAST: taṁ vaḥ śardham mārutaṁ sumnayur giropa bruve namasā daivyaṁ janam
Griffith: I craving joy address with hymn and homage your heavenly host, the company of Maruts,
Devanāgarī: तं वः शर्धं मारुतं सुम्नयुर्गिरोप ब्रुवे नमसा दैव्यं जनम्
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | śardham | mārutam | sumna-yuḥ | girā | upa | bruve | namasā | daivyam | janam || yathā | rayim | sarva-vīram | naśāmahai | apatya-sācam | śrutyam | dive-dive ||2.30.11||

IAST: yathā rayiṁ sarvavīraṁ naśāmahā apatyasācaṁ śrutyaṁ dive-dive
Griffith: That we may gain wealth with full store of heroes, each day more famous, and with troops of children.
Devanāgarī: यथा रयिं सर्ववीरं नशामहा अपत्यसाचं श्रुत्यं दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | śardham | mārutam | sumna-yuḥ | girā | upa | bruve | namasā | daivyam | janam || yathā | rayim | sarva-vīram | naśāmahai | apatya-sācam | śrutyam | dive-dive ||2.30.11||

IAST: asmākam mitrāvaruṇāvataṁ ratham ādityai rudrair vasubhiḥ sacābhuvā
Griffith: HELP, Varuna and Mitra, O ye Twain allied with Vasus, Rudras, and Adityas, help our car,
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं मित्रावरुणावतं रथमादित्यै रुद्रैर्वसुभिः सचाभुवा
pada pāṭha: asmākam | mitrāvaruṇā | avatam | ratham | ādityaiḥ | rudraiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | sacā-bhuvā || pra | yat | vayaḥ | na | paptan | vasmanaḥ | pari | śravasyavaḥ | hr̥ṣī-vantaḥ | vana-sadaḥ ||2.31.1||

IAST: pra yad vayo na paptan vasmanas pari śravasyavo hṛṣīvanto vanarṣadaḥ
Griffith: That, as the wild birds of the forest from their home, our horses may fly forth, glad, eager for renown.
Devanāgarī: प्र यद्वयो न पप्तन्वस्मनस्परि श्रवस्यवो हृषीवन्तो वनर्षदः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | mitrāvaruṇā | avatam | ratham | ādityaiḥ | rudraiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | sacā-bhuvā || pra | yat | vayaḥ | na | paptan | vasmanaḥ | pari | śravasyavaḥ | hr̥ṣī-vantaḥ | vana-sadaḥ ||2.31.1||

IAST: adha smā na ud avatā sajoṣaso rathaṁ devāso abhi vikṣu vājayum
Griffith: Yea, now ye Gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might;
Devanāgarī: अध स्मा न उदवता सजोषसो रथं देवासो अभि विक्षु वाजयुम्
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | naḥ | ut | avata | sa-joṣasaḥ | ratham | devāsaḥ | abhi | vikṣu | vāja-yum || yat | āśavaḥ | padyābhiḥ | titrataḥ | rajaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | sānau | jaṅghananta | pāṇi-bhiḥ ||2.31.2||

IAST: yad āśavaḥ padyābhis titrato rajaḥ pṛthivyāḥ sānau jaṅghananta pāṇibhiḥ
Griffith: When, hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs, our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth.
Devanāgarī: यदाशवः पद्याभिस्तित्रतो रजः पृथिव्याः सानौ जङ्घनन्त पाणिभिः
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | naḥ | ut | avata | sa-joṣasaḥ | ratham | devāsaḥ | abhi | vikṣu | vāja-yum || yat | āśavaḥ | padyābhiḥ | titrataḥ | rajaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | sānau | jaṅghananta | pāṇi-bhiḥ ||2.31.2||

IAST: uta sya na indro viśvacarṣaṇir divaḥ śardhena mārutena sukratuḥ
Griffith: Or may our Indra here, the Friend of all mankind, coming from heaven, most.wise, girt by the Marut host,
Devanāgarī: उत स्य न इन्द्रो विश्वचर्षणिर्दिवः शर्धेन मारुतेन सुक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | naḥ | indraḥ | viśva-carṣaṇiḥ | divaḥ | śardhena | mārutena | su-kratuḥ || anu | nu | sthāti | avr̥kābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | ratham | mahe | sanaye | vāja-sātaye ||2.31.3||

IAST: anu nu sthāty avṛkābhir ūtibhī ratham mahe sanaye vājasātaye
Griffith: Accompany, with aid untroubled by a foe, our car to mighty gain, to win the meed of strength.
Devanāgarī: अनु नु स्थात्यवृकाभिरूतिभी रथं महे सनये वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | naḥ | indraḥ | viśva-carṣaṇiḥ | divaḥ | śardhena | mārutena | su-kratuḥ || anu | nu | sthāti | avr̥kābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | ratham | mahe | sanaye | vāja-sātaye ||2.31.3||

IAST: uta sya devo bhuvanasya sakṣaṇis tvaṣṭā gnābhiḥ sajoṣā jūjuvad ratham
Griffith: Or may this Tvastar, God who rules the world with power, one-minded with the Goddesses speed forth our car;
Devanāgarī: उत स्य देवो भुवनस्य सक्षणिस्त्वष्टा ग्नाभिः सजोषा जूजुवद्रथम्
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | devaḥ | bhuvanasya | sakṣaṇiḥ | tvaṣṭā | gnābhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | jūjuvat | ratham || iḷā | bhagaḥ | br̥hat-divā | uta | rodasī iti | pūṣā | puram-dhiḥ | aśvinau | adha | patī iti ||2.31.4||

IAST: iḻā bhago bṛhaddivota rodasī pūṣā puraṁdhir aśvināv adhā patī
Griffith: Ila and Bhaga the celestial, Earth and Heaven, Pusan, Purandhi, and the Asvins, ruling Lords.
Devanāgarī: इळा भगो बृहद्दिवोत रोदसी पूषा पुरंधिरश्विनावधा पती
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | devaḥ | bhuvanasya | sakṣaṇiḥ | tvaṣṭā | gnābhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | jūjuvat | ratham || iḷā | bhagaḥ | br̥hat-divā | uta | rodasī iti | pūṣā | puram-dhiḥ | aśvinau | adha | patī iti ||2.31.4||

IAST: uta tye devī subhage mithūdṛśoṣāsānaktā jagatām apījuvā
Griffith: Or, seen alternate, those two blessed Goddesses, Morning and Night who stir all living things to act:
Devanāgarī: उत त्ये देवी सुभगे मिथूदृशोषासानक्ता जगतामपीजुवा
pada pāṭha: uta | tye iti | devī iti | subhage iti su-bhage | mithu-dr̥śā | uṣasānaktā | jagatām | api-juvā || stuṣe | yat | vām | pr̥thivi | navyasā | vacaḥ | sthātuḥ | ca | vayaḥ | tri-vayāḥ | upa-stire ||2.31.5||

IAST: stuṣe yad vām pṛthivi navyasā vacaḥ sthātuś ca vayas trivayā upastire
Griffith: While with my newest song I praise you both, O Earth, that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food.
Devanāgarī: स्तुषे यद्वां पृथिवि नव्यसा वचः स्थातुश्च वयस्त्रिवया उपस्तिरे
pada pāṭha: uta | tye iti | devī iti | subhage iti su-bhage | mithu-dr̥śā | uṣasānaktā | jagatām | api-juvā || stuṣe | yat | vām | pr̥thivi | navyasā | vacaḥ | sthātuḥ | ca | vayaḥ | tri-vayāḥ | upa-stire ||2.31.5||

IAST: uta vaḥ śaṁsam uśijām iva śmasy ahir budhnyo 'ja ekapād uta
Griffith: Your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire: the Dragon of the Deep, and Aja-Ekapad,
Devanāgarī: उत वः शंसमुशिजामिव श्मस्यहिर्बुध्न्योऽज एकपादुत
pada pāṭha: uta | vaḥ | śaṁsam | uśijām-iva | śmasi | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | ajaḥ | eka-pāt | uta || tritaḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | savitā | canaḥ | dadhe | apām | napāt | āśu-hemā | dhiyā | śami ||2.31.6||

IAST: trita ṛbhukṣāḥ savitā cano dadhe 'pāṁ napād āśuhemā dhiyā śami
Griffith: Trita, Rbhuksan, Savitar shall joy in us, and ihe Floods' swift Child in our worship and our prayer.
Devanāgarī: त्रित ऋभुक्षाः सविता चनो दधेऽपां नपादाशुहेमा धिया शमि
pada pāṭha: uta | vaḥ | śaṁsam | uśijām-iva | śmasi | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | ajaḥ | eka-pāt | uta || tritaḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | savitā | canaḥ | dadhe | apām | napāt | āśu-hemā | dhiyā | śami ||2.31.6||

IAST: etā vo vaśmy udyatā yajatrā atakṣann āyavo navyase sam
Griffith: These earnest prayers I pray to you, ye Holy: to pay you honour, living men have formed them,
Devanāgarī: एता वो वश्म्युद्यता यजत्रा अतक्षन्नायवो नव्यसे सम्
pada pāṭha: etā | vaḥ | vaśmi | ut-yatā | yajatrāḥ | atakṣan | āyavaḥ | navyase | sam || śravasyavaḥ | vājam | cakānāḥ | saptiḥ | na | rathyaḥ | aha | dhītim | aśyāḥ ||2.31.7||

IAST: śravasyavo vājaṁ cakānāḥ saptir na rathyo aha dhītim aśyāḥ
Griffith: Men fain to win the prize and glory. May they win, as a car-horse might the goal, your notice.
Devanāgarī: श्रवस्यवो वाजं चकानाः सप्तिर्न रथ्यो अह धीतिमश्याः
pada pāṭha: etā | vaḥ | vaśmi | ut-yatā | yajatrāḥ | atakṣan | āyavaḥ | navyase | sam || śravasyavaḥ | vājam | cakānāḥ | saptiḥ | na | rathyaḥ | aha | dhītim | aśyāḥ ||2.31.7||

IAST: asya me dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāyato bhūtam avitrī vacasaḥ siṣāsataḥ
Griffith: GRACIOUSLY further, O ye Heaven and Earth, this speech striving to win reward, of me your worshipper.
Devanāgarī: अस्य मे द्यावापृथिवी ऋतायतो भूतमवित्री वचसः सिषासतः
pada pāṭha: asya | me | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | r̥ta-yataḥ | bhūtam | avitrī iti | vacasaḥ | sisāsataḥ || yayoḥ | āyuḥ | pra-taram | te iti | idam | puraḥ | upastute ityupa-stute | vasu-yuḥ | vā | mahaḥ | dadhe ||2.32.1||

IAST: yayor āyuḥ prataraṁ te idam pura upastute vasūyur vām maho dadhe
Griffith: First rank I give to you, Immortal, high extolled! I, fain to win me wealth, to you the migbty Pair.
Devanāgarī: ययोरायुः प्रतरं ते इदं पुर उपस्तुते वसूयुर्वां महो दधे
pada pāṭha: asya | me | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | r̥ta-yataḥ | bhūtam | avitrī iti | vacasaḥ | sisāsataḥ || yayoḥ | āyuḥ | pra-taram | te iti | idam | puraḥ | upastute ityupa-stute | vasu-yuḥ | vā | mahaḥ | dadhe ||2.32.1||

IAST: mā no guhyā ripa āyor ahan dabhan mā na ābhyo rīradho ducchunābhyaḥ
Griffith: Let not man's guile annoy us, secret or by day: give not us up a prey to these calamities.
Devanāgarī: मा नो गुह्या रिप आयोरहन्दभन्मा न आभ्यो रीरधो दुच्छुनाभ्यः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | guhyāḥ | ripaḥ | āyoḥ | ahan | dabhan | mā | naḥ | ābhyaḥ | rīradhaḥ | ducchunābhyaḥ || mā | naḥ | vi | yauḥ | sakhyā | viddhi | tasya | naḥ | sumna-yatā | manasā | tat | tvā | īmahe ||2.32.2||

IAST: mā no vi yauḥ sakhyā viddhi tasya naḥ sumnāyatā manasā tat tvemahe
Griffith: Sever not thou our friendship: think thereon for us. This, with a heart that longs for bliss, we seek from thee.
Devanāgarī: मा नो वि यौः सख्या विद्धि तस्य नः सुम्नायता मनसा तत्त्वेमहे
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | guhyāḥ | ripaḥ | āyoḥ | ahan | dabhan | mā | naḥ | ābhyaḥ | rīradhaḥ | ducchunābhyaḥ || mā | naḥ | vi | yauḥ | sakhyā | viddhi | tasya | naḥ | sumna-yatā | manasā | tat | tvā | īmahe ||2.32.2||

IAST: aheḻatā manasā śruṣṭim ā vaha duhānāṁ dhenum pipyuṣīm asaścatam
Griffith: Bring hither with benignant mind the willing Cow teeming with plenteous milk, full, inexhaustible.
Devanāgarī: अहेळता मनसा श्रुष्टिमा वह दुहानां धेनुं पिप्युषीमसश्चतम्
pada pāṭha: aheḷatā | manasā | śruṣṭim | ā | vaha | duhānām | dhenum | pipyuṣīm | asaścatam || padyābhiḥ | āśum | vacasā | ca | vājinam | tvām | hinomi | puru-hūta | viśvahā ||2.32.3||

IAST: padyābhir āśuṁ vacasā ca vājinaṁ tvāṁ hinomi puruhūta viśvahā
Griffith: O thou invoked by many, day by day I urge thee with my word, a charger rapid in his tread.
Devanāgarī: पद्याभिराशुं वचसा च वाजिनं त्वां हिनोमि पुरुहूत विश्वहा
pada pāṭha: aheḷatā | manasā | śruṣṭim | ā | vaha | duhānām | dhenum | pipyuṣīm | asaścatam || padyābhiḥ | āśum | vacasā | ca | vājinam | tvām | hinomi | puru-hūta | viśvahā ||2.32.3||

IAST: rākām ahaṁ suhavāṁ suṣṭutī huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tmanā
Griffith: With eulogy I call on Raka swift to hear may she, auspicious, hear us, and herself observe.
Devanāgarī: राकामहं सुहवां सुष्टुती हुवे शृणोतु नः सुभगा बोधतु त्मना
pada pāṭha: rākām | aham | su-havām | su-stutī | huve | śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | su-bhagā | bodhatu | tmanā || sīvyatu | apaḥ | sūcyā | acchidyamānayā | dadātu | vīram | śata-dāyam | ukthyam ||2.32.4||

IAST: sīvyatv apaḥ sūcyācchidyamānayā dadātu vīraṁ śatadāyam ukthyam
Griffith: With never-breaking needle may she sew her work, and give a hero son most wealthy, meet for praise.
Devanāgarī: सीव्यत्वपः सूच्याच्छिद्यमानया ददातु वीरं शतदायमुक्थ्यम्
pada pāṭha: rākām | aham | su-havām | su-stutī | huve | śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | su-bhagā | bodhatu | tmanā || sīvyatu | apaḥ | sūcyā | acchidyamānayā | dadātu | vīram | śata-dāyam | ukthyam ||2.32.4||

IAST: yās te rāke sumatayaḥ supeśaso yābhir dadāsi dāśuṣe vasūni
Griffith: All thy kind thoughts, O Raka, lovely in their form, wherewith thou grantest wealth to him who offers gifts-
Devanāgarī: यास्ते राके सुमतयः सुपेशसो याभिर्ददासि दाशुषे वसूनि
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | te | rāke | su-matayaḥ | su-peśasaḥ | yābhiḥ | dadāsi | dāśuṣe | vasūni || tābhiḥ | naḥ | adya | su-manāḥ | upa-āgahi | sahasra-poṣam | su-bhage | rarāṇā ||2.32.5||

IAST: tābhir no adya sumanā upāgahi sahasrapoṣaṁ subhage rarāṇā
Griffith: With these come thou to us this day benevolent, O Blessed One, bestowing food of thousand sorts.
Devanāgarī: ताभिर्नो अद्य सुमना उपागहि सहस्रपोषं सुभगे रराणा
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | te | rāke | su-matayaḥ | su-peśasaḥ | yābhiḥ | dadāsi | dāśuṣe | vasūni || tābhiḥ | naḥ | adya | su-manāḥ | upa-āgahi | sahasra-poṣam | su-bhage | rarāṇā ||2.32.5||

IAST: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā
Griffith: O broad-tressed Sinivali, thou who art the Sister of the Gods,
Devanāgarī: सिनीवालि पृथुष्टुके या देवानामसि स्वसा
pada pāṭha: sinīvāli | pr̥thu-stuke | yā | devānām | asi | svasā || juṣasva | havyam | ā-hutam | pra-jām | devi | didiḍḍhi | naḥ ||2.32.6||

IAST: juṣasva havyam āhutam prajāṁ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
Griffith: Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny.
Devanāgarī: जुषस्व हव्यमाहुतं प्रजां देवि दिदिड्ढि नः
pada pāṭha: sinīvāli | pr̥thu-stuke | yā | devānām | asi | svasā || juṣasva | havyam | ā-hutam | pra-jām | devi | didiḍḍhi | naḥ ||2.32.6||

IAST: yā subāhuḥ svaṅguriḥ suṣūmā bahusūvarī
Griffith: With lovely fingers, lovely arms, prolific Mother of many sons-
Devanāgarī: या सुबाहुः स्वङ्गुरिः सुषूमा बहुसूवरी
pada pāṭha: yā | su-bāhuḥ | su-aṅguriḥ | su-sūmā | bahu-sūvarī || tasyai | viśpatnyai | haviḥ | sinīvālyai | juhotana ||2.32.7||

IAST: tasyai viśpatnyai haviḥ sinīvālyai juhotana
Griffith: Present the sacred gifts to her, to Sinlivali Queen of men.
Devanāgarī: तस्यै विश्पत्न्यै हविः सिनीवाल्यै जुहोतन
pada pāṭha: yā | su-bāhuḥ | su-aṅguriḥ | su-sūmā | bahu-sūvarī || tasyai | viśpatnyai | haviḥ | sinīvālyai | juhotana ||2.32.7||

IAST: yā guṅgūr yā sinīvālī yā rākā yā sarasvatī
Griffith: Her, Sinivali, her, Gungu, her, Raka, her, Sarasvati,
Devanāgarī: या गुङ्गूर्या सिनीवाली या राका या सरस्वती
pada pāṭha: yā | guṅgūḥ | yā | sinīvālī | yā | rākā | yā | sarasvatī || indrāṇīm | ahve | ūtaye | varuṇānīm | svastaye ||2.32.8||

IAST: indrāṇīm ahva ūtaye varuṇānīṁ svastaye
Griffith: Indrani to mine aid I call, and Vartunani for my weal.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राणीमह्व ऊतये वरुणानीं स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: yā | guṅgūḥ | yā | sinīvālī | yā | rākā | yā | sarasvatī || indrāṇīm | ahve | ūtaye | varuṇānīm | svastaye ||2.32.8||

IAST: ā te pitar marutāṁ sumnam etu mā naḥ sūryasya saṁdṛśo yuyothāḥ
Griffith: FATHER of Maruts, let thy bliss approach us: exclude us not from looking on the sunlight.
Devanāgarī: आ ते पितर्मरुतां सुम्नमेतु मा नः सूर्यस्य संदृशो युयोथाः
pada pāṭha: ā | te | pitaḥ | marutām | sumnam | etu | mā | naḥ | sūryasya | sam-dr̥śaḥ | yuyothāḥ || abhi | naḥ | vīraḥ | arvati | kṣameta | pra | jāyemahi | rudra | pra-jābhiḥ ||2.33.1||

IAST: abhi no vīro arvati kṣameta pra jāyemahi rudra prajābhiḥ
Griffith: Gracious to our fleet courser be the Hero may we transplant us, Rudra, in our children.
Devanāgarī: अभि नो वीरो अर्वति क्षमेत प्र जायेमहि रुद्र प्रजाभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | te | pitaḥ | marutām | sumnam | etu | mā | naḥ | sūryasya | sam-dr̥śaḥ | yuyothāḥ || abhi | naḥ | vīraḥ | arvati | kṣameta | pra | jāyemahi | rudra | pra-jābhiḥ ||2.33.1||

IAST: tvādattebhī rudra śaṁtamebhiḥ śataṁ himā aśīya bheṣajebhiḥ
Griffith: With the most saving medicines which thou givest, Rudra, may I attain a hundred winters.
Devanāgarī: त्वादत्तेभी रुद्र शंतमेभिः शतं हिमा अशीय भेषजेभिः
pada pāṭha: tvā-dattebhiḥ | rudra | śam-tamebhiḥ | śatam | himāḥ | aśīya | bheṣajebhiḥ || vi | asmat | dveṣaḥ | vi-taram | vi | aṁhaḥ | vi | amīvāḥ | cātayasva | viṣūcīḥ ||2.33.2||

IAST: vy asmad dveṣo vitaraṁ vy aṁho vy amīvāś cātayasvā viṣūcīḥ
Griffith: Far from us banish enmity and hatred, and to all quarters maladies and trouble.
Devanāgarī: व्यस्मद्द्वेषो वितरं व्यंहो व्यमीवाश्चातयस्वा विषूचीः
pada pāṭha: tvā-dattebhiḥ | rudra | śam-tamebhiḥ | śatam | himāḥ | aśīya | bheṣajebhiḥ || vi | asmat | dveṣaḥ | vi-taram | vi | aṁhaḥ | vi | amīvāḥ | cātayasva | viṣūcīḥ ||2.33.2||

IAST: śreṣṭho jātasya rudra śriyāsi tavastamas tavasāṁ vajrabāho
Griffith: Chief of all born art thou in glory, Rudra, armed with the thunder, mightiest of the mighty.
Devanāgarī: श्रेष्ठो जातस्य रुद्र श्रियासि तवस्तमस्तवसां वज्रबाहो
pada pāṭha: śreṣṭhaḥ | jātasya | rudra | śriyā | asi | tavaḥ-tamaḥ | tavasām | vajrabāho iti vajra-bāho || parṣi | naḥ | pāram | aṁhasaḥ | svasti | viśvāḥ | abhi-itīḥ | rapasaḥ | yuyodhi ||2.33.3||

IAST: parṣi ṇaḥ pāram aṁhasaḥ svasti viśvā abhītī rapaso yuyodhi
Griffith: Transport us over trouble to well-being repel thou from us all assaults of mis. chief.
Devanāgarī: पर्षि णः पारमंहसः स्वस्ति विश्वा अभीती रपसो युयोधि
pada pāṭha: śreṣṭhaḥ | jātasya | rudra | śriyā | asi | tavaḥ-tamaḥ | tavasām | vajrabāho iti vajra-bāho || parṣi | naḥ | pāram | aṁhasaḥ | svasti | viśvāḥ | abhi-itīḥ | rapasaḥ | yuyodhi ||2.33.3||

IAST: mā tvā rudra cukrudhāmā namobhir mā duṣṭutī vṛṣabha mā sahūtī
Griffith: Let us not anger thee with worship, Rudra, ill praise, Strong God! or mingled invocation.
Devanāgarī: मा त्वा रुद्र चुक्रुधामा नमोभिर्मा दुष्टुती वृषभ मा सहूती
pada pāṭha: mā | tvā | rudra | cukrudhāma | namaḥ-bhiḥ | mā | duḥ-stutī | vr̥ṣabha | mā | sa-hūtī || ut | naḥ | vīrān | arpaya | bheṣajebhiḥ | bhiṣak-tamam | tvā | bhiṣajām | śr̥ṇomi ||2.33.4||

IAST: un no vīrām̐ arpaya bheṣajebhir bhiṣaktamaṁ tvā bhiṣajāṁ śṛṇomi
Griffith: Do thou with strengthening balms incite our heroes: I hear thee famed as best of all physicians.
Devanāgarī: उन्नो वीराँ अर्पय भेषजेभिर्भिषक्तमं त्वा भिषजां शृणोमि
pada pāṭha: mā | tvā | rudra | cukrudhāma | namaḥ-bhiḥ | mā | duḥ-stutī | vr̥ṣabha | mā | sa-hūtī || ut | naḥ | vīrān | arpaya | bheṣajebhiḥ | bhiṣak-tamam | tvā | bhiṣajām | śr̥ṇomi ||2.33.4||

IAST: havīmabhir havate yo havirbhir ava stomebhī rudraṁ diṣīya
Griffith: May I with praise-songs win that Rudra's favour who is adored with gifts and invocations.
Devanāgarī: हवीमभिर्हवते यो हविर्भिरव स्तोमेभी रुद्रं दिषीय
pada pāṭha: havīma-bhiḥ | havate | yaḥ | haviḥ-bhiḥ | ava | stomebhiḥ | rudram | diṣīya || r̥dūdaraḥ | su-havaḥ | mā | naḥ | asyai | babhruḥ | su-śipraḥ | rīradhat | manāyai ||2.33.5||

IAST: ṛdūdaraḥ suhavo mā no asyai babhruḥ suśipro rīradhan manāyai
Griffith: Ne'er may the tawny God, fair-checked, and gracious, swifthearing, yield us to this evil purpose.
Devanāgarī: ऋदूदरः सुहवो मा नो अस्यै बभ्रुः सुशिप्रो रीरधन्मनायै
pada pāṭha: havīma-bhiḥ | havate | yaḥ | haviḥ-bhiḥ | ava | stomebhiḥ | rudram | diṣīya || r̥dūdaraḥ | su-havaḥ | mā | naḥ | asyai | babhruḥ | su-śipraḥ | rīradhat | manāyai ||2.33.5||

IAST: un mā mamanda vṛṣabho marutvān tvakṣīyasā vayasā nādhamānam
Griffith: The Strong, begirt by Maruts, hath refreshed me, with most invigorating food, imploring.
Devanāgarī: उन्मा ममन्द वृषभो मरुत्वान्त्वक्षीयसा वयसा नाधमानम्
pada pāṭha: ut | mā | mamanda | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | marutvān | tvakṣīyasā | vayasā | nādhamānam || ghr̥ṇi-iva | chāyām | arapāḥ | aśīya | ā | vivāseyam | rudrasya | sumnam ||2.33.6||

IAST: ghṛṇīva cchāyām arapā aśīyā vivāseyaṁ rudrasya sumnam
Griffith: As he who finds a shade in fervent sunlight may I, uninjured, win the bliss of Rudra.
Devanāgarī: घृणीव च्छायामरपा अशीया विवासेयं रुद्रस्य सुम्नम्
pada pāṭha: ut | mā | mamanda | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | marutvān | tvakṣīyasā | vayasā | nādhamānam || ghr̥ṇi-iva | chāyām | arapāḥ | aśīya | ā | vivāseyam | rudrasya | sumnam ||2.33.6||

IAST: kva sya te rudra mṛḻayākur hasto yo asti bheṣajo jalāṣaḥ
Griffith: Where is that gracious hand of thine, O Rudra, the hand that giveth health and bringeth comfort,
Devanāgarī: क्व स्य ते रुद्र मृळयाकुर्हस्तो यो अस्ति भेषजो जलाषः
pada pāṭha: kva | syaḥ | te | rudra | mr̥ḷayākuḥ | hastaḥ | yaḥ | asti | bheṣajaḥ | jalāṣaḥ || apa-bhartā | rapasaḥ | daivyasya | abhi | nu | mā | vr̥ṣabha | cakṣamīthāḥ ||2.33.7||

IAST: apabhartā rapaso daivyasyābhī nu mā vṛṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ
Griffith: Remover of the woe that Gods have sent us? O Strong One, look thou on me with compassion.
Devanāgarī: अपभर्ता रपसो दैव्यस्याभी नु मा वृषभ चक्षमीथाः
pada pāṭha: kva | syaḥ | te | rudra | mr̥ḷayākuḥ | hastaḥ | yaḥ | asti | bheṣajaḥ | jalāṣaḥ || apa-bhartā | rapasaḥ | daivyasya | abhi | nu | mā | vr̥ṣabha | cakṣamīthāḥ ||2.33.7||

IAST: pra babhrave vṛṣabhāya śvitīce maho mahīṁ suṣṭutim īrayāmi
Griffith: To him the strong, great, tawny, fair-complexioned, I utter forth a mighty hymn of praises.
Devanāgarī: प्र बभ्रवे वृषभाय श्वितीचे महो महीं सुष्टुतिमीरयामि
pada pāṭha: pra | babhrave | vr̥ṣabhāya | śvitīce | mahaḥ | mahīm | su-stutim | īrayāmi || namasya | kalmalīkinam | namaḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇīmasi | tveṣam | rudrasya | nāma ||2.33.8||

IAST: namasyā kalmalīkinaṁ namobhir gṛṇīmasi tveṣaṁ rudrasya nāma
Griffith: We serve the brilliant God with adorations, we glorify, the splendid name of Rudra.
Devanāgarī: नमस्या कल्मलीकिनं नमोभिर्गृणीमसि त्वेषं रुद्रस्य नाम
pada pāṭha: pra | babhrave | vr̥ṣabhāya | śvitīce | mahaḥ | mahīm | su-stutim | īrayāmi || namasya | kalmalīkinam | namaḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇīmasi | tveṣam | rudrasya | nāma ||2.33.8||

IAST: sthirebhir aṅgaiḥ pururūpa ugro babhruḥ śukrebhiḥ pipiśe hiraṇyaiḥ
Griffith: With firm limbs, multiform, the strong, the tawny adorns himself with bright gold decorations:
Devanāgarī: स्थिरेभिरङ्गैः पुरुरूप उग्रो बभ्रुः शुक्रेभिः पिपिशे हिरण्यैः
pada pāṭha: sthirebhiḥ | aṅgaiḥ | puru-rūpaḥ | ugraḥ | babhruḥ | śukrebhiḥ | pipiśe | hiraṇyaiḥ || īśānāt | asya | bhuvanasya | bhūreḥ | na | vai | ūm̐ iti | yoṣat | rudrāt | asuryam ||2.33.9||

IAST: īśānād asya bhuvanasya bhūrer na vā u yoṣad rudrād asuryam
Griffith: The strength of Godhead ne'er departs from Rudra, him who is Sovran of this world, the mighty.
Devanāgarī: ईशानादस्य भुवनस्य भूरेर्न वा उ योषद्रुद्रादसुर्यम्
pada pāṭha: sthirebhiḥ | aṅgaiḥ | puru-rūpaḥ | ugraḥ | babhruḥ | śukrebhiḥ | pipiśe | hiraṇyaiḥ || īśānāt | asya | bhuvanasya | bhūreḥ | na | vai | ūm̐ iti | yoṣat | rudrāt | asuryam ||2.33.9||

IAST: arhan bibharṣi sāyakāni dhanvārhan niṣkaṁ yajataṁ viśvarūpam
Griffith: Worthy, thou carriest thy bow and arrows, worthy, thy manyhued and honoured necklace.
Devanāgarī: अर्हन्बिभर्षि सायकानि धन्वार्हन्निष्कं यजतं विश्वरूपम्
pada pāṭha: arhan | bibharṣi | sāyakāni | dhanva | arhan | niṣkam | yajatam | viśva-rūpam || arhan | idam | dayase | viśvam | abhvam | na | vai | ojīyaḥ | rudra | tvat | asti ||2.33.10||

IAST: arhann idaṁ dayase viśvam abhvaṁ na vā ojīyo rudra tvad asti
Griffith: Worthy, thou cuttest here each fiend to pieces: a mightier than thou there is not, Rudra.
Devanāgarī: अर्हन्निदं दयसे विश्वमभ्वं न वा ओजीयो रुद्र त्वदस्ति
pada pāṭha: arhan | bibharṣi | sāyakāni | dhanva | arhan | niṣkam | yajatam | viśva-rūpam || arhan | idam | dayase | viśvam | abhvam | na | vai | ojīyaḥ | rudra | tvat | asti ||2.33.10||

IAST: stuhi śrutaṁ gartasadaṁ yuvānam mṛgaṁ na bhīmam upahatnum ugram
Griffith: Praise him the chariot-borne, the young, the famous, fierce, slaying like a dread beast of the forest.
Devanāgarī: स्तुहि श्रुतं गर्तसदं युवानं मृगं न भीममुपहत्नुमुग्रम्
pada pāṭha: stuhi | śrutam | garta-sadam | yuvānam | mr̥gam | na | bhīmam | upa-hatnum | ugram || mr̥ḷa | jaritre | rudra | stavānaḥ | anyam | te | asmat | ni | vapantu | senāḥ ||2.33.11||

IAST: mṛḻā jaritre rudra stavāno 'nyaṁ te asman ni vapantu senāḥ
Griffith: O Rudra, praised, be gracious to the singer. let thy hosts spare us and smite down another.
Devanāgarī: मृळा जरित्रे रुद्र स्तवानोऽन्यं ते अस्मन्नि वपन्तु सेनाः
pada pāṭha: stuhi | śrutam | garta-sadam | yuvānam | mr̥gam | na | bhīmam | upa-hatnum | ugram || mr̥ḷa | jaritre | rudra | stavānaḥ | anyam | te | asmat | ni | vapantu | senāḥ ||2.33.11||

IAST: kumāraś cit pitaraṁ vandamānam prati nānāma rudropayantam
Griffith: I bend to thee as thou approachest, Rudra, even as a boy before the sire who greets him.
Devanāgarī: कुमारश्चित्पितरं वन्दमानं प्रति नानाम रुद्रोपयन्तम्
pada pāṭha: kumāraḥ | cit | pitaram | vandamānam | prati | nanāma | rudra | upa-yantam || bhūreḥ | dātāram | sat-patim | gr̥ṇīṣe | stutaḥ | tvam | bheṣajā | rāsi | asme iti ||2.33.12||

IAST: bhūrer dātāraṁ satpatiṁ gṛṇīṣe stutas tvam bheṣajā rāsy asme
Griffith: I praise thee Bounteous Giver, Lord of heroes: give medicines to us as thou art lauded.
Devanāgarī: भूरेर्दातारं सत्पतिं गृणीषे स्तुतस्त्वं भेषजा रास्यस्मे
pada pāṭha: kumāraḥ | cit | pitaram | vandamānam | prati | nanāma | rudra | upa-yantam || bhūreḥ | dātāram | sat-patim | gr̥ṇīṣe | stutaḥ | tvam | bheṣajā | rāsi | asme iti ||2.33.12||

IAST: yā vo bheṣajā marutaḥ śucīni yā śaṁtamā vṛṣaṇo yā mayobhu
Griffith: Of your pure medicines, O potent Martits, those that are wholesomest and healthbestowing,
Devanāgarī: या वो भेषजा मरुतः शुचीनि या शंतमा वृषणो या मयोभु
pada pāṭha: yā | vaḥ | bheṣajā | marutaḥ | śucīni | yā | śam-tamā | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yā | mayaḥ-bhu || yāni | manuḥ | avr̥ṇīta | pitā | naḥ | tā | śam | ca | yoḥ | ca | rudrasya | vaśmi ||2.33.13||

IAST: yāni manur avṛṇītā pitā nas tā śaṁ ca yoś ca rudrasya vaśmi
Griffith: Those which our father Manu hath selected, I crave from. Rudra for our gain and welfare.
Devanāgarī: यानि मनुरवृणीता पिता नस्ता शं च योश्च रुद्रस्य वश्मि
pada pāṭha: yā | vaḥ | bheṣajā | marutaḥ | śucīni | yā | śam-tamā | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yā | mayaḥ-bhu || yāni | manuḥ | avr̥ṇīta | pitā | naḥ | tā | śam | ca | yoḥ | ca | rudrasya | vaśmi ||2.33.13||

IAST: pari ṇo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ pari tveṣasya durmatir mahī gāt
Griffith: May Rudra's missile turn aside and spare us, the great wrath of the impetuous One avoid us.
Devanāgarī: परि णो हेती रुद्रस्य वृज्याः परि त्वेषस्य दुर्मतिर्मही गात्
pada pāṭha: pari | naḥ | hetiḥ | rudrasya | vr̥jyāḥ | pari | tveṣasya | duḥ-matiḥ | mahī | gāt || ava | sthirā | maghavat-bhyaḥ | tanuṣva | mīḍhvaḥ | tokāya | tanayāya | mr̥ḷa ||2.33.14||

IAST: ava sthirā maghavadbhyas tanuṣva mīḍhvas tokāya tanayāya mṛḻa
Griffith: Turn, Bounteous God, thy strong bow from our princes, and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.
Devanāgarī: अव स्थिरा मघवद्भ्यस्तनुष्व मीढ्वस्तोकाय तनयाय मृळ
pada pāṭha: pari | naḥ | hetiḥ | rudrasya | vr̥jyāḥ | pari | tveṣasya | duḥ-matiḥ | mahī | gāt || ava | sthirā | maghavat-bhyaḥ | tanuṣva | mīḍhvaḥ | tokāya | tanayāya | mr̥ḷa ||2.33.14||

IAST: evā babhro vṛṣabha cekitāna yathā deva na hṛṇīṣe na haṁsi
Griffith: O tawny Bull, thus showing forth thy nature, as neither to be wroth, O God, nor slay us.
Devanāgarī: एवा बभ्रो वृषभ चेकितान यथा देव न हृणीषे न हंसि
pada pāṭha: eva | babhro iti | vr̥ṣabha | cekitāna | yathā | deva | na | hr̥ṇīṣe | na | haṁsi || havana-śrut | naḥ | rudra | iha | bodhi | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.33.15||

IAST: havanaśrun no rudreha bodhi bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Here, Rudra, listen to our invocation. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: हवनश्रुन्नो रुद्रेह बोधि बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: eva | babhro iti | vr̥ṣabha | cekitāna | yathā | deva | na | hr̥ṇīṣe | na | haṁsi || havana-śrut | naḥ | rudra | iha | bodhi | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.33.15||

IAST: dhārāvarā maruto dhṛṣṇvojaso mṛgā na bhīmās taviṣībhir arcinaḥ
Griffith: THE Maruts of resistless might who love the rain, resplendent, terrible like wild beasts in their strength,
Devanāgarī: धारावरा मरुतो धृष्ण्वोजसो मृगा न भीमास्तविषीभिरर्चिनः
pada pāṭha: dhārāvarāḥ | marutaḥ | ghr̥ṣṇu-ojasaḥ | mr̥gāḥ | na | bhīmāḥ | taviṣībhiḥ | arcinaḥ || agnayaḥ | na | śuśucānāḥ | r̥jīṣiṇaḥ | bhr̥mim | dhamantaḥ | apa | gāḥ | avr̥ṇvata ||2.34.1||

IAST: agnayo na śuśucānā ṛjīṣiṇo bhṛmiṁ dhamanto apa gā avṛṇvata
Griffith: Glowing like flames of fire, impetuous in career, blowing the wandering raincloud, have disclosed the kine.
Devanāgarī: अग्नयो न शुशुचाना ऋजीषिणो भृमिं धमन्तो अप गा अवृण्वत
pada pāṭha: dhārāvarāḥ | marutaḥ | ghr̥ṣṇu-ojasaḥ | mr̥gāḥ | na | bhīmāḥ | taviṣībhiḥ | arcinaḥ || agnayaḥ | na | śuśucānāḥ | r̥jīṣiṇaḥ | bhr̥mim | dhamantaḥ | apa | gāḥ | avr̥ṇvata ||2.34.1||

IAST: dyāvo na stṛbhiś citayanta khādino vy abhriyā na dyutayanta vṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: They gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars, like cloud-born lightnings shine the torrents of their rain.
Devanāgarī: द्यावो न स्तृभिश्चितयन्त खादिनो व्यभ्रिया न द्युतयन्त वृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: dyāvaḥ | na | str̥-bhiḥ | citayanta | khādinaḥ | vi | abhriyāḥ | na | dyutayanta | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ || rudraḥ | yat | vaḥ | marutaḥ | rukma-vakṣasaḥ | vr̥ṣā | ajani | pr̥śnyāḥ | śukre | ūdhani ||2.34.2||

IAST: rudro yad vo maruto rukmavakṣaso vṛṣājani pṛśnyāḥ śukra ūdhani
Griffith: Since the strong Rudra, O Maruts with brilliant chests, sprang into life for you in Prsni's radiant lap.
Devanāgarī: रुद्रो यद्वो मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसो वृषाजनि पृश्न्याः शुक्र ऊधनि
pada pāṭha: dyāvaḥ | na | str̥-bhiḥ | citayanta | khādinaḥ | vi | abhriyāḥ | na | dyutayanta | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ || rudraḥ | yat | vaḥ | marutaḥ | rukma-vakṣasaḥ | vr̥ṣā | ajani | pr̥śnyāḥ | śukre | ūdhani ||2.34.2||

IAST: ukṣante aśvām̐ atyām̐ ivājiṣu nadasya karṇais turayanta āśubhiḥ
Griffith: They drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds; with the stream's rapid cars they hasten on their way.
Devanāgarī: उक्षन्ते अश्वाँ अत्याँ इवाजिषु नदस्य कर्णैस्तुरयन्त आशुभिः
pada pāṭha: ukṣante | aśvān | atyān-iva | ājiṣu | nadasya | karṇaiḥ | turayante | āśu-bhiḥ || hiraṇya-śiprāḥ | marutaḥ | davidhvataḥ | pr̥kṣam | yātha | pr̥ṣatībhiḥ | sa-manyavaḥ ||2.34.3||

IAST: hiraṇyaśiprā maruto davidhvataḥ pṛkṣaṁ yātha pṛṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ
Griffith: Maruts with helms of gold, ye who make all things shake, con e with your spotted deer, one-minded, to our food.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यशिप्रा मरुतो दविध्वतः पृक्षं याथ पृषतीभिः समन्यवः
pada pāṭha: ukṣante | aśvān | atyān-iva | ājiṣu | nadasya | karṇaiḥ | turayante | āśu-bhiḥ || hiraṇya-śiprāḥ | marutaḥ | davidhvataḥ | pr̥kṣam | yātha | pr̥ṣatībhiḥ | sa-manyavaḥ ||2.34.3||

IAST: pṛkṣe tā viśvā bhuvanā vavakṣire mitrāya vā sadam ā jīradānavaḥ
Griffith: They have bestowed of Mitra all that live, to feed, they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow;
Devanāgarī: पृक्षे ता विश्वा भुवना ववक्षिरे मित्राय वा सदमा जीरदानवः
pada pāṭha: pr̥kṣe | tā | viśvā | bhuvanā | vavakṣire | mitrāya | vā | sadam | ā | jīra-dānavaḥ || pr̥ṣat-aśvāsaḥ | anavabhra-rādhasaḥ | r̥jipyāsaḥ | na | vayuneṣu | dhūḥ-sadaḥ ||2.34.4||

IAST: pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhasa ṛjipyāso na vayuneṣu dhūrṣadaḥ
Griffith: Whose steeds are spotted deer, whose riches never fail, like horses in full speed, bound to the pole in work.
Devanāgarī: पृषदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधस ऋजिप्यासो न वयुनेषु धूर्षदः
pada pāṭha: pr̥kṣe | tā | viśvā | bhuvanā | vavakṣire | mitrāya | vā | sadam | ā | jīra-dānavaḥ || pr̥ṣat-aśvāsaḥ | anavabhra-rādhasaḥ | r̥jipyāsaḥ | na | vayuneṣu | dhūḥ-sadaḥ ||2.34.4||

IAST: indhanvabhir dhenubhī rapśadūdhabhir adhvasmabhiḥ pathibhir bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: With brightly-flarning kine whose udders swell with milk, idth glittering lances on your unobstructed paths,
Devanāgarī: इन्धन्वभिर्धेनुभी रप्शदूधभिरध्वस्मभिः पथिभिर्भ्राजदृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: indhanva-bhiḥ | dhenu-bhiḥ | rapśadūdha-bhiḥ | adhvasma-bhiḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | bhrājat-r̥ṣṭayaḥ || ā | haṁsāsaḥ | na | svasarāṇi | gantana | madhoḥ | madāya | marutaḥ | sa-manyavaḥ ||2.34.5||

IAST: ā haṁsāso na svasarāṇi gantana madhor madāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ
Griffith: O Maruts, of one mind, like swans who seek their nests, come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath.
Devanāgarī: आ हंसासो न स्वसराणि गन्तन मधोर्मदाय मरुतः समन्यवः
pada pāṭha: indhanva-bhiḥ | dhenu-bhiḥ | rapśadūdha-bhiḥ | adhvasma-bhiḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | bhrājat-r̥ṣṭayaḥ || ā | haṁsāsaḥ | na | svasarāṇi | gantana | madhoḥ | madāya | marutaḥ | sa-manyavaḥ ||2.34.5||

IAST: ā no brahmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavo narāṁ na śaṁsaḥ savanāni gantana
Griffith: To these our prayers, O Maruts, come unanimous, come ye to our libations like the praise of men.
Devanāgarī: आ नो ब्रह्माणि मरुतः समन्यवो नरां न शंसः सवनानि गन्तन
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | brahmāṇi | marutaḥ | sa-manyavaḥ | narām | na | śaṁsaḥ | savanāni | gantana || aśvām-iva | pipyata | dhenum | ūdhani | karta | dhiyam | jaritre | vāja-peśasam ||2.34.6||

IAST: aśvām iva pipyata dhenum ūdhani kartā dhiyaṁ jaritre vājapeśasam
Griffith: Make it swell like a mare, in udder like a cow, and for the singer grace the song with plenteous strength.
Devanāgarī: अश्वामिव पिप्यत धेनुमूधनि कर्ता धियं जरित्रे वाजपेशसम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | brahmāṇi | marutaḥ | sa-manyavaḥ | narām | na | śaṁsaḥ | savanāni | gantana || aśvām-iva | pipyata | dhenum | ūdhani | karta | dhiyam | jaritre | vāja-peśasam ||2.34.6||

IAST: taṁ no dāta maruto vājinaṁ ratha āpānam brahma citayad dive-dive
Griffith: Give us a steed, O Maruts migbty in the car; prevailing prayer that brings remembrance day by day;
Devanāgarī: तं नो दात मरुतो वाजिनं रथ आपानं ब्रह्म चितयद्दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: tam | naḥ | dāta | marutaḥ | vājinam | rathe | āpānam | brahma | citayat | dive-dive || iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | vr̥janeṣu | kārave | sanim | medhām | ariṣṭam | dustaram | sahaḥ ||2.34.7||

IAST: iṣaṁ stotṛbhyo vṛjaneṣu kārave sanim medhām ariṣṭaṁ duṣṭaraṁ sahaḥ
Griffith: Food to your praisers, to your bard in deeds of might give winning wisdom, power uninjured, unsurpassed.
Devanāgarī: इषं स्तोतृभ्यो वृजनेषु कारवे सनिं मेधामरिष्टं दुष्टरं सहः
pada pāṭha: tam | naḥ | dāta | marutaḥ | vājinam | rathe | āpānam | brahma | citayat | dive-dive || iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | vr̥janeṣu | kārave | sanim | medhām | ariṣṭam | dustaram | sahaḥ ||2.34.7||

IAST: yad yuñjate maruto rukmavakṣaso 'śvān ratheṣu bhaga ā sudānavaḥ
Griffith: When the bright-chested Maruts, lavish of their gifts, bind at the time bliss their horses to the cars,
Devanāgarī: यद्युञ्जते मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसोऽश्वान्रथेषु भग आ सुदानवः
pada pāṭha: yat | yuñjate | marutaḥ | rukma-vakṣasaḥ | aśvān | ratheṣu | bhage | ā | su-dānavaḥ || dhenuḥ | na | śiśve | svasareṣu | pinvate | janāya | rāta-haviṣe | mahīm | iṣam ||2.34.8||

IAST: dhenur na śiśve svasareṣu pinvate janāya rātahaviṣe mahīm iṣam
Griffith: Then, as the milch-cow feeds her calf within the stalls, they pour forth food for all oblation-bringing men.
Devanāgarī: धेनुर्न शिश्वे स्वसरेषु पिन्वते जनाय रातहविषे महीमिषम्
pada pāṭha: yat | yuñjate | marutaḥ | rukma-vakṣasaḥ | aśvān | ratheṣu | bhage | ā | su-dānavaḥ || dhenuḥ | na | śiśve | svasareṣu | pinvate | janāya | rāta-haviṣe | mahīm | iṣam ||2.34.8||

IAST: yo no maruto vṛkatāti martyo ripur dadhe vasavo rakṣatā riṣaḥ
Griffith: Save us, O Maruts, Vasus, from the injurer, the mortal foe who makes us looked upon as wolves.
Devanāgarī: यो नो मरुतो वृकताति मर्त्यो रिपुर्दधे वसवो रक्षता रिषः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | marutaḥ | vr̥ka-tāti | martyaḥ | ripuḥ | dadhe | vasavaḥ | rakṣata | riṣaḥ || vartayata | vapuṣā | cakriyā | abhi | tam | ava | rudrāḥ | aśasaḥ | hantana | vadhariti ||2.34.9||

IAST: vartayata tapuṣā cakriyābhi tam ava rudrā aśaso hantanā vadhaḥ
Griffith: With chariot all aflame compass him round about: O Rudras, cast away the foeman's deadly bolt.
Devanāgarī: वर्तयत तपुषा चक्रियाभि तमव रुद्रा अशसो हन्तना वधः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | marutaḥ | vr̥ka-tāti | martyaḥ | ripuḥ | dadhe | vasavaḥ | rakṣata | riṣaḥ || vartayata | vapuṣā | cakriyā | abhi | tam | ava | rudrāḥ | aśasaḥ | hantana | vadhariti ||2.34.9||

IAST: citraṁ tad vo maruto yāma cekite pṛśnyā yad ūdhar apy āpayo duhuḥ
Griffith: Well-known, ye Maruts, is that wondrous course of yours, when they milked Prsni's udder, close akin to her.
Devanāgarī: चित्रं तद्वो मरुतो याम चेकिते पृश्न्या यदूधरप्यापयो दुहुः
pada pāṭha: citram | tat | vaḥ | marutaḥ | yāma | cekite | pr̥śnyāḥ | yat | ūdhaḥ | api | āpayaḥ | duhuḥ || yat | vā | nide | navamānasya | rudriyāḥ | tritam | jarāya | juratām | adābhyāḥ ||2.34.10||

IAST: yad vā nide navamānasya rudriyās tritaṁ jarāya juratām adābhyāḥ
Griffith: Or when to shame the bard who lauded, Rudra's Sons, ye O infallible brought Trita to decay.
Devanāgarī: यद्वा निदे नवमानस्य रुद्रियास्त्रितं जराय जुरतामदाभ्याः
pada pāṭha: citram | tat | vaḥ | marutaḥ | yāma | cekite | pr̥śnyāḥ | yat | ūdhaḥ | api | āpayaḥ | duhuḥ || yat | vā | nide | navamānasya | rudriyāḥ | tritam | jarāya | juratām | adābhyāḥ ||2.34.10||

IAST: tān vo maho maruta evayāvno viṣṇor eṣasya prabhṛthe havāmahe
Griffith: We call youi such, great Maruts, following wonted ways, to the oblation paid to Visnu Speeder-on.
Devanāgarī: तान्वो महो मरुत एवयाव्नो विष्णोरेषस्य प्रभृथे हवामहे
pada pāṭha: tān | vaḥ | mahaḥ | marutaḥ | eva-yāvnaḥ | viṣṇoḥ | eṣasya | pra-bhr̥the | havāmahe || hiraṇya-varṇān | kakuhān | yata-srucaḥ | brahmaṇyantaḥ | śaṁsyam | rādhaḥ | īmahe ||2.34.11||

IAST: hiraṇyavarṇān kakuhān yatasruco brahmaṇyantaḥ śaṁsyaṁ rādha īmahe
Griffith: With ladles lifted up, with prayer, we seek of them preeminent, golden-hued, the wealth which all extol.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यवर्णान्ककुहान्यतस्रुचो ब्रह्मण्यन्तः शंस्यं राध ईमहे
pada pāṭha: tān | vaḥ | mahaḥ | marutaḥ | eva-yāvnaḥ | viṣṇoḥ | eṣasya | pra-bhr̥the | havāmahe || hiraṇya-varṇān | kakuhān | yata-srucaḥ | brahmaṇyantaḥ | śaṁsyam | rādhaḥ | īmahe ||2.34.11||

IAST: te daśagvāḥ prathamā yajñam ūhire te no hinvantūṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu
Griffith: They, the Dasagvas, first of all brought sacrifice: they at the break of mornings shall inspirit us.
Devanāgarī: ते दशग्वाः प्रथमा यज्ञमूहिरे ते नो हिन्वन्तूषसो व्युष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: te | daśa-gvāḥ | prathamāḥ | yajñam | ūhire | te | naḥ | hinvantu | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭiṣu || uṣāḥ | na | rāmīḥ | aruṇaiḥ | apa | ūrṇute | mahaḥ | jyotiṣā | śucatā | go-arṇasā ||2.34.12||

IAST: uṣā na rāmīr aruṇair aporṇute maho jyotiṣā śucatā goarṇasā
Griffith: Dawn with her purple beams uncovereth the nights, with great light glowing like a billowy sea of milk.
Devanāgarī: उषा न रामीररुणैरपोर्णुते महो ज्योतिषा शुचता गोअर्णसा
pada pāṭha: te | daśa-gvāḥ | prathamāḥ | yajñam | ūhire | te | naḥ | hinvantu | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭiṣu || uṣāḥ | na | rāmīḥ | aruṇaiḥ | apa | ūrṇute | mahaḥ | jyotiṣā | śucatā | go-arṇasā ||2.34.12||

IAST: te kṣoṇībhir aruṇebhir nāñjibhī rudrā ṛtasya sadaneṣu vāvṛdhuḥ
Griffith: The Rudras have rejoiced thern in the gathered bands at seats of worship as in purple ornaments.
Devanāgarī: ते क्षोणीभिररुणेभिर्नाञ्जिभी रुद्रा ऋतस्य सदनेषु वावृधुः
pada pāṭha: te | kṣoṇībhiḥ | aruṇebhiḥ | na | añji-bhiḥ | rudrāḥ | r̥tasya | sadaneṣu | vavr̥dhuḥ || ni-meghamānāḥ | atyena | pājasā | su-candram | varṇam | dadhire | su-peśasam ||2.34.13||

IAST: nimeghamānā atyena pājasā suścandraṁ varṇaṁ dadhire supeśasam
Griffith: They with impetuous vigour sending down the rain have taken to themselves a bright and lovely hue.
Devanāgarī: निमेघमाना अत्येन पाजसा सुश्चन्द्रं वर्णं दधिरे सुपेशसम्
pada pāṭha: te | kṣoṇībhiḥ | aruṇebhiḥ | na | añji-bhiḥ | rudrāḥ | r̥tasya | sadaneṣu | vavr̥dhuḥ || ni-meghamānāḥ | atyena | pājasā | su-candram | varṇam | dadhire | su-peśasam ||2.34.13||

IAST: tām̐ iyāno mahi varūtham ūtaya upa ghed enā namasā gṛṇīmasi
Griffith: Soliciting their high protection for our help, with this our adoration we sing praise to them,
Devanāgarī: ताँ इयानो महि वरूथमूतय उप घेदेना नमसा गृणीमसि
pada pāṭha: tān | iyānaḥ | mahi | varūtham | ūtaye | upa | gha | it | enā | namasā | gr̥ṇīmasi || tritaḥ | na | yān | pañca | hotr̥̄n | abhiṣṭaye | ā-vavartat | avarān | cakriyā | avase ||2.34.14||

IAST: trito na yān pañca hotṝn abhiṣṭaya āvavartad avarāñ cakriyāvase
Griffith: Whom, for assistance, like the five terrestrial priests. Trita hath brought to aid us hither on his car.
Devanāgarī: त्रितो न यान्पञ्च होतॄनभिष्टय आववर्तदवराञ्चक्रियावसे
pada pāṭha: tān | iyānaḥ | mahi | varūtham | ūtaye | upa | gha | it | enā | namasā | gr̥ṇīmasi || tritaḥ | na | yān | pañca | hotr̥̄n | abhiṣṭaye | ā-vavartat | avarān | cakriyā | avase ||2.34.14||

IAST: yayā radhram pārayathāty aṁho yayā nido muñcatha vanditāram
Griffith: So may your favouring help be turned to us-ward, your kindness like a Iowing cow approach us,
Devanāgarī: यया रध्रं पारयथात्यंहो यया निदो मुञ्चथ वन्दितारम्
pada pāṭha: yayā | radhram | pārayatha | ati | aṁhaḥ | yayā | nidaḥ | muñcatha | vanditāram || arvācī | sā | marutaḥ | yā | vaḥ | ūtiḥ | o iti | su | vāśrā-iva | su-matiḥ | jigātu ||2.34.15||

IAST: arvācī sā maruto yā va ūtir o ṣu vāśreva sumatir jigātu
Griffith: Wherewith ye bear your servant over trouble, and free your worshipper from scoff and scorning.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाची सा मरुतो या व ऊतिरो षु वाश्रेव सुमतिर्जिगातु
pada pāṭha: yayā | radhram | pārayatha | ati | aṁhaḥ | yayā | nidaḥ | muñcatha | vanditāram || arvācī | sā | marutaḥ | yā | vaḥ | ūtiḥ | o iti | su | vāśrā-iva | su-matiḥ | jigātu ||2.34.15||

IAST: upem asṛkṣi vājayur vacasyāṁ cano dadhīta nādyo giro me
Griffith: EAGER for spoil my flow of speech I utter: may the Floods' Child accept my songs with favour.
Devanāgarī: उपेमसृक्षि वाजयुर्वचस्यां चनो दधीत नाद्यो गिरो मे
pada pāṭha: upa | īm | asr̥kṣi | vāja-yuḥ | vacasyām | canaḥ | dadhīta | nādyaḥ | giraḥ | me || apām | napāt | āśu-hemā | kuvit | saḥ | su-peśasaḥ | karati | joṣiṣat | hi ||2.35.1||

IAST: apāṁ napād āśuhemā kuvit sa supeśasas karati joṣiṣad dhi
Griffith: Will not the rapid Son of Waters make them lovely, for he it is who shall enjoy them?
Devanāgarī: अपां नपादाशुहेमा कुवित्स सुपेशसस्करति जोषिषद्धि
pada pāṭha: upa | īm | asr̥kṣi | vāja-yuḥ | vacasyām | canaḥ | dadhīta | nādyaḥ | giraḥ | me || apām | napāt | āśu-hemā | kuvit | saḥ | su-peśasaḥ | karati | joṣiṣat | hi ||2.35.1||

IAST: imaṁ sv asmai hṛda ā sutaṣṭam mantraṁ vocema kuvid asya vedat
Griffith: To him let us address the song well-fashioned, forth from the heart. Shall he not understand it'
Devanāgarī: इमं स्वस्मै हृद आ सुतष्टं मन्त्रं वोचेम कुविदस्य वेदत्
pada pāṭha: imam | su | asmai | hr̥daḥ | ā | su-taṣṭam | mantram | vocema | kuvit | asya | vedat || apām | napāt | asuryasya | mahnā | viśvāni | aryaḥ | bhuvanā | jajāna ||2.35.2||

IAST: apāṁ napād asuryasya mahnā viśvāny aryo bhuvanā jajāna
Griffith: The friendly Son of Waters by the greatness of Godhead hath produced all things existing.
Devanāgarī: अपां नपादसुर्यस्य मह्ना विश्वान्यर्यो भुवना जजान
pada pāṭha: imam | su | asmai | hr̥daḥ | ā | su-taṣṭam | mantram | vocema | kuvit | asya | vedat || apām | napāt | asuryasya | mahnā | viśvāni | aryaḥ | bhuvanā | jajāna ||2.35.2||

IAST: sam anyā yanty upa yanty anyāḥ samānam ūrvaṁ nadyaḥ pṛṇanti
Griffith: Some floods unite themselves and others join them: die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse.
Devanāgarī: समन्या यन्त्युप यन्त्यन्याः समानमूर्वं नद्यः पृणन्ति
pada pāṭha: sam | anyāḥ | yanti | upa | yanti | anyāḥ | samānam | ūrvam | nadyaḥ | pr̥ṇanti || tam | ūm̐ iti | śucim | śucayaḥ | dīdi-vāṁsam | apām | napātam | pari | tasthuḥ | āpaḥ ||2.35.3||

IAST: tam ū śuciṁ śucayo dīdivāṁsam apāṁ napātam pari tasthur āpaḥ
Griffith: On every side the bright Floods have encompassed the bright resplendent Offspring of the Waters.
Devanāgarī: तमू शुचिं शुचयो दीदिवांसमपां नपातं परि तस्थुरापः
pada pāṭha: sam | anyāḥ | yanti | upa | yanti | anyāḥ | samānam | ūrvam | nadyaḥ | pr̥ṇanti || tam | ūm̐ iti | śucim | śucayaḥ | dīdi-vāṁsam | apām | napātam | pari | tasthuḥ | āpaḥ ||2.35.3||

IAST: tam asmerā yuvatayo yuvānam marmṛjyamānāḥ pari yanty āpaḥ
Griffith: The never-sullen waters, youthful Maidens, carefully decking, wait on him the youthful.
Devanāgarī: तमस्मेरा युवतयो युवानं मर्मृज्यमानाः परि यन्त्यापः
pada pāṭha: tam | asmerāḥ | yuvatayaḥ | yuvānam | marmr̥jyamānāḥ | pari | yanti | āpaḥ || saḥ | śukrebhiḥ | śikva-bhiḥ | revat | asme iti | dīdāya | anidhmaḥ | ghr̥ta-nirnik | ap-su ||2.35.4||

IAST: sa śukrebhiḥ śikvabhī revad asme dīdāyānidhmo ghṛtanirṇig apsu
Griffith: He with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty, unfed with wood. in waters, oil-enveloped.
Devanāgarī: स शुक्रेभिः शिक्वभी रेवदस्मे दीदायानिध्मो घृतनिर्णिगप्सु
pada pāṭha: tam | asmerāḥ | yuvatayaḥ | yuvānam | marmr̥jyamānāḥ | pari | yanti | āpaḥ || saḥ | śukrebhiḥ | śikva-bhiḥ | revat | asme iti | dīdāya | anidhmaḥ | ghr̥ta-nirnik | ap-su ||2.35.4||

IAST: asmai tisro avyathyāya nārīr devāya devīr didhiṣanty annam
Griffith: To him three Dames are oftering food to feed him, Goddesses to the God whom none may injure.
Devanāgarī: अस्मै तिस्रो अव्यथ्याय नारीर्देवाय देवीर्दिधिषन्त्यन्नम्
pada pāṭha: asmai | tisraḥ | avyathyāya | nārīḥ | devāya | devīḥ | didhiṣanti | annam || kr̥tā-iva | upa | hi | pra-sarsre | ap-su | saḥ | pīyūṣam | dhayati | pūrva-sūnām ||2.35.5||

IAST: kṛtā ivopa hi prasarsre apsu sa pīyūṣaṁ dhayati pūrvasūnām
Griffith: Within the waters hath he pressed, as hollows, and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.
Devanāgarī: कृता इवोप हि प्रसर्स्रे अप्सु स पीयूषं धयति पूर्वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: asmai | tisraḥ | avyathyāya | nārīḥ | devāya | devīḥ | didhiṣanti | annam || kr̥tā-iva | upa | hi | pra-sarsre | ap-su | saḥ | pīyūṣam | dhayati | pūrva-sūnām ||2.35.5||

IAST: aśvasyātra janimāsya ca svar druho riṣaḥ sampṛcaḥ pāhi sūrīn
Griffith: Here was the horse's birth; his was the sunlight. Save thou our princes from the oppressor's onslaught.
Devanāgarī: अश्वस्यात्र जनिमास्य च स्वर्द्रुहो रिषः सम्पृचः पाहि सूरीन्
pada pāṭha: aśvasya | atra | janima | asya | ca | svaḥ | druhaḥ | riṣaḥ | sam-pr̥caḥ | pāhi | sūrīn || āmāsu | pūrṣu | paraḥ | apra-mr̥ṣyam | na | arātayaḥ | vi | naśan | na | anr̥tāni ||2.35.6||

IAST: āmāsu pūrṣu paro apramṛṣyaṁ nārātayo vi naśan nānṛtāni
Griffith: Him, indestructible, dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.
Devanāgarī: आमासु पूर्षु परो अप्रमृष्यं नारातयो वि नशन्नानृतानि
pada pāṭha: aśvasya | atra | janima | asya | ca | svaḥ | druhaḥ | riṣaḥ | sam-pr̥caḥ | pāhi | sūrīn || āmāsu | pūrṣu | paraḥ | apra-mr̥ṣyam | na | arātayaḥ | vi | naśan | na | anr̥tāni ||2.35.6||

IAST: sva ā dame sudughā yasya dhenuḥ svadhām pīpāya subhv annam atti
Griffith: He, in whose mansion is the teeming Milch-cow, swells the Gods' nectar and cats noble viands.
Devanāgarī: स्व आ दमे सुदुघा यस्य धेनुः स्वधां पीपाय सुभ्वन्नमत्ति
pada pāṭha: sve | ā | dame | su-dughā | yasya | dhenuḥ | svadhām | pīpāya | su-bhu | annam | atti || saḥ | apām | napāt | ūrjayan | ap-su | antaḥ | vasu-deyāya | vidhate | vi | bhāti ||2.35.7||

IAST: so apāṁ napād ūrjayann apsv antar vasudeyāya vidhate vi bhāti
Griffith: lle Son of Waters, gathering strength in waters, shines for his worshipper to give him treasures.
Devanāgarī: सो अपां नपादूर्जयन्नप्स्वन्तर्वसुदेयाय विधते वि भाति
pada pāṭha: sve | ā | dame | su-dughā | yasya | dhenuḥ | svadhām | pīpāya | su-bhu | annam | atti || saḥ | apām | napāt | ūrjayan | ap-su | antaḥ | vasu-deyāya | vidhate | vi | bhāti ||2.35.7||

IAST: yo apsv ā śucinā daivyena ṛtāvājasra urviyā vibhāti
Griffith: He who in waters with his own pure Godhead shines widely, law-abiding, everlasting-
Devanāgarī: यो अप्स्वा शुचिना दैव्येन ऋतावाजस्र उर्विया विभाति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ap-su | ā | śucinā | daivyena | r̥ta-vā | ajasraḥ | urviyā | vi-bhāti || vayāḥ | it | anyā | bhuvanāni | asya | pra | jāyante | vīrudhaḥ | ca | pra-jābhiḥ ||2.35.8||

IAST: vayā id anyā bhuvanāny asya pra jāyante vīrudhaś ca prajābhiḥ
Griffith: The other worlds are verily his branches, and plants are born of him with all their offspring.
Devanāgarī: वया इदन्या भुवनान्यस्य प्र जायन्ते वीरुधश्च प्रजाभिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ap-su | ā | śucinā | daivyena | r̥ta-vā | ajasraḥ | urviyā | vi-bhāti || vayāḥ | it | anyā | bhuvanāni | asya | pra | jāyante | vīrudhaḥ | ca | pra-jābhiḥ ||2.35.8||

IAST: apāṁ napād ā hy asthād upasthaṁ jihmānām ūrdhvo vidyutaṁ vasānaḥ
Griffith: The Waters' Son hath risen, and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled cloud's bosom;
Devanāgarī: अपां नपादा ह्यस्थादुपस्थं जिह्मानामूर्ध्वो विद्युतं वसानः
pada pāṭha: apām | napāt | ā | hi | asthāt | upa-stham | jihmānām | ūrdhvaḥ | vi-dyutam | vasānaḥ || tasya | jyeṣṭham | mahimānam | vahantīḥ | hiraṇya-varṇāḥ | pari | yanti | yahvīḥ ||2.35.9||

IAST: tasya jyeṣṭham mahimānaṁ vahantīr hiraṇyavarṇāḥ pari yanti yahvīḥ
Griffith: And bearing with them his supremest glory the Youthful Ones, gold-coloured, move around him.
Devanāgarī: तस्य ज्येष्ठं महिमानं वहन्तीर्हिरण्यवर्णाः परि यन्ति यह्वीः
pada pāṭha: apām | napāt | ā | hi | asthāt | upa-stham | jihmānām | ūrdhvaḥ | vi-dyutam | vasānaḥ || tasya | jyeṣṭham | mahimānam | vahantīḥ | hiraṇya-varṇāḥ | pari | yanti | yahvīḥ ||2.35.9||

IAST: hiraṇyarūpaḥ sa hiraṇyasaṁdṛg apāṁ napāt sed u hiraṇyavarṇaḥ
Griffith: Golden in form is he, like gold to look on, his colour is like gold, the Son of Waters.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यरूपः स हिरण्यसंदृगपां नपात्सेदु हिरण्यवर्णः
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-rūpaḥ | saḥ | hiraṇya-saṁdr̥k | apām | napāt | saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | hiraṇya-varṇaḥ || hiraṇyayāt | pari | yoneḥ | ni-sadya | hiraṇya-dāḥ | dadati | annam | asmai ||2.35.10||

IAST: hiraṇyayāt pari yoner niṣadyā hiraṇyadā dadaty annam asmai
Griffith: When he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्ययात्परि योनेर्निषद्या हिरण्यदा ददत्यन्नमस्मै
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-rūpaḥ | saḥ | hiraṇya-saṁdr̥k | apām | napāt | saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | hiraṇya-varṇaḥ || hiraṇyayāt | pari | yoneḥ | ni-sadya | hiraṇya-dāḥ | dadati | annam | asmai ||2.35.10||

IAST: tad asyānīkam uta cāru nāmāpīcyaṁ vardhate naptur apām
Griffith: This the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the Waters' Son increase in secret.
Devanāgarī: तदस्यानीकमुत चारु नामापीच्यं वर्धते नप्तुरपाम्
pada pāṭha: tat | asya | anīkam | uta | cāru | nāma | apīcyam | vardhate | naptuḥ | apām || yam | indhate | yuvatayaḥ | sam | itthā | hiraṇya-varṇam | ghr̥tam | annam | asya ||2.35.11||

IAST: yam indhate yuvatayaḥ sam itthā hiraṇyavarṇaṁ ghṛtam annam asya
Griffith: Whom here the youthful Maids together kindle, his food is sacred oil of golden colour.
Devanāgarī: यमिन्धते युवतयः समित्था हिरण्यवर्णं घृतमन्नमस्य
pada pāṭha: tat | asya | anīkam | uta | cāru | nāma | apīcyam | vardhate | naptuḥ | apām || yam | indhate | yuvatayaḥ | sam | itthā | hiraṇya-varṇam | ghr̥tam | annam | asya ||2.35.11||

IAST: asmai bahūnām avamāya sakhye yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
Griffith: Him, nearest Friend of many, will we worship with sacrifice. and reverence and oblation.
Devanāgarī: अस्मै बहूनामवमाय सख्ये यज्ञैर्विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः
pada pāṭha: asmai | bahūnām | avamāya | sakhye | yajñaiḥ | vidhema | namasā | haviḥ-bhiḥ || sam | sānu | mārjmi | didhiṣāmi | bilmaiḥ | dadhāmi | annaiḥ | pari | vande | r̥k-bhiḥ ||2.35.12||

IAST: saṁ sānu mārjmi didhiṣāmi bilmair dadhāmy annaiḥ pari vanda ṛgbhiḥ
Griffith: I make his back to shine, with chips provide him; t offer food and with my songs exalt him.
Devanāgarī: सं सानु मार्ज्मि दिधिषामि बिल्मैर्दधाम्यन्नैः परि वन्द ऋग्भिः
pada pāṭha: asmai | bahūnām | avamāya | sakhye | yajñaiḥ | vidhema | namasā | haviḥ-bhiḥ || sam | sānu | mārjmi | didhiṣāmi | bilmaiḥ | dadhāmi | annaiḥ | pari | vande | r̥k-bhiḥ ||2.35.12||

IAST: sa īṁ vṛṣājanayat tāsu garbhaṁ sa īṁ śiśur dhayati taṁ rihanti
Griffith: The Bull hath laid his own life-germ Within them. He sucks them as an infant, and they kiss him.
Devanāgarī: स ईं वृषाजनयत्तासु गर्भं स ईं शिशुर्धयति तं रिहन्ति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | vr̥ṣā | ajanayat | tāsu | garbham | saḥ | īm | śiśuḥ | dhayati | tam | rihanti || saḥ | apām | napāt | anabhimlāta-varṇaḥ | anyasya-iva | iha | tanvā | viveṣa ||2.35.13||

IAST: so apāṁ napād anabhimlātavarṇo 'nyasyeveha tanvā viveṣa
Griffith: He, Son of Waters, of unfading colour, hadi entered here as in another's body.
Devanāgarī: सो अपां नपादनभिम्लातवर्णोऽन्यस्येवेह तन्वा विवेष
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | vr̥ṣā | ajanayat | tāsu | garbham | saḥ | īm | śiśuḥ | dhayati | tam | rihanti || saḥ | apām | napāt | anabhimlāta-varṇaḥ | anyasya-iva | iha | tanvā | viveṣa ||2.35.13||

IAST: asmin pade parame tasthivāṁsam adhvasmabhir viśvahā dīdivāṁsam
Griffith: While here he dwelleth in sublimest station, resplendent with the rays that never perish,
Devanāgarī: अस्मिन्पदे परमे तस्थिवांसमध्वस्मभिर्विश्वहा दीदिवांसम्
pada pāṭha: asmin | pade | parame | tasthi-vāṁsam | adhvasma-bhiḥ | viśvahā | dīdi-vāṁsam || āpaḥ | naptre | ghr̥tam | annam | vahantīḥ | svayam | atkaiḥ | pari | dīyanti | yahvīḥ ||2.35.14||

IAST: āpo naptre ghṛtam annaṁ vahantīḥ svayam atkaiḥ pari dīyanti yahvīḥ
Griffith: The Waters, bearing oil to feed their ofispring, flow, Youthful Ones, in wanderings about him.
Devanāgarī: आपो नप्त्रे घृतमन्नं वहन्तीः स्वयमत्कैः परि दीयन्ति यह्वीः
pada pāṭha: asmin | pade | parame | tasthi-vāṁsam | adhvasma-bhiḥ | viśvahā | dīdi-vāṁsam || āpaḥ | naptre | ghr̥tam | annam | vahantīḥ | svayam | atkaiḥ | pari | dīyanti | yahvīḥ ||2.35.14||

IAST: ayāṁsam agne sukṣitiṁ janāyāyāṁsam u maghavadbhyaḥ suvṛktim
Griffith: Agni, I gave good shelter to the people, and to the princes goodly preparation.
Devanāgarī: अयांसमग्ने सुक्षितिं जनायायांसमु मघवद्भ्यः सुवृक्तिम्
pada pāṭha: ayāṁsam | agne | su-kṣitim | janāya | ayāṁsam | ūm̐ iti | maghavat-bhyaḥ | su-vr̥ktim || viśvam | tat | bhadram | yat | avanti | devāḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.35.15||

IAST: viśvaṁ tad bhadraṁ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Blessed is all that Gods regard with favour. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: विश्वं तद्भद्रं यदवन्ति देवा बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: ayāṁsam | agne | su-kṣitim | janāya | ayāṁsam | ūm̐ iti | maghavat-bhyaḥ | su-vr̥ktim || viśvam | tat | bhadram | yat | avanti | devāḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.35.15||

IAST: tubhyaṁ hinvāno vasiṣṭa gā apo 'dhukṣan sīm avibhir adribhir naraḥ
Griffith: WATER and milk hath he endued, sent forth to thee: the men have drained him with the filters and the stones.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं हिन्वानो वसिष्ट गा अपोऽधुक्षन्सीमविभिरद्रिभिर्नरः
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | hinvānaḥ | vasiṣṭa | gāḥ | apaḥ | adhukṣan | sīm | avi-bhiḥ | adri-bhiḥ | naraḥ || piba | indra | svāhā | pra-hutam | vaṣaṭ-kr̥tam | hotrāt | ā | somam | prathamaḥ | yaḥ | īśiṣe ||2.36.1||

IAST: pibendra svāhā prahutaṁ vaṣaṭkṛtaṁ hotrād ā somam prathamo ya īśiṣe
Griffith: Drink, Indra, from the Hotar's bowlfirst right is thine-Soma hallowed and poured with Vasat and Svaha.
Devanāgarī: पिबेन्द्र स्वाहा प्रहुतं वषट्कृतं होत्रादा सोमं प्रथमो य ईशिषे
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | hinvānaḥ | vasiṣṭa | gāḥ | apaḥ | adhukṣan | sīm | avi-bhiḥ | adri-bhiḥ | naraḥ || piba | indra | svāhā | pra-hutam | vaṣaṭ-kr̥tam | hotrāt | ā | somam | prathamaḥ | yaḥ | īśiṣe ||2.36.1||

IAST: yajñaiḥ sammiślāḥ pṛṣatībhir ṛṣṭibhir yāmañ chubhrāso añjiṣu priyā uta
Griffith: Busied with sacrifice, with spotted deer and spears, gleaming upon your way with ornaments, yea, our Friends,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञैः सम्मिश्लाः पृषतीभिरृष्टिभिर्यामञ्छुभ्रासो अञ्जिषु प्रिया उत
pada pāṭha: yajñaiḥ | sam-miślāḥ | pr̥ṣatībhiḥ | r̥ṣṭi-bhiḥ | yāman | śubhrāsaḥ | añjiṣu | priyāḥ | uta || ā-sadya | barhiḥ | bharatasya | sūnavaḥ | potrāt | ā | somam | pibata | divaḥ | naraḥ ||2.36.2||

IAST: āsadyā barhir bharatasya sūnavaḥ potrād ā somam pibatā divo naraḥ
Griffith: Sitting on sacred grass, ye Sons of Bharata, drink Soma from the Potar's bowl, O Men of heaven.
Devanāgarī: आसद्या बर्हिर्भरतस्य सूनवः पोत्रादा सोमं पिबता दिवो नरः
pada pāṭha: yajñaiḥ | sam-miślāḥ | pr̥ṣatībhiḥ | r̥ṣṭi-bhiḥ | yāman | śubhrāsaḥ | añjiṣu | priyāḥ | uta || ā-sadya | barhiḥ | bharatasya | sūnavaḥ | potrāt | ā | somam | pibata | divaḥ | naraḥ ||2.36.2||

IAST: ameva naḥ suhavā ā hi gantana ni barhiṣi sadatanā raṇiṣṭana
Griffith: Come unto us, ye swift to listen: as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves.
Devanāgarī: अमेव नः सुहवा आ हि गन्तन नि बर्हिषि सदतना रणिष्टन
pada pāṭha: amā-iva | naḥ | su-havāḥ | ā | hi | gantana | ni | barhiṣi | sadatana | raṇiṣṭana || atha | mandasva | jujuṣāṇaḥ | andhasaḥ | tvaṣṭaḥ | devebhiḥ | jani-bhiḥ | sumat-gaṇaḥ ||2.36.3||

IAST: athā mandasva jujuṣāṇo andhasas tvaṣṭar devebhir janibhiḥ sumadgaṇaḥ
Griffith: And, Tvastar, well-content be joyful in the juice with Gods and Goddesses in gladsome company.
Devanāgarī: अथा मन्दस्व जुजुषाणो अन्धसस्त्वष्टर्देवेभिर्जनिभिः सुमद्गणः
pada pāṭha: amā-iva | naḥ | su-havāḥ | ā | hi | gantana | ni | barhiṣi | sadatana | raṇiṣṭana || atha | mandasva | jujuṣāṇaḥ | andhasaḥ | tvaṣṭaḥ | devebhiḥ | jani-bhiḥ | sumat-gaṇaḥ ||2.36.3||

IAST: ā vakṣi devām̐ iha vipra yakṣi cośan hotar ni ṣadā yoniṣu triṣu
Griffith: Bring the Gods hither, Sage, and offer sacrifice: at the three altars seat thee willingly, O Priest.
Devanāgarī: आ वक्षि देवाँ इह विप्र यक्षि चोशन्होतर्नि षदा योनिषु त्रिषु
pada pāṭha: ā | vakṣi | devān | iha | vipra | yakṣi | ca | uśan | hotaḥ | ni | sada | yoniṣu | triṣu || prati | vīhi | pra-sthitam | somyam | madhu | piba | āgnīdhrāt | tava | bhāgasya | tr̥pṇuhi ||2.36.4||

IAST: prati vīhi prasthitaṁ somyam madhu pibāgnīdhrāt tava bhāgasya tṛpṇuhi
Griffith: Accept for thy delight the proffered Soma meath: drink from the Kindler's bowl and fill thee with thy share.
Devanāgarī: प्रति वीहि प्रस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पिबाग्नीध्रात्तव भागस्य तृप्णुहि
pada pāṭha: ā | vakṣi | devān | iha | vipra | yakṣi | ca | uśan | hotaḥ | ni | sada | yoniṣu | triṣu || prati | vīhi | pra-sthitam | somyam | madhu | piba | āgnīdhrāt | tava | bhāgasya | tr̥pṇuhi ||2.36.4||

IAST: eṣa sya te tanvo nṛmṇavardhanaḥ saha ojaḥ pradivi bāhvor hitaḥ
Griffith: This is the strengthener of thy body's manly might: strength, victory for all time are placed within thine arms.
Devanāgarī: एष स्य ते तन्वो नृम्णवर्धनः सह ओजः प्रदिवि बाह्वोर्हितः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | te | tanvaḥ | nr̥mṇa-vardhanaḥ | sahaḥ | ojaḥ | pra-divi | bāhvoḥ | hitaḥ || tubhyam | sutaḥ | magha-van | tubhyam | ā-bhr̥taḥ | tvam | asya | brāhmaṇāt | ā | tr̥pat | piba ||2.36.5||

IAST: tubhyaṁ suto maghavan tubhyam ābhṛtas tvam asya brāhmaṇād ā tṛpat piba
Griffith: Pressed for thee, Maghavan, it is offered unto thee: drink from the chalice of this Brahman, drink thy fill.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं सुतो मघवन्तुभ्यमाभृतस्त्वमस्य ब्राह्मणादा तृपत्पिब
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | te | tanvaḥ | nr̥mṇa-vardhanaḥ | sahaḥ | ojaḥ | pra-divi | bāhvoḥ | hitaḥ || tubhyam | sutaḥ | magha-van | tubhyam | ā-bhr̥taḥ | tvam | asya | brāhmaṇāt | ā | tr̥pat | piba ||2.36.5||

IAST: juṣethāṁ yajñam bodhataṁ havasya me satto hotā nividaḥ pūrvyā anu
Griffith: Accept the sacrifice; mark both of you, my call: the Priest hath seated him after the ancient texts.
Devanāgarī: जुषेथां यज्ञं बोधतं हवस्य मे सत्तो होता निविदः पूर्व्या अनु
pada pāṭha: juṣethām | yajñam | bodhatam | havasya | me | sattaḥ | hotā | ni-vidaḥ | pūrvyāḥ | anu || accha | rājānā | namaḥ | eti | ā-vr̥tam | pra-śāstrāt | ā | pibatam | somyam | madhu ||2.36.6||

IAST: acchā rājānā nama ety āvṛtam praśāstrād ā pibataṁ somyam madhu
Griffith: My prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the Kings: drink ye the Soma meath from the Director's bowl.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा राजाना नम एत्यावृतं प्रशास्त्रादा पिबतं सोम्यं मधु
pada pāṭha: juṣethām | yajñam | bodhatam | havasya | me | sattaḥ | hotā | ni-vidaḥ | pūrvyāḥ | anu || accha | rājānā | namaḥ | eti | ā-vr̥tam | pra-śāstrāt | ā | pibatam | somyam | madhu ||2.36.6||

IAST: mandasva hotrād anu joṣam andhaso 'dhvaryavaḥ sa pūrṇāṁ vaṣṭy āsicam
Griffith: Enjoy thy fill of meath out of the Hotar's cup: Adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him.
Devanāgarī: मन्दस्व होत्रादनु जोषमन्धसोऽध्वर्यवः स पूर्णां वष्ट्यासिचम्
pada pāṭha: mandasva | hotrāt | anu | joṣam | andhasaḥ | adhvaryavaḥ | saḥ | pūrṇām | vaṣṭi | ā-sicam || tasmai | etam | bharata | tat-vaśaḥ | dadiḥ | hotrāt | somam | draviṇaḥ-daḥ | piba | r̥tu-bhiḥ ||2.37.1||

IAST: tasmā etam bharata tadvaśo dadir hotrāt somaṁ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
Griffith: Bring it him: seeking this he gives. Granter of Wealth, drink Sorna with the Rtus from the Hotar's cup.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा एतं भरत तद्वशो ददिर्होत्रात्सोमं द्रविणोदः पिब ऋतुभिः
pada pāṭha: mandasva | hotrāt | anu | joṣam | andhasaḥ | adhvaryavaḥ | saḥ | pūrṇām | vaṣṭi | ā-sicam || tasmai | etam | bharata | tat-vaśaḥ | dadiḥ | hotrāt | somam | draviṇaḥ-daḥ | piba | r̥tu-bhiḥ ||2.37.1||

IAST: yam u pūrvam ahuve tam idaṁ huve sed u havyo dadir yo nāma patyate
Griffith: He whom of old I called on, him I call on now. He is to be invoked; his name is He who Gives,
Devanāgarī: यमु पूर्वमहुवे तमिदं हुवे सेदु हव्यो ददिर्यो नाम पत्यते
pada pāṭha: yam | ūm̐ iti | pūrvam | ahuve | tam | idam | huve | saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | havyaḥ | dadiḥ | yaḥ | nāma | patyate || adhvaryu-bhiḥ | pra-sthitam | somyam | madhu | potrāt | somam | draviṇaḥ-daḥ | piba | r̥tu-bhiḥ ||2.37.2||

IAST: adhvaryubhiḥ prasthitaṁ somyam madhu potrāt somaṁ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
Griffith: Here brought by priests is Soma meath. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Potar's cup.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्युभिः प्रस्थितं सोम्यं मधु पोत्रात्सोमं द्रविणोदः पिब ऋतुभिः
pada pāṭha: yam | ūm̐ iti | pūrvam | ahuve | tam | idam | huve | saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | havyaḥ | dadiḥ | yaḥ | nāma | patyate || adhvaryu-bhiḥ | pra-sthitam | somyam | madhu | potrāt | somam | draviṇaḥ-daḥ | piba | r̥tu-bhiḥ ||2.37.2||

IAST: medyantu te vahnayo yebhir īyase 'riṣaṇyan vīḻayasvā vanaspate
Griffith: Fat may the horses be wherewith thou specdest on: Lord of the Wood, unharming, strengthen thou thyself.
Devanāgarī: मेद्यन्तु ते वह्नयो येभिरीयसेऽरिषण्यन्वीळयस्वा वनस्पते
pada pāṭha: medyantu | te | vahnayaḥ | yebhiḥ | īyase | ariṣaṇyan | vīḷayasva | vanaspate || ā-yūya | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | abhi-gūrya | tvam | neṣṭrāt | somam | draviṇaḥ-daḥ | piba | r̥tu-bhiḥ ||2.37.3||

IAST: āyūyā dhṛṣṇo abhigūryā tvaṁ neṣṭrāt somaṁ draviṇodaḥ piba ṛtubhiḥ
Griffith: Drawing and seizing, Bold One, thou who grantest wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Nestar's cup.
Devanāgarī: आयूया धृष्णो अभिगूर्या त्वं नेष्ट्रात्सोमं द्रविणोदः पिब ऋतुभिः
pada pāṭha: medyantu | te | vahnayaḥ | yebhiḥ | īyase | ariṣaṇyan | vīḷayasva | vanaspate || ā-yūya | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | abhi-gūrya | tvam | neṣṭrāt | somam | draviṇaḥ-daḥ | piba | r̥tu-bhiḥ ||2.37.3||

IAST: apād dhotrād uta potrād amattota neṣṭrād ajuṣata prayo hitam
Griffith: From Hotar's cup and Potar's he hath drunk and joyed: the proffered food hath pleased him from the Nestar's bowl.
Devanāgarī: अपाद्धोत्रादुत पोत्रादमत्तोत नेष्ट्रादजुषत प्रयो हितम्
pada pāṭha: apāt | hotrāt | uta | potrāt | amatta | uta | neṣṭrāt | ajuṣata | prayaḥ | hitam || turīyam | pātram | amr̥ktam | amartyam | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | pibatu | drāviṇaḥ-dasaḥ ||2.37.4||

IAST: turīyam pātram amṛktam amartyaṁ draviṇodāḥ pibatu drāviṇodasaḥ
Griffith: The fourth cup undisturbed, immortal, let him drink who giveth wealth, the cup of the wealth-giving God.
Devanāgarī: तुरीयं पात्रममृक्तममर्त्यं द्रविणोदाः पिबतु द्राविणोदसः
pada pāṭha: apāt | hotrāt | uta | potrāt | amatta | uta | neṣṭrāt | ajuṣata | prayaḥ | hitam || turīyam | pātram | amr̥ktam | amartyam | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | pibatu | drāviṇaḥ-dasaḥ ||2.37.4||

IAST: arvāñcam adya yayyaṁ nṛvāhaṇaṁ rathaṁ yuñjāthām iha vāṁ vimocanam
Griffith: Yoke, O ye Twain, to-day your hero-bearing car, swift-moving hitherward: your loosing-place is here.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाञ्चमद्य यय्यं नृवाहणं रथं युञ्जाथामिह वां विमोचनम्
pada pāṭha: arvāñcam | adya | yayyam | nr̥-vāhanam | ratham | yuñjāthām | iha | vām | vi-mocanam || pr̥ṅktam | havīṁṣi | madhunā | ā | hi | kam | gatam | atha | somam | pibatam | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū ||2.37.5||

IAST: pṛṅktaṁ havīṁṣi madhunā hi kaṁ gatam athā somam pibataṁ vājinīvasū
Griffith: Mix the oblations, then come hither with the meath, and drink the Soma, ye rich in abundant strength.
Devanāgarī: पृङ्क्तं हवींषि मधुना हि कं गतमथा सोमं पिबतं वाजिनीवसू
pada pāṭha: arvāñcam | adya | yayyam | nr̥-vāhanam | ratham | yuñjāthām | iha | vām | vi-mocanam || pr̥ṅktam | havīṁṣi | madhunā | ā | hi | kam | gatam | atha | somam | pibatam | vājinīvasū iti vājinī-vasū ||2.37.5||

IAST: joṣy agne samidhaṁ joṣy āhutiṁ joṣi brahma janyaṁ joṣi suṣṭutim
Griffith: Agni, accept the fuel and our offered gift: accept the prayer of man, accept our eulogy,
Devanāgarī: जोष्यग्ने समिधं जोष्याहुतिं जोषि ब्रह्म जन्यं जोषि सुष्टुतिम्
pada pāṭha: joṣi | agne | sam-idham | joṣi | ā-hutim | joṣi | brahma | janyam | joṣi | su-stutim || viśvebhiḥ | viśvān | r̥tunā | vaso iti | mahaḥ | uśan | devān | uśataḥ | pāyaya | haviḥ ||2.37.6||

IAST: viśvebhir viśvām̐ ṛtunā vaso maha uśan devām̐ uśataḥ pāyayā haviḥ
Griffith: Do thou with all, with Rtu, O thou Excellent, fain, make the great Gods all fain taste the gift we bring.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेभिर्विश्वाँ ऋतुना वसो मह उशन्देवाँ उशतः पायया हविः
pada pāṭha: joṣi | agne | sam-idham | joṣi | ā-hutim | joṣi | brahma | janyam | joṣi | su-stutim || viśvebhiḥ | viśvān | r̥tunā | vaso iti | mahaḥ | uśan | devān | uśataḥ | pāyaya | haviḥ ||2.37.6||

IAST: ud u ṣya devaḥ savitā savāya śaśvattamaṁ tadapā vahnir asthāt
Griffith: UPRISEN is Savitar, this God, to quicken, Priest who neglects not this most constant duty.
Devanāgarī: उदु ष्य देवः सविता सवाय शश्वत्तमं तदपा वह्निरस्थात्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | savāya | śaśvat-tamam | tat-apāḥ | vahniḥ | asthāt || nūnam | devebhyaḥ | vi | hi | dhāti | ratnam | atha | ā | abhajat | vīti-hotram | svastau ||2.38.1||

IAST: nūnaṁ devebhyo vi hi dhāti ratnam athābhajad vītihotraṁ svastau
