Griffith: To the Gods, verily, he gives rich treasure, and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.
Devanāgarī: नूनं देवेभ्यो वि हि धाति रत्नमथाभजद्वीतिहोत्रं स्वस्तौ
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | savāya | śaśvat-tamam | tat-apāḥ | vahniḥ | asthāt || nūnam | devebhyaḥ | vi | hi | dhāti | ratnam | atha | ā | abhajat | vīti-hotram | svastau ||2.38.1||

IAST: viśvasya hi śruṣṭaye deva ūrdhvaḥ pra bāhavā pṛthupāṇiḥ sisarti
Griffith: Having gone up on high, the God broadhanded spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him.
Devanāgarī: विश्वस्य हि श्रुष्टये देव ऊर्ध्वः प्र बाहवा पृथुपाणिः सिसर्ति
pada pāṭha: viśvasya | hi | śruṣṭaye | devaḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | pra | bāhavā | pr̥thu-pāṇiḥ | sisarti || āpaḥ | cit | asya | vrate | ā | ni-mr̥grāḥ | ayam | cit | vātaḥ | ramate | pari-jman ||2.38.2||

IAST: āpaś cid asya vrata ā nimṛgrā ayaṁ cid vāto ramate parijman
Griffith: Even the waters bend them to his service: even this wind rests in the circling region.
Devanāgarī: आपश्चिदस्य व्रत आ निमृग्रा अयं चिद्वातो रमते परिज्मन्
pada pāṭha: viśvasya | hi | śruṣṭaye | devaḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | pra | bāhavā | pr̥thu-pāṇiḥ | sisarti || āpaḥ | cit | asya | vrate | ā | ni-mr̥grāḥ | ayam | cit | vātaḥ | ramate | pari-jman ||2.38.2||

IAST: āśubhiś cid yān vi mucāti nūnam arīramad atamānaṁ cid etoḥ
Griffith: Though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them: e'en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going.
Devanāgarī: आशुभिश्चिद्यान्वि मुचाति नूनमरीरमदतमानं चिदेतोः
pada pāṭha: āśu-bhiḥ | cit | yān | vi | mucāti | nūnam | arīramat | atamānam | cit | etoḥ || ahyarṣūṇām | cit | ni | ayān | aviṣyām | anu | vratam | savituḥ | mokī | ā | agāt ||2.38.3||

IAST: ahyarṣūṇāṁ cin ny ayām̐ aviṣyām anu vrataṁ savitur moky āgāt
Griffith: He hath checked e'en their haste who glide like serpents. Night closely followed Savitar's dominion.
Devanāgarī: अह्यर्षूणां चिन्न्ययाँ अविष्यामनु व्रतं सवितुर्मोक्यागात्
pada pāṭha: āśu-bhiḥ | cit | yān | vi | mucāti | nūnam | arīramat | atamānam | cit | etoḥ || ahyarṣūṇām | cit | ni | ayān | aviṣyām | anu | vratam | savituḥ | mokī | ā | agāt ||2.38.3||

IAST: punaḥ sam avyad vitataṁ vayantī madhyā kartor ny adhāc chakma dhīraḥ
Griffith: What was spread out she weaves afresh, re-weaving: the skilful leaves his labour half-completed.
Devanāgarī: पुनः समव्यद्विततं वयन्ती मध्या कर्तोर्न्यधाच्छक्म धीरः
pada pāṭha: punariti | sam | avyat | vi-tatam | vayantī | madhyā | kartoḥ | ni | adhāt | śakma | dhīraḥ || ut | sam-hāya | asthāt | vi | r̥tūn | adardhaḥ | aramatiḥ | savitā | devaḥ | ā | agāt ||2.38.4||

IAST: ut saṁhāyāsthād vy ṛtūm̐r adardhar aramatiḥ savitā deva āgāt
Griffith: He hath arisen from rest, and parted seasons: Savitar hath approached, God, holy-minded.
Devanāgarī: उत्संहायास्थाद्व्यृतूँरदर्धररमतिः सविता देव आगात्
pada pāṭha: punariti | sam | avyat | vi-tatam | vayantī | madhyā | kartoḥ | ni | adhāt | śakma | dhīraḥ || ut | sam-hāya | asthāt | vi | r̥tūn | adardhaḥ | aramatiḥ | savitā | devaḥ | ā | agāt ||2.38.4||

IAST: nānaukāṁsi duryo viśvam āyur vi tiṣṭhate prabhavaḥ śoko agneḥ
Griffith: Tlirough various dwellings, through entire existence, spreads, manifest, the household light of Agni.
Devanāgarī: नानौकांसि दुर्यो विश्वमायुर्वि तिष्ठते प्रभवः शोको अग्नेः
pada pāṭha: nānā | okāṁsi | duryaḥ | viśvam | āyuḥ | vi | tiṣṭhate | pra-bhavaḥ | śokaḥ | agneḥ || jyeṣṭham | mātā | sūnave | bhāgam | ā | adhāt | anu | asya | ketam | iṣitam | savitrā ||2.38.5||

IAST: jyeṣṭham mātā sūnave bhāgam ādhād anv asya ketam iṣitaṁ savitrā
Griffith: The Mother gives her Son the goodliest portion, and Savitar hath sped to meet his summons.
Devanāgarī: ज्येष्ठं माता सूनवे भागमाधादन्वस्य केतमिषितं सवित्रा
pada pāṭha: nānā | okāṁsi | duryaḥ | viśvam | āyuḥ | vi | tiṣṭhate | pra-bhavaḥ | śokaḥ | agneḥ || jyeṣṭham | mātā | sūnave | bhāgam | ā | adhāt | anu | asya | ketam | iṣitam | savitrā ||2.38.5||

IAST: samāvavarti viṣṭhito jigīṣur viśveṣāṁ kāmaś caratām amābhūt
Griffith: He comes again, unfolded, fain for conquest: at home was he, the love of all things moving.
Devanāgarī: समाववर्ति विष्ठितो जिगीषुर्विश्वेषां कामश्चरताममाभूत्
pada pāṭha: sam-āvavarti | vi-sthitaḥ | jigīṣuḥ | viśveṣām | kāmaḥ | caratām | amā | abhūt || śaśvān | apaḥ | vi-kr̥tam | hitvī | ā | agāt | anu | vratam | savituḥ | daivyasya ||2.38.6||

IAST: śaśvām̐ apo vikṛtaṁ hitvy āgād anu vrataṁ savitur daivyasya
Griffith: Each man hath come leaving his evil doings, after the Godlike Savitar's commandment.
Devanāgarī: शश्वाँ अपो विकृतं हित्व्यागादनु व्रतं सवितुर्दैव्यस्य
pada pāṭha: sam-āvavarti | vi-sthitaḥ | jigīṣuḥ | viśveṣām | kāmaḥ | caratām | amā | abhūt || śaśvān | apaḥ | vi-kr̥tam | hitvī | ā | agāt | anu | vratam | savituḥ | daivyasya ||2.38.6||

IAST: tvayā hitam apyam apsu bhāgaṁ dhanvānv ā mṛgayaso vi tasthuḥ
Griffith: The wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters.
Devanāgarī: त्वया हितमप्यमप्सु भागं धन्वान्वा मृगयसो वि तस्थुः
pada pāṭha: tvayā | hitam | apyam | ap-su | bhāgam | dhanva | anu | ā | mr̥gayasaḥ | vi | tasthuḥ || vanāni | vi-bhyaḥ | nakiḥ | asya | tāni | vratā | devasya | savituḥ | minanti ||2.38.7||

IAST: vanāni vibhyo nakir asya tāni vratā devasya savitur minanti
Griffith: The woods are given to the birds. These statutes of the God Savitar none disobeyeth.
Devanāgarī: वनानि विभ्यो नकिरस्य तानि व्रता देवस्य सवितुर्मिनन्ति
pada pāṭha: tvayā | hitam | apyam | ap-su | bhāgam | dhanva | anu | ā | mr̥gayasaḥ | vi | tasthuḥ || vanāni | vi-bhyaḥ | nakiḥ | asya | tāni | vratā | devasya | savituḥ | minanti ||2.38.7||

IAST: yādrādhyaṁ varuṇo yonim apyam aniśitaṁ nimiṣi jarbhurāṇaḥ
Griffith: With utmost speed, in restless haste at sunset Varuna seeks his watery habitation.
Devanāgarī: याद्राध्यं वरुणो योनिमप्यमनिशितं निमिषि जर्भुराणः
pada pāṭha: yāt-rādhyam | varuṇaḥ | yonim | apyam | ani-śitam | ni-miṣi | jarbhurāṇaḥ || viśvaḥ | mārtāṇḍaḥ | vrajam | ā | paśuḥ | gāt | stha-śaḥ | janmāni | savitā | vi | ā | akarityakaḥ ||2.38.8||

IAST: viśvo mārtāṇḍo vrajam ā paśur gāt sthaśo janmāni savitā vy ākaḥ
Griffith: Then seeks each bird his nest, each beast his lodging. In due place Savitar hath set each creature.
Devanāgarī: विश्वो मार्ताण्डो व्रजमा पशुर्गात्स्थशो जन्मानि सविता व्याकः
pada pāṭha: yāt-rādhyam | varuṇaḥ | yonim | apyam | ani-śitam | ni-miṣi | jarbhurāṇaḥ || viśvaḥ | mārtāṇḍaḥ | vrajam | ā | paśuḥ | gāt | stha-śaḥ | janmāni | savitā | vi | ā | akarityakaḥ ||2.38.8||

IAST: na yasyendro varuṇo na mitro vratam aryamā na minanti rudraḥ
Griffith: Him whose high law not Varuna nor Indra, not Mitra, Aryaman, nor Rudra breaketh,
Devanāgarī: न यस्येन्द्रो वरुणो न मित्रो व्रतमर्यमा न मिनन्ति रुद्रः
pada pāṭha: na | yasya | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | na | mitraḥ | vratam | aryamā | na | minanti | rudraḥ || na | arātayaḥ | tam | idam | svasti | huve | devam | savitāram | namaḥ-bhiḥ ||2.38.9||

IAST: nārātayas tam idaṁ svasti huve devaṁ savitāraṁ namobhiḥ
Griffith: Nor evil-hearted fiends, here for my welfare him I invoke, God Savitar, with worship.
Devanāgarī: नारातयस्तमिदं स्वस्ति हुवे देवं सवितारं नमोभिः
pada pāṭha: na | yasya | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | na | mitraḥ | vratam | aryamā | na | minanti | rudraḥ || na | arātayaḥ | tam | idam | svasti | huve | devam | savitāram | namaḥ-bhiḥ ||2.38.9||

IAST: bhagaṁ dhiyaṁ vājayantaḥ puraṁdhiṁ narāśaṁso gnāspatir no avyāḥ
Griffith: May they who strengthen bliss, and thought and wisdom, and the Dames' Lord and Narasamsa aid us.
Devanāgarī: भगं धियं वाजयन्तः पुरंधिं नराशंसो ग्नास्पतिर्नो अव्याः
pada pāṭha: bhagam | dhiyam | vājayantaḥ | puram-dhim | narāśaṁsaḥ | gnāḥpatiḥ | naḥ | avyāḥ || ā-aye | vāmasya | sam-gathe | rayīṇām | priyāḥ | devasya | savituḥ | syāma ||2.38.10||

IAST: āye vāmasya saṁgathe rayīṇām priyā devasya savituḥ syāma
Griffith: That good may come to us and wealth be gathered, may we be Savitar the God's beloved.
Devanāgarī: आये वामस्य संगथे रयीणां प्रिया देवस्य सवितुः स्याम
pada pāṭha: bhagam | dhiyam | vājayantaḥ | puram-dhim | narāśaṁsaḥ | gnāḥpatiḥ | naḥ | avyāḥ || ā-aye | vāmasya | sam-gathe | rayīṇām | priyāḥ | devasya | savituḥ | syāma ||2.38.10||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ tad divo adbhyaḥ pṛthivyās tvayā dattaṁ kāmyaṁ rādha ā gāt
Griffith: So come to us our hearts' desire, the bounty bestowed by thee, from heaven and earth and waters,
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं तद्दिवो अद्भ्यः पृथिव्यास्त्वया दत्तं काम्यं राध आ गात्
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tat | divaḥ | at-bhyaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | tvayā | dattam | kāmyam | rādhaḥ | ā | gāt || śam | yat | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | āpaye | bhavāti | uru-śaṁsāya | savitaḥ | jaritre ||2.38.11||

IAST: śaṁ yat stotṛbhya āpaye bhavāty uruśaṁsāya savitar jaritre
Griffith: That it be well with friends and those who praise thee, and, Savitar, with the loud-lauding singer.
Devanāgarī: शं यत्स्तोतृभ्य आपये भवात्युरुशंसाय सवितर्जरित्रे
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tat | divaḥ | at-bhyaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | tvayā | dattam | kāmyam | rādhaḥ | ā | gāt || śam | yat | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | āpaye | bhavāti | uru-śaṁsāya | savitaḥ | jaritre ||2.38.11||

IAST: grāvāṇeva tad id arthaṁ jarethe gṛdhreva vṛkṣaṁ nidhimantam accha
Griffith: SING like the two press-stones for this same purpose; come like two misers to the tree of treasure;
Devanāgarī: ग्रावाणेव तदिदर्थं जरेथे गृध्रेव वृक्षं निधिमन्तमच्छ
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇā-iva | tat | it | artham | jarethe iti | gr̥dhrā-iva | vr̥kṣam | nidhi-mantam | accha || brahmāṇā-iva | vidathe | uktha-śasā | dūtā-iva | havyā | janyā | puru-trā ||2.39.1||

IAST: brahmāṇeva vidatha ukthaśāsā dūteva havyā janyā purutrā
Griffith: Like two laud-singing Brahmans in the assembly, like the folk's envoys called in many places.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्माणेव विदथ उक्थशासा दूतेव हव्या जन्या पुरुत्रा
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇā-iva | tat | it | artham | jarethe iti | gr̥dhrā-iva | vr̥kṣam | nidhi-mantam | accha || brahmāṇā-iva | vidathe | uktha-śasā | dūtā-iva | havyā | janyā | puru-trā ||2.39.1||

IAST: prātaryāvāṇā rathyeva vīrājeva yamā varam ā sacethe
Griffith: Moving at morning like two chr-borne heroes, like to a pair of goats ye come electing;
Devanāgarī: प्रातर्यावाणा रथ्येव वीराजेव यमा वरमा सचेथे
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ-yāvānā | rathyā-iva | vīrā | ajā-iva | yamā | varam | ā | sacethe iti || mene iveti mene-iva | tanvā | śumbhamāne iti | daṁpatī iveti daṁpatī-iva | kratu-vidā | janeṣu ||2.39.2||

IAST: mene iva tanvā śumbhamāne dampatīva kratuvidā janeṣu
Griffith: Like two fair dames embellishing their bodies, like a wise married pair among the people.
Devanāgarī: मेने इव तन्वा शुम्भमाने दम्पतीव क्रतुविदा जनेषु
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ-yāvānā | rathyā-iva | vīrā | ajā-iva | yamā | varam | ā | sacethe iti || mene iveti mene-iva | tanvā | śumbhamāne iti | daṁpatī iveti daṁpatī-iva | kratu-vidā | janeṣu ||2.39.2||

IAST: śṛṅgeva naḥ prathamā gantam arvāk chaphāv iva jarbhurāṇā tarobhiḥ
Griffith: Like to a pair of horns come first to usward, like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion;
Devanāgarī: शृङ्गेव नः प्रथमा गन्तमर्वाक्छफाविव जर्भुराणा तरोभिः
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṅgā-iva | naḥ | prathamā | gantam | arvāk | śaphau-iva | jarbhurāṇā | taraḥ-bhiḥ || cakravākā-iva | prati | vastoḥ | usrā | arvāñcā | yātam | rathyā-iva | śakrā ||2.39.3||

IAST: cakravākeva prati vastor usrārvāñcā yātaṁ rathyeva śakrā
Griffith: Come like two Cakavas in the grey of morning, come like two chariot wheels at dawn, ye Mighty.
Devanāgarī: चक्रवाकेव प्रति वस्तोरुस्रार्वाञ्चा यातं रथ्येव शक्रा
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṅgā-iva | naḥ | prathamā | gantam | arvāk | śaphau-iva | jarbhurāṇā | taraḥ-bhiḥ || cakravākā-iva | prati | vastoḥ | usrā | arvāñcā | yātam | rathyā-iva | śakrā ||2.39.3||

IAST: nāveva naḥ pārayataṁ yugeva nabhyeva na upadhīva pradhīva
Griffith: Bear us across the rivers like two vessels, save us as ye were yokes, naves, spokes and fellies.
Devanāgarī: नावेव नः पारयतं युगेव नभ्येव न उपधीव प्रधीव
pada pāṭha: nāvā-iva | naḥ | pārayatam | yugā-iva | nabhyā-iva | naḥ | upadhī ivetyupadhī-iva | pradhī iveti pradhī-iva || śvānā-iva | naḥ | ariṣaṇyā | tanūnām | khr̥galā-iva | vi-srasaḥ | pātam | asmān ||2.39.4||

IAST: śvāneva no ariṣaṇyā tanūnāṁ khṛgaleva visrasaḥ pātam asmān
Griffith: Be like two dogs that injure not our bodies; preserve us, like two crutches, that we fall not.
Devanāgarī: श्वानेव नो अरिषण्या तनूनां खृगलेव विस्रसः पातमस्मान्
pada pāṭha: nāvā-iva | naḥ | pārayatam | yugā-iva | nabhyā-iva | naḥ | upadhī ivetyupadhī-iva | pradhī iveti pradhī-iva || śvānā-iva | naḥ | ariṣaṇyā | tanūnām | khr̥galā-iva | vi-srasaḥ | pātam | asmān ||2.39.4||

IAST: vātevājuryā nadyeva rītir akṣī iva cakṣuṣā yātam arvāk
Griffith: Like two winds ageing not, two confluent rivers, come with quick vision like two eyes before us.
Devanāgarī: वातेवाजुर्या नद्येव रीतिरक्षी इव चक्षुषा यातमर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: vātā-iva | ajuryā | nadyā-iva | rītiḥ | akṣī ivetyakṣī-iva | cakṣuṣā | ā | yātam | arvāk || hastau-iva | tanve | śam-bhaviṣṭhā | pādā-iva | naḥ | nayatam | vasyaḥ | accha ||2.39.5||

IAST: hastāv iva tanve śambhaviṣṭhā pādeva no nayataṁ vasyo accha
Griffith: Come like two hands most helpful to the body, and guide us like two feet to what is precious.
Devanāgarī: हस्ताविव तन्वे शम्भविष्ठा पादेव नो नयतं वस्यो अच्छ
pada pāṭha: vātā-iva | ajuryā | nadyā-iva | rītiḥ | akṣī ivetyakṣī-iva | cakṣuṣā | ā | yātam | arvāk || hastau-iva | tanve | śam-bhaviṣṭhā | pādā-iva | naḥ | nayatam | vasyaḥ | accha ||2.39.5||

IAST: oṣṭhāv iva madhv āsne vadantā stanāv iva pipyataṁ jīvase naḥ
Griffith: Even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey, even as two breasts that nourish our existence,
Devanāgarī: ओष्ठाविव मध्वास्ने वदन्ता स्तनाविव पिप्यतं जीवसे नः
pada pāṭha: oṣṭhau-iva | madhu | āsne | vadantā | stanau-iva | pipyatam | jīvase | naḥ || nāsā-iva | naḥ | tanvaḥ | rakṣitārā | karṇau-iva | su-śrutā | bhūtam | asme iti ||2.39.6||

IAST: nāseva nas tanvo rakṣitārā karṇāv iva suśrutā bhūtam asme
Griffith: Like the two nostrils that protect our being, be to us as our ears that hear distinctly.
Devanāgarī: नासेव नस्तन्वो रक्षितारा कर्णाविव सुश्रुता भूतमस्मे
pada pāṭha: oṣṭhau-iva | madhu | āsne | vadantā | stanau-iva | pipyatam | jīvase | naḥ || nāsā-iva | naḥ | tanvaḥ | rakṣitārā | karṇau-iva | su-śrutā | bhūtam | asme iti ||2.39.6||

IAST: hasteva śaktim abhi saṁdadī naḥ kṣāmeva naḥ sam ajataṁ rajāṁsi
Griffith: Like two hands give ye us increasing vigour; like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions.
Devanāgarī: हस्तेव शक्तिमभि संददी नः क्षामेव नः समजतं रजांसि
pada pāṭha: hastā-iva | śaktim | abhi | saṁdadī iti sam-dadī | naḥ | kṣāma-iva | naḥ | sam | ajatam | rajāṁsi || imāḥ | giraḥ | aśvinā | yuṣma-yantīḥ | kṣṇotreṇa-iva | sva-dhitim | sam | śiśītam ||2.39.7||

IAST: imā giro aśvinā yuṣmayantīḥ kṣṇotreṇeva svadhitiṁ saṁ śiśītam
Griffith: Asvins, these hymns that struggle to approach you, sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone.
Devanāgarī: इमा गिरो अश्विना युष्मयन्तीः क्ष्णोत्रेणेव स्वधितिं सं शिशीतम्
pada pāṭha: hastā-iva | śaktim | abhi | saṁdadī iti sam-dadī | naḥ | kṣāma-iva | naḥ | sam | ajatam | rajāṁsi || imāḥ | giraḥ | aśvinā | yuṣma-yantīḥ | kṣṇotreṇa-iva | sva-dhitim | sam | śiśītam ||2.39.7||

IAST: etāni vām aśvinā vardhanāni brahma stomaṁ gṛtsamadāso akran
Griffith: These prayers of ours exalting you, O Asvins, have the GrtSamadas, for a laud, made ready.
Devanāgarī: एतानि वामश्विना वर्धनानि ब्रह्म स्तोमं गृत्समदासो अक्रन्
pada pāṭha: etāni | vām | aśvinā | vardhanāni | brahma | stomam | gr̥tsa-madāsaḥ | akran || tāni | narā | jujuṣāṇā | upa | yātam | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.39.8||

IAST: tāni narā jujuṣāṇopa yātam bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Welcome them, O ye Heroes, and come bither. Loud may we speak. with brave men, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: तानि नरा जुजुषाणोप यातं बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: etāni | vām | aśvinā | vardhanāni | brahma | stomam | gr̥tsa-madāsaḥ | akran || tāni | narā | jujuṣāṇā | upa | yātam | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.39.8||

IAST: somāpūṣaṇā jananā rayīṇāṁ jananā divo jananā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: SOMA and Pusan, Parents of all riches, Parents of earth and Parents of high heaven,
Devanāgarī: सोमापूषणा जनना रयीणां जनना दिवो जनना पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: somāpūṣaṇā | jananā | rayīṇām | jananā | divaḥ | jananā | pr̥thivyāḥ || jātau | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | gopau | devāḥ | akr̥ṇvan | amr̥tasya | nābhim ||2.40.1||

IAST: jātau viśvasya bhuvanasya gopau devā akṛṇvann amṛtasya nābhim
Griffith: You Twain, brought forth as the whole world's protectors, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.
Devanāgarī: जातौ विश्वस्य भुवनस्य गोपौ देवा अकृण्वन्नमृतस्य नाभिम्
pada pāṭha: somāpūṣaṇā | jananā | rayīṇām | jananā | divaḥ | jananā | pr̥thivyāḥ || jātau | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | gopau | devāḥ | akr̥ṇvan | amr̥tasya | nābhim ||2.40.1||

IAST: imau devau jāyamānau juṣantemau tamāṁsi gūhatām ajuṣṭā
Griffith: At birth of these two Gods all Gods are joyful: they have caused darkness, which we hate, to vanish.
Devanāgarī: इमौ देवौ जायमानौ जुषन्तेमौ तमांसि गूहतामजुष्टा
pada pāṭha: imau | devau | jāyamānau | juṣanta | imau | tamāṁsi | gūhatām | ajuṣṭā || ābhyām | indraḥ | pakvam | āmāsu | antariti | somāpūṣa-bhyām | janat | usriyāsu ||2.40.2||

IAST: ābhyām indraḥ pakvam āmāsv antaḥ somāpūṣabhyāṁ janad usriyāsu
Griffith: With these, with Soma and with Pusan, India generates ripe warm milk in the raw milch-cows.
Devanāgarī: आभ्यामिन्द्रः पक्वमामास्वन्तः सोमापूषभ्यां जनदुस्रियासु
pada pāṭha: imau | devau | jāyamānau | juṣanta | imau | tamāṁsi | gūhatām | ajuṣṭā || ābhyām | indraḥ | pakvam | āmāsu | antariti | somāpūṣa-bhyām | janat | usriyāsu ||2.40.2||

IAST: somāpūṣaṇā rajaso vimānaṁ saptacakraṁ ratham aviśvaminvam
Griffith: Soma and Pusan, urge your chariot hither, the seven-wheeIed car that measures out the region,
Devanāgarī: सोमापूषणा रजसो विमानं सप्तचक्रं रथमविश्वमिन्वम्
pada pāṭha: somāpūṣaṇā | rajasaḥ | vi-mānam | sapta-cakram | ratham | aviśva-minvam || viṣu-vr̥tam | manasā | yujyamānam | tam | jinvathaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | pañca-raśmim ||2.40.3||

IAST: viṣūvṛtam manasā yujyamānaṁ taṁ jinvatho vṛṣaṇā pañcaraśmim
Griffith: That stirs not all, that moves to every quarter, fivc-reined and harnessed by the thought, ye Mighty.
Devanāgarī: विषूवृतं मनसा युज्यमानं तं जिन्वथो वृषणा पञ्चरश्मिम्
pada pāṭha: somāpūṣaṇā | rajasaḥ | vi-mānam | sapta-cakram | ratham | aviśva-minvam || viṣu-vr̥tam | manasā | yujyamānam | tam | jinvathaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | pañca-raśmim ||2.40.3||

IAST: divy anyaḥ sadanaṁ cakra uccā pṛthivyām anyo adhy antarikṣe
Griffith: One in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling, on earth and in the firmament the other.
Devanāgarī: दिव्यन्यः सदनं चक्र उच्चा पृथिव्यामन्यो अध्यन्तरिक्षे
pada pāṭha: divi | anyaḥ | sadanam | cakre | uccā | pr̥thivyām | anyaḥ | adhi | antarikṣe || tau | asmabhyam | puru-vāram | puru-kṣum | rāyaḥ | poṣam | vi | syatām | nābhim | asme iti ||2.40.4||

IAST: tāv asmabhyam puruvāram purukṣuṁ rāyas poṣaṁ vi ṣyatāṁ nābhim asme
Griffith: May they disclose to us great store of treasure, much-longed for, rich in food, source of enjoyment.
Devanāgarī: तावस्मभ्यं पुरुवारं पुरुक्षुं रायस्पोषं वि ष्यतां नाभिमस्मे
pada pāṭha: divi | anyaḥ | sadanam | cakre | uccā | pr̥thivyām | anyaḥ | adhi | antarikṣe || tau | asmabhyam | puru-vāram | puru-kṣum | rāyaḥ | poṣam | vi | syatām | nābhim | asme iti ||2.40.4||

IAST: viśvāny anyo bhuvanā jajāna viśvam anyo abhicakṣāṇa eti
Griffith: One of you Twain is Parent of all creatures, the otherjourneys onward all-beholding.
Devanāgarī: विश्वान्यन्यो भुवना जजान विश्वमन्यो अभिचक्षाण एति
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | anyaḥ | bhuvanā | jajāna | viśvam | anyaḥ | abhi-cakṣāṇaḥ | eti || somāpūṣaṇau | avatam | dhiyam | me | yuvābhyām | viśvāḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | jayema ||2.40.5||

IAST: somāpūṣaṇāv avataṁ dhiyam me yuvābhyāṁ viśvāḥ pṛtanā jayema
Griffith: Soma and Pusan, aid my thought with favour: with you may we o'ercome in all encounters.
Devanāgarī: सोमापूषणाववतं धियं मे युवाभ्यां विश्वाः पृतना जयेम
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | anyaḥ | bhuvanā | jajāna | viśvam | anyaḥ | abhi-cakṣāṇaḥ | eti || somāpūṣaṇau | avatam | dhiyam | me | yuvābhyām | viśvāḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | jayema ||2.40.5||

IAST: dhiyam pūṣā jinvatu viśvaminvo rayiṁ somo rayipatir dadhātu
Griffith: May Pusan stir our thought, the all-impelling, may Soma Lord of riches grant us riches.
Devanāgarī: धियं पूषा जिन्वतु विश्वमिन्वो रयिं सोमो रयिपतिर्दधातु
pada pāṭha: dhiyam | pūṣā | jinvatu | viśvam-invaḥ | rayim | somaḥ | rayi-patiḥ | dadhātu || avatu | devī | aditiḥ | anarvā | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.40.6||

IAST: avatu devy aditir anarvā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: May Aditi the perfect Goddess aid us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: अवतु देव्यदितिरनर्वा बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: dhiyam | pūṣā | jinvatu | viśvam-invaḥ | rayim | somaḥ | rayi-patiḥ | dadhātu || avatu | devī | aditiḥ | anarvā | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.40.6||

IAST: vāyo ye te sahasriṇo rathāsas tebhir ā gahi
Griffith: O VAYU, come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine,
Devanāgarī: वायो ये ते सहस्रिणो रथासस्तेभिरा गहि
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | ye | te | sahasriṇaḥ | rathāsaḥ | tebhiḥ | ā | gahi || niyutvān | soma-pītaye ||2.41.1||

IAST: niyutvān somapītaye
Griffith: Team-borne, to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: नियुत्वान्सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | ye | te | sahasriṇaḥ | rathāsaḥ | tebhiḥ | ā | gahi || niyutvān | soma-pītaye ||2.41.1||

IAST: niyutvān vāyav ā gahy ayaṁ śukro ayāmi te
Griffith: Drawn by thy team, O Vayu, come; to thee is offered this, the pure.
Devanāgarī: नियुत्वान्वायवा गह्ययं शुक्रो अयामि ते
pada pāṭha: niyutvān | vāyo iti | ā | gahi | ayam | śukraḥ | ayāmi | te || gantā | asi | sunvataḥ | gr̥ham ||2.41.2||

IAST: gantāsi sunvato gṛham
Griffith: Thou visitest the presser's house.
Devanāgarī: गन्तासि सुन्वतो गृहम्
pada pāṭha: niyutvān | vāyo iti | ā | gahi | ayam | śukraḥ | ayāmi | te || gantā | asi | sunvataḥ | gr̥ham ||2.41.2||

IAST: śukrasyādya gavāśira indravāyū niyutvataḥ
Griffith: Indra and Vayu, drawn by teams, ye Heroes, come today and drink.
Devanāgarī: शुक्रस्याद्य गवाशिर इन्द्रवायू नियुत्वतः
pada pāṭha: śukrasya | adya | go-āśiraḥ | indravāyū iti | niyutvataḥ || ā | yātam | pibatam | narā ||2.41.3||

IAST: ā yātam pibataṁ narā
Griffith: Of the bright juice when blent with milk.
Devanāgarī: आ यातं पिबतं नरा
pada pāṭha: śukrasya | adya | go-āśiraḥ | indravāyū iti | niyutvataḥ || ā | yātam | pibatam | narā ||2.41.3||

IAST: ayaṁ vām mitrāvaruṇā sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā
Griffith: This Soma hath been shed for you, Lawstrengtheners, Mitra-Varuna!
Devanāgarī: अयं वां मित्रावरुणा सुतः सोम ऋतावृधा
pada pāṭha: ayam | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | sutaḥ | somaḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhā || mama | it | iha | śrutam | havam ||2.41.4||

IAST: mamed iha śrutaṁ havam
Griffith: Listen ye here to this my call.
Devanāgarī: ममेदिह श्रुतं हवम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | sutaḥ | somaḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhā || mama | it | iha | śrutam | havam ||2.41.4||

IAST: rājānāv anabhidruhā dhruve sadasy uttame
Griffith: Both Kings who never injure aught seat them in their supremest home,
Devanāgarī: राजानावनभिद्रुहा ध्रुवे सदस्युत्तमे
pada pāṭha: rājānau | anabhi-druhā | dhruve | sadasi | ut-tame || sahasra-sthūṇe | āsāte iti ||2.41.5||

IAST: sahasrasthūṇa āsāte
Griffith: The thousand-pillared, firmly-based.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रस्थूण आसाते
pada pāṭha: rājānau | anabhi-druhā | dhruve | sadasi | ut-tame || sahasra-sthūṇe | āsāte iti ||2.41.5||

IAST: tā samrājā ghṛtāsutī ādityā dānunas patī
Griffith: Fed with oblation, Sovran Kings, Adityas, Lords of liberal gifts.
Devanāgarī: ता सम्राजा घृतासुती आदित्या दानुनस्पती
pada pāṭha: tā | sam-rājā | ghr̥tāsutī iti ghr̥ta-āsutī | ādityā | dānunaḥ | patī iti || sacete iti | anava-hvaram ||2.41.6||

IAST: sacete anavahvaram
Griffith: They wait on him whose life is true.
Devanāgarī: सचेते अनवह्वरम्
pada pāṭha: tā | sam-rājā | ghr̥tāsutī iti ghr̥ta-āsutī | ādityā | dānunaḥ | patī iti || sacete iti | anava-hvaram ||2.41.6||

IAST: gomad ū ṣu nāsatyāśvāvad yātam aśvinā
Griffith: With kine, Nasatyas, and with steeds, come, Asvins, Rudras, to the house
Devanāgarī: गोमदू षु नासत्याश्वावद्यातमश्विना
pada pāṭha: go-mat | ūm̐ iti | su | nāsatyā | aśva-vat | yātam | aśvinā || vartiḥ | rudrā | nr̥-pāyyam ||2.41.7||

IAST: vartī rudrā nṛpāyyam
Griffith: That will protect its heroes well;
Devanāgarī: वर्ती रुद्रा नृपाय्यम्
pada pāṭha: go-mat | ūm̐ iti | su | nāsatyā | aśva-vat | yātam | aśvinā || vartiḥ | rudrā | nr̥-pāyyam ||2.41.7||

IAST: na yat paro nāntara ādadharṣad vṛṣaṇvasū
Griffith: Such, wealthy Gods! as none afar nor standing nigh to us may harm,
Devanāgarī: न यत्परो नान्तर आदधर्षद्वृषण्वसू
pada pāṭha: na | yat | paraḥ | na | antaraḥ | ā-dadharṣat | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || duḥ-śaṁsaḥ | martyaḥ | ripuḥ ||2.41.8||

IAST: duḥśaṁso martyo ripuḥ
Griffith: Yea, no malicious mortal foe.
Devanāgarī: दुःशंसो मर्त्यो रिपुः
pada pāṭha: na | yat | paraḥ | na | antaraḥ | ā-dadharṣat | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || duḥ-śaṁsaḥ | martyaḥ | ripuḥ ||2.41.8||

IAST: tā na ā voḻham aśvinā rayim piśaṅgasaṁdṛśam
Griffith: As such, O longed-far Asvins, lead us on to wealth of varied sort,
Devanāgarī: ता न आ वोळ्हमश्विना रयिं पिशङ्गसंदृशम्
pada pāṭha: tā | naḥ | ā | voḷham | aśvinā | rayim | piśaṅga-saṁdr̥śam || dhiṣṇyā | varivaḥ-vidam ||2.41.9||

IAST: dhiṣṇyā varivovidam
Griffith: Wealth that shall bring us room and rest.
Devanāgarī: धिष्ण्या वरिवोविदम्
pada pāṭha: tā | naḥ | ā | voḷham | aśvinā | rayim | piśaṅga-saṁdr̥śam || dhiṣṇyā | varivaḥ-vidam ||2.41.9||

IAST: indro aṅga mahad bhayam abhī ṣad apa cucyavat
Griffith: Verily Indra, conquering all, driveth e'en mighty fear away,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो अङ्ग महद्भयमभी षदप चुच्यवत्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | aṅga | mahat | bhayam | abhi | sat | apa | cucyavat || saḥ | hi | sthiraḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ ||2.41.10||

IAST: sa hi sthiro vicarṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: For firm is he and swift to act.
Devanāgarī: स हि स्थिरो विचर्षणिः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | aṅga | mahat | bhayam | abhi | sat | apa | cucyavat || saḥ | hi | sthiraḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ ||2.41.10||

IAST: indraś ca mṛḻayāti no na naḥ paścād aghaṁ naśat
Griffith: Indra be gracious unto us: sin shall not reach us afterward,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रश्च मृळयाति नो न नः पश्चादघं नशत्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | ca | mr̥ḷayāti | naḥ | na | naḥ | paścāt | agham | naśat || bhadram | bhavāti | naḥ | puraḥ ||2.41.11||

IAST: bhadram bhavāti naḥ puraḥ
Griffith: And good shall be before us still.
Devanāgarī: भद्रं भवाति नः पुरः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | ca | mr̥ḷayāti | naḥ | na | naḥ | paścāt | agham | naśat || bhadram | bhavāti | naḥ | puraḥ ||2.41.11||

IAST: indra āśābhyas pari sarvābhyo abhayaṁ karat
Griffith: From all the regions of the world let Indra send security,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र आशाभ्यस्परि सर्वाभ्यो अभयं करत्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | āśābhyaḥ | pari | sarvābhyaḥ | abhayam | karat || jetā | śatrūn | vi-carṣaṇiḥ ||2.41.12||

IAST: jetā śatrūn vicarṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: The foe-subduer, swift to act.
Devanāgarī: जेता शत्रून्विचर्षणिः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | āśābhyaḥ | pari | sarvābhyaḥ | abhayam | karat || jetā | śatrūn | vi-carṣaṇiḥ ||2.41.12||

IAST: viśve devāsa ā gata śṛṇutā ma imaṁ havam
Griffith: O all ye Gods, come hitherward: hear this mine invocation, seat
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवास आ गत शृणुता म इमं हवम्
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāsaḥ | ā | gata | śr̥ṇuta | me | imam | havam || ā | idam | barhiḥ | ni | sīdata ||2.41.13||

IAST: edam barhir ni ṣīdata
Griffith: Yourselves upon this sacred grass.
Devanāgarī: एदं बर्हिर्नि षीदत
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāsaḥ | ā | gata | śr̥ṇuta | me | imam | havam || ā | idam | barhiḥ | ni | sīdata ||2.41.13||

IAST: tīvro vo madhumām̐ ayaṁ śunahotreṣu matsaraḥ
Griffith: Among ihe gunahotras strong for you is this sweet gladdening draught.
Devanāgarī: तीव्रो वो मधुमाँ अयं शुनहोत्रेषु मत्सरः
pada pāṭha: tīvraḥ | vaḥ | madhu-mān | ayam | śuna-hotreṣu | matsaraḥ || etam | pibata | kāmyam ||2.41.14||

IAST: etam pibata kāmyam
Griffith: Drink ye of this delightsome juice.
Devanāgarī: एतं पिबत काम्यम्
pada pāṭha: tīvraḥ | vaḥ | madhu-mān | ayam | śuna-hotreṣu | matsaraḥ || etam | pibata | kāmyam ||2.41.14||

IAST: indrajyeṣṭhā marudgaṇā devāsaḥ pūṣarātayaḥ
Griffith: Ye Martus led by Indra, Gods with Pri an for your bounteousest,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रज्येष्ठा मरुद्गणा देवासः पूषरातयः
pada pāṭha: indra-jyeṣṭhāḥ | marut-gaṇāḥ | devāsaḥ | pūṣa-rātayaḥ || viśve | mama | śruta | havam ||2.41.15||

IAST: viśve mama śrutā havam
Griffith: Hear all of you this call of mine.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे मम श्रुता हवम्
pada pāṭha: indra-jyeṣṭhāḥ | marut-gaṇāḥ | devāsaḥ | pūṣa-rātayaḥ || viśve | mama | śruta | havam ||2.41.15||

IAST: ambitame nadītame devitame sarasvati
Griffith: Best Mother, best of Rivers, best of Goddesses, Sarasvati,
Devanāgarī: अम्बितमे नदीतमे देवितमे सरस्वति
pada pāṭha: ambi-tame | nadī-tame | devi-tame | sarasvati || apraśastāḥ-iva | smasi | pra-śastim | amba | naḥ | kr̥dhi ||2.41.16||

IAST: apraśastā iva smasi praśastim amba nas kṛdhi
Griffith: We are, as 'twere, of no repute and dear Mother, give thou us renown.
Devanāgarī: अप्रशस्ता इव स्मसि प्रशस्तिमम्ब नस्कृधि
pada pāṭha: ambi-tame | nadī-tame | devi-tame | sarasvati || apraśastāḥ-iva | smasi | pra-śastim | amba | naḥ | kr̥dhi ||2.41.16||

IAST: tve viśvā sarasvati śritāyūṁṣi devyām
Griffith: In thee, Sarasvati, divine, all generations have their stay.
Devanāgarī: त्वे विश्वा सरस्वति श्रितायूंषि देव्याम्
pada pāṭha: tve iti | viśvā | sarasvati | śritā | āyūṁṣi | devyām || śuna-hotreṣu | matsva | pra-jām | devi | didiḍḍhi | naḥ ||2.41.17||

IAST: śunahotreṣu matsva prajāṁ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
Griffith: Be, glad with Sunahotra's sons: O Goddess grant us progeny.
Devanāgarī: शुनहोत्रेषु मत्स्व प्रजां देवि दिदिड्ढि नः
pada pāṭha: tve iti | viśvā | sarasvati | śritā | āyūṁṣi | devyām || śuna-hotreṣu | matsva | pra-jām | devi | didiḍḍhi | naḥ ||2.41.17||

IAST: imā brahma sarasvati juṣasva vājinīvati
Griffith: Enriched with sacrifice, accept Sarasvati, these prayers of ours,
Devanāgarī: इमा ब्रह्म सरस्वति जुषस्व वाजिनीवति
pada pāṭha: imā | brahma | sarasvati | juṣasva | vājinīvati || yā | te | manma | gr̥tsa-madāḥ | r̥ta-vari | priyā | deveṣu | juhvati ||2.41.18||

IAST: yā te manma gṛtsamadā ṛtāvari priyā deveṣu juhvati
Griffith: Thoughts which GrtSamadas beloved of Gods bring, Holy One,to thee.
Devanāgarī: या ते मन्म गृत्समदा ऋतावरि प्रिया देवेषु जुह्वति
pada pāṭha: imā | brahma | sarasvati | juṣasva | vājinīvati || yā | te | manma | gr̥tsa-madāḥ | r̥ta-vari | priyā | deveṣu | juhvati ||2.41.18||

IAST: pretāṁ yajñasya śambhuvā yuvām id ā vṛṇīmahe
Griffith: Ye who bless sacrifice, go forth, for verily we choose you both,
Devanāgarī: प्रेतां यज्ञस्य शम्भुवा युवामिदा वृणीमहे
pada pāṭha: pra | itām | yajñasya | śam-bhuvā | yuvām | it | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe || agnim | ca | havya-vāhanam ||2.41.19||

IAST: agniṁ ca havyavāhanam
Griffith: And Agni who conveys our gifts.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं च हव्यवाहनम्
pada pāṭha: pra | itām | yajñasya | śam-bhuvā | yuvām | it | ā | vr̥ṇīmahe || agnim | ca | havya-vāhanam ||2.41.19||

IAST: dyāvā naḥ pṛthivī imaṁ sidhram adya divispṛśam
Griffith: This our.effectual sacrifice, reaching the sky, shall Heaven and Earth
Devanāgarī: द्यावा नः पृथिवी इमं सिध्रमद्य दिविस्पृशम्
pada pāṭha: dyāvā | naḥ | pr̥thivī iti | imam | sidhram | adya | divi-spr̥śam || yajñam | deveṣu | yacchatām ||2.41.20||

IAST: yajñaṁ deveṣu yacchatām
Griffith: Present unto the Gods to-day.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञं देवेषु यच्छताम्
pada pāṭha: dyāvā | naḥ | pr̥thivī iti | imam | sidhram | adya | divi-spr̥śam || yajñam | deveṣu | yacchatām ||2.41.20||

IAST: ā vām upastham adruhā devāḥ sīdantu yajñiyāḥ
Griffith: In both your laps, ye guileless Ones, the Holy Gods shall sit them down
Devanāgarī: आ वामुपस्थमद्रुहा देवाः सीदन्तु यज्ञियाः
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | upa-stham | adruhā | devāḥ | sīdantu | yajñiyāḥ || iha | adya | soma-pītaye ||2.41.21||

IAST: ihādya somapītaye
Griffith: To-day to drink the Soma here.
Devanāgarī: इहाद्य सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | upa-stham | adruhā | devāḥ | sīdantu | yajñiyāḥ || iha | adya | soma-pītaye ||2.41.21||

IAST: kanikradaj januṣam prabruvāṇa iyarti vācam ariteva nāvam
Griffith: TELLING his race aloud with cries repeated, he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman.
Devanāgarī: कनिक्रदज्जनुषं प्रब्रुवाण इयर्ति वाचमरितेव नावम्
pada pāṭha: kanikradat | januṣam | pra-bruvāṇaḥ | iyarti | vācam | aritā-iva | nāvam || su-maṅgalaḥ | ca | śakune | bhavāsi | mā | tvā | kā | cit | abhi-bhā | viśvyā | vidat ||2.42.1||

IAST: sumaṅgalaś ca śakune bhavāsi mā tvā kā cid abhibhā viśvyā vidat
Griffith: O Bird, be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee.
Devanāgarī: सुमङ्गलश्च शकुने भवासि मा त्वा का चिदभिभा विश्व्या विदत्
pada pāṭha: kanikradat | januṣam | pra-bruvāṇaḥ | iyarti | vācam | aritā-iva | nāvam || su-maṅgalaḥ | ca | śakune | bhavāsi | mā | tvā | kā | cit | abhi-bhā | viśvyā | vidat ||2.42.1||

IAST: mā tvā śyena ud vadhīn mā suparṇo mā tvā vidad iṣumān vīro astā
Griffith: Let not the falcon kill thee, nor the eagle let not the arrow-bearing archer reach thee.
Devanāgarī: मा त्वा श्येन उद्वधीन्मा सुपर्णो मा त्वा विददिषुमान्वीरो अस्ता
pada pāṭha: mā | tvā | śyenaḥ | ut | vadhīt | mā | su-parṇaḥ | mā | tvā | vidat | iṣu-mān | vīraḥ | astā || pitryām | anu | pra-diśam | kanikradat | su-maṅgalaḥ | bhadra-vādī | vada | iha ||2.42.2||

IAST: pitryām anu pradiśaṁ kanikradat sumaṅgalo bhadravādī vadeha
Griffith: Still crying in the region of the Fathers, speak here auspicious, bearing joyful tidings.
Devanāgarī: पित्र्यामनु प्रदिशं कनिक्रदत्सुमङ्गलो भद्रवादी वदेह
pada pāṭha: mā | tvā | śyenaḥ | ut | vadhīt | mā | su-parṇaḥ | mā | tvā | vidat | iṣu-mān | vīraḥ | astā || pitryām | anu | pra-diśam | kanikradat | su-maṅgalaḥ | bhadra-vādī | vada | iha ||2.42.2||

IAST: ava kranda dakṣiṇato gṛhāṇāṁ sumaṅgalo bhadravādī śakunte
Griffith: Bringing good tidings, Bird of happy omen, call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings,
Devanāgarī: अव क्रन्द दक्षिणतो गृहाणां सुमङ्गलो भद्रवादी शकुन्ते
pada pāṭha: ava | kranda | dakṣiṇataḥ | gr̥hāṇām | su-maṅgalaḥ | bhadra-vādī | śakunte || mā | naḥ | stenaḥ | īśata | mā | agha-śaṁsaḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.42.3||

IAST: mā naḥ stena īśata māghaśaṁso bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: So that no thief, no sinner may oppress us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
Devanāgarī: मा नः स्तेन ईशत माघशंसो बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: ava | kranda | dakṣiṇataḥ | gr̥hāṇām | su-maṅgalaḥ | bhadra-vādī | śakunte || mā | naḥ | stenaḥ | īśata | mā | agha-śaṁsaḥ | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.42.3||

IAST: pradakṣiṇid abhi gṛṇanti kāravo vayo vadanta ṛtuthā śakuntayaḥ
Griffith: HERE on the right sing forth chanters of hymns of praise, even the winged birds that in due season speak.
Devanāgarī: प्रदक्षिणिदभि गृणन्ति कारवो वयो वदन्त ऋतुथा शकुन्तयः
pada pāṭha: pra-dakṣiṇit | abhi | gr̥ṇanti | kāravaḥ | vayaḥ | vadantaḥ | r̥tu-thā | śakuntayaḥ || ubhe iti | vācau | vadati | sāmagāḥ-iva | gāyatram | ca | traistubham | ca | anu | rājati ||2.43.1||

IAST: ubhe vācau vadati sāmagā iva gāyatraṁ ca traiṣṭubhaṁ cānu rājati
Griffith: He, like: a Sama-chanter utters both the notes, skilled in the mode of Trstup and of Gayatri.
Devanāgarī: उभे वाचौ वदति सामगा इव गायत्रं च त्रैष्टुभं चानु राजति
pada pāṭha: pra-dakṣiṇit | abhi | gr̥ṇanti | kāravaḥ | vayaḥ | vadantaḥ | r̥tu-thā | śakuntayaḥ || ubhe iti | vācau | vadati | sāmagāḥ-iva | gāyatram | ca | traistubham | ca | anu | rājati ||2.43.1||

IAST: udgāteva śakune sāma gāyasi brahmaputra iva savaneṣu śaṁsasi
Griffith: Thou like the chanter-priest chantest the Sama, Bird; thou singest at libations like a Brahman's son.
Devanāgarī: उद्गातेव शकुने साम गायसि ब्रह्मपुत्र इव सवनेषु शंससि
pada pāṭha: udgātā-iva | śakune | sāma | gāyasi | brahmaputraḥ-iva | savaneṣu | śaṁsasi || vr̥ṣā-iva | vājī | śiśu-matīḥ | api-itya | sarvataḥ | naḥ | śakune | bhadram | ā | vada | viśvataḥ | naḥ | śakune | puṇyam | ā | vada ||2.43.2||

IAST: vṛṣeva vājī śiśumatīr apītyā sarvato naḥ śakune bhadram ā vada viśvato naḥ śakune puṇyam ā vada
Griffith: Even as a vigorous horse when he comes near the mare, announce to us good forturue, Bird, on every side, proclaim in all directions happy luck, O Bird.
Devanāgarī: वृषेव वाजी शिशुमतीरपीत्या सर्वतो नः शकुने भद्रमा वद विश्वतो नः शकुने पुण्यमा वद
pada pāṭha: udgātā-iva | śakune | sāma | gāyasi | brahmaputraḥ-iva | savaneṣu | śaṁsasi || vr̥ṣā-iva | vājī | śiśu-matīḥ | api-itya | sarvataḥ | naḥ | śakune | bhadram | ā | vada | viśvataḥ | naḥ | śakune | puṇyam | ā | vada ||2.43.2||

IAST: āvadam̐s tvaṁ śakune bhadram ā vada tūṣṇīm āsīnaḥ sumatiṁ cikiddhi naḥ
Griffith: When singing here, O Bird. announce good luck to us, and when thou sittest still think on us with kind thoughts.
Devanāgarī: आवदँस्त्वं शकुने भद्रमा वद तूष्णीमासीनः सुमतिं चिकिद्धि नः
pada pāṭha: ā-vadan | tvam | sakune | bhadram | ā | vada | tūṣṇīm | āsīnaḥ | su-matim | cikiddhi | naḥ || yat | ut-patan | vadasi | karkariḥ | yathā | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.43.3||

IAST: yad utpatan vadasi karkarir yathā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ
Griffith: When flying off thou singest thou art like a lute. With brave sons in assembly may we speak aloud.
Devanāgarī: यदुत्पतन्वदसि कर्करिर्यथा बृहद्वदेम विदथे सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: ā-vadan | tvam | sakune | bhadram | ā | vada | tūṣṇīm | āsīnaḥ | su-matim | cikiddhi | naḥ || yat | ut-patan | vadasi | karkariḥ | yathā | br̥hat | vadema | vidathe | su-vīrāḥ ||2.43.3||
